You awaken to the gentle chime of an automated alarm set up by the ship’s AI, telling you the time for sleeping is over. Groggily, you tell it to give you five more minutes. As the captain, you are afforded certain privileges, after all. Unfortunately, the chime refuses to cease. It would appear one of your passengers still remembers their command codes, and has decided the captain has to wake up at a reasonable time. Revissa, her arms around your waist, her face nuzzled in the crook between your neck and shoulder, makes an annoyed grunt. You know her well enough to understand that if you don’t make that sound go away soon, there’s going to be a problem. What do you do? (set: $ProgressGameStart to true) [[Ignore it. It’ll go away on its own eventually ->P01A]] [[Fumble for your blaster and destroy the comm panel making the noise ->P01B]] [[Begrudgingly accept your fate and get out of bed ->P01C]] Screw it. You’re the captain, and you’ll sleep as long as you want to. No damn alarm is going to tell you what to do! You fold your ears as flat against your head as you can and pull Revissa in closer, determined to cuddle away the morning without interruptions. Revissa, unfortunately, is not having it. There is a sudden rush of movement as your wife shapeshifts into a grizzly bear and pounces at the comm panel, destroying it with a combination of teeth and claws and a quarter-ton of raw physical force. She growls proudly at her handiwork before shifting back to her normal appearance, though, sadly, the display was jarring enough to shake away the last dregs of drowsiness from your body, leaving you with little recourse but to get out of bed and actually do your job. [[Check yourself out in the mirror ->P02]] (set: $bearsmash to true) (set: $bearsmash4eva to true) (set: $foamed to false)As captain of this ship, you’re not going to let anyone override your capacity to turn on the snooze alarm. There will be consequences for this brazen defiance of your authority! But for the moment, you just want to get more sleep. Gently removing your arm from your gorgeous wife’s waist, you sleepily flail about on the table next to your bed to find your blaster pistol. Obviously, firing it within crew quarters would show a blatant disregard for any and all safety regulations. But wouldn’t it also be unsafe to force the captain to report for duty when she was still drowsy? Unfortunately, when you finally get your hands around the blaster, your clumsy fingers accidentally depress the trigger, causing a beam of concentrated energy to emit from the muzzle of the weapon and ricochet wildly around the room (you obviously didn’t leave the safety on - who would have time to disengage it if you were raided by pirates in your sleep and needed to defend yourself in a hurry?) In the end, the blast just harmlessly dissipates against the ceiling, but not before somehow triggering the automated fire suppression systems. Thus you and Revissas are rudely awakened by a dousing of cooling foam, forcing you both out of bed as you shiver wildly. On the bright side, as soon as your feet touch the floor, the comm system registers you as being awake, and the alarm helpfully stops. At this point, further attempts to sleep are pointless, leaving you with little recourse but to get out of bed and actually do your job. [[Check yourself out in the mirror ->P02]] (set: $foamed to true) Though it’s been a while since you’ve had crew aboard other than your darling wife, you vaguely recall the feeling of wanting to impress the people under your command. And so, with the deepest regret imaginable, you extricate yourself from Revissa’s warm and loving embrace and slide out of bed. On the bright side, as soon as your feet touch the floor, the comm system registers you as being awake, and the alarm helpfully stops. On the darker side (though this is open to interpretation), Revissa is none too pleased that you have shirked your responsibility to spend the morning cuddling with her, and immediately shapeshifts into a giant spider. It only takes her a few seconds to use this form’s natural silk-spinning abilities to render you quite incapable of performing any additional duties. (link:"Mmph!")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/P01_MelfyWebbed01_by_Spiderweber.png" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Spiderweber(click-replace: "Art by Spiderweber")[https://www.deviantart.com/spiderweber https://twitter.com/spiderweber2]] With the threat properly contained, she transforms back to her normal self and spends the next half hour making the case for why you should never have crawled out of bed. It is *quite* convincing. Sadly, all good things must eventually come to an end, and when the alarm blares a second time even she must acquiesce that duty must be performed. She cuts you free, helps wipe off any sticky residue leftover from her bindings, and permits you to get started with your day. At least you’re not tired anymore! [[Check yourself out in the mirror ->P02]] (set: $bedwebbed to true) (set: $foamed to false) (set: $picP01 to true) ] (if: $ProgressLevelSelect is true)[[[Jump to Holo-Chamber Scene->P07]]] You rub your eyes, yawn loudly, scratch your butt, then trundle over to one of the walls of your quarters, waving a hand to activate a holo-screen which displays a mirrored image of everything facing it. Checking out your reflection, you have to admit - you’ve still got it. (link:"Looking good")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/P02_MelfyNude_by_NaughtyAzima.png" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by NaughtyAzima(click-replace: "Art by NaughtyAzima")[https://www.deviantart.com/naughtyazima https://twitter.com/NaughtyAzima]] Your name is Melfy Murachi. You’re the captain of the Lucky Break, and the Commander of the Rabbit’s Foot Company, a mercenary outfit you inherited after a run of bad luck took out all the former members. You’re 5 foot 10 - about average height for a kemomi, with short blonde hair and fur that turns brown at the tips of your ears and tail. A daily workout regimen ensures a muscular physique, even if in recent years you haven’t had as much occasion to make use of it. You’d like to think it’s your bright blue eyes and winning smile that makes you irresistible to the ladies, but honestly it’s probably just this rockin' bod. Though by no means famous, you and your crew made a name for yourself during the war between the Kemomi Empire and the Elvaan Federation. Some might even generously say your heroics turned the tides - maybe even saved the galaxy! Not that the details ever became fully public. Either way, after the war died down, most of your crew went their separate ways. A lot of the enlisted support crew you were ‘borrowing’ either went back to their old positions in the military or returned to civilian life. Krysta and Lumina settled down together on Mine Nine, eager to start a family. And Vhaja made good on a promise to officially begin pursuing a career in the Empire navy. Despite being an Elvaan, you hear she’s proven herself capable enough that there are whispers she’ll have her own starship command within a year or two! Which is kind of why you’re out here in the first place. A week ago, Vhaja got in touch, asking for your help to conduct some field research that has to be kept under wraps for political reasons. Eager for some action, you readily agreed - even if you still don’t know exactly what the mission entails. You watch a pair of hands encircle your waist in the reflection on the wall as Revissa slides in against you. She gently kisses you on the shoulder, moving in such a way that shows off the adorable twitches of the little deer tail poking out from her pert behind. (set: $picP02 to true) [[Take a look at your smokin’ hot wife ->P03]] ]You’ve loved many women over the years, but none as completely or as passionately as you've Revissa Bloomtender. You first met her when you were just starting out your adventuring career. She was a part of the Bolg resistance, trying to repel the Orochebi occupation of their homeworld. You bumped into her just as some Orochebi soldiers were trying to arrest her. You’d like to say you valiantly rescued her, but instead you were also immediately captured after trying to step in. Luckily, the rest of your crew at the time tracked you down and got you both free a day later, so technically it was your actions that led to her escape. What followed was a steamy love affair, strong enough that you were considering joining the resistance together with her. But she knew better than to get you tied up into it, and disappeared into the night, vanishing from your life until several years later, when *she* helped save *you* from some kidnappers. At that point, the occupation was long over, and she was happy to join your mercenary company and rekindle your romance, though she was stationed on a different ship. After the war when the company mostly disbanded, she stayed on, officially tying the knot with you. Once she has your attention, she lounges alluringly, showing off her body for you to appreciate. (link:"Appreciate the view")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/P32_RevissaNude_by_MuleExpress.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by MuleExpress(click-replace: "Art by MuleExpress")[https://twitter.com/alfiardyrulli]] (set: $picP32 to true) She’s about the same height as you, though with a less defined physique. Her long brown hair comes down into a tight braid draped over her back, and her fair skin is covered in beautiful green ritual tattoos that denote her as a mistress of druidic Bolg magic. That said, half her blood is Elvaan, which is why there are only two tiny horns poking out from her forehead rather than the full antlers most of her people would sport - though she still has the adorable deer-like ears and tail, brown like her hair though spattered with spotty patches of white. She’s talented in various forms of nature magic, able to make plants grow, manipulate the earth and soil, create healing herbs, and even conjure animals to come to her aid. Though perhaps her most noteworthy ability is the capacity to shapeshift into animal (or animal hybrid) form, letting her be anything from a bird to a bug to a fish to even a T-rex, when the situation calls for it. You’ve always been particularly fond of her ‘deer-taur’ form, which allows you to hop on her back and ride her - in more ways than one. With a smile, you pull her in close and go for a passionate good-morning kiss, one which she readily accepts.] |drink1)[(link:"Now kiss")[(show:?drink2)]] |drink2)[<img src="images/P03_MelfyxRevissa_by_TunaTeluna.png" style="max-width: 100%;"> (css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by TunaTeluna(click-replace: "Art by TunaTeluna")[https://www.deviantart.com/tunateluna https://twitter.com/TelunaTuna]] But, eventually, the two of you pull apart, and you decide it’s finally time to start your day. (set: $picP03 to true) [[Get dressed and head to the bridge ->P03A]] ]Your ship is called the Lucky Break, a modified cargo vessel with space to fit about twenty crew comfortably, though it's been ages since you’ve even approached that number. For years it was in such disrepair that visitors were always worried life support would fail at any time, or that a hatch would blow somewhere and you’d all be thrown into the endless vacuum of space. After the war, you finally got around to having some of those critical systems repaired, enough that while it’s still a piece of junk, at least everything important works, more or less. As you and Revissa enter the bridge, you find yourselves greeted by a number of familiar faces. Vhaja is the first to stand and speak to you. (if: $bearsmash is true)[“Ah, Captain. So good of you to finally grace us with your presence. I’m glad to see that in the years since we’ve worked together, you’ve become the sort of person to destroy a comm panel rather than reporting for duty at a reasonable time.” “That was me, actually,” Revissa says proudly. “Your alarm ruined our morning.” “My deepest apologies,” Vhaja replies, with her usual amount of dry snark. “Next time I drop a lucrative military contract into your lap, I’ll be sure to not actually hold you to completing it.”](if: $foamed is true)[“Ah, Captain. So good of you to finally grace us with your presence. And you only caused a single fire in the process.” “Oh, don’t worry,” you say with ironic confidence. “There wasn’t any fire. I was just trying to shoot the comm panel making that damn alarm and missed by a few meters.” “Of course. I’m so glad after dropping a lucrative military contract right into your lap, you would rather destroy part of your own ship than show up on time to complete it.”](if: $bedwebbed is true)["Ah, Captain. So good of you to join us. I suppose a blaring alarm wasn’t quite enough to convince you to roll out of bed.” You scratch your head sheepishly. “Actually… I was really trying to report for duty on time. I just, uh, got a bit tied up along the way.” Revissa smirks and pinches your butt playfully. Your tail gently wags as you think about how much fun it was being all wrapped up by her. Vhaja, ever the vigilant one, picks up on your body language and groans. “My apologies. I thought perhaps dropping a lucrative military contract right into your lap was reason enough for you to put your… libidos on hold for just a day, but I suppose I was overestimating your restraint.” “Oh, no, she was definitely restrained,” Revissa says snidely. That gets an eyebrow raise from Vhaja, and an embarrassed blush from yourself.] You hold up your arms diplomatically. “Look, let’s just put all that aside, and maybe you can finally tell us what this mission is about?” (link:"Meet Vhaja")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/P04_VhajaArt_by_Izra.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;"> (css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Izra(click-replace: "Art by Izra")[https://twitter.com/IZRART https://picarto.tv/IZRA]] Vhaja sighs in the way she always does, looking you over with an expression as if she is having regrets about contracting you in the first place. She was one of the founding members of the current iteration of your mercenary outfit, the Rabbit’s Foot Company. Surprisingly fit for her species, her trim figure is accentuated with dark brown skin, piercing green eyes, and light lavender hair tied into a pair of signature braids hanging over her shoulder. As an Elvaan with a rare case of morals, she betrayed her own race by trading military secrets she had access to for Kemomi Empire citizenship. And when the war ended, she decided to stay on working for the empire navy. Currently she is serving as a science officer on a mid-sized starship, but she is quickly climbing the ranks to eventually get her own command. “I’ve hired you for the purposes of a… simple research mission,” she says slowly. “You are to head down to a particular planet and place some data-gathering equipment in predetermined locations.” You raise a skeptical eyebrow. “No way you’d call me in for something ‘simple’. Let me guess - this planet is off limits? The kind of place an official empire science vessel couldn’t be seen near?” “You are, as always, savvy in your insights. Yes. The planet in question has been designated as restricted by inter-planetary treaty. And yet… the insights it might provide through study are too fascinating to turn down. For the specifics, I will defer to my partner to explain better than I can.” (set: $picP04 to true) [[Hear from Vhaja’s partner ->P05]] ]You can’t deny it. Your pulse always rises whenever you’re near Vhaja’s romantic partner. Jyumon Zathura, scion of a well-to-do family in the empire, and recently appointed chairwoman of the Kemomi Science Consulate. Though she is an expert in all things both academic and arcane, her chief speciality is in ghosts, spirits, and the supernatural - phenomena which she herself classifies as falling under the field of ‘spookology’. (link:"Meet Jyumon")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/P05_JyumonArt_by_izra.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;"> (css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Izra(click-replace: "Art by Izra")[https://twitter.com/IZRART https://picarto.tv/IZRA]] But obviously, the thing that stands out most about her is her appearance. Perfect curves, a beautiful, bushy tail, and long, luscious reddish-brown hair that is always held up in a high ponytail that swishes whenever she moves. And unlike you and Revissa, she and Vhaja seem to be able to maintain an aura of professionalism when in each other’s presence. “To put it simply, the planet we are heading to is incredibly spooky,” she says. You scratch your head. “Okay, I rarely say this, but could you maybe put it a little bit less simply?” The gorgeous fox makes a polite chuckle. “Less simply, the planet - currently designated as Spectra I - is a ghost. By which I mean, it should be dead, and yet is not. According to cosmological scans, several centuries ago its sun released a radiation wave that destroyed all life in the system - including on Spectra. Yet, somehow, the planet continued to live regardless. Everything there is, technically, a ghost, but is carrying on pretending that it isn’t. To the naked eye, it would look like a perfectly normal planet, capable of supporting life - though currently without any sapient species. However, check it on the thaumaturgical spectrum and it is positively teeming with ectoplasmic matter.” You’re not sure you understood the less simple explanation, but you nod your head anyway. “So… why do you need us?” “The planet is technically in the neutral zone between Kemomi and Elvaan space. This system was specifically selected as a buffer because, at the time of the treaty, there were no habitable planets there. But this ghost planet just… showed up a few months ago. Appeared out of thin air, as far as we can tell. And we’d like to have a look at it.” “Can’t you just send down drones or probes?” “Impossible. Because it’s a ghost planet, nothing without a soul can physically interact with it. So what we need is for you to set up some of these data collection devices in a specific formation about ten miles apart from each other, to triangulate readings. The data collectors are powered by living insects and complex bio-gel circuits, which should be sufficient to allow them to keep operating.” “Alright… seems simple enough. Head down, plant the probes, and leave. So, why did we bring in her?” you ask, pointing to the other face in the room. Your old friend smiles and comes in for a hug. (set: $picP05 to true) [[Hug her back ->P06]] ] You grew up an orphan on a small colony run by the Kemomi military. And ever since you could walk, Krysta had always been there with you. Your own last name, Murachi, was the name of the colony, given to you since no one even knew who your parents were. Krysta used to have that name too, making you practically sisters, until she eventually learned she was a part of the infamous McKendricks clan. Though she is technically half-kemomi, those genes ended up being recessive, meaning she normally has no fur or tail (though a small bout of unrelated lycanthropy means she occasionally transforms into a squirrel girl). Her other half is Yearthling, a strange race of physically unassuming women with plain, rounded ears, and no other distinguishing features. Krysta and her wife, Lumina, a winged Celestial outcast from her society, were together with you and Vhaja the founding members of the current Rabbit’s Foot Company. Now she works as a Star Scout, part of an organization of magical girls who protect the galaxy. She is on permanent assignment to Mine Nine, a hollowed-out asteroid made into a space station that orbits a wormhole that connects two distant parts of the galaxy. An important transit hub, which she does her best to keep safe - a far cry from her early days as a petty thief. (link:"Meet Krysta and Lumina")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/P06_KrystaLuminaArt_by_Erdjie.png" style="max-width: 100%;"> (css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by ERDJIE(click-replace: "Art by ERDJIE")[https://www.deviantart.com/erdjie]] “Bring it in!” she says, wrapping her arms tightly around your waist. Always much stronger than her, you hug her back, tight enough to make her gasp for breath and frantically tap out. “It’s great to see you. Both of you,” you say, glancing over at her beautiful wife. Lumina smiles and clasps your hand affectionately. Long black hair, gorgeously feathered wings, and an impressive bust - it’s not hard to see what Krysta sees in her. Though her best feature is her nurturing personality. It’s no surprise she would start a family once the war ended. “How’s the egg? Hatched yet?” you ask. How the two of them ended up being the proud parents of a dragon egg is too complicated a question to get into at the moment. “We’re still waiting, sadly. Melyra is egg-sitting for the week while we’re away.” Lumina says. “Though really, you should come see that for yourself. You don’t visit nearly enough!” You raise your hands apologetically. “Sorry… but you know how it is. Busy living the adventuring life and all–” “We haven’t had a job in three months,” Revissa chimes in ‘helpfully’. That makes you cough awkwardly. “Anyway! What about this job requires your, uh, expertise?” “Knotties,” Krysta says simply. “...Knotties?” “Yup. Apparently they’ve set up camp and have been scavenging the place for resources. It would seem that restraints made from ghost matter are really excellent at keeping prisoners, uh, ‘fresh’, if you get my meaning.” The Knottie race, as you well know, is almost entirely dedicated to the art of bondage. To them the act of restraint is as natural as breathing. Through various mystical techniques, they can even submit people to a state of ‘permanent bondage’, where the subject no longer needs to eat or drink, and doesn’t even age. Normally that technique is only available to incredibly talented martial artists, but if you follow what Krysta is saying, tools made from ghost matter can allow anyone to put people into ‘permanent bondage’. You can see why they’d want the stuff. “As something of a bondage expert myself, and being well-trained in their techniques, I’m gonna head down to their camp together with Lumi to do some negotiating. They’re not bound - heh - by the treaty, so if we could pay them under the table to occasionally send us some samples, that would be great.” Vhaja steps forward. “So, to summarize. You and Revissa will plant the probes, Krysta and Lumina will negotiate, and Jyumon and I will remain on the ship in orbit to monitor your progress. Is that clear?” You would object to her acting like she’s the captain - but the money on offer for the job really is quite generous. (set: $picP06 to true) [[Be a good captain and get ready to start the mission straight away ->P06A]] [[Suggest everyone take the opportunity to catch up with each other before starting to mission ->P06B]] ]“Sounds good,” you say. “So let’s get started. When can we head down to the planet?” Vhaja massages her forehead irritably. “We obviously need to get to it, first. It’s in the neutral zone, remember? A half day’s travel with the Lucky Break’s engine.” “Oh, in that case, why don’t we reminisce about old times?” Lumina suggests brightly. “It’s been so long since all of us were together!” “An excellent idea,” Vhaja says. You were totally going to suggest that! That’s what you get for trying to be a good captain. You resolve to never do it again. “Hey, is it true you installed a holo-simulator?” Krysta asks. “Actually, yes,” you say. “How we got the money for it is actually a really cool story. I had to –” “Last one there is a rotten clucker egg!” she says loudly, running at full tilt off the bridge. Seriously, no respect, even on your own ship. At least Revissa gives you a comforting squeeze on the shoulder as you follow after her. (set: $Responsibility to true) [[Check out the simulator ->P07]] “Sounds good,” you say. “Though don’t forget I’m technically the captain here.” “Well, if we are pulling rank, I technically have the authority to commission civilian vessels registered with the Empire whenever I like,” Vhaja says playfully. “But for the moment, I will defer to your orders.” “How generous of you. But I’m gonna hold you to that. Before we get started, why don’t we all take the opportunity to catch up on old times?” “Oh, that sounds lovely!” Lumina says, clapping her hands excitedly. “Agreed,” says Vhaja. “We have at least half a day of travel before we reach the neutral zone, so we have plenty of time for it.” A chance to relax, and put off doing work until the last possible minute? Now this is more like it! You feel like things have gone back to how they were in the old days. “Hey, is it true you installed a holo-simulator?” Krysta asks. “Actually, yes,” you say. “How we got the money for it is actually a really cool story. I had to –” “Last one there is a rotten clucker egg!” she says loudly, running at full tilt off the bridge. Typical Krysta. Everyone laughs as they follow you down the hall. [[Check out the simulator ->P07]] Holo simulators come in a variety of models. Some are equipped with powerful AI processors that can generate entire movie plots on the fly. Others are little more than glorified film projectors. The one on the Lucky Break is somewhere between those two, but leaning much closer to the less-advanced end of that spectrum. Krysta is the first one inside, and is unsuccessfully fiddling with the controls as you enter. Unlike Vhaja, she doesn’t remember her command codes from when she was an official crew member. As everyone else files in, you come up beside her and unlock it. “What program should we run?” she asks, as she begins scrolling through the options. It is only at this point that you realize why that’s a problem. “We’ve got… Spider Queen Bondage Dungeon, Virgian Slave Market… oooh, Knottie Sex Cult!” You get her in a headlock and drag her away from the controls. Everyone else laughs as your face turns a bright shade of red. “The Spider Queen one is her favorite,” Revissa says helpfully. “We know,” say Vhaja and Lumina in unison. Have your fetishes always been that obvious? You cough loudly and scroll to the options at the very bottom - the only two that aren’t just purely porn programs. (set: $ProgressHoloChamber to true) [[Choose the ‘Hot Springs’ program ->P08]] [[Choose the ‘Beach Party’ program ->P09]]You press the button, and watch as the formerly featureless holo-chamber (save for the cracks in the floor and water stains on the wall) transforms into a digitally imagined scene. The ground turns from mute gunmetal to cobbled stones, a water-filled pit manifests in the center of the room (or, more accurately, holographic matter is formed to raise your feet into the air so that there is now space to sink ‘lower’), drinks appear on charming little trays, fluffy towels show up neatly folded to the sides, and a small hedge of modesty bushes sprout up around a path that would lead farther into the ‘resort’. All of it, of course, is fake, and given the bargain bin parts the chamber has installed, a lot of it doesn’t hold up to scrutiny. The bushes, for instance, have patches of oddly yellowed leaves in places, whose pattern is identical to the stains on the wall. But it’s good enough. Vhaja raises an eyebrow. “This is the least pornographic program you could muster?” “And here I thought I wasn’t going to wind up naked on this mission,” Jyumon says with a beleaguered pout. Revissa has already doffed her clothing, and slides into the water without a care. “Don’t be shy! On Bolg, it’s very traditional to meet old acquaintances in the nude, so you can see for yourselves how your bodies have changed since you were away.” There is some huffing and puffing, but eventually everyone acquiesces. And after the first hour, no one much seems to mind. Holographic resort staff bring out tray after tray of holographic snacks, and despite none of it being ‘real,’ the chamber is still programmed to simulate things such as taste - and the effect of alcohol. (link:"Drink")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[Which is why, after only one and a half cups of sake, Revissa has already gotten flirty, leaning on your shoulder for support - drinks have always made her horny. (set: $picP07 to true) <img src="images/P07_MelfyRevissaSprings_by_Kawanmushi.png" style="max-width: 100%;"> (css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Kawanmushi(click-replace: "Art by Kawanmushi")[https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/44123467 https://twitter.com/Kawanmushi]] ] |drink1)[(link:"Drink")[(show:?drink2)]] |drink2)[Vhaja and Jyumon fill you in on the latest goings on of the empire and the military, both getting highly animated as they discuss the technical details of exciting new experiments which go straight over your head - though you can’t deny it’s nice to see your old friend truly able to relax and be in her element. (set: $picP10 to true) <img src="images/P10_GroupSprings_by_Kawanmushi.png" style="max-width: 100%;"> (css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Kawanmushi(click-replace: "Art by Kawanmushi")[https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/44123467 https://twitter.com/Kawanmushi]] It is, honestly, some of the most fun you’ve had in years. You feel a smile creep on your face that doesn’t let up the whole time you’re there. Well, at least until the discussion comes back around to the mission. Though maybe you’re not quite ready to talk business… [[Suggest a game ->P08A]] [[Listen to the details ->P10]] ] You press the button, and watch as the formerly featureless holo-chamber (save for the cracks in the floor and water stains on the wall) transforms into a digitally imagined scene. The ground turns from mute gunmetal to coarse, rough sand that gets everywhere, the walls seem to vanish, giving way to an endless expanse of cerulean blue ocean, and the gentle background hum of normal starship mechanisms is replaced with the lapping of waves and the cawing of distant gulls. All of it, of course, is fake, and given the bargain bin parts the chamber has installed, a lot of it doesn’t hold up to scrutiny. The sky, for example, would be perfectly convincing - if not for the various discolored splotches in the same shape as the water stains on the wall. You turn to your friends. “Alright everybody. Now get your clothes off and the program will manifest you some holographic swimwear.” Vhaja raises an eyebrow. “This is the least pornographic program you could muster?” “And here I thought I wasn’t going to need to get naked on this mission,” Jyumon says with a beleaguered pout. But everyone eventually complies. And when they’re done, the program (much to your own surprise) actually works as intended, providing your crew with setting-appropriate attire. (link:"Hit the beach")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/P17_GroupBeach_by_Zeemalken.png" style="max-width: 100%;"> (css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Zeemalken(click-replace: "Art by Zeemalken")[https://www.deviantart.com/zeemalken https://twitter.com/zeemalken]] After striking a pose with the group, Krysta runs off to inspect the volleyball net resting in the sand off to the side. She turns to you and smirks. “Whaddya say? Up for a match… ‘captain’?” You raise an eyebrow. “I may be a bit out of practice, but I’ve still got a leg up on you when it comes to sports.” “Yeah? Well we’ll see about that!” says the red-head. “Wanna make a bet? Loser has to do whatever the winner tells them to!” “You’re on,” you say, fully confident in your future victory. Revissa, perhaps slightly turned on by the alpha wolf behavior, sidles up next to you and presses herself against your arm. “This is a team game though, isn’t it? Obviously, I’ll be your partner.” Krysta scratches her head. “Good point. I guess I need one too.” You look towards the rest group. (set: $picP17 to true) [[Ask Lumina if she wants to play ->P09A]] [[Ask Vhaja if she wants to play ->P09B]] [[Ask Jyumon if she wants to play ->P09C]] ]Lumina steps forward with a flutter of wings. “Of course! It’s been so long since we’ve played any games like this!” she says, doing some stretches - and losing her balance in the process. As she face-plants into the sand, you give Revissa a confident look. Krysta might be passable at athletics, but Lumina is a hopeless klutz. You’ve got this one in the bag. “So, what exactly are we playing for?” Revissa asks. “Hmm… how about the losing team needs to play maid service for the winners?” Krysta suggests. “Serve drinks and snacks and stuff for the rest of the time in the program.” Everyone agrees to those terms. And so the game begins. It goes almost exactly like you expected it would. Krysta is passable at the sport, but you’re strongest, faster, and have kept yourself in better shape than she has. And while Revissa isn’t the most capable when she isn’t using magic, compared to Lumina it’s like night and day. After the third time the angel gets hopelessly tangled in the volleyball net the holo-program glitches out and is unable to regenerate it, ending the game by default, with a final score of 14 - 2 in Team Melfy’s favor. “Well, how do I look?” (link:"Check her out")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/P19_KrystaMaid_by_JamminSam.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;"> (css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by JamminSam(click-replace: "Art by JamminSam")[https://twitter.com/JamminSamArt]] (set: $picP19 to true) Much to your annoyance, Krysta seems perfectly at home in frills. You were hoping for some embarrassment, but you forgot how shameless she really was. And as for Lumina…] |drink1)[(link:"Enjoy the show")[(show:?drink2)]] |drink2)[<img src="images/P20_LuminaMaid_by_SeductiveBunneh.png" style="max-width: 100%;"> (css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by SeductiveBunneh(click-replace: "Art by SeductiveBunneh")[https://www.deviantart.com/seductivebunneh https://twitter.com/SedBunneh]] …well, a body like hers was custom-built for fetish cosplay. She was always the motherly sort who enjoyed cooking, cleaning, and things like that, so in the end it’s hardly a punishment at all. Still, everything was in good fun, with laughs and smiles had by all as Krysta scampers back and forth fulfilling people’s orders. You and Revissa spend the rest of the time sitting beside each other, hand in hand, watching the waves and reminiscing on old times with your friends. The time goes by much too quickly, and before long you are forced to get back to business and discuss the specifics of your mission. (set: $picP20 to true) [[Listen to the details ->P10]] ]Vhaja steps forward, a surprisingly competitive look on her face. “I was actually hoping you would ask,” she says with her trademark quiet confidence. Krysta scratches her head. “Oh… I was kind of expecting that Lumi was going to be my partner.” “A good choice… if you did not want to maximize your chances of winning,” says the Elvaan. You raise a finger. “Hey, so, just a point of order, but this is just a normal game, okay? No magic allowed or anything.” “Of course,” says Vhaja. “I would expect nothing less.” A shiver runs down your spine. You had been confident in your choice… but now, you somehow feel like you made a mistake. And as the game begins, you understand why. Vhaja had always kept herself fit, of course, but you had never taken her for being particularly athletic. But when the first ball she returns spikes you directly in the face, you are reminded that a few years can make all the difference in the world. As the game goes on, Jyumon and Lumina cheer from the sidelines, and the points quickly rack up for both sides - with the advantage going to the other team. Vhaja proves to be far more adept than you ever could have imagined, and soon the only way you can keep up is by intentionally trying to serve on Krysta’s end of the field and hoping she slips up enough to win. She doesn’t. When the last ball hits the sand, the score is 17 to 21 in Team Krysta’s favor. You lost. After the girlfriends charge the field to give the winners a hug, Krysta turns to you with a big smile on her face. “Now… what should we ask of the losers?” Vhaja gets a strange look in her eye. “Krysta, perhaps you could lend me some of your ropes…?” Wait… since when had Vhaja been into bondage? (link:"Mmph")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/P27_MelfyRevissaKidnapped_by_Watergirl20.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;"> (css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Watergirl20(click-replace: "Art by Watergirl20")[https://www.deviantart.com/watergirl20]] A few minutes later, you and Revissa are bound and gagged and crunched into the trunk of a dune buggy. “Consider this practice for the mission,” Vhaja says, as she slams the trunk shut. “Any Knotties you encounter on the planet will tie far better knots than this.” And so, for the next few hours, while the other two couples enjoy the sand and sea, you and Revissa wriggle and squirm. By the time you finally escape, you’ve nearly reached your destination, and you are forced to get out and discuss the finer details of the mission. (set: $picP27 to true) (set: $VBL1 to true) [[Listen to the details ->P10]] ]You walk up to the curvy fox and ask if she wants to play a game of beach volleyball. “Why in the world would you ask *me* first?” she wonders aloud. “I am utterly hopeless when it comes to sports, and - no offense - but I could not ever imagine myself teaming up with Krysta to begin with.” “Absolutely none taken,” Krysta replies. “And obviously, she was just so desperate to win that she was trying to pick the absolutely worst possible choice to be my partner.” Jyumon grimaces. “Actually, that does slightly offend me.” “Look, I’m just spitting truth here,” Krysta continues. “If this were a video game, you’d have put all your stat points into floof and boobs and nothing into anything useful in the real world.” “You know, I am actually quite offended, now,” Jyumon says. And, with a quiet wave of her finger, she weaves a small curse around the red-head. “Offended or not, we still need a victim to trounce!” says Revissa. She’s right, of course. You look at your options. (set: $KCurse to true) [[Ask Lumina if she wants to play ->P09D]] [[Ask Vhaja if she wants to play ->P09E]](if: $ProgressLevelSelect is true)[[[Jump to the End->P15]]] The holo-chamber was fun, but in the end, business has to win out over pleasure. As the simulated environment fades away, everyone puts their original clothes back on, and congregates in the center of the area. Vhaja inserts a data chip into the computer to bring up a holographic map of Spectra I, then has it zoom in on a particular continent. “So, to get straight to the point, we need you to land on the planet and place data probes in three predetermined locations. The probes will triangulate their detection radius and should be able to create an etheric sensor net that will penetrate to the core of the planet.” You nod blankly, already somewhat lost. At least everything is clearly labeled. With the landing site at the center of the map, it looks like you’ll need to venture through three distinct locales - the ruins of an ancient city, a subterranean cavern, and a section simply labeled the ‘spider forest’. Why is it every planet seems to have a forest (or jungle, or desert, or mountain) filled with spiders? You’d like to have a word with the creator of the universe about it. (link:"Look at the map")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/A02_Map_made_using_Inkarnate.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;"> The mission is otherwise simple enough to understand. Vhaja drones on and on, but really the gist is to just reach the three locations without being caught by the local wildlife. Or the environment. Or the Knotties. Okay, so maybe it won’t exactly be easy, but you’re confident you can pull it off. “Something to keep in mind is that everything on the planet is comprised of what Jyumon has dubbed ‘ghost matter’ - elements that technically shouldn’t exist in the physical world but which, nonetheless, are in absolute abundance here. Such matter interacts with sentient beings in unpredictable ways, but most important for our purposes is the fact that it can preserve living creatures entangled with it indefinitely.” You nod your head. “So if we, say, were gobbled up by a giant plant, or were wrapped up in spider webs, or even just got buried under a rockslide, we wouldn’t be in any mortal danger.” “Exactly. Though you might not be able to escape, you’ll also not suffer from hunger or thirst, you won’t age - you won’t even need to *breathe*, technically.” “But if no one manages to find us… then we’d also basically be stuck forever.” “Let’s hope it does not come to that. Luckily, we all have some tools which should help you. Let’s go over each of them.” [[Hear about the tools ->P11]] ]Lumina steps forward with a flutter of wings. “Of course! It’s been so long since we’ve played any games like this!” she says, doing some stretches - and losing her balance in the process. As she face-plants into the sand, you give Revissa a confident look. Krysta might be passable at athletics, but Lumina is a hopeless klutz. You’ve got this one in the bag. “So, what exactly are we playing for?” Revissa asks. “Hmm… how about the losing team needs to play maid service for the winners?” Krysta suggests. “Serve drinks and snacks and stuff for the rest of the time in the program.” Everyone agrees to those terms. And so the game begins. You thought it would be easy. But there was something you didn’t account for. Jyumon, in her annoyance, put a minor curse of incompetence on Krysta - one to make her trip, stumble, botch her serves, and overall be just as big of a klutz as Lumina was. But therein lay the problem. For as soon as the game starts, the power of two people with a comical level of ineptitude somehow cancels each other out, causing all their pratfalls to somehow, consistently, land the ball on your side of the court. Before you know it, you’re on the ropes. Which is when you get stabbed in the back by the woman you trusted most. “I resign from the team!” Revissa yells, right when Team Krysta is one point away from victory. “Wait… what?” you say, as Krysta steps on a pointy seashell, yowls in pain, falls over, and somehow in her flailing manages to connect with the ball and send it smacking right into your face. And so… against all odds, you’ve lost. But Revissa’s betrayal stings more than the pain of defeat. (link:"Get dressed")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/P18_MelfyMaid_by_JamminSam.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;"> (css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by JamminSam(click-replace: "Art by JamminSam")[https://twitter.com/JamminSamArt]] “I… can’t believe I have to do this alone…” you grumble, trying to hide the burning sensation in your cheeks. You’d rather be paraded around naked than be dressed like… this. Revissa just grins and raises a hand to order. “I’ll take a chestnut tea, extra syrup!” she says brightly. And so the humiliation begins. Everyone is so amused by your predicament that you have no time to really enjoy the scenery, forced to run back and forth delivering drinks. For once in your life, you are actually relieved when it comes time to discuss the finer details of your mission, since it means you can finally take a break. (set: $picP18 to true)(set: $VBL2 to true) [[Listen to the details ->P10]] ] Vhaja steps forward, a surprisingly competitive look on her face. “I was actually hoping you would ask,” she says with her trademark quiet confidence. Krysta scratches her head. “Oh… I was kind of expecting that Lumi was going to be my partner.” “A good choice… if you did not want to maximize your chances of winning,” says the Elvaan. You raise a finger. “Hey, so, just a point of order, but this is just a normal game, okay? No magic allowed or anything.” “Of course,” says Vhaja. “I would expect nothing less.” A shiver runs down your spine. You had been confident in your choice… but now, you somehow feel like you made a mistake. And as the game begins, you understand why. Vhaja had always kept herself fit, of course, but you had never taken her for being particularly athletic. But when the first ball she returns spikes you directly in the face, you are reminded that a few years can make all the difference in the world. However, as the game goes on, the influence of Jyumon’s curse makes itself apparent. Krysta keeps missing returns, colliding with her partner, or just plain tripping over her own feet. It would normally be enough to make the game a cakewalk, but even with her teammate more hindrance than help, Vhaja puts on a good show. Just… not quite good enough. Perhaps Jyumon should have thought twice about weaving a curse before knowing who the recipient’s teammate was going to be - but you’re not complaining. When the last ball hits the sand, the score is 21 to 17 in Team Melfy’s favor. You won! After giving your girlfriend a great big victory hug, she turns towards the losers with a surprisingly vicious smile on her face. “Now then… what to do with these two?” Vhaja and Krysta back away nervously, but Revissa only smiles as she makes some druidic hand motions which are all too familiar to you. And then in a flash, she has taken the form of a giant spider. The rest of the scene basically writes itself. (link:"Enjoy the show")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/P22_KrystaVhajaWebs_by_Zefram.png" style="max-width: 100%;"> (css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Zefram(click-replace: "Art by Zefram")[https://www.deviantart.com/zefram https://twitter.com/zeframmann]] Once the two of them have been divested of their beachwear, Revissa spins them some silky new duds… though perhaps the outfits are a bit too tight. Either way, the tethers over their lips prevents them from complaining. Once her work is finished, she leaves it to Jyumon and Lumina to decide the fate of their captive lovers. As they squirm, you can’t help but be a little jealous. (if: $bedwebbed is true) [Remembering the silky treatment you got earlier this morning, you wonder if Revissa might be willing to wrap something else up while she’s still a spider.] Though of course, you still need to hash out the rest of the details of the mission. (set: $picP22 to true) (if: $bedwebbed is true)[ [[Ask Revissa to web you up too ->P09F]]] [[Listen to the details ->P10]] ]Revissa is, of course, only too happy to comply. It always amazes you how quickly she can get you from clothed and mobile to naked and helpless when she spins her silk, though to be fair, you’re not exactly putting up a fight. (link:"Mmph")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/P21_MelfyWebs_by_Zefram.png" style="max-width: 100%;"> (css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Zefram(click-replace: "Art by Zefram")[https://www.deviantart.com/zefram https://twitter.com/zeframmann]] (set: $picP21 to true) There’s just something about spider silk that always gets you going. Maybe it’s the fact that, no matter how strong you are, and no matter how much you struggle, the webbing will never break. It’s stronger than steel, after all. Being totally at the mercy of a woman you love is nice too, of course, and so you wiggle happily as you submit yourself to her care. What you were not expecting was the surprised squeak from Lumina, as she clumsily slipped into some of the leftover strands while playing with her girlfriend. And then, somehow, managed to completely restrain herself while trying to get free.] |drink1)[(link:"Watch")[(show:?drink2)]] |drink2)[<img src="images/P23_LuminaWebbed_by_Zefram.png" style="max-width: 100%;"> (css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Zefram(click-replace: "Art by Zefram")[https://www.deviantart.com/zefram https://twitter.com/zeframmann]] (set: $picP23 to true) Which just leaves Jyumon. The fox backs away as Revissa’s spidery eyes gleam menacingly, but she is nowhere near fast enough.] |drink2)[(link:"Keep Watching")[(show:?drink3)]] |drink3)[<img src="images/P24_JyumonWebbed_by_Dvega.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;"> (css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Dvega(click-replace: "Art by Dvega")[https://www.deviantart.com/dvega https://picarto.tv/Tek]] Which thus leaves all five of you bound, gagged, and trussed up in silk. Shifting back into humanoid form, she grins as she surveys her handiwork. (set: $picP24 to true) [[Enjoy what comes next ->P09G]] [[Try and coax her into getting caught herself ->P09H]] ]What plays out is a repeat from your encounter earlier this morning - but with more time to enjoy it… and a captive audience forced to watch. That, somehow, makes it hotter. Though at least Revissa is nice enough to eventually squish Krysta against Lumina (who both quite enjoy it), and Vhaja to Jyumon (who also enjoy it… but are annoyed that they do). If only you could have this much fun every day. Wait… you do, because this amazing woman is you wife, and she is only too happy to satisfy your fantasies. Well… all the ones that are possible to satisfy. To be honest, even more than your lovely wife, you still dream about being kidnapped for real by a sexy spider lady of some kind, wrapped up tight and forced to submit to all her wildest desires… Ahem. Anyway, you still feel pretty fulfilled by the end of this kinky beach party. Eventually, Revissa cuts you free, and you, in turn, rescue the others. And though quite a few feathers are ruffled (or in Lumina’s case, gunked up with silk residue), you eventually smooth things over enough that everyone is ready to get back to work discussing the finer details of your mission. [[Listen to the details ->P10]]No one has ever accused you of being particularly forward-thinking. Right now, as you wriggle and squirm, all you can think of is how hot it is that your whole team has been snagged in webbing. The whole team… except for one. And so, when Revissa draws near to have some fun with you, you play along… for a time. But when the opportunity presents itself, you distract her with some heavy moans, then start guiding her to step backwards into some stray silken strands to get herself stuck. Not enough to really incapacitate her… but she can see the devious gleam in your eyes. And, bless her heart, she’s always willing to indulge you. So she conjures some more webbing with her own nature magic, and starts to wiggle herself into it, spinning this way and that until her arms are stuck at her side and her lips are firmly sealed. (link:"Watch")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/P25_RevissaWebbed_by_Leila2015.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;"> (css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Leila2015(click-replace: "Art by Leila2015")[https://www.deviantart.com/leila2015]] Success! You’ve gotten your girlfriend caught! …wait. You look around at your assembled comrades. Krysta, Lumina, Vhaja, and Jyumon. Yourself and Revissa. Erm… if all of you are totally wrapped up… who’s going to free you? (set: $picP25 to true) (if: $faeriddle is true and $candy is false)[ [[Oops->P09X]]](else: )[[[Oops ->P09Y]]] ]Hours go by as the six of you wriggle and squirm. And while you do, the ship moves forward, heading towards your destination. Since it was a restricted area, you were supposed to turn on some jamming devices to prevent patrol ships from noticing your approach. But with everyone wrapped up, that never happens. Eventually, one such ship detects you. And, when no one responds to the hails they send, the Kemomi officers on the patrol ship naturally board your vessel, and find all of you helplessly writhing in the holo-chamber. While there’s no harm done, the incident does get entered into the patrol ship’s log… which in turn directly places all of you, and your ship, at the scene, right outside restricted space. In the end, this forces Vhaja to abort the mission. Your horniness has completely ruined all their plans, failing the job before you even stepped foot on the planet! At the very least, you get points for efficiency. Though now all your friends are mad at you. Suffice to say, Vhaja won’t be approaching you for any more secret missions in the future. GAME OVER (set: $beachwebbed to true) [[Start Over->A0X]]Unable to contain yourself, you raise your sake cup and propose a challenge to the group. Though the holo-chamber can generate food and drink, and even simulate things such as taste and texture, in the end none of it is ‘real’, and by the time you exit any sense of fullness from eating or any side effects of what you consumed will be gone. Which means… you could all drink as much as you want with no ill effects afterwards. So why not a drinking challenge? You’ll square off and see who can take the most alcohol. Losers are determined when the holo-chamber’s internal safeties kick in and decide the drink is making them sick - at which point the loser will be disqualified via a paralysis field being activated around their bodies. What the winners want to do with them while they’re frozen is totally up to them. Discussion breaks out over the finer points of the rules, but eventually everyone agrees to it in the spirit of good fun. It is decided the game will be held in two rounds - first everyone pairs off to out-drink a single opponent, and then the remaining three players will have a free-for-all to be the last woman standing. As the person who suggested the challenge, you take it upon yourself to choose who your first rival will be… [[Challenge Revissa ->P08B]] [[Challenge Krysta ->P08C]] [[Challenge Lumina ->P08D]] [[Challenge Vhaja ->P08E]] [[Challenge Jyumon ->P08F]] You and your chosen opponent square off, sitting across from each other with a bottle of simulated high quality Kemomi sake between you. Beneath your bottoms is a round platform - to be your display pedestal in the case of defeat. And at the sound of a chime issued from the ship’s computer, you begin. Across from you is Revissa, who dips into her first cup with gusto, perfectly happy to win or lose, as long as it’s against you. (if: $foamed is true)[As soon as you start drinking, you feel yourself getting a bit more flushed than you’d normally expect. Did something earlier in the day tire you out?] Elsewhere, Krysta faces off against Lumina, and Vhaja against Jyumon - about what was expected. Everyone paired up with their girlfriends, it seems. (link:"Drink")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[After a half hour, it’s Jyumon and Lumina who tap out first. Lumina pouts in annoyance, folding her arms beneath her chest as the paralysis field bathes her in light, freezing her in place quite nicely. Beneath your bottoms is a round platform - to be your display pedestal in the case of defeat. And at the sound of a chime issued from the ship’s computer, you begin. Across from you is Krysta, who seems eager to take you on, a continuation of a friendly (and sometimes not-so-friendly) rivalry you’ve shared since you were kids. (if: $foamed is true)[As soon as you start drinking, you feel yourself getting a bit more flushed than you’d normally expect. Did something earlier in the day tire you out?] Elsewhere, Revissa faces off against Lumina, and Vhaja against Jyumon. Just you, Vhaja, and Revissa remain. The three of you move into a circle with a bottle of sake between you, ready to finally determine the winner. [[And the winner is… ->P08CC]]] You and your chosen opponent square off, sitting across from each other with a bottle of simulated high quality Kemomi sake between you. Beneath your bottoms is a round platform - to be your display pedestal in the case of defeat. And at the sound of a chime issued from the ship’s computer, you begin. Across from you is Lumina, who seems surprised you’d want to face her - and suspicious it was just an attempt to get an easy win. {As soon as you start drinking, you feel yourself getting a bit more flushed than you’d normally expect. Did something earlier in the day tire you out?} Elsewhere, Krysta faces off against Revissa, and Vhaja against Jyumon. (link:"Drink")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[After a half hour, it’s Jyumon and Lumina who tap out first. Lumina pouts in annoyance, folding her arms beneath her chest as the paralysis field bathes her in light, freezing her in place quite nicely. Perhaps a bit unfair to target her, but you’ve made it to the next round! Were she not drunk, she might have grasped the issue with this fact, but as it stands, all she does is smile and pose, letting the paralyzing light affix her in place. <img src="images/P13_VhajaShiny_by_cangkulretak.png" style="max-width: 100%;"> (css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Cangkulretak(click-replace: "Art by Cangkulretak")[https://www.deviantart.com/cangkulretak https://twitter.com/dinnerhaver]] And so, the drinking game ends in a draw. Which also means… there’s no one left to tell the program to release you… (set: $picP13 to true) (set: $VDrunk3 to true) (if: $faeriddle is true and $candy is false)[ [[Oops->P08X]]](else: )[[[Oops ->P08Y]]] ] Hours go by as the six of you stand still as statues, helplessly held in place by the holo-chamber’s procedurally generated paralysis pads. None of you can move an inch, able to do nothing but stare ahead and ponder the mistakes that led to this outcome. Since the drunkenness you’re experiencing is simulated, none of you will sober up naturally, which also means there is no way to automatically trigger the safety protocols to release you. All you can do is stand and wait, light gleaming off your glossy skin. And while you do, the ship moves forward, heading towards your destination. Since it was a restricted area, you were supposed to turn on some jamming devices to prevent patrol ships from noticing your approach. But with everyone paralyzed, that never happens. Eventually, one such ship detects you. And, when no one responds to the hails, the Kemomi officers on the patrol ship naturally board your vessel, and find all of you helplessly trapped in the holo-chamber. And while there’s no harm done, the incident does get entered into the patrol ship’s log… which in turn directly places all of you, and your ship, at the scene, right outside restricted space. In the end, this forces Vhaja to abort the mission. Your crew’s carelessness has completely ruined all their plans, failing the job before you even stepped foot on the planet! At the very least, you get points for efficiency. Unfortunately, the failure will jeopardize your friend’s career, and almost assuredly means there will be no more military jobs coming your way in the future. GAME OVER (set: $ShinySprings to true) [[Start Over->A0X]]“I’m surprised you could outdrink Revissa,” you say to Vhaja, reaching towards the next glass of sake. “But I doubt you have the constitution to hold up against a full-blooded Kemomi.” “I imagine there are many things about me that would surprise you,” she says calmly. “While the rest of you have settled for complacency since the war, I have continued to push myself forward.” “Well prepare to – *hic* – start standing still!” Krysta says, clearly the most inebriated of the three of you. (link:"Drink")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[And so it begins. As expected, Krysta reaches her limit quite quickly. But drunk Krysta is not known for being graceful in defeat. She leaps off her pedestal to try and avoid getting frozen, but the holo-chamber quickly generates an aerial stun lamp drone to trap her anyway. (set: $picP12 to true) <img src="images/P12_KrystaShiny_by_Cutichan.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;"> (css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Cutichan(click-replace: "Art by Cutichan")[https://www.deviantart.com/cutichan https://www.hentai-foundry.com/user/NotCuti/profile]] ] |drink1)[(link:"Keep Drinking")[(show:?drink2)]] |drink2)[Which brings things down to the final two. You honestly can’t believe the slim Elvaan could be so good at packing away alcohol, but as the empty cups pile up, you start to realize that she’s finally reaching her limit. “What a shame… I thought I had finally surpassed you,” she says, quietly setting down her final cup. You raise an eyebrow. “I didn’t realize you were trying to.” Vhaja smiles warmly. “To be honest… I had always looked up to you, Melfy. Your confidence. Self-assurance. Even when you were hopelessly outmatched, when you were woefully unqualified to handle the situation. Over your head.” “Um… I think I’m supposed to be flattered?” you murmur. Is she being serious right now? Or is it just the sake talking? The Elvaan answers that all on her home. With strangely eager eyes, she leans forward, kissing you deeply on the lips. “Trying to rise through the ranks in the empire military means spending a lot of time in back rooms sharing drinks with the brass,” she explains, slowly drawing away. “So I’ve built up something of a tolerance… and also learned to be more forward. Forceful, even. Kemomi respond better to confidence than quiet logic, I have found.” “I don’t… wha?” you sputter. “You and Jyumon are still together, aren’t you?” “We are. And I love her completely. It was actually she who picked up on it… my lingering emotions. My attraction to you - both emotional and physical. We have an agreement, the two of us, that permits us to seek out pleasure in other arms, when the inclination takes us. I originally had no plans on pursuing it with you, of course… but I suppose losing to you has brought all those feelings to the forefront once more.” And so she stands up, posing herself calmly on the paralysis pad. It starts to glow, as arresting light washes over her. “Enjoy your prize… Captain.”] |drink2)[(link:"Victory!")[(show:?drink3)]] |drink3)[<img src="images/P13_VhajaShiny_by_cangkulretak.png" style="max-width: 100%;"> (css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Cangkulretak(click-replace: "Art by Cangkulretak")[https://www.deviantart.com/cangkulretak https://twitter.com/dinnerhaver]] A deep blush covers your cheeks - and not just from the alcohol. You had no idea Vhaja had felt this way about you. Sure, you’d hooked up once, right when she first joined the crew, but that was at a time the two of you were emotionally vulnerable. That there was still something there… Well, if she opened up this much, it would be rude of you not to reciprocate. She said Jyumon was okay with it… and you know Revissa would be too. And so… you take your prize. Or maybe it’s her who really won? Your fingers, your lips - and on a few occasions, your teeth - find purchase on her frozen body. She is stiff yet still soft and warm, and unresisting to your advances as you pull off, you hope, some of your best moves. And though there is no outward indication of her pleasure, certain autonomous functions of her body provide you a clue as to her enjoyment. And so, for the next two hours, the losers are at your mercy, though only one of them has your attention. Until, eventually, you instruct the holo-emitters to set everyone free. After all, you weren’t really getting drunk, the program was just making assumptions about the state of your body based on its parameters. And once those parameters are altered, no one feels inebriated anymore, and the simulator releases everyone from the paralysis fields holding them stiffly in place. At which point, it is finally time to get back to work and go over the details of your mission. (set: $picP13 to true) (set: $VDrunk2 to true) [[Listen to the details ->P10]] ] “I’m surprised you could outdrink Revissa,” you say to Vhaja, reaching towards the next glass of sake. “But I doubt you have the constitution to hold up against a full-blooded Kemomi.” “I imagine there are many things about me that would surprise you,” she says calmly. “While the rest of you have settled for complacency since the war, I have continued to push myself forward.” “Well prepare to – *hic* – start standing still!” Krysta says, clearly the most inebriated of the three of you. You would shiver, if you could move a muscle. “So I’ve built up something of a tolerance… and also learned to be more forward. Forceful, even. Kemomi respond better to confidence than quiet logic, I have found.” And then with a slight smile, she leans in and gives you a soft kiss on your glossy cheek, before pulling away to give more… intimate attention to her girlfriend. Well, you might have lost, but at least you learned something new about your friend.
