After all, you weren’t really getting drunk, the program was just making assumptions about the state of your body based on its parameters. And once those parameters are altered, no one feels inebriated anymore, and the simulator releases everyone from the paralysis fields holding them stiffly in place. At which point, it is finally time to get back to work and go over the details of your mission. (set: $picP11 to true) [[Listen to the details ->P10]] ]Jyumon steps forward, handing you a series of small capsules. “These are nano-fiber synthesizers and molecular recombiners. Able to generate clothing, tools, and basic equipment within seconds. I’ve already taken the liberty of programming them based on your outfits and weapons compliment.” You nod your head in thanks. “That’ll help. Funny how the perils on alien planets always seem to destroy your clothing, isn’t it?” “You call it ‘funny’, I call it ‘infuriating’. I had to go on a mission in a spider-filled jungle once, and got stripped naked more times than I can count. Which is why I never leave home without at least a few dozen of these, just in case.” After slipping them into your pocket, Lumina walks up to you next. “I’ve spent the last few weeks imbuing these stones with Celestial healing magic,” she explains. “Hold it up to your body and it will cure you of most wounds… and revert any unwanted transformations.” You nod and accept the handful of beautifully glowing diamonds - every single one sparkles as if a star were trapped within its prism. These will be useful. Perhaps the only thing more common than spiders on your adventures are things that want to petrify, gild, vitrify, encase, solidify, harden, congeal, or otherwise immobilize you. The angel gives you a warm, but worried smile. “But don’t get too careless - if both of you get transformed at the same time there won’t be anyone around to restore you. Based on Vhaja’s analysis, it doesn’t look like anything on the planet will be able to petrify you permanently… but that doesn’t do you much good if no one can find your statues…” “Which is where I come in!” says Krysta. She hops forward and hands to you what looks like a small, individually wrapped hard candy. “This is a Star Scout Tracking Gumdrop,” she explains. “Cherry flavor, of course. Once you eat it, you’ll give off a magical aura that is detectable on most Star Scout comm frequencies. If you feel particularly imperiled, it will basically send out a distress beacon that can be used to track you down for a rescue.” You palm it quickly. “Not that I’ll need it, of course.” “Hey, you never know,” your friend says with a shrug. “Just make sure you finish the whole thing, or it won’t work.” Finally, Vhaja approaches you, bearing two small packages wrapped in cloth. “And these are from me.” You take one and uncover it, revealing what appears to be a small, rune-covered dagger. “If you find yourself thoroughly restrained with materials made out of ghost matter, your raw strength probably isn’t going to be much help in getting you free - but this is enchanted to allow you to sever even spectral substances. Without this, getting captured probably means you’d be staying that way until someone else arrives to rescue you. So… try not to have both of you get restrained at the same time.” “No promises,” you say with a smirk. “Because the only thing hotter than being bound and gagged and at the mercy of a sexy evil lady is having your wife bound up right beside you.” Vhaja gives Revissa a stern look. “Please do not indulge her fetishes while on an important mission.” Your wife snickers and gives you a quick peck on the cheek. “You have my word - if she tries to surrender herself to a sexy villain, I’ll make sure to tie her up first instead.” “How… reassuring,” the Elvaan mutters. But with that, it appears all the details have been thoroughly explained. And a helpful chime from the ship’s computer tells you that you’re nearing the restricted area of space around the planet. It looks like it’s time to finally get this mission underway! [[Head to the bridge ->P12]] As soon as you arrive at the bridge, you instruct the ship’s computer to activate a signal jammer to make sure no nearby ships notice your approach. The entire reason for bringing you in on this mission is to avoid the diplomatic incident that would arise if a Kemomi ship breached the Neutral Zone, so you don’t wanna anyone to know you’re here - even the local Kemomi patrols. Once that is done, you bring the Lucky Break out of its hyper-jump, leaving you about twenty minutes of sub-light flight away from your destination. Vhaja makes a motion for you to draw near. “Now then, for the most important part of the mission. Please take these data synthesizers. They are specially made to gather information from Spectra I.” A strange device that seems to be comprised of concentric rectangular frames with a brightly colored sphere in the center begins to hover above her hand. “And they are also one of a kind,” says Jyumon. “Or at least, three-of-a-kind. And quite sensitive." (link:"Accept the synthesizer")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/P28_JyumonVhajaArt_by_Erdjie.png " style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by ERDJIE(click-replace: "Art by ERDJIE")[https://www.deviantart.com/erdjie]] “It has bio-gel circuitry, and is powered by tiny, living insects which inhabit the inner frames. Each segment has a different scanning function, and must be set up within a triangulated distance from one another, about a mile apart.” You carefully take the object from her hands and slip it into your bag. Vhaja looks at you sternly. “Please do not lose it, drop it, or delay too long in setting it up. Once properly aligned, the segments will attune to the planet’s thaumic field, but if it runs out of battery before then it will be rendered inert.” “So basically, if we get incapacitated for too long, the mission’s a bust,” you observe. “Exactly. Please distribute the pieces at the proper locations as quickly as possible, and we will perform remote calibrations from orbit on the ship. However, transmission signals must otherwise be kept to an absolute minimum, both because we are not supposed to be here in the first place, but also because they will impact the synthesizer’s calibration settings. The only messages you should send are for each time you reach one of the destinations and set up the device to let us know to begin searching for its data stream. Once you’re finished, rendezvous with Krysta and Lumina at the Knottie camp, then head back to the landing site for extraction.” You nod in understanding. “Got it. So, maintain radio silence except after each successful installation.” At this point, you feel like you’ve gone over everything you needed to. You and Revissa just go over your equipment (and maybe do a bit of light canoodling), until you hear Krysta call out from in front of the helm. “Hey, looks like the planet is coming into view!” (set: $picP28 to true) [[Check it out ->P13]] ] Spectra I looks like - well, a planet. Green landmasses, blue oceans, a perfectly breathable atmosphere. Not that different from Fuwafuwa Prime, or any other habitable, life-supporting world. “So… what’s the big deal?” says Krysta, saying aloud what you were thinking. “Looks pretty boring to me.” Jyumon begins fiddling with the viewscreen controls. “Well, for one thing, the ectoplasmic discharge that builds up in the stratosphere creates a perpetual aurora borealis. At any time of year, any time of day, in any part of the continent, not localized to any particular region.” “Can I see it?” Revissa asks. “Yes, of course.” And with a press of a button, a display of the sky above the landing sight sends shivers down your spine as a kaleidoscopic array of fantastic colors swirls in a constant celestial tango. The display becomes only more vibrant as the ship breaches the planet’s atmosphere, quickly passing through clouds as it descends to the designated landing coordinates. From this high up, the trek to the three targets doesn’t look like it will be that bad at all, but you know from experience how dicey missions can get in the blink of an eye. To your relief, the Lucky Break’s landing struts properly deploy without any additional coaxing, despite not having been serviced since before the end of the war. And they hold their weight as the ship touches ground, giving nothing more than a few protesting creaks as the engines power down. [[Disembark ->P14]]The Lucky Break’s exit is via the loading ramp in the cargo bay, and, like always, the bay doors get stuck as they try to roll down, forcing you to take time to manually pull the emergency override lever to get it moving. Someday you’ll get it properly repaired. Probably. As soon as the ramp lowers, you are struck by a whiff of some of the freshest air you’ve ever breathed, and a dazzling light show twisting in the sky above you. To the west is a thriving, verdant forest, to the east are the ruins of long-gone civilization, and south are towering cliffs that nearly reach the aurora. For a supposedly dead planet, it certainly feels more alive than most industrialized worlds you’ve visited. Though, when you pay closer attention, you do get a sense of… wrongness to the place. You can’t really put a finger on why, because nothing your eyes, ears, or even nose tells you seems incorrect, yet the fur on the end of your tail still stands on end. *Fwump!* Speaking of fur, your oldest friend suddenly sprouts some as she takes in the view. (link:"SQUIRREL!")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/P29_SquirrelKrystaArt_by_ViciousTrunk.jpg " style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by ViciousTrunk(click-replace: "Art by ViciousTrunk")[https://www.deviantart.com/vicioustrunk https://twitter.com/vicioustrunk]] (set: $picP29 to true) You still don’t quite understand the process by which it happened - some kind of ancient magic that ‘unlocks true potential’ or something, but whatever the reason, Krysta now suffers from a ‘curse’ that randomly changes her from Yearthling to Squira. You always knew she was half Kemomi, but it seems the curse activated her recessive genes - and this was the result. While poofy-tailed she is faster and more nimble, and is able to scamper up trees and steep inclines, but is also more skittish and excitable, racing away at the slightest provocation. “Oooh… look at all those high branches!” she yells, eyes darting to the west. She starts to high-tail it over there, but a chiding voice from above calls her back before she gets too far.] |drink1)[(link:"Heaven help us")[(show:?drink2)]] |drink2)[<img src="images/P30_LuminaArt_by_ViciousTrunk.jpg " style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by ViciousTrunk(click-replace: "Art by ViciousTrunk")[https://www.deviantart.com/vicioustrunk https://twitter.com/vicioustrunk]] Though it’s been a few years, Lumina’s heavenly curves haven’t diminished an inch. If she’s gotten rounder since then, it’s been in all the right places. Her wings flutter behind her as she takes to the air, catching Krysta by the scruff and pulling her in the proper direction. “*Our* job is to be diplomats - remember?” “Right! Bondage!” Krysta says, her big, poofy tail swaying wildly behind her. You’re totally not jealous of how much floofier she is than you when she’s like this. Nope. Not at all. She scampers back towards you and smiles. “Alright, time for us to head out! You can find us with all the sexy tentacle-head ladies - just listen for the sound of ropes and leather,” she says with a smirk. For you, bondage is a fun way to pass the time with a girlfriend (or a sexy villain). For Krysta - and for Knotties - it’s a way of life. An art form. You have every confidence she’ll be able to win them over with her skills. And then she’s off in the proper direction. Lumina waves one last time, before soaring after her in the air. Though, before she gets out of sight, Krysta turns and calls out to you. “Make sure to eat that candy!” she yells. Right. The Star Scout Tracking Gumdrop. Apparently it’ll send out a distress signal if you get trapped. You fish around in your pocket, peel off the wrapper, and pop it in your mouth. …and immediately wish you hadn’t. It tastes *rancid*. Does this thing come with an expiration date? Or did Krysta just let it ferment in pickle juice and fish oil? (set: $picP30 to true) [[Spit it out - no amount of safety is worth suffering through this ->P14A]] [[Suck it up and suck it down - you could use the reassurance ->P14B]] ] *Ptooey!* You spit the expired gumdrop out onto the dirt. If you had to guess, Krysta was supposed to keep it refrigerated and just forgot. You don’t even want to imagine what gross things it was rubbing up against in her pocket all this time. Either way, it’s time to get on with your mission. (set: $candy to false) [[Get your bearings ->P15]] (css: "color: red;font-size: 90%" )[**Author’s Note: By selecting this option, you are entering “Bad End Mode”. Without Krysta’s failsafe, if you get yourself captured, trapped, or rendered inanimate, no one will be able to find and rescue you. If you’re not comfortable with the prospect of being stuck forever in whatever perils you might stumble into, go back and choose the other option. This choice otherwise has no impact on the game, and will not offer or take away any exploration paths, artwork opportunities, or content.**]As gross as this thing tastes, you know better than to throw away a lifeline. Though by the stars, you wish Krysta was better at keeping track of these things. If you had to guess, she was supposed to keep it refrigerated and just forgot. You don’t even want to imagine what gross things it was rubbing up against in her pocket all this time. For the next few minutes, your taste buds are assaulted in the most violent ways imaginable, but eventually your saliva manages to dissolve the whole thing. You don’t *feel* any different afterwards, but hopefully your sacrifice will be worth it when it matters most. Either way, it’s time to get on with your mission. (set: $candy to true) [[Get your bearings ->P15]] (css: "color: red;font-size: 90%" )[**Author’s Note: By selecting this option, you are entering “Safety Mode”. With Krysta’s failsafe, even if you get yourself captured, trapped, or rendered inanimate, you will, eventually, be discovered and restored to normal - though it may take a long time, and will almost certainly mean failing your mission. At least, however, you won’t be doomed forever if you mess up. If you prefer permanent Bad Ends for your mistakes, go back and choose the other option. This choice otherwise has no impact on the game, and will not offer or take away any exploration paths, artwork opportunities, or content.**]As you take a moment to take in your surroundings, you see the loading ramp retract behind you, and hear the Lucky Break’s engines start to fire up (with a slight sputter, since it takes the old girl a bit of time to get going). You and Revissa take safe cover being a nearby boulder, then look up as your ship flies high up into the sky, becoming a tiny speck before disappearing entirely. “Welp, guess it’s back to just the two of us,” you say to your darling wife. Revissa smiles, leans in for a kiss, then pulls out her staff. You draw your sword and grin, standing beside her with the ruins to the west looming in the horizon. (link:"Strike a pose")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/P31_MelfyRevissaArt_by_Erdjie.png" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by ERDJIE(click-replace: "Art by ERDJIE")[https://www.deviantart.com/erdjie]] So this is it - the start of your mission. Until you place one of the three data gathering devices, you’ve been instructed not to contact Vhaja back on the Lucky Break. Based on the map, the sites you need to head towards are within the ruins, deep in the spider forest to the east, and within the cave system to the south. And Krysta has gone off to negotiate with the Knotties at their encampment to the southeast. It’s time to go on an adventure! Where will you head first? (set: $picP31 to true) (set: $ProgressLevelSelect to true) [[Explore the Ruins ->RA01]] [[Plunge into the Spider Forest -> FA01]] [[Delve into the Caverns ->CA01]] [[Check up on Krysta at the Knottie Camp ->KA01]] [[Start Over->A0X]] (css: "color: red;font-size: 90%" )[**Author’s Note: This game is still under development! Currently, there is only content available in the Spider Forest. Please stay tuned for more in future updates!**] ] (if: $forestcomplete4eva is true)[Congratulations on making it through the Spider Forest! You’ve cleared one path, but there will be others once the game is complete. Here’s a preview of what you can find in the Ancient Ruins. Spectra I is a dead world, literally. Centuries ago all life on it was destroyed, yet somehow, the planet still carries on as if it wasn’t. But while trees and plants and baser animals are still active here, there’s no signs of intelligent life, despite the fact there are ruins of advanced civilizations scattered all across the land. While exploring this area, you might just solve the mystery of why that is. But before you enter the deepest part of the ruins, first you’ll need to find the entrance. That will require moving about on the surface through a network of destroyed buildings. All those broken walls and collapsed roofs make for perfect hiding places… for you, or for a predator trying to hunt you. (link:"Go on safari")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/R01_SafariIwani_by_Goddo.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Goddo(click-replace: "Art by Goddo")[https://www.deviantart.com/goddo15 https://twitter.com/goddoartt]] Her name is Iwani, and she’s a gorgon. And not just any gorgon - a gorgon with whom Melfy is intimately familiar. Years ago, you foiled her plot to petrify the holo-film star Artura Rembrant and got her arrested. It turns out Iwani had been spending centuries adopting the persona of film directors just to capture famous actresses right before their careers declined, but you ruined all that and had her gallery of starlets taken from her. Now she wants revenge. She’s followed you to this planet and donned hunting gear, and is lying in wait to add you to her collection as payback. If you manage to make it past her (and unlock the entrance to the ruins with a key you might find in the Knottie Camp), you’ll descend underground to a subterranean crypt. It’s full of dangerous traps, but also hidden archeological secrets that reveal the hidden history of this dead planet. And there’s someone here researching those secrets.] |drink1)[(link:"Make first contact")[(show:?drink2)]] |drink2)[<img src="images/R04_Areka_by_Izra.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Izra(click-replace: "Art by Izra")[https://twitter.com/IZRART https://picarto.tv/IZRA]] Areka is a mysterious and beautiful alien from a place that Melfy’s portion of the galaxy has little to no contact with. She’s fascinated by ancient history, and would love to learn more about the culture and people of Spectra I before it was destroyed. She could be an ally, but push her the wrong way, and she might push *you* into some of the traps throughout the temple to make her own job easier. And of course, she might have enemies of her own that have tracked her down here… But she’s not the only foreign visitor this far in. Prowling the depths of the ruins is another gorgeous woman, though this one’s interested in a different kind of ancient history.] |drink2)[(link:"She's hard to ignore")[(show:?drink3)]] |drink3)[<img src="images/R03_Silica_by_Izra.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Izra(click-replace: "Art by Izra")[https://twitter.com/IZRART https://picarto.tv/IZRA]] Her name is Silica, and she’s got the powers of a “Leystrider”. These natural-born travelers can instantly traverse the space between worlds by riding the leylines that connect planets together. But every leystrider has a different condition to make their powers work. For Silica, she needs to transform a sentient native of that planet into a waypoint – by petrifying them and anchoring their soul to the planet’s leyline. But unfortunately for her, there’s no intelligent life here… or is there? Does she know something the rest of you don’t? Perhaps there’s life here after all. Or at least, one life. The planet’s people might have died, but there’s one entity still keeping the place in order. Her name is Isis, and she’s a goddess of death. She’s decided to punish the souls of the planet’s former dominant race by locking them away for eternity as mummy-wrapped bundles in the planet’s depths. And she’s got a chip on her shoulder about it, and will be quick to punish *any* living beings who dare come into her presence…] |drink3)[(link:"You are dying to meet her")[(show:?drink4)]] |drink4)[<img src="images/R02_MelfyIsis_by_Dvega.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Dvega(click-replace: "Art by Dvega")[https://www.deviantart.com/dvega https://picarto.tv/Tek]] Can you avoid her wrath? Or will you end up joining the souls of the planet’s departed locked forever in a tomb? [(link:"Go back")[(go-to: (history:)'s last)]]]](else: )[Under Construction! Hit the back button to return to the place you came from.]{ (if: $stagecomplete is '1')[ You bring up a map of the area on your comm device, noting that your next destination is a few hours walk from the landing site. <br /><br /> With one success already under your belt, you’re feeling pretty good. Good enough to tackle what is surely the most difficult task of the adventure - making it through a forest full of spiders. On every planet you visit, there always seems to be something that wants to snag you in webs - be it massive arachnids, adorable moths, or, your favorite, gorgeous ladies with silk-spinning abilities. And while there is no promise there are actually any spiders in the ‘spider forest’ (and if there are, that any of them are hot-lady-shaped) you certainly walk with a spring in your step as you imagine how much fun it will be if there are. ](else-if: $stagecomplete is '2')[ So this is it, the last leg of the adventure. You just need to plant one more data collection device and you’ll be done. It’s been a rough time so far, but you’re feeling confident as you bring up the map of the area on your comm device. Only a few hour’s walk to the outskirts of the forest area. <br /><br /> “Saving the best for last, are we?” says Revissa with a knowing smirk. <br /><br /> You raise an eyebrow at her, but she points to your backside - where your tail has been steadily wagging back and forth. Okay, fine, so it’s true. You’ve always been turned on by the idea of getting tangled up in webs - especially when it’s a gorgeous lady spinning the silk. And while there is no guarantee that the ‘spider forest’ has spiders (or that they are lady-shaped spiders if there are), you won’t deny you kind of hope there will be. ](else: )[Your tail flicks behind you eagerly as you bring up the map of the local area on your comm device. From the landing site, it’s maybe an hour’s walk to reach the edge of the forest area, and then a significantly more difficult trek to get to the location where you need to place the data device. <br /><br /> Revissa rolls her eyes. “Of course you would want to check out the forest first. What, is my shapeshifting not enough to indulge your spider obsession?” <br /><br /> You cough awkwardly, and try to make excuses, but your wagging tail is a dead giveaway. Fine, so it’s true. You have a thing specifically for sexy spider ladies wrapping you up. Is that so wrong? It’s not like there’s any guarantee that the ‘spider forest’ actually has spiders in it, or, if there are, that the spiders come in hot lady form - though you’d be lying if you said you weren’t hoping they were. ]} Fetishistic thoughts aside, the walk to the woods is otherwise uneventful. The aurora gleams brightly overhead, causing your shadows to form gleaming, rainbow-colored silhouettes against the ground as you travel. For a ghost planet, everything feels incredibly alive, beautifully vibrant, delightfully engaging - maybe even supernaturally so. You wonder if this world was so breathtaking before it was destroyed, or if its inexplicable resurrection is responsible for all the wonders you’ve witnessed as you’ve explored it. Either way, the two of you eventually reach the edge of the trees without incident. The forest stretches endlessly ahead of you, the trees climbing high into the air. From a distance, you had thought it must be autumn, because all the leaves were brightly colored, but this close you can see that it’s something far more fantastic. You’re no botanist, but you know enough about nature to be aware that plants feed on sunlight, that chlorophyll in their leaves drinks in solar rays. But the aurora must be somehow filtering the sunlight, changing its properties, which in turn imbues every leaf on every tree with a glittery sheen that refracts into rainbow prisms in pools of light on the ground. It is, to be honest, breathtaking. “I’ve never seen something so beautiful…” says your wife, spellbound, beside you. You give her a roguish smile. “Have you never looked in a mirror?” That gets you an elbow jab between the ribs. Revissa chides you for thinking any mere mortal could outstrip the beauty of the natural world. Looks like chivalry is as dead here as the rest of the planet. Or maybe you just don’t have as much game as you used to - lines like that used to work all the time when you first started dating! However, a soft smile from your wife gives you some validation, as she holds out a hand. And once you take it, she leads you into the trees, her eyes bright and eager to experience the wonders of the forest ahead of you. You wisely decide not to ask her to keep an eye out for gorgeous spider ladies. [[Into the Woods->FA02]] (if: $forestcomplete4eva is true)[Congratulations on making it through the Spider Forest! You’ve cleared one path, but there will be others once the game is complete. Here’s a preview of what you can find in the Caverns. You’ll need to plant your data device in the deepest part of the caverns, but something is lying in wait there, eager to claim some prey. You may have encountered a portion of this creature while exploring the forest, a living slime symbiote capable of coating its victims in tightly conforming black rubber. (link:"Achieve symbiosis")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/C01_Desiree_by_Riidil.png" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Riidi(click-replace: "Art by Riidi")[https://twitter.com/m_riidi]] Her name is Desireé, though she prefers if you just call her Desire. She hungers for body heat, especially heat generated by intelligent beings. Her body is nearly indestructible, though it is susceptible to cold, and she’s able to emit powerful pheromones that lure her targets into her lusty embrace. Once she has them in her thrall, she’ll coat them head to toe in elements of her body and stow them away, to keep them as replenishing sources of sustenance. Melfy has never met her before, but another member of her crew has, and if she discovered the connection, she might try to use our heroine to lure the rest of her friends into her clutches… No matter how hard you try, if you face Desireé with just the tools you have available, you’ll be sure to fail. But perhaps there’s something else in the caverns that can aid you in your quest. Because, as it so happens, these caves happen to be the location of an ancient dragon’s hoard. Or, more accurately, multiple dragons. It was called the First Dragon Bank, and it was a rare collaboration between the ancient and powerful lizards. The idea was, essentially, they would each contribute some of the wealth from their hoards into a combined stockpile, and that money would be used as capital to fund various ventures in the galactic stock market, with dividends to be paid out between all the members. However, when Spectra I was supposedly destroyed, the hidden hoard was lost. But now the planet has returned, and all that dragon’s wealth is ripe for the taking! …though of course it won’t be *easy*. The bank is guarded, both by devious traps, and by four artificial intelligence-powered holograms, each bearing the memories and personalities of the dragons that joined forces to bring the bank into existence.] |drink1)[(link:"Bow before her")[(show:?drink2)]] |drink2)[<img src="images/C02_RahnaGold_by_Izra.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Izra(click-replace: "Art by Izra")[https://twitter.com/IZRART https://picarto.tv/IZRA]] Rahna Draconlev the red dragon is the first. Some might call her arrogant, though she would tell them it’s only considered arrogance when your status is unearned. She believes herself superior to non-dragons merely as a circumstance as her birth, and won’t hold that against you – so long as you respect her strength and authority. She favors valuables such as gemstones and gold, and her traps will likely transform you into material of the same kind.] |drink2)[(link:"Chill out wit her")[(show:?drink3)]] |drink3)[<img src="images/C04_LadyFrigga_by_MuleExpress.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by MuleExpress(click-replace: "Art by MuleExpress")[https://twitter.com/alfiardyrulli]] Lady Frigga, the white dragon, is the second. Though some might call her demeanor ‘cold’, the truth is she is an adherent to the ideas of fairness and justice. Of course, those who act unjustly must be punished… and intruding upon the hoard of a dragon and trying to steal from it would certainly meet that criteria. Those she deems to be in need of judgment will be met with icy indifference, and will suffer the chilling consequences of their actions.] |drink3)[(link:"Geek out with her")[(show:?drink4)]] |drink4)[<img src="images/C05_Coactore_by_Dreamons2.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Dreamons(click-replace: "Art by Dreamons")[https://www.deviantart.com/dreamons2]] Coactore D. Raco, the amethyst dragon, is the third member of the alliance. Though dragons are by nature quite reclusive, Coactore could rightly be called a shut-in. When she exerts influence over the galaxy, she usually does so from the comfort of her personal lair through shell corporations and holo-net avatars, rarely being seen outside her home. Some have called her the “Nerd Dragon”, a moniker that fits her well, given her tendency to accumulate trading cards and shiny action figures… and her propensity to use magic or her minty-fresh gloss breath to transform people into those collectibles.] |drink4)[(link:"Find out about her")[(show:?drink5)]] |drink5)[<img src="images/C03_RazielLightning_by_Izra.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Izra(click-replace: "Art by Izra")[https://twitter.com/IZRART https://picarto.tv/IZRA]] Finally, there is the mind behind the infrastructure that makes the whole bank tick. Raziel is half blue dragon and half demon, mistress of lightning and wielder of infernal influence. The currency she most likes to trade in is information, something she hoards with as much fervor as a traditional dragon accumulates gold. The bank was her idea, a way to leverage wealth, plus her intel about the galactic stock exchange and market movements, to enrich all the members of the alliance. Her knowledge is what created the holographic representations of her fellow dragons in the first place, and her own avatar resides in the control center as the admin that keeps the bank running. Play your cards right, and something in the bank’s vaults may help you complete your mission. But one wrong move, and you’ll end up as a part of the hoard instead. [(link:"Go back")[(go-to: (history:)'s last)]]]](else: )[Under Construction! Hit the back button to return to the place you came from.](if: $forestcomplete4eva is true)[Congratulations on making it through the Spider Forest! You’ve cleared one path, but there will be others once the game is complete. Here’s a preview of what you can find in the Knottie Camp. The Knottie Camp will be a smaller section in terms of the others, about the length of one of the roads through the forest. It would be more accurate to call it an extension of the Ruins path, especially because the key to the deepest part of the ruins is being held somewhere in the camp, and must be found to proceed. As a species, the Knotties are wholly dedicated to the art of bondage and restraint - to them, being tied up is part of their religion, it’s a strongly held spiritual belief (though some also favor the use of freezium encasement). But for some sects of Knotties, this is not just a way of life, but a compulsion that overrides all other thoughts and emotions. Such is the case for the Shackled Sisters, a powerful and dangerous cult who are dedicated to bringing the love of bondage to all species in the galaxy… by force, if necessary. Their end goal is for every woman, everywhere, to be placed into permanent and inescapable bondage, and the unique properties of Spectra I’s ghost matter will be instrumental in them advancing that cause. The leader of the camp is a Shackled Sister named Abrahbaba, though everyone here just calls her by her title of Domina. (link:"Check her out")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/K01__Abrahbaba_by_Riidi.png" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Riidi(click-replace: "Art by Riidi")[https://twitter.com/m_riidi]] Both beautiful and incredibly skilled at the art of restraint, one wrong move in her presence will surely end up taking you to a prison cell – or worse. But she is still a woman guided by intense religious devotion and an abiding sense of honor, so you might be able to escape her clutches if you find a loophole in the restrictive rules of her belief system. In addition, while exploring the camp you might stumble upon a beautiful captive. The kind-hearted, innocent, and almost comically naive Elvaan princess, Noctelle Hozma, has been kidnapped by the bondage-obsessed aliens.] |drink1)[(link:"Meet Noctelle")[(show:?drink2)]] |drink2)[<img src="images/K02_PrincessNoctelle_by_Dreamons2.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Dreamons(click-replace: "Art by Dreamons")[https://www.deviantart.com/dreamons2]] Rescuing her is certainly the right thing to do… but it will surely complicate matters. She is a princess in both the literal sense, but also in the meta-fictive sense, in that she embodies the qualities of the damsel in distress to an absurd degree. Having her nearby will invite perils upon our heroes that they might not be able to rescue her (or themselves) from. Though would being captured together with such a lovely royal damsel really be considered a “Bad” end? [(link:"Go back")[(go-to: (history:)'s last)]]]](else: )[Under Construction! Hit the back button to return to the place you came from.]Welcome to The Perils of Spectra I. (if: $ProgressGameStart is true)[[[Start a new game->A0X]]](else: )[[[Start a new game->P01]]] (if: $ProgressGameStart is true)[(link:"Save game")[ (if:(save-game:"Slot A"))[ Game saved! ](else: )[ Sorry, I couldn't save your game. ] ]] {(if: (saved-games: ) contains "Slot A")[ (link: "Load game")[(load-game:"Slot A")] ]} (link-goto: "Resume Current Game", $lastPassage) Disclaimer: This is a fetish-themed choose-your-own-adventure story that features scenarios and imagery that may be erotic, disturbing, or both. Content includes nudity, sexual themes, non-consenting sexual intercourse, bondage, transformation, and perilous fates. [[How to Play->A01]] [[Image Gallery->AI00]] [[Challenges->A03]] [[About the Setting->A02]] [[Options->A06]] (if: $debug is true)[[[Debug Menu->A05]]](else: )[[[Activate Debug Mode->A04]]] (css: "color: green;font-size: 70%")[Version 1.0] (css: "color: black;font-size: 70%")[a] The Perils of Spectra I runs on Twine, a free-to-use interactive story-making program. To advance between story chapters, you simply need to click the blue links, which will either reveal new parts of the current passage or take you to the next one. On occasion, you will have more than one option, giving the story branching paths. Sometimes, the paths will eventually reconvene, but the game ‘remembers’ the choices you made, which might influence future events. It is also possible to encounter ‘Bad Ends’, a series of choices which makes the heroines unable to complete their mission. When you reach Game Over screen, you will either need to retrace your steps with the back arrow (see below), or start the game over to try again. When starting your game over, you can begin from certain checkpoints in the story. This is useful to avoid repeating segments you have already seen, but keep in mind that many branches in the game depend on choices you have made or secrets you have discovered in earlier sections, so jumping right ahead to a checkpoint may lock you out of some secret paths. If you hover over the upper left portion of your screen, a curly white ‘back’ arrow will appear, taking you back to the previous passage. If you do this, any progress made, triggers activated, options chosen, etc, will be ‘forgotten’ by the game. This is important to keep in mind if you are trying to unlock all of the images for the image gallery, available from the main menu. At the bottom of every page is a link to return to the Main Menu. However, if you return to the menu, then resume your current game, your 'back' arrow will take you back to the menu and not the previous passage within the game. There is also a Save Game feature. When choosing to save your game, information about the game’s current state is stored as a cookie in the browser you are using. Make sure that cookies are enabled or you will be unable to save your progress. Your game will automatically load whenever you start it up. Please note that there is only one save file, though thanks to the checkpoint system it should never be too difficult to backtrack to a story segment you enjoy. Unfortunately, there is not currently any way to transfer save files between different computers, devices, or browsers. This means if you change your device you will need to start the game over again. [[Back to the Main Menu->A00]] Welcome to the Image Gallery! Every time you encounter an image in the story, it will be unlocked here for future viewing. Just make sure not to back out using Twine’s previous page function, and instead manually exit back to the main menu. [[Prologue Images->AIP]] [[Ruins Images->AIR]] [[Spider Forest Images->AIF]] [[Caverns Images->AIC]] [[Knottie Camp Images->AIK]] (if: $gallery is true)[[[Special Gallery->AIA]]] [[Back to Main Menu->A00]]<img src="images/A03_StarphoriaPoster_by_Dvega.jpg " style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Dvega(click-replace: "Art by Dvega")[https://www.deviantart.com/dvega https://picarto.tv/Tek]] Starphoria is a universe created by Sekikumo and TheAmberBub, used as a setting for many stories, roleplaying sessions, and tabletop campaigns. It features a galaxy full of magic, technology, and adventure! There are hundreds of different species scattered throughout the worlds of Starphoria, many of them strange, grotesque, monstrous, or even non-organic. However, all humanoid species are purely female in shape and form. Everyone in Starphoria who isn’t a weird slug creature, a rock monster, a robot, or some other unusual critter is a gorgeous woman. And on top of that, those gorgeous women always seem to run afoul of kinky perils. Clothing gets shredded or destroyed at the slightest touch, entire cultures are built around bondage, petrification, or transformation, and most people seem quick to jump into bed with each other without much pretense. It’s a playground for the strange predilections of its authors, and it doesn’t pretend to be anything else. While the history and lore of Starphoria is expansive and ever-evolving, for the purposes of this game, knowing about these factions should be enough to get you up to speed. **The Kemomi Empire** The Kemomi are animal-eared women with the traits of cats, foxes, and wolves, with centuries of inter-breeding making them essentially a single species (though usually with dominant features of one of the three). Within the Empire’s sphere of influence are also the bunny-eared Usami, the aquatic Pescans, and the bushy-tailed Squira. **The Elvaan Federation** Long-eared, lithe-bodied Elvaans are graced with lifespans that are measured in centuries, a fact that often leads to them feeling they are superior to other races. Far from unified, the Federation is a loose coalition among different subraces of the species, which are roughly grouped into the Blanche and Noire. Fiercely hierarchical with a powerful class of nobility, the Elvaans were known for enslaving members of other species or transforming them into decorative statues - especially Kemomi. Tensions over this practice eventually exploded into a bloody, years-long war, which has only recently ended with a tentative truce. **Knotties** A relatively minor species of women on the galactic stage, who have tendril-like growths on their heads instead of hair. Their entire culture is centered around the art of bondage and restraint. **Spider Queens** A race of war-like conquerors, bearing the upper torso of a powerfully built woman, and the lower body of a monstrous spider. The only reason they aren’t a major galactic power is that queens are fiercely territorial and constantly battle each other for supremacy, limiting their ability to mobilize on a scale that can threaten the major powers - though isolated or remote colonies often prove tempting targets for individual queens. **Tsunojians** A species of horned women who were once aggressive and war-like, until they restructured their culture to focus on sports and other non-violent forms of competition. Known for hosting the galaxy’s most intense and elaborate game shows. **The Shackled Sisters** A fanatical cult of Knottie monks who believe the ideal state of existence is to be in permanent, inescapable bondage - and who wish to forcibly ‘convert’ other beings to sharing in that joy. **Star Scouts** A galaxy-wide peace-keeping organization of magical girls. Anyone, from any species can become a Star Scout, so long as they have a pure heart and a desire to do good. A collection of one or two page vignettes showcasing Bad Ends for various heroines throughout the multiverse, unrelated to the main story or meta-story. You can find them by clicking on secret links hiding in plain text throughout the game. ] Spider Forest Complete *Collect all the art in the Spider Forest* (if: ($picF01 is true) and ($picF02 is true) and ($picF03 is true) and ($picF04 is true) and ($picF05 is true) and ($picF06 is true) and ($picF52 is true) and ($picF53 is true) and ($picF54 is true) and ($picF55 is true) and ($picF56 is true) and ($picF57 is true) and ($picF58 is true) and ($picF59 is true) and ($picF60 is true) and ($picF61 is true) and ($picF62 is true) and ($picF63 is true) and ($picF64 is true) and ($picF65 is true) and ($picF66 is true) and ($picF67 is true) and ($picF68 is true) and ($picF69 is true) and ($picF70 is true) and ($picF71 is true) and ($picF72 is true) and ($picF73 is true) and ($picF74 is true) and ($picF75 is true) and ($picF76 is true) and ($picF77 is true) and ($picF78 is true) and ($picF79 is true) and ($picF80 is true) and ($picF81 is true) and ($picF82 is true) and ($picF83 is true) and ($picF84 is true) and ($picF85 is true) and ($picF86 is true) and ($picF87 is true) and ($picF88 is true) and ($picF89 is true) and ($picF90 is true) and ($picF91 is true) and ($picF92 is true) and ($picF93 is true) and ($picF94 is true) and ($picF95 is true) and ($picF96 is true) and ($picF97 is true) and ($picF98 is true) and ($picF99 is true) and ($picF100 is true) and ($picF101 is true) and ($picF102 is true) and ($picF103 is true) and ($picF104 is true) and ($picF105 is true) and ($picF106 is true) and ($picF107 is true) and ($picF108 is true) and ($picF109 is true) and ($picF110 is true) and ($picF111 is true) and ($picF112 is true) and ($picF113 is true) and ($picF114 is true) and ($picF115 is true) and ($picF116 is true) and ($picF117 is true) and ($picF118 is true) and ($picF119 is true) and ($picF120 is true) and ($picF121 is true) and ($picF122 is true) and ($picF123 is true) and ($picF124 is true) and ($picF125 is true) and ($picF126 is true) and ($picF127 is true) and ($picF128 is true) and ($picF129 is true) and ($picF130 is true) and ($picF131 is true) and ($picF132 is true) and ($picF133 is true) and ($picF134 is true) and ($picF135 is true) and ($picF136 is true) and ($picF137 is true) and ($picF138 is true) and ($picF140 is true) and ($picF141 is true) and ($picF142 is true))[(link:"Complete!")[(show:?FC21)]] |FC21)[<img src="images/FC20_WebComic1_by_Grafhou.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;"> <img src="images/FC21_WebComic2_by_Grafhou.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;"> <img src="images/FC22_WebComic3_by_Grafhou.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;"> <img src="images/FC23_WebComic4_by_Grafhou.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;"> <img src="images/F45_TotalPartyWeb_by_Grafhou.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Grafhou(click-replace: "Art by Grafhou")[https://www.deviantart.com/grafhou https://twitter.com/Grafhou2]] ] ] [[Back to the Main Menu->A00]]After only a few minutes of walking, you find yourself totally enmeshed in nature. The trees close in around you, concealing the rest of the planet’s scenery from view. Leaves crunch and crack beneath your feet as you walk, each one letting out little sparks of iridescence as you release whatever energy remains trapped within them after falling from their branches. All around you, you hear the chattering of birds, see the motion of scurrying insects, and can even smell the pollen of blooming flora filling the air around you. It would be easy to forget you’re here for a reason. In fact, for a short while, you do. But eventually you pull out your comm device and bring out a topological map of the area, trying to pick the best way forward. (set: $FBStart to false)(set: $FCStart to false)(set: $FDStart to false) [[Plan your route->FA03]] (set: $foreststart to true) Though Revissa loves nature, she finds maps of it artificial and uninteresting. So as you pore over the readout on your device, she wanders off to inspect some local flora. But you don’t mind - it’s a perfect opportunity to put your wilderness survival skills to the test! You might have gotten rusty cooped up in a spaceship for most of your adult life, but you’ve still got the in-born talent of a kemomi to fall back on. After some deliberation, you pick out three viable trails through the woods. The first is the low road, taking you along the path of a river cutting through a winding ravine. The second is the high road, taking you in a curved arc alongside the trajectory of the steep cliffs that encircle the western reaches of the forest. Finally, you could take the middle road, the shortest in distance, but with no discernible landmarks to follow. You’d basically be wandering blind through the thickest tangle of forest. All the options have their benefits and drawbacks, but after considering from every angle, you make your decision. Revissa really only seems interested in the local plants, so it seems like you’re free to go in whatever direction you want. [[Take the high road->FB01]] [[Take the low road->FC01]] [[Take the middle road->FD01]] [[Take an interest in what Revissa is looking at first->FA04]] (set: $lewdpollen to false)(set: $FBStart to true) In the end, you opt for the high road. It might be the longest of the three choices, but it’s also, in your opinion, the safest. Moving along the side of the cliff will give you a vantage point from which you can overlook the entire forest area, allowing you to spot any obvious signs of danger. Not to mention you can get the lay of the land, and pick out the best route to reach the destination from afar. Maybe even figure out why this place is called the Spider Forest. And so you follow the plan. Heading west, you find a ridge overlooking the area and head across it, always trying to keep to the higher ground. The forest is still thick here, but now whenever you climb a tree you are treated to an amazing view of not just the entire forest, but also the landscape beyond it. You can see the landing site, the scattered tents of the Knottie camp, and the sprawl of ancient ruins just past it. But… still no spiders. Not that you were hoping for spiders, or anything… but at the same time, you are a bit upset at the lack of truth in advertising. Who even named it that, anyway? “Jyumon did,” Revissa informs you when you ask her. “She had a bad experience with a jungle expedition once, and from then onwards just assumed every forest was a Spider Forest.” Fair enough. And in her defense, most forests the galaxy over are teeming with spiders. This one seems to be the exception. Noting your annoyance, Revissa wanders off into the trees for a moment, searching for something. After a while, she calls you over. “There you go!” she says proudly. “Spiders! In the forest!” You follow her finger… and sure enough, there is, indeed, a whole nest of tiny arachnids scurrying about in a dead, hollowed-out tree. Each one is about the size of your fingernail. They’re covered in bright pink fuzz, and seem to have a whole little society built here, more like a colony of ants than anything else. Adorable, to be sure, but nothing sexy about it. Where are the gorgeous spider babes here to wrap you up?! Revissa just rolls her eyes, even though you didn’t say that out loud. You grin sheepishly and motion to a log a few meters away. Good place to take a rest. She agrees, and the two of you sit down and set down your gear. (if: $lewdpollen is true)[And then… you take off more than that. A strange warmth suddenly grips you, and you find yourself peeling off your boots. And your pants. Your shirt, your underwear. What’s happening? Why are you suddenly so… horny? “The pollen from earlier,” Revissa remarks between heavy breaths. “From that flower you disturbed. It must have had… aphrodisiac properties…” Her face flushes as she reaches over and takes your hand. The two of you lock eyes, expressions of desire evident on both of your faces. Triggering that pollen was a mistake to be sure, but… you see no reason whatsoever why you shouldn’t capitalize on that mistake right now.] (if: $lewdpollen is false)[[[Take a load off->FB02]]] (if: $lewdpollen is true)[[[Have some fun->FB03]]] (set: $FCStart to true) After careful consideration, you decide on taking the low road. According to your map, simply following the river’s path will eventually take you a mere half-mile from the destination point, minimizing your chances of getting lost or distracted. And so you head to the side of the river. From one bank to the other it is maybe 30 feet across, though looking over the edge you can see that it gets reasonably deep in places, deep enough that you couldn’t just wade across it. Thankfully, it is flowing at a pretty manageable pace, though sadly your location is upstream from the direction of the current, so you won’t just be able to sail your way there. Either way, you make quite good progress following the river’s meandering trail, deciding to stick to the bank instead of venturing off into the trees. Revissa remarks at all the fascinating plants springing up in the mineral-rich silt at the sides of the stream, happily collecting leaf and seed samples from the ones she finds most interesting and stowing them in her pack. It is, altogether, a rather uneventful journey, though after about an hour of walking you come across something that surprises you. Poking out of a tree is a metal spigot, standing out like a sore thumb in the otherwise pristine environment unmarred by the intervention of civilization. The faucet at the end of the spigot is dripping with the residue of a clear amber liquid, which has piled up in a small puddle at the ground beneath it. An overwhelming sweet, honey-like scent wafts from the liquid, suggesting it’s some kind of tree nectar rich in natural sugars. But what’s it doing here, and who’s collecting it? “I can’t believe it!” Revissa remarks. “This forest is so beautiful! Who would dare spoil it by harvesting its resources?” That is actually an excellent question. Looking around, you do see a path leading through the trees that looks like it was worn down not by local wildlife, but humanoid feet. Has someone made an outpost here? It bears investigating… but poking around could be dangerous if the culprits were smugglers of some sort - not to mention you’d be taking time away from your mission objectives. (if: $lewdpollen is true)[And yet, as you ponder the choice, you can’t help but take notice of your wife. The defiant look in her eyes, the slight curl of annoyance on her lips, the adorable way her little deer tail flicks to the side when she’s upset at something. She’s always the most beautiful when she’s mad. You can’t help yourself but feel massively turned on. In fact, your body is completely gripped by a warmth that defies explanation, and as soon as you register the desire it becomes impossible to ignore, demanding that you act on your impulses immediately. [[Act on your desires->FC01A]] ](else: )[[[Investigate the area->FC02]] [[Continue on with the mission->FC03]]] (set: $FDStart to true) At the end of the day, you’re just here to plant the data device and leave. So the direct route seems the best option for the job. Sure, it’s a thick, impenetrable tangle of trees and foliage, but you’re not some primeval hunter fighting her way through an ancient forest. You come from a galaxy-spanning civilization with access to tech that would be inconceivable to your distant ancestors. Technology like a wrist-mounted comm device that can access the scanners back on the Lucky Break in orbit to display a holographic map of the topography. How could you possibly get lost with something like that? …an hour of walking later, you find out. You were so certain you were heading the right way, yet every time you check the map, it displays your position as farther and farther off course. “Maybe it’s busted,” Revissa suggests after a while. “It’s not busted!” you protest. “See? The location data is updating properly. If there was an uplink error it would tell me!” Your wife shrugs. “Then maybe you’re just bad at reading it.” Your pride does not allow you to even entertain that option. Surely there’s something else at play here. But what? And… even if you knew what it was, what, exactly, are you planning on doing about it? “Let’s just stop and ask for directions,” Revissa eventually suggests. You raise an eyebrow at the absurdity of the statement. “What? I’m a druid, remember? I can talk to plants!” For some reason, some sort of stubborn, primal part of your psyche feels opposed to that plan. You can figure it out, you just need more time! If anything, Revissa is the one being unreasonable, doubting your pathfinding skills! Surely you’ll reach your destination eventually. The forest isn’t *that* big! Though… maybe she would be happier with you if you just went along with her idea anyway. Wives can be like that sometimes. Or you could just give up entirely and head back the way you came in defeat. (if: $lewdpollen is true)[And… come to think about it. All of this walking has made you surprisingly… hot and bothered. In fact, just looking at your gorgeous wife makes you bite your lower lip in desire. Maybe what everyone needs right now is a bit of… relaxation. [[Kiss and make up->FD05]] ](else: )[ [[Keep stubbornly pressing on->FD02]] [[Give up and retrace your steps->FD03]] [[Let Revissa ask for directions->FD04]] ] The adventure can wait. Revissa is clearly interested in the local plants, and she deserves the chance to investigate them to her heart’s content. What kind of wife would you be if you pulled her away from that? Especially considering how much she has given up, living with you in a cramped, broken-down starship. She’s a student of nature, an animist, a druid, someone who loves the outdoors even more than you do - and, given her life’s history, has considerably more first-hand experience living in it. And so, in deference to this, you don’t interrupt her as she studies the fantastical flora of this strange world. Instead, you just quietly walk up beside her, laying a gentle hand on her shoulder as she looks into the bulb of some sort of pink-ish colored blossom. “What’cha lookin’ at?” you begin to say, but you don’t even get two syllables in before the unexpected pressure of your hand causes Revissa to yelp in surprise! You should have known better. Despite all her training and experience, she still has the instincts of a deer - a prey animal. She practically leaps into the air from your startling presence, losing all concentration over whatever ritual she was conducting with the plant. As a result, the bulbous bulb opens and lets out a pungent puff of pollen, filling the air around the two of you and making you both sneeze. And so, your only reward for trying to be a conscientious and accommodating spouse is a dirty look and a painful jab in the shin with the butt of her staff. Chivalry really *is* dead. In no further mood to talk, she just sullenly follows after you as you proceed with your adventure. As before, there are three paths before you. (set: $lewdpollen to true) [[Take the high road->FB01]] [[Take the low road->FC01]] [[Take the middle road->FD01]] You take a deep breath, enjoying the crisp freshness of the clear forest air. It seems even cleaner this high up, perhaps fortified by some winds blowing in from the cliffs up above. Revissa seems happy as well, even going so far to shrug off her clothing and stand naked amongst the trees, drinking in the beauty of the world around her. Though if you’re being perfectly honest, the most beautiful thing here is her. Your heart races as you watch the wind flick her long hair braid around behind her, and an errant beam of sunlight filters through the trees to highlight the ritual tattoos on her gorgeous body. It’s all so perfect… but you can think of a way to make it even better… [[Pounce on her and have some kinky forest fun->FB02A]] [[Sit back and enjoy the show->FB02B]] Despite being the predator among the two of you, it is often Revissa who makes the first move in situations like this. But today, you’re feeling guilty for messing up her flower studies, so you decide your lovely wife deserves a treat. A treat in the form of you pouncing on her and rolling her onto her back, pressing up against her as you press her with kisses. (link:"Canoodle")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/F01_MelfyRevissaLoving_by_DAKuroiHoshi.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by KuroiHoshi(click-replace: "Art by KuroiHoshi")[https://www.deviantart.com/dakuroihoshi https://picarto.tv/TheKuroiHoshi]] (set: $picF01 to true) Revissa, thankfully, is completely into it. Seems she got just as heavy a dose of that pollen as you did. And neither of you are in any mood to try and fight it. That’s part of why you love her so much. For all her bluster, she’s just as much of a horn-dog as you are. Your sex life as you travel the stars is incredibly active and wonderfully varied, and Revissa is always happy to indulge all your weirdest desires. Today, however, your only desire is to make her scream out in ecstasy. And to achieve that goal, you pull out all the stops. The two of you roll through the brush as you roll in the hay, panting and moaning and working up quite the sweat. All the local critters smartly scatter away as you tumble around amongst the leaves, because neither of you are putting much effort looking out for where you’re going. A dereliction of duty for the nature druid among you, to be sure. And as it turns out, a rather critical one. About half an hour into your steamy encounter, you stumble backwards towards the hollowed out tree you spied earlier, teeming with cute fuzzy spiders. Spiders which, unlike the other nearby fauna, had not abandoned their posts even as the love-making giants thrashed about. Which means that the two of you end up with skin and fur covered in highly alarmed and deeply annoyed spiders as the wood of their home splinters around you. “Oh no … sorry about that — yeee-ouch!” Revissa yells. Several of the little buggers have climbed on top of her, biting her with tiny, but highly effective fangs. The same happens to you. Despite it being your fault, you still snarl in annoyance as your naked skin gets peppered with welts. Just wanting to get out of here as fast as possible, you stand up, shaking your body frantically to dislodge as many of the pesky critters as you can. But then, suddenly, you feel woozy. Your legs lock up, you stumble forward, then fully fall right back down to the floor. “P-paralytic… v-venom…” Revissa murmurs. “And r-really… p-potent…” you stammer, as your limbs stiffen and your muscles lock in place. And just like that, the two of you become completely frozen, naked and helpless, among a nest of angry arachnids. [[Suffer the consequences->FB03A]] ]You can’t move a muscle - can’t even flick your tail! The tiny spiders' venom worked quickly and effectively, utterly immobilizing you and your wife before you had a chance to scramble away. The two of you can only lay there, staring helplessly into each other’s eyes, as the daunting realization sets in that you are both entirely at the mercy of these cute, fuzzy creatures. There is, at least, a bit of good news - the spiders are vegetarians. As you lay there you can see nibbles taken out of the nearby leaves. That’s a relief. The bad part is - they are also fiercely territorial, and the entire colony has gone into high alert mode now that their home has been endangered. For them, the top priority is neutralizing the threat they have been faced with. And as spiders, they know exactly one way to get that done. (link:"Mmph")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/F02_MelfyRevissaWebbed1_by_DAKuroiHoshi.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by KuroiHoshi(click-replace: "Art by KuroiHoshi")[https://www.deviantart.com/dakuroihoshi https://picarto.tv/TheKuroiHoshi]] (set: $picF02 to true) That they manage to completely cocoon the two of you in the space of ten minutes is not all that surprising to you. There are, after all, hundreds of the little guys to spread the work out amongst them. That they know how to apply leverage to bend your legs at the knees and wrench your arms behind your back is slightly more surprising. But, bound and gagged as you are, expertly anchored to a number of strong, sturdy trees, you make not even a lick of headway in escaping. And when those days turn into weeks, and then months, you eventually just stop trying at all. It’s pointless to bother - nothing you do has any effect. And as the months become years, and the years become centuries, the two of you become a literal part of the forest. Birds build nests on your head. Little critters take up residence beneath the floof of your tail. Frightened animals hide from predators by scrunching themselves up between your exposed breasts. You have no idea what happened to the rest of your crew, but it eventually becomes clear they’re never going to find you. Perhaps they were caught by something else on this planet. Not a remote possibility, given how even a colony of tiny spiders managed to trap you and Revissa with such complete finality that it is becoming clear the rest of your lives will be spent here. At least Revissa finally got her wish to spend more time enveloped in nature. You just wish you had a bit more freedom in the matter. If there’s one silver lining, it’s the Star Scout homing beacon you swallowed at the start of the adventure. And so as the hours drag on, you pray that’s enough to lead someone out here to find you. In the end, it happened while you were asleep. Krysta and Vhaja found their way to your location and cut you down, carrying you back to the Lucky Break, where they took the time to properly remove all the webbing from your body. [[Try to grab the dagger->FB05A]] [[Try to use the comm device->FB05B]] (if: $candy is false)[[[Don’t try to escape at all->FB05X]]](if: $candy is true)[[[Don't try to escape at all->FB05Y]]] ] Of course you want to escape! And you’re not getting that at the moment, which means it’s time to take a stand. With that dagger, you might be able to cut yourself free! Obviously, you might nick yourself with the blade in the process, but it would be worth it if it led to you attaining your freedom. And so, when your captor leaves the room, you get to work. And now there’s no way for you to get it! “Oh no! Are you okay?!” Merry’s voice comes from the doorway as she rushes in, instantly spying the dropped knife. She runs over and picks it up, quickly moving it away from you. Then she scans your body inch by inch, checking to see if it cut you anywhere. “I’m so sorry! I shouldn’t have left that so close. You might have hurt yourself!” she says, with genuine concern. “But it’s okay… I’ll make sure nothing like this ever happens again. Both spider-ladies immediately notice the smell and sling themselves up to the cliff area to investigate, giving you the chance to climb down in their wake. “What is that smell?” one of the spider women asks. “Is it coming from this thing? What is it?” “I don’t know - other than that it smells… amazing!” says the other. Well… that was unexpected. But every nose is different, you suppose. Moving forward as quickly as possible, you quietly start slinking towards your pack. All you need to do is scoop everything up and get out of here, and you and Revissa can meet up later. At least… that’s what you hoped. “Well whatever it is, we definitely need to bring it back with us! I’m gonna catch it!” You hear the *thwap* of silk firing from spinnerets, followed by something slamming against a rock wall. And then Revissa’s surprised voice groaning in pain. “Woah - it turned into a cutie!” “Well… don’t just stand there! Wrap her up!” Crap crap crap! You scramble to pick up your things, even as you can hear Revissa being made short work of as silk spins around her. It looks like you’re going to need to rescue her! But at least you’ve got your gear now– *Splort* You get slammed to the ground as a sticky glob of webbing gloms onto your back. Not good! For a few moments you flail about lamely, trying to get free… before a many-legged shadow looms above you. “Found another cutie!” a spider-woman announces, as she presses down against your body. The subsequent attempt to spin around and face her is met with more pressure, pinning you in place. Followed by spindly legs picking you up and starting to twirl you round and round. In the space of a few seconds, your limbs are pressed tightly against your body, and your skin vanishes beneath the tight embrace of reams of expertly woven webbing, stretching from your feet all the way to your lips. Not too much farther to the forest’s center. But now you’ve seen that those spider ladies prowl the clifftop area. Trying to get further using this path might attract them towards you. Perhaps it would be better to double back to the entrance to the forest and try taking a different route. When you voice your concerns to Revissa, she says she’ll follow you whichever choice you make. (set: $silkyescape to true) [[Double back to the start->FB06A]] [[Keep pressing forward->FB06B]] The spider ladies do come back the next day. And the day after that. And the next one, too. Over the next few years, they visit you religiously, making it part of their daily routine to grope and fondle you to their heart’s content. With nothing else to keep you occupied, it becomes the highlight of your day, the only distraction from the tedium of being a web-wrapped damsel hidden away from all prying eyes. You never manage to escape. The webs are too tight, too well-woven. Towards the beginning you would spend hours, thrashing and squirming, but despite your strength you never made so much as a single tear. After the first few weeks, you stop trying. The only small consolation is that the ‘ghost matter’ properties described in your briefing seem to apply to the webbing used to restrain you. You never feel hungry or thirsty, despite being left alone for, sometimes, days on end, and, as the months give way to years, and then centuries, you never age a day. No rescue ever comes for you. You have no idea what happened to Vhaja and the rest of your crew. It’s entirely possible they were also captured by spider ladies, or by something else on the planet. Or maybe they spent some time looking for you but eventually were forced to leave. Either way, it leaves the two of you here, as nothing but helpless playthings to be enjoyed by your captors. And here is where you will spend the rest of your life, never knowing the taste of freedom again. GAME OVER [[Start Over->A0X]]The spider ladies do come back the next day. And the day after that. And the next one, too. Over the next few weeks, they visit you religiously, making it part of their daily routine to grope and fondle you to their heart’s content. With nothing else to keep you occupied, it becomes the highlight of your day, the only distraction from the tedium of being a web-wrapped damsel hidden away from all prying eyes. You never manage to escape. The webs are too tight, too well-woven. Towards the beginning you would spend hours, thrashing and squirming, but despite your strength you never make so much as a single tear. After the first few days, you stop trying. The only small consolation is that the ‘ghost matter’ properties described in your briefing seem to apply to the webbing used to restrain you. You never feel hungry or thirsty, despite being left alone for, sometimes, days on end. It’s only thanks to the Star Scout tracking beacon that help ever comes for you. One day, shortly after your daily groping session, you hear a rustling from the ground beneath you, as Krysta scurries up and slices away the webbing tethering you in place. Then she and Lumina carry you back to your ship, parked on a nearby rock outcropping. They make it in just as the spider ladies return, and narrowly avoid getting captured themselves. Sadly, there was no time to recover the data collection devices, and so the research mission is a bust. But at least you escaped with your freedom. Maybe next time, you won’t wish so hard for a steamy encounter with a sexy spider lady. Because while you got your wish, it came at the expense of the mission’s success. GAME OVER [[Start Over->A0X]]It’s clear these women are attempting to capture you - which means there’s no option but to fight! Watching the spider lady drop through the air towards you, your hand reaches for the blaster pistol at your side. Though you’re better in melee than at range, you get the sense this lady isn’t going to give you the chance to close the distance to her. Unfortunately, she’s moving too fast for you to get a good bead on her either. Maybe it’s a shot Krysta could have pulled off, but your aim has never been anywhere near as good as hers. The blaster’s energy discharge goes wide, leaving scorching holes in a nearb tree and causing birds to flutter away in a chorus of wingbeats. Plenty of damage done - but not to your target. That missed opportunity proves to be the last one you get. As she lands, her back legs twitch, sending out a half-dozen lines of webbing hurtling towards you with far better precision than you had just shown. One catches your wrist, glomming up the gun in your hand, and another strikes your face, locking your lips beneath a layer of warm webbing. A third wraps around your waist, giving your opponent a perfect piece of leverage to yank you into her waiting grip. Thrown off balance, all you can do is make a surprised ‘mmph’ sound as the lady uses the sharp points of her legs as a knife to slice away every inch of your clothing. You try to squirm from her grip, but she doesn’t let you keep your balance long enough to accomplish much of anything. Instead, she just starts spinning you round and round, winding layers of warm, wet silk over your defenseless body. And by the time the dizziness abates, you find yourself totally wrapped from your feet to just below your nose. You can do nothing but squirm helplessly in her grip. Sensing her prey is thoroughly restrained, she gives you one last friendly squeeze on the rump then slings you over her shoulder, heading back up to the cliff face she descended from. [[Reunite with your wife->FB02BD]] ] Revissa’s been snagged, and you don’t know the first thing about these women’s offensive capabilities. As embarrassing as it is to admit, your best choice is to make a run for it. Once you’ve put some distance between them, maybe you can find a way to sneak up on them and regain the advantage. It’s not the best plan, but it’s the only one you’ve got. Leaving your rest spot behind, you rush into the trees, not even bothering to look back as you plunge recklessly into the forest. Right now, the most important thing is to just not get caught yourself. Only once you’re sure you’re safe can you figure out where to go from there. You duck under branches, leap through bushes, and barrel past confused wildlife, making a lot of noise, but hopefully going fast enough that your pursuer won’t be able to follow. Though, after a while, you slow your steps and proceed with more caution, doing your best to cover your tracks and thoroughly give the spider-lady the slip. In the back of your mind, you realize in your haste you’ve also completely lost your bearings, meaning that getting back to where Revissa was is going to be a huge pain. Luckily, you still have the map on your comm device - but as you glance down at it, the readings don’t seem to make any sense. Have you gotten even more lost than you thought? Or is there something supernatural at play here messing with your navigation? Maybe you’d have a better chance of understanding it if you’d explored this part of the forest before rushing blindly though it. Either way, you finally decide you’ve gone far enough, and slump down against the trunk of a tree to catch your breath. Your heart is pounding, pulse racing, body both tense and exhausted from the chase. And now that you finally have a moment to close your eyes and think, you have the time to regret abandoning your wife to whatever fate those dangerous (though also undeniably sexy) spider ladies have for her. Were you wrong? Should you have stood and fought? What if you never see her again? Instantly, you try to pull away, but several globs of webbing rain down to restrain your ankles and wrists against the tree behind you. This gives her the chance to enjoy every instant of her long, passionate kiss, saliva dripping from her mouth as she finally pulls away. You look up at her with terror and confusion, but she just smiles and pokes your nose. “I figured you deserved a little reward for giving me such a good workout,” she says brightly. “But now, let’s get you wrapped up and back together with your cute little friend.” Stuck and exhausted, you are unable to put up anything even resembling a fight. A slash from the sharp point of one of her back legs cuts away your clothing, then a gentle spin from her humanoid arms sends you whirling round and round as the silk emerging from her body coils you up nice and tight. Soon you’re bundled up completely, from the feet to just below the nose, bound, gagged, and totally at your pursuer’s mercy. Nothing you do seems to work, almost as if the forest itself has willed itself to resist understanding. Which is when you feel the ground give out from beneath you. A sickening *splort* fills your ears as your feet sink into the earth, your legs suddenly enmeshed in gooey, viscous liquid. Looking around, you find that somehow you have walked right into the center of a pit of sticky black tar, laying in a pool smack dab in the middle of a wide clearing. How you got that far into it before you started sinking defies explanation, but the fact remains that you are here. “Ack… what is this stuff!” Revissa yells, stuck right alongside you. Maybe sticking close together wasn’t such a good call, because now both you and your wife find yourselves buried past your shins in gooey tar. Trying to lift your legs only results in the sticky mire snapping you back down in place, making you sink down even further. “I think I’m stuck…” you murmur, your strength useless in pulling you free. You turn to Revissa. “What about you? Can you think of any magic that can help” “Maybe if I transform into a bird, I can flutter out of here,” your wife suggests. “Then I can find something to help you.” You nod in agreement at the plan, even as the suction from the swamp pulls you down past the knees. Revissa closes her eyes, raising her staff as high as she can while chanting the spell to change her form. But then… something beneath you reacts. An unnatural suction force tugs powerfully at your bodies, ripping her staff from her hands and drawing it deep into the muck beneath you. Both of your clothes are taken with it, as you sink all the way down to your waists. “What the heck was that?” you yell. “I… don’t know,” Revissa says grimly. “This must be something more than a mere swamp. It has… a consciousness to it, a willpower. And… it wants us inside of it.” Well that’s not good news. Looking around, you find that the wave of suction pulled loose an overhanging vine from a nearby tree, giving you something to hold on to. You motion for Revissa to grab onto your arm as you tug… but then, as the end of the vine falls into the mire, that same suction force pulls down and snaps it apart. During my time in the Bolg Resistance, some guerrillas that specialized in deep forest missions would report getting lost - even in locations they should have known like the back of their hands. It turned out there was some kind of predator that sent out a sort of … psychic pulse that confused their pathfinding skills and led them into traps. Maybe there’s something similar happening here as well.” You consider that information thoughtfully. On the one hand, if that’s what’s going on here, it would exonerate your lack of directional awareness - so long as you found some way to overcome it. On the other, at this point you’ve been wandering aimlessly for hours, so it might just be best to cut your losses. It’s not something you can see with your eyes, but your senses are sharp enough that you can still pick up on the changes around you - a susurrus of animal noises, a sharp pang of earthy aroma filling your nostrils, a sort of energy in the air that makes the fur of your tail bristle. When she is done, she directs that nature energy towards a nearby tree, causing the rough bark on its surface to shift into the shape of a vaguely humanoid face. As it slowly opens its eyes, Revissa bows respectfully and delivers a traditional greeting in some ancient druidic tongue. [[Bark up the wrong tree->FD04A]] (if: $forestfae is true)[ You look desperately towards the edge of the tar pit. There’s not anyone nearby that you can see, but you can’t think of anything else that will get you out of this. “Help!” you shout above the sound of bubbling goop. “Anyone!” Your voice echoes between the trees, unanswered. But you *know* there’s someone out there. Watching, waiting.
