But maybe Revissa’s right - better the devil you know, as the saying goes. [[Accept your fate and sink->FD02D]] [[Call out again->FD06]] ](else: )[ You look desperately towards the edge of the tar pit. There’s not anyone nearby that you can see, but you can’t think of anything else that will get you out of this. “Help!” you shout above the sound of bubbling goop. “Anyone!” Your voice echoes between the trees, but you get no answer. Moving quickly, you fashion the leafy rope into a serviceable snare, creating a loop that you’re hopeful will be sturdy enough to support your weight. You know you’re working against time, and you can feel your body dipping further and further into the sludge, but finally, you think you’re ready to give it a toss. But there’s one problem - you don’t see anywhere nearby to anchor it. The vine simply isn’t long enough to catch onto any of the trees outside of the pit… which makes you wonder how it even ended up here in the first place. Maybe Revissa’s right - there’s some kind of consciousness associated with this swamp, and it has a cruel sense of humor. And that’s when it hits you. What was it she had said - the predator she was talking about could disrupt the senses, make you believe something that wasn’t actually real. Well, nothing about this swamp makes any sense. You somehow fell right into its center while walking, never noticing the edges. A vine dropped down from nowhere, even though there wasn’t a nearby tree for it to hang from. The forest itself has been defying your every effort to keep track of where you were going. Nothing about this is natural. So maybe… the solution you need to escape is equally unnatural. [[Escape the swamp->FD02E]] ](else: )[ If life gives you lemons, you make lemonade, and if a tar pit gives you a broken vine, you turn it into a lasso. Moving quickly, you fashion the leafy rope into a serviceable snare, creating a loop that you’re hopeful will be sturdy enough to support your weight. You know you’re working against time, and you can feel your body dipping further and further into the sludge, but finally, you think you’re ready to give it a toss. But there’s one problem - you don’t see anywhere nearby to anchor it. The vine simply isn’t long enough to catch onto any of the trees outside of the pit… which makes you wonder how it even ended up here in the first place. Maybe Revissa’s right - there’s some kind of consciousness associated with this swamp, and it has a cruel sense of humor. With no other options, you lamely toss the lasso as far as it will go, hoping it at least does *something*. But the only something it does is sink beneath the surface of the tar pit with another sickening *glorp*. Along with the vine goes your body, as the suction of the swamp pulls hard enough to drag your arms beneath its surface, leaving you buried half past your waist. At this point, you can’t think of any more options. Other than the obvious one. [[Sink->FD02D]] ] (if: $faewin is true)[ Thinking fast, you come to a grim realization. Other than your physical strength, you don’t have many tools available to help you out of this, and that strength has already failed you. But Revissa knows magic, can transform into animals, can do all kinds of things. If only one of you makes it out of this pit, it ought to be her. And so, you wrap your arms around her waist and start hoisting upwards, causing the equal and opposite reaction of making you sink more deeply. Now down halfway past your waist, with your arms totally submerged, there’s no way you’re going to be climbing out under your own power. “Melfy, what are you doing?” your wife asks. “Getting you out of here. Just close your eyes and concentrate. Even without your staff, you should be able to turn yourself into a tiny bird or something. Once you get clear, you can think of something else – or at least make it back to the ship without me…” There is a long silence… followed by a sudden moment of realization from your partner. She seems to be distracted by something – something other than your heroic sacrifice. Has she figured something out? “Don’t always believe everything you see or hear…” she mutters. Those were the fae woman’s parting words. You’d think Revissa of all people would be suspicious of what she had told you, but in her eyes you see a flicker of understanding. “Melfy… you trust me?” she asks. “Of course.” “Then close your eyes, and take my hand. Concentrate on nothing other than the sound of my voice.” You do as you’re told. It’s obvious she’s onto something here. You close your eyes, and you try to ignore the feeling of the muck pulling against your body, of the fact that you’re slowly sinking, that in a few moments your head will be beneath the surface of the inky swamp. All you do is listen, and wait. “And now… stand up.” If it were anyone else telling you to do that when you were in the middle of a tar pit, you’d have told them they were crazy. But you trust your wife. You trust her more than yourself, more than even your own senses. And so, despite the absurdity, you bend your knees, you push upwards… and you stand straight and tall. Before you have a chance to process what is happening, she clutches her fingers around your wrist and begins to walk forward. So you follow her. Moving through what should have been impossibly thick tar, but finding it as easy as if you were taking a morning jog. [[Escape the swamp->FD02H]] ](else: )[ Thinking fast, you come to a grim realization. Other than your physical strength, you don’t have many tools available to help you out of this, and that strength has already failed you. But Revissa knows magic, can transform into animals, can do all kinds of things. If only one of you makes it out of this pit, it ought to be her. And so, you wrap your arms around her waist and start hoisting upwards, causing the equal and opposite reaction of making you sink more deeply. Now down halfway past your waist, with your arms totally submerged, there’s no way you’re going to be climbing out under your own power. “Melfy, what are you doing?” your wife asks. “Getting you out of here. Just close your eyes and concentrate. Even without your staff, you should be able to turn yourself into a tiny bird or something. Once you get clear, you can think of something else – or at least make it back to the ship without me…” There is a long silence… followed by a goopy splort. Revissa wiggles out of your grip and allows herself to sink to the same depth as you have. She smiles weakly as she looks you in the eye. “I’d rather disappear together with you than carry on without you,” she says, with a depth of affection that makes your heart swell. It’s a wonderful sentiment… but also not one that is going to help you escape. In the end, it leaves you both with no choices left other than to [[Sink->FD02D]] ] Now wait a moment. Why would you try to escape? You’re enjoying it here! You’re nice and tightly wrapped, snug as a bug. Your lips are eternally locked with Revissa’s, the two of you given the opportunity to kiss each other to your heart’s content, and to grind against each other whenever you’re horny. With webbing imbued with the planet’s ghost matter, you never need to eat or sleep, and you won’t even grow any older. You’ll get to enjoy the loving ministrations of your owner every day, who always keeps you entertained and stimulated. What more could you ask for in life? No more scraping by for enough credits to pay for repairs, no more risking your life on dangerous missions. To be perfectly honest, you would have been happy here forever. You had no intention of escaping. But the Star Scout rescue beacon you swallowed earlier had other thoughts on the matter. Thanks to the beacon, your crew was able to track you down, and though they couldn’t manage to save you directly, they did negotiate your freedom with the spider women in exchange for all the information they had gathered on the planet so far. Sadly, that included giving over the data collection devices, meaning your mission was a failure. But at least you have your freedom. Though for the rest of your life, you’ll always wonder if you might have enjoyed things more being a pet… GAME OVER (set: $merrypet to true) [[Start Over->A0X]]Revissa’s been snagged, and you don’t know the first thing about these women’s offensive capabilities. As embarrassing as it is to admit, your best choice is to make a run for it. Once you’ve put some distance between them, maybe you can find a way to sneak up on them and regain the advantage. It’s not the best plan, but it’s the only one you’ve got. Leaving your rest spot behind, you rush into the trees, not even bothering to look back as you plunge recklessly into the forest. Right now, the most important thing is to just not get caught yourself. Only once you’re sure you’re safe can you figure out where to go from there. You duck under branches, leap through bushes, and barrel past confused wildlife, making a lot of noise, but hopefully going fast enough that your pursuer won’t be able to follow. Though, after a while, you slow your steps and proceed with more caution, doing your best to cover your tracks and thoroughly give the spider-lady the slip. In the back of your mind, you realize in your haste you’ve also completely lost your bearings, meaning that getting back to where Revissa was is going to be a huge pain. Luckily, you still have the map on your comm device - though there’s no guarantee those ladies will still be there, even if you do manage to find it again. Speaking of your map, as you glance at it, you notice something disconcerting… namely, that your position doesn’t seem to be correctly updating. Or rather, that something might be interfering with it. All at once, your memories from your previous attempt at making it through the forest come rushing back in, of the strange predator that confused and disoriented you, tried to lead you into an imaginary tar pit. Could it be that you’ve run so far and so quickly that you’ve stumbled back into its territory? Your heart beats faster as your mind races to consider your options. This could be a good thing or a bad thing, depending on how you look at it. On the one hand, you’re doubling the number of creatures trying to capture you now. But on the other hand… your spidery pursuer might fall into the same trap that you did earlier, only she wouldn’t know how to escape it. [[Try to lure the spider into someone else’s web->FB02C]] [[Turn back and try something else->FB02BF]] Your mind quickly starts formulating a plan. Yes… this could work. You just need to wait for the spider lady to catch up with you, then start leading her further and further into the other creature’s territory. She’ll get caught up, and you’ll be able to escape. Then you just need to retrace your steps, find Revissa, and save her from the second lady who’s gotten her all wrapped up. What could go wrong? And so, you slow your movements, trying to make yourself obvious as you plunge further and further towards the middle of the forest. And eventually you’re rewarded by the sound of skittering from the branches above you. She’s here! “Phew… you gave me quite the workout,” she says cheerily, dropping down from a branch above you. You’d like to say you put up a good fight. That knowing you had a plan, your confidence allowed you to pull out some kind of amazing distraction that enabled you to escape. But of course, that doesn’t happen. (link:"Mmph")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/F04_MelfyWebbed1_by_Dvega.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Dvega(click-replace: "Art by Dvega")[https://www.deviantart.com/dvega https://picarto.tv/Tek]] (set: $picF04 to true) Less than a minute after appearing, the spider lady has you striped, bound, gagged, and totally at her mercy. So much for having a plan. In the end, it seems like there was nothing you could have ever done to escape your fate. And yet… after she finishes wrapping you up, the spider-babe seems to get distracted. She looks around wildly, eyes filled with fear, before stepping away. You’re not sure what she sees, what memory was pulled from her mind. All you know is that suddenly she freezes in place, holding perfectly still, hardly even breathing. And then… she slowly lays down, curls up into a ball, and closes her eyes. Could it be… has she fallen victim to the same predator who had tricked you into thinking you were sinking? You wriggle about helplessly in your webs, unable to get closer to inspect the situation. All you can do is watch as something emerges from the woods. This must be it! The creature that tormented your mind. The monster that controls the entire central expanse of these woods. A predator who snags its prey without ever lifting a finger, defeating them with such overwhelming power they never even have the *chance* to put up a fight. And as it comes into view, you can see that it’s…] |drink1)[(link:"Be Amazed")[(show:?drink2)]] |drink2)[<img src="images/F13_ItMustBeBunnies_by_Dreamons.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Dreamons(click-replace: "Art by Dreamons")[https://www.deviantart.com/dreamons2]] (set: $picF13 to true) …a bunny? Sure enough, an adorable woodland creature, with bright green and gold fur, cautiously hops out and pokes the inert spider-gal with its adorable twitchy nose. Once it confirms she’s incapacitated, it hops up on top of her, curls up and… falls asleep? Well then. It looks like the fearsome predator trapping you in its mental prison was actually just an adorable bunny that wanted someplace cozy to take a nap. Though… you get the feeling, as cute as it is, it had no intention of letting you go if it had actually managed to catch you. But all things considered… this is probably the most adorable way to get trapped in the forest. [[Escape->FB02CA]] ] In the end, you decide you can’t risk it. Part of the reason you escaped the swamp trap was because Revissa was with you. Without her, how could you possibly find the courage and strength to defy your own senses? No… it would be too dangerous. Instead, you start to double back, looking towards your map to see when it starts making sense again. Unfortunately, you pay a bit too much attention to that, and not to your surroundings. So you don’t realize you’re being watched until the sudden pressure on the back of your head, and a hand pulling you forward so that your lips meet a woman’s tender kiss. “Mmmph?” Opening your eyes, you see the spider lady who was chasing you suspended upside down on a length of webbing. Instantly, you try to pull away, but several globs of webbing rain down to restrain your ankles and wrists against the tree behind you. This gives her the chance to enjoy every instant of her long, passionate kiss, saliva dripping from her mouth as she finally pulls away. You look up at her with terror and confusion, but she just smiles and pokes your nose. “I figured you deserved a little reward for giving me such a good workout,” she says brightly. “But now, let’s get you wrapped up and back together with your cute little friend.” Stuck and exhausted, you are unable to put up anything even resembling a fight. A slash from the sharp point of one of her back legs cuts away your clothing, then a gentle spin from her humanoid arms sends you whirling round and round as the silk emerging from her body coils you up nice and tight. Soon you’re bundled up completely, from the feet to just below the nose, bound, gagged, and totally at your pursuer’s mercy. (link:"Mmph")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/F04_MelfyWebbed1_by_Dvega.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Dvega(click-replace: "Art by Dvega")[https://www.deviantart.com/dvega https://picarto.tv/Tek]] (set: $picF04 to true) “There we go!” she says happily. She gives your butt an affectionate squeeze as she lifts you up, slings you over her shoulder, and carries you back to the cliffside with no trouble at all. [[Reunite with your wife->FB02BD]] ] Perhaps since you had already escaped its telepathic misdirection once before, the bunny pays you no mind. So over the course of the next hour you manage to wiggle over to the clothes the spider lady peeled off of you and retrieve the runic knife Vhaja entrusted to you earlier. And with a whole lot of effort you cut yourself free, get yourself dressed again, and head back towards where your wife is waiting. (set: $sawbunny to true) As you go, you see more slumbering forms scattered about, trapped in the bunny’s mental labyrinth. Mostly woodland creatures, though there’s a couple humanoids scattered about - a pair of knotties, probably women from the camp who got themselves lost. You decide not to risk waking them, lest you arouse the fear of the mighty green rabbit. Though you notice nestled in the arms of the sleeping women are some brightly colored eggs, suggesting they might be contributing to the circle of life by incubating the critter’s descendants. Either way, you make your way back to where you and Revissa were separated, using your map once the bunny’s psychic distortions allow you to follow it properly. Eventually you see the cliff face towering above you, and carefully creep up it, trying not to disturb the second gorgeous spider-babe who might be lurking in wait. You don’t find her – but you do find something else. (link:"Enjoy the show")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/F14_RevissaWebbedForest_by_Faust1173.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Faust1173(click-replace: "Art by Faust1173")[https://www.furaffinity.net/user/faust1173/]] (set: $picF14 to true) Revissa looks up at you fearfully, wriggling ineffectively in a tight silk cocoon. Not just bound up, but also anchored to the floor and to a rock from an overhanging portion of the cliff up above. Her lips are sealed, but her breasts are exposed, indicating her captor must have spent some time having fun with her before leaving. You can’t help yourself, and give her inviting pair a firm squeeze. It’s so rare that Revissa is the one in need of rescuing and not you. She rolls her eyes and strains against her bindings, just making her chest bounce all the more obviously. “Hold still now,” you say with a chuckle, taking out the runic knife to cut her free. A few minutes later, Revissa is parted from the silk, and has reclaimed the clothing and gear the spider lady had taken from her. She explains that her captor had stuck by her for a few hours when her sister had run off into the forest in pursuit of you, but when her fellow arachnid did not return she eventually went searching for her. It’s just pure dumb luck that the two of you didn’t meet up on your way back, or she probably would have caught you as easily as her sister did. Either way, it seems like against all odds you’ve managed to escape capture - thanks to the help of an unassuming forest critter. Revissa hardly believes your story about the bunny as you explain it to her, but admits there’s no reason a psychic predator needs to be a scary and terrifying monster when you’re up close to it. Now, with the spider ladies gone, it would seem that you have a clear shot to the heart of the forest. But it’s always possible that more dangers are lurking here in the cliffs. Perhaps it would be best to double back and try a different route through the forest, just in case? [[Continue the mission->FB02CB]] [[Head back to the start->FB02CC]] ]After a fraught and perilous journey through the forest, you’ve managed to cover the majority of the distance needed. You and Revissa now find yourselves in the heart of the woods, with only a short trek to your destination remaining, if the map on your comm device is to be believed. If this were a video game, you would expect this to be the part where the environment grew dark, twisted and foreboding as a boss battle loomed on the horizon, but as a pleasant surprise, the area ahead seems the most welcoming of all the places you’ve yet visited in the forest. You appear to have arrived at a natural grove of fruit trees, tightly clustered together in this one particular region. Revissa gives you a complicated explanation for why you hadn’t encountered the fruit trees elsewhere in the forest, taking into account elevation, light levels, soil fertility, and the migration patterns of birds depositing the seeds, but it rather goes over your head. Instead you just pick up a stray fruit and take a lazy bite. It’s an iridescent green color and is vaguely shaped like an apple, but has much softer, fleshier skin, giving way to an almost honey-like nectar as you eat. Revissa sighs as some spills down your chin, chastising you not to eat random things off the ground from a weird grove in the middle of a ghost planet. You respond by taking another bite. It really is quite good. Advisability of partaking of the delectable fruits aside, your map is telling you the data device needs to be set somewhere within the grove, so the two of you push further ahead. (if: $treetalk is true)[But as you walk, your sharp ears pick up on a rustle coming from the branches up above. [[Investigate the sound->FE01A]] ](else-if: $takeclothes is true)[But as you walk, your sharp ears pick up on a rustle coming from the branches up above. [[Investigate the sound->FE01A]] ](else: )[ [[Plant the beacon->FE02]]]In the end, it’s just too risky. Those spider-babes, sexy though they may be, are clearly too much of a threat. You get the sense that an open confrontation with them would swiftly result in your and Revissa’s quick and decisive capture. And though you may yearn for the softness of their silk against your skin, you decide to save that for private time with your wife’s spider-form when you get back to your quarters on the ship. So, tail between your legs, you retreat. You double back the way you came, trying to keep out of sight of the cliffs above, from whence an arachnid might pounce at any moment. All things considered, you make good time, and soon your map tells you the entrance to the forest is within sight. However, as you approach, your ears happen to catch the sound of something rustling nearby in the brush. Revissa, standing beside you, hears it too. The two of you exchange glances and then, as one, turn to face it. (if: $takeclothes is false)[[[Lay your eyes on the threat->FA05]] [[Pull back and wait->FB06C]]](if: $takeclothes is true)[[[Lay your eyes on the threat->FB06D]] [[Pull back and wait->FB06E]]] It’s potentially more dangerous, but you’ve already wasted enough time. Doubling back would waste even more. So you choose to keep going, hopeful that you’ve done enough to give the spider-women the slip. The two of you proceed for several tense minutes, with Revissa constantly looking behind you for signs of pursuit, and you alternating between checking the map on your comm device and looking out over the horizon to try and pick out the direction towards your destination. You feel pretty confident that you can get there, but will you be able to do it safely? Only time will tell. Either way, the path is ahead of you. And soon you find yourself plunging into the very heart of the woods. [[Proceed with the mission->FE01]] There are a lot of benefits that come with experience. You and your wife have both gone through so much, endured countless adventures, both together and on your own. And because of that, your instincts have been honed to a razor sharp edge, letting you pick up on danger where other women would have continued unawares. Usually, that experience is a good thing. Normally, reacting quickly can save your life. Sadly, this time, it proves to have the opposite effect. Because as the two of you wheel around in unison, you find yourselves looking right into the eyes of a large, squat, bulky lizard with vibrant scales the same pastiche of colors as the leaves crumpled up on the ground. That trained mind of yours, honed by years of instinct, warns you of the threat you now face a micro-second before your body begins to seize up. You have just enough time to begin to swivel, for your eyes to widen, for your lips to part and for a warning to begin to form on your tongue. Revissa reacts even faster, holding a hand out in front of her, as if that, somehow, could stop what was about to happen. What you’ve discovered, creeping up on you in the brush, is a basilisk. A creature known for its ability to turn flesh to stone as soon as one meets its gaze. In a universe where you were less perceptive, you might have been better off. But that’s not the universe you and your wife currently occupy. (link:"...")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/F15_MelfyRevissaStone_by_MoaiHero.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by MoaiHero(click-replace: "Art by MoaiHero")[https://twitter.com/MOWwitchblade https://www.deviantart.com/witchbladeproyect]] (set: $picF15 to true) If there’s any mercy, it’s that the transformation is shockingly swift. Your ears have a moment to register the telltale crackling sound, your muscles have the brief opportunity to feel how swiftly they are stiffening. And your eyes have a blissful few seconds to register the bright yellow pupils of the monster that entrapped you, before they become little more than blank, sightless orbs. Given how many adventures you and your wife have made it through, it’s a rather ignominious way to end this one. But as your clothing turns brittle and crumples away, and your mind falls into a deep, dreamless sleep, you realize with your last gasp of consciousness that life is not always fair. The greatest of stories can end in a heartbeat with one mistimed step. And it seems yours has met just such an unsatisfying conclusion. (if: $candy is false)[[[Rock on->FA05X]]] (if: $candy is true)[[[Rock on->FA05Y]]] ] At the last moment, you think better of it. You grab Revissa’s shoulder and pull her back, away from the sound, motioning instead to hide behind a rock. She gives you a curious look, but nods anyway, following you as you take cover. After a few minutes, you hear more rustling, then the lazy groan of some local wildlife foraging for food nearby. A false alarm, it would seem. But as you leave your hiding place, you explain that if it was your pursuers, then even laying eyes on them might have been a fatal misstep - since then they, in turn, could lay eyes on you. And you don’t have any confidence you’d be able to give them the slip if they caught your trail a second time. Either way, it seems that you’re free to continue back to the start and pick up your journey once more. [[Return to the start->FA06]] As one, the two of you spin around, glancing in the direction of the sound. And that’s when you see it, a flash of chitinous leg, the flutter of a woman’s dress brushing against branches. They’re here! You’re lucky enough to lay eyes on one of the two women before she spies you, giving you a moment to plan your next move. She seems to be searching, prowling - hunting for the two of you, unwilling to give up the chase. But she doesn't know exactly where you are. With a frenzied hand motion, you direct Revissa to follow you as you shimmy as quietly as you can inside of a hollowed out log, clutching each other tightly as you press against the rotting bark. Through a gap in the wood, you can see the spider-woman seemingly catch the scent of something, prompting her to leap into the air, swing along a silken tether, then pounce behind a nearby rock. But instead of a pair of lovely adventurers, she just surprises some local wildlife. It lets out a guttural growl, but then retreats into the brush, fleeing from the sudden intrusion. “Hmmph,” your pursuer says with an honestly quite adorable pout. “I was so sure they were here…” She lingers around for a while longer, but eventually leaves without any prey. You and Revissa wait a good ten minutes after she is out of sight, holding your breath, sweat dripping down your brows, but she does not seem to be circling back. And so, carefully, quietly, you climb out from your hiding place, and continue your retreat back to the forest entrance. Hopefully you’ll have better luck on one of the other routes. (set: $takeclothes to false) [[Return to the start->FA06]]At the last moment, you think better of it. You grab Revissa’s shoulder and pull her back, away from the sound, motioning instead to hide behind a rock. She gives you a curious look, but nods anyway, following you as you take cover. Your reasoning is that if you can see them, then it would also be possible for them to see you, and you don’t want to take any chances. You have no confidence you’d be able to escape again if they spotted you. And so you wrap your arms around your wife and hold her tight as you try to make yourselves as small and quiet as possible. For several tense moments you stay there, trying to still your breathing, to will yourselves out of existence entirely. There is the briefest of moments where you think it worked. But then comes the shadow from above, the spider-woman propelled on a line of silk swinging herself from a tree branch. She tackles you both to the ground at once, and in the same movement sprays you both with more silk than you could possibly handle. By the time you come to your senses, you’re already completely restrained, already at the arachnid’s mercy as the sharp points at the end of her back legs begin making short work of your clothing. “Gotcha!” she purrs dreamily, tossing each of you other a shoulder, totally cocooned, kicking and screaming fruitlessly into silk gags woven over your lips. And just like that, you’re captured. With no choice in the matter, she brings you back towards the cliffs where she makes her home. [[Get carried away->FB06EA]] Despite your best efforts, you’ve just ended up right back where you’ve started. So now all there is to do is try again. Hopefully this time, you’ll actually make some progress. (if: ($FBStart is true) and ($FCStart is true) and ($FCStart is true))[Except for one problem - you’ve exhausted all the options you’d come up with. You tried all three paths, and all three of them presented threats and dangers you were not equipped to handle. So now it seems you’re going to have to pore over the map for another option. [[Find another way->FA06A]]](else: )[(if: $FBStart is false)[[[Take the high road->FB01]]] (if: $FCStart is false)[[[Take the low road->FC01]]] (if: $FDStart is false)[[[Take the middle road->FD01]]] ] “Aww… they really are adorable, aren’t they?” “It’s true. They were so cute, cowering in fear behind a rock, cuddling each other for protection. It was almost a shame to break them up.” “Almost.” “Tee-hee. Well, they are much cuter like this, wouldn’t you say?” You look up helplessly towards the two women looming over you. Disoriented from the trip over here, you strain against the webbing wrapped so tautly around your body. It of course does you no good. (link:"Mmph")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/F04_MelfyWebbed1_by_Dvega.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Dvega(click-replace: "Art by Dvega")[https://www.deviantart.com/dvega https://picarto.tv/Tek]] (set: $picF04 to true) Try as you might, you can’t move a muscle. Whatever these women may or may not be, they are no slackers when it comes to binding. There’s not a single point of articulation available to you, no give anywhere in the wrappings. You’re not going anywhere, and you’re not escaping while they have you here.] |drink1)[(link:"Look towards your wife")[(show:?drink2)]] |drink2)[<img src="images/F06_RevissaWebbed1_by_Dvega.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Dvega(click-replace: "Art by Dvega")[https://www.deviantart.com/dvega https://picarto.tv/Tek]] (set: $picF06 to true) Revissa, of course, has been rendered equally helpless. Her naked body has even less strength than yours to resist, and given how fruitless your efforts have been up until now, hers are even doubly so. There won’t be any help from her. After confirming the tightness of her restraints, she fearfully locks eyes with you, as if to ask - how the heck are you going to get out of this? …of course, the answer is grimly obvious. You aren’t. All you can do is lay here and wait to see what happens next. [[See what they have in store for you-> FB02AA2]] ] Two statues stand frozen, trapped beneath a canopy of trees and branches. Once they were women, but now they are nothing but stone. They cannot see, they cannot hear, they cannot think. They just *are*. When the statues were women, they had friends. Friends who would come looking for them, who would want to cure them, who would want to restore them to what they once were. The friends never find them. Is it because the statues were too far lost, too well hidden? Or is it because those friends have gotten themselves into their own trouble, trouble they can’t get out of. To the statues, it doesn’t matter. Their friends never come, but the statues cannot take offense, because stone is incapable of emotion. As the days pass, as the seasons change, as the moss grows and the granite cracks, as the birds make nests amongst their hair, as the rodents huddle for warmth and protection beneath their feet, as time passes forward, as it always does, the statues remain. Before long, they are as much a part of the forest as are the trees. And there they remain. Forever. GAME OVER [[Start Over->A0X]]And so, you and Revissa stand. Frozen, motionless, trapped beneath a canopy of trees and branches. For the moment, you are no longer women. You’re nothing but stone. You cannot see, cannot hear, cannot think. You just *are*. The last thing you remember is the shame and embarrassment of being caught in such an unflattering way. You’re a hero for goddess-sake, you practically saved the galaxy! How can you keep calling yourself that when you turn a bit too quickly towards a sound in the woods, and become an overgrown paperweight for your troubles? Lucky for you that you had taken the Star Scout homing beacon. If not, Vhaja and the rest of the crew would not have been able to find you. And lucky for you that Lumina knows healing magic, that she could restore petrified flesh into something warm and pliable once more. Lucky for you that your friends aren’t terribly angry at you, despite the embarrassing way you got yourselves caught. They had their own problems to deal with while you were stone. But there is one unlucky thing - along with your clothing and equipment, the data gathering devices were destroyed by the elements while you stood there in stony silence. The mission is a failure without them, so you’re forced to leave the planet with your tail between your legs. At least you’re still mobile enough to take on another job, some other day - assuming anyone will hire you for it. GAME OVER [[Start Over->A0X]] (if: not ((passage:)'s tags contains "menu"))[(set: $lastPassage to (passage:)'s name)](if: $chapter is true)[(css: "color: gray;font-size: 70%" )[(print: (passage:)'s name)] ]After so many adventures, coming so far together, it’s hard to believe that it would end like this. But there’s nothing else to do but accept it. You and Revissa lock eyes, exchanging fearful glances, knowing that this might be the last chance you have to speak to each other. “Melfy, I–” your wife begins. But you cut her off with a kiss. It’s impossible to fight the suction of the tar-filled mire enough to break through the surface, but you still have enough strength to find her body within the muck and pull it in close. When your lips part, you’re both up to your necks. “Whatever happens next… we’ll be together,” you say quietly. She sniffles and nods. “Together…” she agrees. And so you press your foreheads against one another and close your eyes, as with one final *splort*, you sink completely. All around you can hear nothing but the incessant churning of the mire, can see nothing through the thick, all-encompassing tar. You hold Revissa as tight as you can, with even more urgency than holding your breath. Your lungs give out before your arms. And yet… you don’t drown. You gasp for air, feeling the tar slip down your throat, but then something seems to suddenly snap into place within your body, like a picture coming into focus. After that, you don’t feel the need to breathe. Thinking back to your briefing, you recall what was said about the planet’s ‘ghost matter’. That so long as you were in contact with it, you would not need to eat or drink, would not even require air. It seems like that is the case. It means your lives aren’t about to end… but that’s *all* it means. The sinking never seems to stop. You keep falling, down, down down, further and further, feet never reaching a bottom. Is it a trick of the mind? Have you fallen into some kind of dimension of infinite sludge? You have no way of knowing. The one thing that drives you is the need to keep holding onto your wife, to make sure your bodies never part. Because if you separated, you’d never find her again in this endlessly churning mire. At this point, there’s no hope of finding a way out. But at least you’ll suffer that fact together with the woman you love. (if: $candy is false)[[[Keep sinking->FD02DX]]] (if: $candy is true)[[[Keep sinking->FD02DY]]] “Revissa… hold onto me tight. And close your eyes!” She sees the confidence in your eyes, and does as she is told. You feel her wrap her arms around your waist, pulling herself in close, nuzzling her face against your shoulder. It’s a nice feeling, a familiar feeling, and an empowering one too. Knowing she trusts you enough not to ask questions gives you the self-assurance you need to fight against your own senses. You close your eyes as well, scooping Revissa up in your arms. Yes, you easily lift her in the air, as if there weren’t any sticky tar holding you down. Because, you now realize, there *isn’t* any. And then you start to walk, one foot in front of the other, ignoring the sounds of the supposed swamp surrounding you and the impossible grip of the tar. None of this is real. It’s all just some kind of mental confusion meant to keep you stuck in one place. For what purpose, you can’t imagine, but it surely isn’t one that’s good for your health. Navigating purely by belief, disregarding your brain’s perception of reality, you stomp forward, maintaining your momentum until you smack face-first into a tree. At least it feels like you do, but that might be more diversion. You keep walking, keep pushing forward, ignoring more attempts to distract you - the heat of flames and smell of smoke, the shuddering footsteps and hungry snarl of a vicious beast, the pleasant smell of perfume and coquettish giggle of a beautiful forest nymph, all of it. Until, finally, the illusions stop. You collapse to the ground in a heap with your wife, finally peeling open your eyes to find yourself in an entirely unassuming portion of the woods. No tar pit, no fire, no monsters, and no lusty dryads (sadly). It seems like you’ve escaped the lair of whatever creature was trying to trap you in its mental projections. You never actually managed to lay eyes on it… but maybe that’s for the best. Pulling out the map on your comm device, you find you’re halfway between your starting location and your destination. At this point, you’re probably safe to keep heading forwards… but maybe it would be best to double back. There’s no telling if the creature might try to trap you once more. (set: $swampescape to true)(set: $swampescape4eva to true) [[Keep going->FD02F]] [[Double back->FD02G]] It defies explanation, but before you know it, you’ve escaped the clutches of the swamp. By doing nothing more than walking out of it. As if it weren’t there in the first place. (set: $swampescape to true) After a few minutes of walking, letting your wife lead you, the two of you come to a stop, and she lets you know you can open your eyes again by brushing a hand against your cheek lightly. “What the heck was that?” you ask. “What magic did you use to get us out of that swamp?” “The swamp… was never there in the first place,” your wife explains. “As we were sinking, I was reminded of something. During my time in the Bolg Resistance, some guerrillas that specialized in deep forest missions would report getting lost - even in locations they should have known like the back of their hands. It turned out there was some kind of predator that sent out a sort of … psychic pulse that confused their pathfinding skills and led them into traps. I think that’s what was happening here. According to their stories, the predator would try to incapacitate them in some way - usually by making them believe something that wasn’t true, like that they had fallen into a ravine and broken their leg. The ones who bought the lie were never heard from again, but those who got out of it did so by noticing the inconsistencies about the situation and fighting against their own senses to escape.” You scratch your head. “You figured that out just from the words the fae woman said? About not trusting your senses.” “Well… more than that. It’s when you tried to sacrifice yourself to save me that I felt it. There was a brief moment where all I could think of was how much I loved you, and… in that instant, I suddenly felt like the tar was gone, that I could move normally.” A blush creeps across your cheeks, but you mask the emotional moment with your usual confident swagger. “So basically, it’s all thanks to me.” Revissa kicks you in the shin with annoyance. “Yeah, sure, completely negate the fact that I remembered something I heard offhand almost two decades ago that let me drag your blonde ass out of an inescapable situation.” It’s these moments of banter that remind you why you love her so much. You just respond by taking her hand and pulling her in for a long, passionate kiss. As always, that smooths things over nicely. “As always, you’re my light in the darkness,” you say as you pull away from her. “Now, let’s get the hell out of here.” Thanks to Revissa’s quick thinking, another perilous situation has been avoided. First conniving fae, now strange psychic predators. At this point, maybe it’s time to admit that you chose wrong when you first entered the forest. Perhaps a different path would be more accommodating to your efforts. Though you’ve already wasted enough time already. After discussing it with your wife, she’s happy to leave the decision in your hands. (set: $swampescape to true)(set: $swampescape4eva to true) [[Turn back->FD09C]] [[Keep going->FD09E]] You understand what Revissa is saying, you really do. The fae are not to be trusted. Any help they offer will only come back to bite you in the ass later. But as the sticky mire pulls you up to the neck, you can’t accept this is as your fate. So with an apologetic glance at your wife, you call out once again. “Whoever you are, wherever you are, I’m sure you’re watching. So… please, save us! Get us out of here, and I’ll play whatever game you want from me.” Despite your plea, you get no reply, other than the snapping and popping of bubbles, the relentless churning of the bottomless, goopy sludge. Another tug and you sink up to your chin. And with another, your nose drops below the surface. The last thing you can do is make desperate eye contact with your wife before, with one final pull, your world becomes dark. No more sky, no more trees, no more air, just an endlessly gyrating morass that subsumes all your senses. So this is it. This is how your story ends - sunken and forgotten at the bottom of a tar pit in the middle of a cursed forest. Not how you expected things to go, that’s for sure. But then, just as gravity loses all meaning, as up and down become indistinguishable from left and right, something gives way, and you feel yourself landing on soft grass. Your eyes shoot open and your lungs hungrily gulp down fresh air as you find yourself in the center of a very familiar clearing. “So… you said you’d play a game with me?” [[Find out what you’ve gotten yourself into->FD06A]] You have no way to keep track of the passing of time as you are. It’s impossible to tell when one day ends and another begins, when a month passes, a year. Your life is in stasis, your body suspended on all sides by the infinite depths of tar. Presumably, you find sleep, though with no other stimuli to keep you occupied, you’re not even sure when you’re awake and when you aren’t. But Revissa remains a constant, the pressure of her body the one comfort you have in this endless nightmare. For the first few days? Weeks? Years? You’re not sure, but for a period of time, you hold on to a hope that someone will find you. Your friends and crewmates would come looking for you, would try to figure out what had happened. But for all you know, they get caught by something else. Hell, they could have fallen into the same infinite sludge pit, could be sinking only inches away from the two of you, and you’d never know it. Because there’s no way to communicate here - other than with the periodic pressure you and Revissa apply to each other’s bodies with your embrace. So maybe if you reached out, you’d bump up against Vhaja, or Krysta, or someone else entirely. There’s no way to know, and you’re not going to risk it. Because at this point, Revissa is your whole world, is your only comfort, and you’re never going to let her go. In the end, eternity passes without a rescue. But at least you never let go. At least you’re not alone. Despite your failure, that’s one small victory. GAME OVER [[Start Over->A0X]]You have no way to keep track of the passing of time as you are. It’s impossible to tell when one day ends and another begins, whether a month has passed, or a year. Your life is in stasis, your body suspended on all sides by the infinite depths of tar. Presumably, you find sleep, though with no other stimuli to keep you occupied, you’re not even sure when you’re awake and when you aren’t. But Revissa remains a constant, the pressure of her body the one comfort you have in this endless nightmare. But thankfully, this is a nightmare you eventually wake up from. You remain ignorant of the fact you’re being rescued right up until you aren’t, when you suddenly find yourself suspended high in the air, together with various bits of rocks, leaves, and small woodland creatures. You find out later that your friends managed to track you down thanks to the Star Scout homing beacon, but when they tried to mount a rescue, they could not pick their way through the forest. So… they flew your spaceship above the location of your beacon and activated its tractor beam, dragging you and half a city block’s worth of forest into the cargo bay. Curiously, there was no tar found in the hold, or on your bodies. Was it all some kind of dream? A hallucination? You aren’t sure. The one thing that you do know is that the rescue attempt destroyed your data collection devices, making the mission a resounding failure. And so you are forced to leave the planet with your tail between your legs, wondering how things might have gone differently if you’d had a better sense of direction. GAME OVER [[Start Over->A0X]]You’ve made it this far, you figure. No sense backing down now. And so, once you get your bearings straight, you begin to walk. This time, it appears there’s nothing tripping you up, allowing you to make good time towards your destination. You feel vindicated that your initial impression about the route was correct - this really was the shortest path, and you really could navigate through it, so long as nothing supernatural got in your way. Speaking of supernatural, just as you start to think you’re going to finish the journey uninterrupted, you do, in fact, get interrupted, by a coarse, scraggly voice coming from just past a nearby tree. “Ho, traveler, stay a while, please, and heed my words,” it says. You and Revissa stop as the voice addresses you, looking around in confusion for its source. “Right here, friends. Beside you.” It is only then that you realize the voice was not coming from *past* the tree, but from *within* it. Or rather, coming *from* it. Because the tree in question appears to have a face carved into its wooden trunk, like one you might see on a jill-o-lantern. You blink a few times, glancing at Revissa in confusion, before finally responding. “Uh… yes? What can we help you with?” “Ah, but it is I who I think can help you, travelers,” says the tree. “These woods are dangerous, as I am sure you already know. I can guide you to the safest path towards your goal, if you’d like.” Finally! Something friendly on this planet, you think to yourself. You’re about to accept the help when you feel your wife lay a stern hand on your shoulder. “Something seems wrong…” Revissa says, looking towards you but with eyes darting suspiciously towards the tree. You raise an eyebrow. “Aren’t you a nature-lover? You should be the *first* person in the world to trust what a tree has to say.” “Yes… but… ugh, I don’t know. Something just seems wrong to me. I can’t put my finger on it, but I’m getting bad vibes from this whole thing.” Well, bad vibes or no, you still have a mission to do. And after losing several hours to aimless wandering, you really should be getting back to it. [[Accept the tree’s guidance->FD02FA]] [[Trust Revissa’s suspicions->FD02FB]] It takes a big woman to admit when she’s wrong. So in a way, maybe you’re actually doing a good job when you turn to Revissa and tell her that it’s best you abandon this path and return to the entrance of the forest. You were… wrong, to pick this option. You were wrong when you stubbornly pressed on, when you refused to admit you were lost, and when you decided to turn back and challenge the perception-altering predator that came so close to trapping you. In the end, it seems clear that this path cutting through the center of the forest was a mistake. Better to double back and try a different route entirely. Revissa seems… frustrated at your indecisiveness, but agrees that she’d really rather not have to contend with all those illusions, or whatever they were, again. And so she walks alongside you as you retrace your steps, heading back the way you came. Thankfully, the map on your comm device appears to be accurate, keeping careful note of your reverse-progress as you near the place where you started. However, as you are looking down to confirm the readings, you happen to notice the sound of rustling coming from the bushes nearby. Revissa, standing beside you, hears it too. The two of you exchange glances and then, as one, turn to face it. [[Lay your eyes on the threat->FA05]] [[Force yourselves to ignore it->FD02GA]]On the one hand, you trust Revissa’s instincts implicitly. If she thinks there’s something fishy here, she’s probably right. But on the other hand, you can’t just turn down the chance to speed things along, especially after wasting so much time. Vhaja is counting on you to install these data devices. “Alright… please show us the way,” you ask to the tree. Revissa gives you a disapproving look. You shrug your shoulders apologetically. “Very well…” says the tree, in its creaking, wooden voice. “All you need do is follow the sound of my voice. This portion of the forest can be quite perilous. Strange monsters roam, waiting to claim unlucky travelers for their own.” You know that all too well, given your previous encounter with whatever trapped you in that fake swamp. Escaping that was only possible with boundless confidence, you recall, and so, you maintain that confidence as you unwaveringly accept the tree’s advice. Revissa rolls her eyes at you, but you maintain a bounce in your step as you head out into the forest once again. It helpfully warns you when there is danger nearby, speaking of a nest of territorial spiders, of a prowling basilisk, and of a sap-spitting plant that would have loved to wrap you up in its leaves. Before long, you find yourself entering the very deepest part of the woods, a short distance from your destination. (set: $treetalk to true) [[Head inside->FE01]] You haven’t gotten as far as you have in life without trusting in Revissa’s instincts. The mission is obviously important, but *because* it’s important you need to avoid walking yourself into any traps that might trip you up. And that’s when you realize it. Who’s to say this isn’t yet another, even more elaborate lure from the predator you had escaped earlier? You’d thought you’d moved past the radius of its influence, but perhaps its reach extends further than you thought. Or maybe this is another one of its kind, or any of a million other possibilities. At this point truth and fiction have become so blurred, you’re not sure if *anything* can be trusted. Other than Revissa. “Let’s go,” you say, taking her hand and leading her away. “You’re right, this is probably just another trick.” She pauses a moment, then nods, allowing you to guide her. Like before, she closes her eyes and leaves everything to you. “Wait – no, come back!” yells the tree. “I promise I’m not the critter who was trying to catch you before. I can help you, really! I’m –” But the tree’s voice has already faded away as you cut through the woods. Once you’ve put enough distance between you, you check your map once again, and find you’re nearly at your destination. Though now you’re wondering if this is yet more misdirection. Maybe you only *think* you’re not lost… is there any way to tell for sure? It is as you are so deep in thought that you hear a rustle come from the bushes beside you. Revissa, standing beside you, hears it too. The two of you exchange glances and then, as one, start to turn to face it. [[Lay eyes on the threat->FA05]] [[Force yourself to ignore it->FD02FC]] “Hold up,” you say, nodding your head towards the direction of the sound. Revissa glances up at the spot, just in time to spy the string of spider silk arcing out from between the branches. It strikes you right in the chest, glomming on tightly, then pulls backwards, lifting you off your feet and high into the air. The world becomes a blur, your mind unable to keep up with the suddenness of your abduction, leaving you disoriented well before your body slams into the side of a tree. And then your attacker is upon you. By the time you manage to get a glimpse of her face, she’s already pinned you beneath her body and bound your wrists and ankles together to prevent any attempt at struggle. (link:"Observe your captor")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/F46_SpiderPrincessTula_by_Dvega.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Dvega(click-replace: "Art by Dvega")[https://www.deviantart.com/dvega https://picarto.tv/Tek]] (set: $picF46 to true) Thick, wavy black hair. Light, reddish skin, dotted with scale-like clumps of chitinous plating. A curvaceous body, an amazing figure, two arms, two legs, and eight spider-like appendages protruding from her back. Four of them are long and sturdy, probably used for mobility, while the other four end in sharp, scythe-like points - more likely used as weapons, or as a tool to peel off the clothing of a victim. She confirms that suspicion as she slices away your outfit, leaving you naked and exposed to the lecherous path her eyes take over your body. (if: $treetalk is true)[“Looks like the tree was right. There really was some tantalizing prey nearby,” she coos, stroking your cheek affectionately. Your eyes widen in confusion and betrayal. “Wait – the *tree* told you we were comm–pppphhh.”](else: )["Looks like the girls were right. There really was some tantalizing prey nearby,” she coos, stroking your cheek affectionately. Your eyes widen in fear. They knew you were coming after all, and informed one of their allies to lie in wait! “But how did you know we’d be coming this wa–”] She cuts off your question with a glob of webbing between the lips. “Hush now. Lovely morsels like you are best seen and not heard.” You make one last, desperate attempt to escape, hurling yourself away from her, but she easily catches you and pulls you back in with more silk.] |drink1)[(link:"Mmph!")[(show:?drink2)]] |drink2)[<img src="images/F42_MelfySnagged_by_Dvega.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Dvega(click-replace: "Art by Dvega")[https://www.deviantart.com/dvega https://picarto.tv/Tek]] (set: $picF42 to true) And then your world becomes as a blur as you spin round and round in her grip, unable to put up a fight as she weaves a taut, inescapable cocoon around your helpless form. If nothing else, you have to marvel at her efficiency. From alert and aware to overwhelmingly helpless in less than a minute flat - a new record, as far as kidnappings go. And that does seem to be her plan. Once she’s done bundling you up, she scoops you into her arms and slings you over a shoulder, using lines of webbing to sling herself between the trees and off towards the line of cliffs to the west that ring the forest area. You make some token wiggles and squirms, grunting into your gag, but she holds on with a vice-like grip, preventing you from even the most rudimentary hope of escape. Before long, she has reached her destination, ducking into a cave opening hidden in the cliffs with her new prize in tow. [[Go spelunking->FE01B]] ] (set: $forestboss to true) Given everything else that’s happened so far, you’re pleased to find that the trip into the grove is uneventful. Your holographic map narrows down the location to an area only a few feet wide, which you reach without incident. The data device syncs with your comm and begins to hum as you get close, letting you know it is time to remove it from your pack and set it down on the ground. It sends out a scanner pulse then starts to hover in the air, before turning itself intangible as it aligns with the spectral frequencies of the ambient environment (not that any of those words mean much to you). And just like that, you’ve completed one of your objectives! Getting here was certainly not a walk in the park, but happily the actual task proved to be relatively simple. If only all your jobs could be this easy! Too late do you realize the error in thinking such a thing. After all the adventures you’d been on in your life, you should know better than to think anything would ever be easy. If something is seeming to go smoothly, it just means you are moments away from a complication that will throw everything up now out of balance. Luckily, the complication this time is quite easy on the eyes. Revissa’s keen awareness picks up on it first - a change in the texture of the air, a nervousness in the minds of nearby prey animals, a flicker of shadow from a nearby cliff face. A word of warning from your partner sets you on edge, and your own keen eyes pick out the threat just as it skitters down in front of you, maybe fifty feet away from where you’re standing. (link:"Along comes a spider")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[ <img src="images/F46_SpiderPrincessTula_by_Dvega.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Dvega(click-replace: "Art by Dvega")[https://www.deviantart.com/dvega https://picarto.tv/Tek]] (set: $picF46 to true) Thick, wavy black hair. Light, reddish skin, dotted with scale-like clumps of chitinous plating. A curvaceous body, an amazing figure, two arms, two legs, and eight spider-like appendages protruding from her back. Four of them are long and sturdy, probably used for mobility, while the other four end in sharp, scythe-like points - probably useful as weapons, or as a tool to peel off the clothing of a victim. Her eyes gleam with a predator’s intensity, fixed squarely on the two of you. As if she’s just encountered two lovely flies who have wandered into the spider’s parlour. You gulp loudly. “Did you wish this lady into existence?” Revissa says with a sigh. Her body tenses, her fingers tighten around her staff, and her breathing steadies as she readies herself for a fight. [[Draw your sword and prepare for battle->FE02A]] [[Step forward and attempt diplomacy->FE03]] [[Turn tail and get the heck out of here->FE06]] ]“Wait!” you yell, tugging Revissa away from the sound. Instead of looking towards it, you pull her in close, locking eyes only with her. Beside you, you hear more rustling, the scraping of feet on dirt, a low growl, but you ignore it. “Let’s keep going,” you say, pressing your forehead against hers. “We can’t afford to be distracted.” The growling grows louder, more urgent, the footsteps get closer, but you don’t let them scare you. With a nod, Revissa closes her eyes once more, and lets you again take her hand. Together, you flee from the sound, keeping your heads down, blotting out anything other than the sound of your own breathing, of each other’s pressure on your skin. Whatever creature was threatening you - if it was even real to begin with - doesn’t seem able to keep up with you. You only stop when your comm device lets out a small beep, informing you that you’re very near to your destination. The two of you pause, catch your breath, and look around, finding yourselves at the deepest part of the woods. It looks like you’ve made it! [[Head inside->FE01]]“Wait!” you yell, tugging Revissa away from the sound. Instead of looking towards it, you pull her in close, locking eyes only with her. Beside you, you hear more rustling, the scraping of feet on dirt, a low growl, but you ignore it. “Let’s keep going,” you say, pressing your forehead against hers. “We can’t afford to be distracted. It might be more illusions trying to trip us up.” The growling grows louder, more urgent, the footsteps get closer, but you don’t let them scare you. With a nod, Revissa closes her eyes once more, and lets you again take her hand. Together, you flee from the unseen predator, keeping your heads down, blotting out anything other than the sound of your own breathing, of each other’s pressure on your skin. Whatever creature was threatening you - if it was even real to begin with - doesn’t seem able to keep up with you. Eventually, you emerge, breathlessly, at the clearing in the forest where you first entered. It seems you’ve made it back, none the worse for wear - other than having wasted several hours making it here. For all your effort, it seems now you just have to pick another path to reach your destination. [[Choose a path->FA06]] The more you think about it, the more you come to the same conclusion. Despite all your success thus far in this portion of the woods, the lack of a reliable readout from your map has been a consistent thorn in your side. Sure, you could keep trying to make progress with brute force, but that’s landed you into peril multiple times already. Better to cut your losses and try something else. It’s not the bravest decision, but it’s the most responsible one. At least, that’s what you tell yourself as you turn around and head back the way you came. Thankfully, the further you get from the thick tangle of trees, the more responsive your map becomes at updating your position, and soon you find yourself on track to return to the place where you started your forest adventure. However, as you walk with your nose buried in the holographic navigation display, your ears happen to pick up a sound - a rustling from the bushes nearby. Revissa hears it too. You and she exchange glances, and then, as one, you turn to face it. [[Lay eyes on the threat->FA05]] [[Force yourselves to ignore it->FD02GA]] After everything you’ve been through thus far, you’re not going to back down now. Be it through strength, wisdom, dedication, or just plain luck, you’ve managed to overcome everything that’s come your way thus far. So what’s a bit more? Sure, the forest has been trying to trip you up, lead you astray, divert your attention, but now you’ve learned much more about it. And so you’re not going to let it scare you from continuing. With newfound courage, you press forward, heading in the direction you think you need to go without paying too much attention to the map, or even to your own senses. Eyes and ears can be fooled, but not the heart. Or at least, so you hope. Against all odds, you appear to be right. Now that you know what it was that was getting you lost, you find yourself able to compensate, navigating the treacherous tangle of trees until you make it far enough that your comm device starts working again, having escaped the influence of whatever was fooling your senses. But even as you are preoccupied with that minor victory, you hear it - the telltale rustling of bushes off to your side. Revissa notices it as well, and as one, the two of you turn to face it. [[Lay eyes on the threat->FA05]] [[Force yourself to ignore it->FD02FC]] “So once they realized what was happening, what did the resistance members do to avoid the predator?” you ask. “Well, the way it worked was, once they were lost and separated from their friends, the predator would try to incapacitate them in some way - usually by making them believe something that wasn’t true, like that they had fallen into a ravine and broken their leg. After that, well - we don’t know what happened to people who it dragged off, but from people that survived, they got out of it by noticing the inconsistencies about the situation and fighting against their own senses to escape.” You puff your chest out proudly. “So basically, what I need to do is be even *more* confident that I’m right, and ignore any information to the contrary, even from my own senses.” “I mean… yeah. I guess?” Revissa says lamely. “But I feel like you’re learning the wrong lesson here.” “Nope! The solution is to be an intolerable ass and never listen to anyone else.” Revissa rolls her eyes and kicks you hard in the shin. You just flash her your most winning smile as you turn around and again head into the center of the forest. (set: $predstory to true) [[Keep stubbornly pressing on->FD02]] You’re done with this stupid section of forest. One can only get lost and disoriented so many times before deciding to try a different path. “Let’s just head back. We’ve wasted too much time already.” Revissa seems disappointed that you’re not interested in making use of her idea, but knows better than to start an argument over it. And so, you begin tromping back through the forest, thankfully finding no further directional mishaps along the way. Before long, you can see the edge of the trees in front of you, indicating you’ve fully doubled back after hours of delay. Now all you need to do is get your bearings once more, and then you can try out a different road. However, as you are cross-referencing your position with the map on your comm, you happen to notice the sound of rustling coming from the bushes nearby. Revissa, standing beside you, hears it too. The two of you exchange glances and then, as one, turn to face it. [[Lay your eyes on the threat->FA05]] Your eyes sag as Revissa does her nature thing. The tree doesn’t seem to speak back to her in any way you can comprehend, but your wife still seems to be making sense of things nonetheless, perhaps noticing the patterns of grass swaying in the breeze, or the motion of leaves as they gently drift down from the branches above. It’s all rather… boring, if you’re being honest. Impressive, to be sure - you’ve never had a knack for magic, arcane, animistic, or otherwise, so you’re sure everything Revissa is doing takes concentration and talent. But it doesn’t change the fact that it’s not particularly engrossing to watch. Which is why your eyes mostly just drift towards Revissa’s shapely posterior, and the adorable little deer tail poking out from beneath her skirt. Back and forth, back and forth, it flicks charmingly as she communes. Though… after a short while, it suddenly holds perfectly still and tense. Raising an eyebrow in confusion, you look towards your wife’s face, and see telltale signs of worry etched into her features. Not necessarily scared, but… cautious. “Something wrong?” you ask. It takes a few long moments before she responds. “I… am not talking to a tree,” she eventually says. You just kind of stare at her with a confused look on her face. She sighs irritably. “It’s… oh, you wouldn’t understand. But it’s not how a tree would normally talk.” She turns and glares at the face in the bark. “It is… some kind of fey spirit, I have to assume. A trickster, playing a bit of a joke. Making me think it’s a tree as a jape.” Now the caution in her posture makes sense. You haven’t really had much dealing with the fair folk - not exactly your department. Vhaja has before, you know, together with an unlikely companion she had made, the half-fey daughter of the Winter Queen. And you’re pretty sure Revissa has spoken about making deals with fairykind during her days in the Bolg Resistance. But you’ve been fortunate enough to avoid that realm up until now, though even you know that fae are fickle, capricious, and potentially very dangerous “How delightfully droll,” comes a voice. It’s sharp and gravely, and appears to be emanating from the ‘mouth’ of the tree-face. “Figured it out so soon, did you?” Revissa narrows her eyes. “I’m not so easily tricked, I’m sorry to say.” Suddenly, there is a rush of sound, like sparkling firecrackers popping all around you, then a flash of motion as the leaves behind Revissa’s feet swirl in a multi-colored vortex. You back away instinctively, reaching towards your sword, watching as a figure emerges from the storm and claps its hands. A figure that… is oddly familiar. (link:"Behold My Bewitching Beauty, $yourname")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/F16_FaeThrone_by_Izra.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Izra(click-replace: "Art by Izra")[https://twitter.com/IZRART https://picarto.tv/IZRA]] (set: $picF16 to true) You recognize the gorgeous woman standing in front of you now. In fact, you were just thinking about her. Skadi, the Winter Witch, the half-fae princess that Vhaja sometimes works with. But… that’s impossible, isn’t it? “The form she is showing is not her true one!” Revissa warns. “She… must be gazing into our memories to construct an image for herself.” The woman who is not Skadi smiles and runs a finger playfully along Revissa’s arm. “And why would you say something like that, my little dear? Or should I say deer? Ho, how clever I can be!” “Because… to me, you look like Un-Rama, the great Guardian Moth, and I know you are not her.” The fey entity throws up her arms. “Guilty as charged! But what’s a little illusion between friends, no? Because… we *are* friends… right?” “That remains to be seen,” Revissa murmurs. “Well, for your sake I hope we are friends. Because you two are lost, and I know the way home.” Suddenly, things start to make sense. Hah! So it wasn’t that you were reading the map poorly. It’s that a trickster spirit was manipulating the terrain around you to make sure you ended up losing your way. There is a pop and not-Skadi is behind you, gently stroking the fluff inside your left ear. “No, my lost little doggie, you got yourself lost all on your own. Though once you *were* lost… I might have bent things around a bit to make sure you stayed that way.” “Why?!” Revissa demands. “Because that way, I can make sure you play my game!” You feel a shiver run down your spine… despite the warm (and not entirely unwelcome) presence of not-Skadi’s bosom compressed against your back. It seems like things have just become very… interesting. [[Find out just how interesting->FD04B]] ](enchant: ?leftDialogue, (align: "<==")+(border: "solid")+(corner-radius: 16, 16, 0, 16)+(background: grey)+(text-color: blue))(enchant: ?rightDialogue, (box: "==x")+(border: "solid")+(corner-radius: 16, 16, 16, 0)+(background: grey)+(text-color: green)) “What kind of game?!” |hidden>[(link: "Revissa")[(go-to: "MX06") ]] demands, stepping towards the suspicious woman. “Actually, no, I don’t want to know, because it’s never a good idea to —” And then her voice cuts off, because, suddenly, the scarf around her neck expands and bubbles out, forming a sort of balloon that has entirely encased her head. No sound seems able to escape from the odd container, nor does light seem to be able to pass through it, as evidenced by your wife’s aimless flailing. “There, much better,” not-|hidden>[(link: "Skadi")[(go-to: "MX08") ]] coos. “A bit of a nag, isn’t she? Though I suppose all wives are.” Her voice is all levity, but you’re not laughing. Though you know better to react aggressively. You get the sense this woman, whatever she is, is quite powerful, and that any attempt at direct confrontation would end poorly for you. “What do you want with us?” you eventually say. “Just to have fun! Is that such a crime?” You watch as |hidden>[(link: "Revissa")[(go-to: "MX06") ]] blindly stumbles over a tree root and falls to the ground. “No offense… but I’m pretty sure anything you do for fun is going to be happening at our expense.” The fae woman sighs dramatically and falls backwards into your arms. “Ugh, this is the problem with experienced adventurers. Always so suspicious.” She disappears in a puff, and then reappears sitting on a tree branch above you. “So, fine, how about this, |hidden>[(link: "Melfy")[(go-to: "MX07") ]] my girl? Just to show you I’m on the up-and-up. I’ll help you out of the jam you’re in, free of charge! You’re lost right now, and all you need to do is say the word and I’ll get you figured out. How’s that sound?” It isn’t lost on you that you have never told her your name, but she knows it anyway. Isn’t a fae knowing your name supposed to be super dangerous? You glance nervously towards |hidden>[(link: "Revissa")[(go-to: "MX06") ]]. Surely she’d tell you not to trust anything this woman says. But if she really is as powerful as it seems like she is, maybe you can get on her good side by going along with her nonsense. “Well, what’s it going to be, wolfie?” she asks, holding out her hands. Cartoon-like word bubbles appear on either side of her, filling out as she speaks the choices. |leftdialogue>[[[Let me get you figured out?->FD04C]]] |rightdialogue>[[[Or ignore the mysterious and beautiful stranger and get yourself lost all over again?->FD04E]]] “Go ahead and click whichever one you like best!” You sigh deeply, but eventually relent. “Fine, you can help me,” you tell the grinning fae, pointing to the word bubble on her left. The woman claps her hands brightly. “Wonderful! But, just to confirm - you want me to help you get figured out, right?” “Okay, fine!” you say, throwing up your hands. “Figure us out!” A mischievous grin forms on not-Skadi’s lips as she snaps her fingers loudly enough to cause an echo between the trees. “Granted!” And that’s when you realize you screwed up. Because all of a sudden, the forest surrounding you starts to grow, the branches of trees stretching away from you higher and higher. Or… wait, maybe they’re not growing. Maybe it’s *you* who is shrinking! “Wha– what are you doing?” you ask in bewilderment, soon growing too small for your clothes to stay fixed on your body. “Exactly what you asked for!” is the only reply you get. By the time it’s done, you’re standing maybe six inches high, and need to burrow your way out of the mountainous pile of clothing you’ve become buried in. By the time you escape, you find an equally tiny Revissa waiting for you with a scowl on her face. “Never agree to anything a fae offers you!” she shrieks. “I just thought–” “Don’t think, don’t try to outsmart them, don’t play along. The best thing you can do is ignore them. Come on, Melfy, we’ve been over this before!” You scratch your head. “We have?” “Yes! On multiple occasions, but you never list— wah!” Your argument is cut off as two giant hands descend from the air, plucking each of your tiny bodies up by squeezing you tightly around the waist. Suddenly you have ascended to dizzying heights, as you and your wife are held at eye level to the relatively giant fae woman. “Aww… don’t fight, you two. You make such a cute couple when you’re getting along. In fact…” Her eyes begin to glow with a bewitching power, and you feel your fear and irritation fading away. Revissa’s scowl turns into a placid smile as well, both of you staring at each other with slack-jawed expressions. “Much better. Now why don’t the two of you show off how much you love each other? Won’t that be more fun than yelling and fighting?” It does sound much more fun. You hate it when Revissa is mad at you, especially when you know she’s totally justified in feeling that way. So you’re only too happy to agree to the perfectly reasonable request given to you by the mischievous fae. Once she seems satisfied you’re both back on good turns, she carries your minimized bodies over to a nearby tree stump, where a small, round platform is waiting. Beckoning, even. It’s a strange feeling, but you become overwhelmed with the idea that this little platform is where you belong. And though it’s only a few inches in diameter, it’s the perfect size to fit a wolf and deer who are eager to make up after a fight. “Shall we?” you say, motioning to the pedestal. Revissa nods, and allows you to take her by the hand as you step on top of it together. The two of you spin around, pressing against each other back to back, linking hands as you turn your heads to smile at the fae woman towering above you. Ready for whatever comes next. “Perfect,” she says, as she snaps her fingers one more time. [[Get figured out->FD04D]] You roll your eyes as you point to the word bubble on the right. “No offense, but I’m pretty sure I’m not supposed to agree to anything a fae offers to me,” you say. Your tone of voice is sincerely apologetic. “Maybe you’d actually help, maybe you wouldn’t, but my wife would be upset with me if I actually went along with it.” Rather than be upset, the fae woman simply claps her hands in amusement. “What a dedicated spouse you are. I’m impressed!” You raise an eyebrow. “You are?” “It’s rare to find true love nowadays. Yet you and your friends all seem to have it.” That causes your eyebrow to raise even further. “My friends? You mean Krysta and Vhaja and the rest?” “I’ve got my eye on all of you,” the fae woman says in a tone of voice that sounds chipper but has an ominous ring behind it. “And I’m eager to see how all of you handle what lies ahead.” You raise a hand to interject, but before a word gets out, the woman is gone. Behind you, Revissa growls in annoyance as she finally gets the scarf off of her head. She looks around quickly then runs over to you in a huff. You give her the run-down of the exchange as best you can. “Good. Never trust a fae,” she says firmly. “Never accept any of their deals. Any help they give always comes at a cost too high to pay.” It feels good that you’ve finally done something smart for once. Though… it doesn’t solve the fact that you’re still lost… (set: $forestfae to true) [[Wander aimlessly->FD02]] You probably should have picked up on it. The way she was phrasing things made it obvious there was some kind of trap hidden beneath her words. Generally speaking, you’re pretty clever about avoiding things like this. But everyone makes mistakes. (link:"Have you figured it out yet?")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/F17_FiguredOut_by_Dvega.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Dvega(click-replace: "Art by Dvega")[https://www.deviantart.com/dvega https://picarto.tv/Tek]] (set: $picF17 to true) It figures this would happen to you. With a snap of her finger, the powerful fae trickster has transformed you and your wife into glossy plastic collectibles, mounted on top of a circular display stand.
