And now that brilliant mind of hers is trapped in a body that cannot ever act on any of the plans she concocts.] |drink2)[(link:"The wings and breasts provide a nice counter-balance to each other to keep the trophy standing upright.")[(show:?drink3)]] |drink3)[<img src="images/F36_LuminaSilver_by_Dreamons.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Dreamons(click-replace: "Art by Dreamons")[https://www.deviantart.com/dreamons2]] (set: $picF36 to true) And finally comes Lumina. The curvaceous angel is frozen as if in mid-takeoff, her legs perched on her trophy stand, arms extend, wings flaring out behind her. Her purple eyes radiate confusion and worry, expressing bewilderment at how she’s ended up here as nothing but a collectible. What kind of game did the fae play with her? Her engraving reads “Best Girl”... what could it mean? Perhaps she was offered the chance to be reunited with her partner, always the faithful lover, but did not expect that the cunning fae would turn her into a trophy as well as a result. Whatever the circumstances, the lot of you are here, and you are trapped. And once your captor is certain you’re all aware of each other’s presence, she slinks to the nightstand. One more time, she flicks her hand, and one more time she produces the helpless form of one your crew.] |drink3)[(link:"Might we call this the Queen of Figures?")[(show:?drink4)]] |drink4)[<img src="images/F32_JyumonFigure_by_Goddo.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Goddo(click-replace: "Art by Goddo")[https://www.deviantart.com/goddo15 https://twitter.com/goddoartt]] (set: $picF32 to true) Jyumon’s body is about eight inches tall, made of hard plastic, molded into a glossy sheen. She’s wearing the outfit of a popular holo-game character whose name you can’t remember, noteworthy for her rather… generous proportions. She fills the outfit well. The fae sets her down onto the nightstand, tilting her so she looks towards the bookcase where the rest of you stand, though there is no change in the expression on her face as she holds the same saucy pose she is trapped in, folding fan jauntily clutched between her inert fingers. “There we are!” she says with a bright smile. “Perfect! All our little heroes, trapped forever in one place. I couldn’t just pick one or two - I had to go for the whole set!” She does a little twirl, before leaning in towards your face, poking you in the nose. “And I do mean forever. There’s no getting out of this one, my lovely little trophy. No last-minute rescue. All of you are mine. And will remain mine, until I decide to let you go. But let’s be honest… such a lovely collection as this one, I don’t see that happening any time soon.” There’s nothing you can do. You’re trapped, helpless. And all of your friends have been transformed into motionless collectibles. They won’t be saving you, and you won’t be saving them. You messed with a fae, and now you’ve paid the price. (if: $candy is false)[[[Watch the years go by->FD07AX]]] (if: $candy is true)[[[Watch the years go by->FD07AY]]] ] It would be nice to say life as a display piece was eventful or exciting, but that, of course, would be a lie. Mostly all you do is sit there as nothing but a trophy, a toy. You and your friends attracted the attention of an otherworldly being with unimaginable power, and now all of you are nothing but baubles for her collection. Though as eternity passes on, it becomes clear that you, for whatever reason, are her favorite. Sure, every once in a while she’ll flip through her card binder and admire Lumina’s holographic image, or spin the merry-go-round on its stand like a wind-up music box, making it turn round and round as tinny carnival music fills the room. Vhaja is more functional than appreciated, anchoring down documents on the desk without much attention given to her - she’s nothing but an object now, after all. Krysta is occasionally squished and squeezed when her owner slides into bed, and Jyumon gets a nice dusting with a wet cloth every now and then, her smooth, glossy curves lovingly cleared of grime. But it’s you that gets to have ‘fun’. (if: $faebound is true)[You’d think, as tightly and firmly strapped in as you are, you would be good as nothing more than a display piece… but it turns out your new owner is willing to put in the work to make use of you. Whenever she gets that lusty look in her eyes, the enterprising fae snaps her fingers, commanding the straps that hold you to unfurl and drag you towards the bed, tightening themselves around the support poles to lay you down on your back. What comes next should be obvious - she pokes and prods, grinds and churns, lays yearning kisses all along your helplessly restrained form, bringing herself to climax in a myriad of inventive ways. At no point do the bindings ever loosen, give you even the tiniest bit of slack, and that big, round gag never slides away from your lips. Functionally you’re basically just a statue, given only the most minimal amount of wiggle room, for no reason other than to watch you squirm. When she’s finished, she leaves her slick residue staining your body, putting you back on display so all your friends can see what your purpose is.](else-if: $faeshiny is true )[You would think as a statue, you were good for nothing more than being put on display… but it turns out there’s more that can be done with a glossy, shiny, life-sized love doll. Whenever she gets that lusty look in her eyes, your owner drags your inert form over onto her bed, laying you down on your back as she slides out of her clothes and straddles your inert form. Your frozen face, the tips of your outstretched fingers, the stiff nubs of your breasts, the tip of your rock-hard tail, every inch of your body can be used to stimulate, assuming your partner is creative enough. And she is *quite* creative. When she’s finished, she leaves your body slick with her residue, putting you back on display so all your friends can see what your purpose is.](else-if: $faetrophy is true )[You’d think as a trophy, you were good for nothing more than being put on display… but it turns out you’re just the right size and shape for a different kind of purpose. Whenever she gets that lusty look in her eyes, your owner plucks up your tiny statue and lays down on her bed, dropping her clothing and plunging you, head-first, into her nether regions. In and out, up and down, your face provides firm metal stimulation for her desires, slaking her insatiable thirst for pleasure. And when she’s done, she lets her slickness gleam on your frozen body for a while, putting you back onto your shelf so all your friends can see what your purpose is.] Her attention is the one distraction from an otherwise bland eternity of helplessness, with you and your crew doomed to spend eternity in her collection. No rescue ever comes. No mercy is ever given. You’re just toys to her, and toys you shall remain. Forever. GAME OVER [[Start over->A0X]]It would be nice to say life as a display piece was eventful or exciting, but that, of course, would be a lie. Mostly all you do is sit there as nothing but a trophy, a toy. You and your friends attracted the attention of an otherworldly being with unimaginable power, and now all of you are nothing but baubles for her collection. Though as eternity passes on, it becomes clear that you, for whatever reason, are her favorite. Sure, every once in a while she’ll flip through her card binder and admire Lumina’s holographic image, or spin the merry-go-round on its stand like a wind-up music box, making it turn round and round as tinny carnival music fills the room. Vhaja is more functional than appreciated, anchoring down documents on the desk without much attention given to her - she’s nothing but an object now, after all. Krysta is occasionally squished and squeezed when her owner slides into bed, and Jyumon gets a nice dusting with a wet cloth every now and then, her smooth, glossy curves lovingly cleared of grime. But it’s you that gets to have ‘fun’. (if: $faebound is true)[You’d think, as tightly and firmly strapped in as you are, you would be good as nothing more than a display piece… but it turns out your new owner is willing to put in the work to make use of you. Whenever she gets that lusty look in her eyes, the enterprising fae snaps her fingers, commanding the straps that hold you to unfurl and drag you towards the bed, tightening themselves around the support poles to lay you down on your back. What comes next should be obvious - she pokes and prods, grinds and churns, lays yearning kisses all along your helplessly restrained form, bringing herself to climax in a myriad of inventive ways. At no point do the bindings ever loosen, give you even the tiniest bit of slack, and that big, round gag never slides away from your lips. Functionally you’re basically just a statue, given only the most minimal amount of wiggle room, for no reason other than to watch you squirm. When she’s finished, she leaves her slick residue staining your body, putting you back on display so all your friends can see what your purpose is.](else-if: $faeshiny is true )[You would think as a statue, you were good for nothing more than being put on display… but it turns out there’s more that can be done with a glossy, shiny, life-sized love doll. Your frozen face, the tips of your outstretched fingers, the stiff nubs of your breasts, the tip of your rock-hard tail, every inch of your body can be used to stimulate, assuming your partner is creative enough. And she is *quite* creative. When she’s finished, she leaves your body slick with her residue, putting you back on display so all your friends can see what your purpose is.](else-if: $faetrophy is true )[You’d think as a trophy, you were good for nothing more than being put on display… but it turns out you’re just the right size and shape for a different kind of purpose. Whenever she gets that lusty look in her eyes, your owner plucks up your tiny statue and lays down on her bed, dropping her clothing and plunging you, head-first, into her nether regions. In and out, up and down, your face provides firm metal stimulation for her desires, slaking her insatiable thirst for pleasure. And when she’s done, she lets her slickness gleam on your frozen body for a while, putting you back onto your shelf so all your friends can see what your purpose is.] And she does seem to enjoy those encounters. But you start to notice that, as the ages flow by, every time she draws near you, she grows increasingly irate. Testy, irritable. You can’t for the life of you imagine why - it’s not like you have any agency at all to influence her mood. But one day she comes out and says it. What feels like a lifetime ago, you sucked down a Star Scout homing beacon, and ever since you’ve been captured it’s been sending out pulses into the void. Useless to attract help, but effective in creating an obnoxious ringing in her ear. Because the Scouts are formed around the tenets of love and happiness, even her fae magic can’t just undo the signal. So she just tries to live with it. But eventually, the benefit of keeping you outweighs the annoyance. All at once, you and your friends appear in a naked pile in the middle of a remote planet. No gear, no equipment, no idea how long you’ve been gone, or how you’ll make your way back to civilization. She doesn’t care - she just wants to put an end to the incessant ringing. Then she vanishes in her signature puff of smoke, leaving your party to their own devices. What follows is an exciting adventure in its own right, but it’s not the adventure we’re here to tell today. And, regardless, your actions have led to failing your original mission. Maybe next time you’ll think better about getting tangled up with a fae. GAME OVER [[Start over->A0X]]It would be nice to say life as a display piece was eventful or exciting, but that, of course, would be a lie. Mostly all you do is sit there as nothing but a trophy, a toy. You and your friends attracted the attention of an otherworldly being with unimaginable power, and now all of you are nothing but baubles for her collection. Though as eternity passes on, it becomes clear to you that you, for whatever reason, are her favorite. Sure, every once in a while she’ll give the others a nice dusting, bust out a wet rag and rub it all over their frozen figures. But it’s you that gets to have ‘fun’. You’d think as a trophy, you were good for nothing more than being put on display… but it turns out you’re just the right size and shape for a different kind of purpose. Whenever she gets that lusty look in her eyes, your owner plucks up your tiny statue and lays down on her bed, dropping her clothing and plunging you, head-first, into her nether regions. In and out, up and down, your face provides firm metal stimulation for her desires, slaking her insatiable thirst for pleasure. And when she’s done, she lets her slickness gleam on your frozen body for a while, putting you back onto your shelf so all your friends can see what your purpose is. Her attention is the one distraction from an otherwise bland eternity of helplessness, you and your crew doomed to spend out eternity in her collection. No rescue ever comes. No mercy is ever given. You’re just toys to her, and toys you shall remain. Forever. GAME OVER [[Start over->A0X]]It would be nice to say life as a display piece was eventful or exciting, but that, of course, would be a lie. Mostly all you do is sit there as nothing but a trophy, a toy. You and your friends attracted the attention of an otherworldly being with unimaginable power, and now all of you are nothing but baubles for her collection. Though as eternity passes on, it becomes clear to you that you, for whatever reason, are her favorite. Sure, every once in a while she’ll give the others a nice dusting, bust out a wet rag and rub it all over their frozen figures. But it’s you that gets to have ‘fun’. You’d think as a trophy, you were good for nothing more than being put on display… but it turns out you’re just the right size and shape for a different kind of purpose. Whenever she gets that lusty look in her eyes, your owner plucks up your tiny statue and lays down on her bed, dropping her clothing and plunging you, head-first, into her nether regions. In and out, up and down, your face provides firm metal stimulation for her desires, slaking her insatiable thirst for pleasure. And when she’s done, she lets her slickness gleam on your frozen body for a while, putting you back onto your shelf so all your friends can see what your purpose is. And she does seem to enjoy those encounters. But you start to notice that, as the ages flow by, every time she draws near you, she grows increasingly irate. Testy, irritable. You can’t for the life of you imagine why - it’s not like you have any agency at all to influence her mood. But one day she comes out and says it. What feels like a lifetime ago, you sucked down a Star Scout homing beacon, and ever since you’ve been captured it’s been sending out pulses into the void. Useless to attract help, but effective in creating an obnoxious ringing in her ear. Because the Scouts are formed around the tenets of love and happiness, even her fae magic can’t just undo the signal. So she just tries to live with it. But eventually, the benefit of keeping you outweighs the annoyance. All at once, you and your friends appear in a naked pile in the middle of a remote planet. No gear, no equipment, no idea how long you’ve been gone, or how you’ll make your way back to civilization. She doesn’t care - she just wants to put an end to the incessant ringing. Then she vanishes in her signature puff of smoke, leaving your party to their own devices. What follows is an exciting adventure in its own right, but it’s not the adventure we’re here to tell today. And, regardless, your actions have led to failing your original mission. Maybe next time you’ll think better about getting tangled up with a fae. GAME OVER [[Start over->A0X]]Overwhelmed by everything that is happening around you, your fingers wrap around the handles of the trophy, and you pull it from the fae woman’s grip. As soon as you do, you feel a strange ripple in the space around you, as if something kind of intangible truth has just been locked into place. It makes you shiver in fear for a moment, but then you lock eyes with the woman and any doubts melt away from your mind. “As a golden trophy,” the announcer voice says, cutting through the din of the cheering crowd. “Melfy will be the eternal property of the second-place winner. She will have no power, no agency, and will be forever nothing more than a collectable knick-knack, to be done with as her owner pleases.” Wait… what? You didn’t agree to that! You’re supposed to win the prize, not become it! And yet, as if in a trance, you smile broadly, holding your arms over your head and flexing to the delight of the invisible crowd. “Of course, our winner will be joined by her wife, who shall remain trapped forever as a glossy merry-go-round horse. They will be part of the same collection, protected by their new owner for the rest of their days.” No… no! You don’t want this! But you’re powerless to resist it now, the spell is too strong. You’ve become completely overwhelmed by the cheering, the fanfare. And now you feel your body starting to stiffen, your powerful muscles turning numb. “In addition, the second-place winner will make every effort to hunt down and capture all of our champion’s companions as well, trapping them with similar games that they can’t ever hope to win at!” This isn’t what you wanted… this isn’t fair! You won! You beat her! And yet, your frozen body begins to shrink, the world around you seeming to pull away higher and higher. You can’t stop it from happening. You can’t resist. Can’t do anything but stand there with that stupid smile stuck on your face, as the numbness spreads to your neck. “And once all six of them are defeated, they will be entered into a collection and put on display forevermore, with no hope of rescue!” A single tear dribbles down from your eye as the numbness eclipses your face. And then… you become the prize you were fighting for. (link:"It really brings out her muscle tone, don't you think?")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/F40_TrophyMelfy_by_Devga.png" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Dvega(click-replace: "Art by Dvega")[https://www.deviantart.com/dvega https://picarto.tv/Tek]] (set: $picF40 to true) Now you’re nothing but a golden trophy, claimed by the person you thought you had defeated. If only you’d tried harder to resist the siren’s call that victory tempted you with. (if: $faekiss is true)[Perhaps if you hadn’t tackled the fae woman to the ground and rolled in the hay with her, you’d have had enough mental fortitude to choose something else than what you’ve now found yourself stuck in.] But it doesn’t matter now. All that matters is that the game is over - and despite winning, you still feel like a loser. “Well, that was fun,” says the fae woman, now easily five or six times your size. She wraps her hands around your golden midsection and brings you up in front of her face so she can inspect you from all sides. “I hope you enjoyed it too. And now you get the prize of belonging to me forever, along with all of your friends. A pretty good deal, wouldn’t you say?” You wouldn’t, but you can’t. All you can do is stand there in silent contemplation, the light gleaming off of your inert figure. After so many adventures, it’s all just resulted in this, caught by a cruel and wicked fae, powerless to stop her from doing the same to the rest of your friends. You’d have been better off being lost in that forest forever. But instead, now you and Revissa are both just two more playthings in the collection of an impossibly powerful being. And with another snap of her fingers, you vanish from the forest, never to return again. (set:$faetrophy to true) [[Begin your new life->FD07D]] ] (set: $racewin to true)(set: $FDStart to true) No… there’s something not right here. You won the game, you should be happy! And yet… you feel the fur on your tail standing on end. What is it Revissa always says - never trust a fae, never accept their gifts. Well one is trying to give you something right now. But you’re not having it. With a powerful swipe of your arms, you knock the proffered trophy from the woman’s grip, sending it careening to the ground. The moment it strikes the earth, the cheering stops, the victory platform vanishes, and the tiny merry-go-round containing your frozen wife appears in your hands. “Well, that’s no fun,” says the fae lady with an adorable pout, pressing her sultry body up against you playfully. “Are you *sure* you don’t want to be my sexy little trophy? I’d take such good care of you!” You slip out of her grasp. “I’m gonna have to pass, sorry. As my prize for winning, I demand you return Revissa back to normal.” She frowns, but then holds up her hand as an idea strikes her. “Now hold on… before you go asking for any prizes, I have an offer for you.” “Not interested.” “Ugh, just listen! This one’s *really* spicy.” She appears behind you, pressing her soft chest against your back. “Why don’t we play one more game. A very simple one. If I win… I get to keep you, of course. But if *you* win… you get to keep *me*.” That at least gives you pause. “I get to keep you?” “That’s right. You can trap me however you like, and I’ll be yours. Up until you die – or until your fate is sealed by someone else.” Okay, this is obviously another trick. One last bit of temptation to try and trap you in her web of lies. And yet… the feeling of her bosom pressed against you is so tantalizing, the way her warm breath brushes against your ears, her hands gently massaging the muscles of your arm. It *would* be nice to keep her… if only to remove such a dangerous being from causing any more mischief. And after all, you already managed to win one of her games - who’s to say you can’t win another? [[Play another game->FD08]] [[Resist the temptation->FD09]] This is stupid. You *know* this is stupid. After how far you’ve come avoiding getting caught by her, it’s utterly bonkers to throw yourself into another one of her games. But like it or not, you’ve fallen under her spell. The temptation to have her for yourself is just too great to ignore. “Alright… I’m in. Let’s play another game.” She actually looks surprised at your decision. “Really? Wow, I can’t believe that worked. You didn’t even ask what the game would be! But it’s too late to back out now!” You know it was a stupid choice, but you don’t really appreciate her rubbing it in like that. “So… first, the stakes. If I lose, you get to keep me for the rest of your life, in whatever form you choose. And if *I* win… I get to keep you. And your wife. And I’ll track down your friends and keep them, too.” “...wait! I never agreed to that!” “You agreed to a game without even hearing the rules. What did you expect?” This was, admittedly, an incredibly dumb choice on your part. But what’s done is done, so now you just have to win. “So… what *is* the game, then?” “Oh, it really is quite simple. All you have to do to win… is speak my name.” You blink in confusion. That’s it? But wait… how could you possibly know her name? “Err… but I don’t know your name,” you say lamely. “Indeed. Quite the conundrum you find yourself in. Anyway, you have ten seconds. Get it right, or be mine forever. So, what’s it gonna be, wolfie?” [[Take a guess->FD08A]]You shake your head. “No dice. Turn my wife back and leave us alone. That’s what I want.” The fae woman pouts. “You’re sure?” For a brief moment, you’re gripped by a pang of anxiety. Are you somehow making the wrong choice? Is this another trick? Were you supposed to say something else, some magic words that would actually get her to do what you want? But you bite your doubts down. No one ever survived an encounter with a fae by being indecisive. “Yes, I’m sure. Return Revissa to normal.” “Ugh, fine. Maybe you’re not as fun as I thought.” She snaps her fingers, and the tiny merry-go-round in your hand starts to spin, whirling faster and faster until one of the ‘horses’ shoots out and smashes into you. And when you look up, Revissa is laying on top of you, hale and hearty. You throw your arms around her and hold her tight. What follows is a kiss more passionate than anything in recent memory. “I told you… never trust a fae,” she says when you finally come up for air. “I could sue you for discrimination, you know,” says the woman, poking her face between the two of you. Revissa bats her away. “Oh, I know - you’re still lost, aren’t you? I can help guide you –” “No!” you and your wife shout in unison. The woman throws up her hands. “Fine then. Enjoy the scenery, I guess! And remember - don’t always believe everything you see or hear!” And then, mercifully, she’s gone. The best way to beat a fae is to make them lose interest in you. It seems like you’ve finally succeeded. The two of you have something of a tradition when it comes to barely escaping nigh-insurmountable peril. And the two of you engage in it now. It involves your bodies getting even closer to one another than they already are, and a whole lot of kissing. On the lips and other places. After thirty minutes you lay beside each other, naked and panting on the grass. In a minute you’ll put your clothes back on and continue exploring, but for the moment you’re just happy to be together. (set: $faewin to true) (if: $forestfae is true)[[[Continue the mission->FD09A]]](else: )[[[Continue the mission->FD09B]] ] You’ve survived a harrowing encounter with one of the most dangerous foes you’ve ever faced, and that’s something to be proud of. But there’s still a mission to complete, and a forest ahead of you that defies all attempts to navigate it. You got lost once before, and nearly drowned in a tar pit for your efforts. Only thanks to the fae woman’s intervention were you able to escape the first time. Without her, will you be able to survive a second? Maybe it would be better to turn around now and try a different path through the woods, one which is easier to navigate. It would be a huge waste of time, but better late to complete the mission than never, right? [[Turn back->FD09C]] [[Keep going->FD09D]] You’ve survived a harrowing encounter with one of the most dangerous foes you’ve ever faced, and that’s something to be proud of. But there’s still a mission to complete, and a forest ahead of you that defies all attempts to navigate it. You got lost once before, what’s stopping you from getting lost a second time? You have no way of knowing if that fae woman herself was responsible, or if there’s some other force at play here that wants to hamper the success of your mission. But for now, all you can do is keep moving forward. [[Keep going->FD02]] You’re not going to turn back now, not after everything you’ve been through. Yes, you’re still not fully sure how to navigate the forest, but that seems like such a quaint complication after the insanity you’ve lived through. It’s not every day you have a merry-go-round race on your wife’s back, after all. And so, gathering up your equipment… and your courage, you begin to walk. Revissa follows dutifully alongside you, vigilant against any more unwanted intrusion from fairies, trees, and monsters. You keep your eyes glued to your map screen for the first hour or so, but eventually, you’re forced to admit that it still isn’t working this deep in. Whatever lured you into that tar pit is still around here, still holds claim over the twisting passages of trees. But that’s fine. You’re feeling more confident now, more sure of yourself. Maybe the map isn’t working, but you still have your innate sense of direction, complications be damned! And as you walk, you think about what the fae woman said before she parted ways - don’t trust your eyes or your ears. Fair enough. So instead, you’ll trust your mind and your heart. You keep walking, recklessly, arrogantly assuming you know what you’re doing, never once looking down at the map. And against all odds, it seems to work. Because as you barrel past yet another identical cluster of bushes, your comm device makes a pleasant beep to let you know you’re approaching the destination you had programmed into it. It should have been a moment of triumph, but at the exact same instant, you happen to hear something else. Claws scraping against dirt, a low growl, leaves rustling as a predator approaches. Already running on instinct, you clutch your sword and wheel around towards the threat without stopping to think whether it’s a good idea. [[Lay eyes on the threat->FD09DA]] There are a lot of benefits that come with experience. You’ve gone on so many adventures, endured so much, suffered defeat and felt the thrill of victory more times than you can count. And because of that, your instincts have been honed to a razor sharp edge, letting you pick up on danger where other women would have continued on unawares. Usually, that experience is a good thing. Normally, reacting quickly can save your life. Sadly, this time, it proves to have the opposite effect. Because as you wheel around, you find yourself looking right into the eyes of a large, squat, bulky lizard with vibrant scales the same pastiche of colors as the leaves crumpled up on the ground. That trained mind of yours, honed by years of instinct, warns you of the threat you now face a micro-second before your body begins to seize up. You have just enough time to start to recoil, for your eyes to widen, for your lips to part and for a warning to begin to form on your tongue. The warning never escapes your lips before your face turns to granite. What you’ve discovered, creeping up on you in the brush, is a basilisk. A creature known for its ability to turn flesh to stone as soon as one meets its gaze. In a universe where you were less perceptive, you might have been better off. But that’s not the universe you currently occupy. (link:"...")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/F41_MelfyStone_by_Dvega.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Dvega(click-replace: "Art by Dvega")[https://www.deviantart.com/dvega https://picarto.tv/Tek]] (set: $picF41 to true) If there’s any mercy, it’s that the transformation is shockingly swift. Your ears have a moment to register the telltale crackling sound, your muscles have the opportunity to feel how swiftly they are stiffening. And your eyes have a blissful few seconds to register the bright yellow pupils of the monster that entrapped you, before they become little more than blank, sightless orbs. Given how many adventures you’ve made it through, this would be a rather ignominious way to end one. But as your clothing turns brittle and crumples away, and your mind falls into a deep, dreamless sleep, you realize with your last gasp of consciousness that life is not always fair. The greatest of stories can end in a heartbeat with one mistimed step. And it seems yours has met just such an unsatisfying conclusion. (set: $basiliskmet to true) [[...or has it?->FD09DB]] ] The next thing you feel is cool forest air against your bare skin. You were standing before, but now you’re on your back, looking up at the canopy of branches above as Revissa leans over you with an expression equal parts relieved and annoyed. “Well… I’m glad these things work,” she says, slipping one of Lumina’s celestially charged healing diamonds back into her pouch. “I was…” you begin groggily. “Rock hard, yes. I always loved how firm your abs were, but this was a bit much.” You rub your head wearily, making use of muscles that had been rendered utterly stiff for several hours. “The… monster? I saw it, I–” Revissa chuckles. “I scared it off. It wasn’t really dangerous, probably just protecting its territory.” Lucky for you it wasn’t. And that you were being so much more aggressive in your movements and reactions than Revissa was. If you’d both looked at it at the same time… well, there wouldn’t have been anyone around to use that healing diamond. Either way, you’re alive now, and not just a hunk of stone. And you’ve made it far enough into the forest that your destination is but a stone’s throw away. Your clothes were destroyed when you were petrified, but the use of one of Jyumon’s matter re-synthesizer capsules gives you an exact duplicate of your outfit, meaning that once you do some stretches to work out the last gasps of stiffness from your muscles, you’re good to go. [[Enter the deepest part of the woods->FE01]] (set: $faename to (prompt: "What is my name?", "")) “Is it…. $faename?“ you guess nervously. (if: $faename is "Adonia")[The fae woman grins. “Now, why would you think *that* was my name? I get the feeling you’re on the right track, but you’ve not quite figured it out yet. Read the whole clue, and pay attention to the numbers. If you know your ABCs, I think you can come up with a way to transform a sum of digits into a single letter, can’t you?” She snaps her fingers. “Either way, you’ve guessed wrong, so I’m afraid poor Melfy is still destined for a Bad End.” [[Get collected->FD08AA]]](else-if: $faename is "Mira")[The fae woman sighs. “Well, I knew it had to happen sooner or later. Yes, you’ve figured it out. "Mira" is a name that I can be called by. Did you do it legitimately by solving my riddle? Or are you a clever little fox who picked it out in the game’s code somehow? Or maybe you just got the answer from someone else? Either way, a deal’s a deal, so now I suppose you’ve earned yourself a prize.” [[Collect your prize->FD08B]]](else-if: $faename is "Banana")[The fae woman raises an eyebrow. “No, silly, that’s the password for the Debug menu, not my name. Unless… are you telling me you’d like for me to handle all de bugs? Well, I suppose I could do something about that… [[Take care of some bugs->FD08F]]](else-if: ($faename is "CHEATER") and ($yourname is "CHEATER"))[The fae woman chuckles. “I asked you to guess *my* name – not yours. Unless… are you saying you don’t like the new name I’ve given you? Well, I suppose there’s something we could do about that… though it would require a sacrifice on your part. Swing by my shop in the main menu later and we’ll have a chat about it. Though for now, I’m afraid poor Melfy is due for a Bad End.” (set: $cheatmeet to true) [[Get collected->FD08AA]]](else: )[“Oh, so sorry, but that’s not correct. I’m afraid there’s only a few very specific strings of characters that will give you a result different from this one, and this, sadly for you, is not one of them. Perhaps you were actually very close to the right answer, but made a typo or something. Or maybe you just entered something rude. Impossible to tell within the parameters of the technology we’re using to communicate here. So, since you didn’t guess one of the handful of interesting options, I’m afraid we’re just going to have to count this as a loss.” You ball up your fists in anger. “What? But that’s not fair!” The fae woman shrugs. “Blame the author. Though to be fair, I get it. Writing all this dialogue must be exhausting.” “Well, crap. So… what, do we just go back, or…?” She laughs. “No, of course not. We’re going to play out the Bad End where I keep you and your friends forever. You still deserve a reward for your poor choices, after all. So…” “Wait, no, hold on–” But she cuts you off with a snap of her fingers. [[Get collected->FD08AA]]] The next thing you know, you’re in the air, suspended off the ground. Something heavy and firm is pressed against your back, and leather straps dig painfully into your bare skin. You open your eyes and find yourself looking out onto the floor of a strange, unfamiliar place, a location stuck outside of time. It has the overall appearance of a curio shop, shelves lining the walls, antiques filling out every table. On one wall, a giant grandmother clock. Hanging from the ceiling, model airplanes suspended on strings. In the center of the floor, a marble birdbath. And yet, upon closer inspection, everything within the room has a macabre secret to it - because every single one hides the form of a helpless woman, trapped or transformed by the fae’s wicked magic. Behind the glass of the clock, a tsunojian is shackled in place, the pendulum tick-tocking between her two heaving breasts. And within the seats of the airplanes are tiny, glossy pilots, kemomi women shrunken and transformed to forever operate the controls. And the basin of the birdbath, of course, is clutched between the fingers of a petrified elvaan, the placid smile etched onto her face belying the terror she must have felt in the moment her fate was sealed. You feel intense sympathy for all the captured women on display throughout the floor. Because you, like them, are now a prisoner. “Well, girls? How does it feel?” the fae whose name is not Skadi asks. “Comfy?” You wish you knew what to call her. If you had, you wouldn’t be in this situation right now. None of you would be. (link:"Damn, I look good here, don't you think?")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/F37_RFGBondageTrophies_by_BoundPretties.png" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by BoundPretties(click-replace: "Art by BoundPretties")[https://www.deviantart.com/boundpretties https://www.patreon.com/boundpretties/overview]] (set: $picF37 to true) The last thing you remember, you were in the forest. And you and Revissa were the only ones victimized by the sultry trickster’s machinations. But now, all of you are part of her collection. Between each of your lips, a rubber ball gag, snugly sealing off your voices. Around your limbs, thick, restrictive leather bands, binding you against a wooden display board mounted on the wall. You’ve been made out to be hunting trophies. Though in a sense, that’s what you all are. Because you *were* hunted, you *were* caught, and now you *are* helpless to do anything but squirm. “So, some ground rules. The bindings are magical, of course. So even our slippery red-headed friend here will have no chance of wiggling out. They’re… conceptual, rather than physical, the *idea* of leather straps. Struggle all you want, you will never make the tiniest bit of headway in getting free. She gives Krysta an affectionate squeeze on the rump before moving on. “Second, you’re in my home realm now, so you won’t ever age, won’t ever grow hungry or tired, and won’t ever come to any harm. Well, not unless you consider being my toy harmful.” Her fingers brush through Lumina’s feathers. “Third, you are mine now. In a metaphysical sense. The universe sees you as my property. Don’t try to wrap your pretty little heads around it, you wouldn’t be able to understand. Not in the way I do. Because you see, I exist at a higher level than the rest of you, I can see the story and how it ends. And it ends with all of you, here, in this place, as part of my collection. Forever.” She walks up and strokes your tail with one hand, and massages Vhaja’s thigh with the other. “Now you might be wondering - what about your lovely girlfriends? Why aren’t they here on display with you? Well, two reasons. One - this commission already cost a lot as it was. Such lovely art, by the way. But two - because I consider you four the real protagonists, and those other two as bonuses. Add-ons. An expansion pack, if you will. But that doesn’t mean I haven’t caught them, and it doesn’t mean they can’t spend eternity mounted up on a wall, just like you four.” A snap of her finger, and two more additions appear in the room.] |drink1)[(link:"You've heard of fox in a box, now try Jyumon in the room-on a wall! She and Vhaja lock eyes, exchanging helpless, defeated glances. They know enough about the magical world to know there’s no escaping when a fae this powerful has her hands on you. “And, of course, the lovely deer… though goodness, we should get new art of her. That old design really doesn’t do her cuteness justice, does it?”] |drink2)[(link:"Aren't we all glad she's here, and not in a galaxy far away?")[(show:?drink3)]] |drink3)[<img src="images/F38_RevissaFreezium_by_Dvega.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Dvega(click-replace: "Art by Dvega")[https://www.deviantart.com/dvega https://picarto.tv/Tek]] (set: $picF38 to true) Revissa is encased in freezium and mounted above a lit fireplace, a lock of shock etched onto her face. Sadly, you and she can not exchange despondent looks, because she is fully inert, trapped in stasis, unconscious (you hope). Perhaps she’s the lucky one. “So yes, there you go. All of you are here, all of you are mine, and none of you will ever escape. No rescue is coming, not here, not in my place of power. No salvation, no silver lining, no last-minute heroics. This is the end for all of you. I win, you lose. And all because a silly little wolfie thought she could beat me at my own game. She squeezes one of your breasts lovingly, then leans in close. “However, I suppose I can give you a little hint for the next time you take a guess. Even we fae need to play by rules - there needs to always be a *chance* that our victims can win. The magic doesn’t *work* otherwise. But it’s only ever a chance, and that chance doesn’t need to be fair. So here’s a little riddle for you. Well, not for *you*, but those lovely people watching at home. If you’re lucky, maybe they’ll figure it out, and have you make a different guess next time we play. So, you ready? You might want to write this down:”] |drink3)[(link:"Listen to my riddle")[(show:?drink4)]] |drink4)[**For you who wish to know my name, a riddle I shall share Throughout this game the letters hide, the question is just where I’ll tell you straight there’s four of them, one’s big and three are small To find them will be quite a feat, each one a treasure’s haul The first, you see, it hides in code, you’ll find it in a while Before we flip, my image gleans, you’ll have to check the file name Your price to me - not so high, add up all three numbers Right? Click it once and then you’ll see that’s where the letter slumbers. Now for the second, this is fun, we’ll return from whence we came You thought grim fates were absent here, but really you’re to blame Have no candy, leave it off, when you’re sailing out in space Find your way to failure then, to gain my letter’s grace For the third you’ll need to look real hard, examine all the options Make sure the chapter’s visible, to mix up this concoction The name you’ll want has MAX or MAY, depending on your preference It’s not capital, but that’s okay, give the hungry plant its deference The fourth of them was always there, even when you first began But it shrouds itself in shadow, so you’ll need to have a plan In high light it reveals itself, but you’ll have to search real low This version’s nice, but I still think there’s deeper we can go** (set: $faeriddle to true) “Got all that? I have more cuties to catch, more heroes to pluck from more timestreams to add to my gallery. So until next we meet… don’t go anywhere!” The echoes of her laughter linger in the room far after she vanishes, leaving you all alone with the rest of her collection. (if: $candy is false)[[[Begin your new lives->FD08AX]]] (if: $candy is true)[[[Begin your new lives->FD08AY]]] ] It would be nice to say life as a display piece was eventful, exciting, but that, of course, would be a lie. Mostly all you do is sit there as nothing but a trophy, a toy. You and your friends attracted the attention of an otherworldly being with unimaginable power, and now all of you are nothing but baubles for her collection. Though as the years passes on, it becomes clear that you, for whatever reason, are her favorite. Sure, every once in a while she’ll lovingly stroke Lumina’s wings, or trace a finger along the length of Vhaja’s long, pointed ear. Krysta gets a peck on the cheek, a squeeze on the rump as she passes by, treated with the same amount of interest as a painting hanging from the wall. Sometimes she might take a cloth and polish Revissa’s inert body, or spray some cleaning solution on the clear plastic casing keeping Jyumon sealed away, making sure there’s no errant smudges. But it’s you that gets to have ‘fun’. Every once in a while, the fae gets that lusty look in her eyes, and decides to make use of you as something more than a decoration. She’ll start with her fingers deftly slipped between your lower lips, churning away until you reach a point of helpless distraction. And while you’re dazed, she’ll pull down your display stand off the wall and set it on the floor, lowering herself on top of your face and grinding herself to completion. At no point do any of your bindings loosen even an iota. In a way, you feel guilty, because it’s the only thing you have to look forward to breaking the monotony of your existence, and it’s apparently an honor reserved only for you. When the woman is finished, she leaves her slick residue staining your body, putting you back on display so all your friends can see what your purpose is. Her attention is the one distraction from an otherwise bland eternity of helplessness, with you and your crew doomed to spend eternity in her collection. No rescue ever comes. No mercy is ever given. You’re just toys to her, and toys you shall remain. Forever. GAME OVER [[Start over->A0X]]It would be nice to say life as a display piece was eventful, exciting, but that, of course, would be a lie. Mostly all you do is sit there as nothing but a trophy, a toy. You and your friends attracted the attention of an otherworldly being with unimaginable power, and now all of you are nothing but baubles for her collection. Though as the years passes on, it becomes clear that you, for whatever reason, are her favorite. Sure, every once in a while she’ll lovingly stroke Lumina’s wings, or trace a finger along the length of Vhaja’s long, pointed ear. Krysta gets a peck on the cheek, a squeeze on the rump as she passes by, treated with the same amount of interest as a painting hanging from the wall. Sometimes she might take a cloth and polish Revissa’s inert body, or spray some cleaning solution on the clear plastic casing keeping Jyumon sealed away, making sure there’s no errant smudges. But it’s you that gets to have ‘fun’. Every once in a while, the fae gets that lusty look in her eyes, and decides to make use of you as something more than a decoration. She’ll start with her fingers deftly slipped between your lower lips, churning away until you reach a point of helpless distraction. And while you’re dazed, she’ll pull down your display stand off the wall and set it on the floor, lowering herself on top of your face and grinding herself to completion. At no point do any of your bindings loosen even an iota. In a way, you feel guilty, because it’s the only thing you have to look forward to breaking the monotony of your existence, and it’s apparently an honor reserved only for you. When the woman is finished, she leaves her slick residue staining your body, putting you back on display so all your friends can see what your purpose is. And she does seem to enjoy those encounters. But you start to notice that, as the ages flow by, every time she draws near you, she grows increasingly irate. Testy, irritable. You can’t for the life of you imagine why - it’s not like you have any agency at all to influence her mood. But one day she comes out and says it. What feels like a lifetime ago, you sucked down a Star Scout homing beacon, and ever since you’ve been captured it’s been sending out pulses into the void. Useless to attract help, but effective in creating an obnoxious ringing in her ear. Because the Scouts are formed around the tenets of love and happiness, even her fae magic can’t just undo the signal. So she just tries to live with it. But eventually, the benefit of keeping you outweighs the annoyance. All at once, you and your friends appear in a naked pile in the middle of a remote planet. No gear, no equipment, no idea how long you’ve been gone, or how you’ll make your way back to civilization. She doesn’t care - she just wants to put an end to the incessant ringing. Then she vanishes in her signature puff of smoke, leaving your party to their own devices. What follows is an exciting adventure in its own right, but it’s not the adventure we’re here to tell today. And, regardless, your actions have led to failing your original mission. Maybe next time you’ll think better about getting tangled up with a fae. GAME OVER [[Start over->A0X]] It’s impossible to keep track of the twists and turns within the caverns, so eventually you give up trying. (if: $treetalk is true)[Instead, you just wonder why it was that the ‘helpful’ tree wanted to lead you into a trap. Maybe your presence had disturbed it. Maybe you were too loud, too disrespectful of the forest. Or maybe it just thought it would be funny to doom you to a life of captivity at the hands of an, admittedly, super gorgeous spider-babe. You have to admit, there are decidedly worse ways to get kidnapped. And you should know, you’ve been kidnapped in practically every way imaginable.](else: )[Instead, you just wonder what these women are even doing here. They can’t possibly be natives to this planet – during your briefing it had been made clear there was no sapient life present. So then what? Smugglers? Pirates? Why this planet? Why now? And… what are they going to do with you, now that they’ve got you. The woman dragging you away provides no answers.] Once she finds a good spot, she plops you down on the ground with your back against the cavern wall, then anchors you in place with more webbing. You strain hard against the taut lines of silk, but don’t move an inch. You’re not going anywhere. “There we go,” she says brightly, poking your breast with a finger. “The perfect bait.” Bait? Your heart sinks as you realize what the purpose of all this is. She skitters over and sets down something on a rock right beneath you - your comm device. You can see that she’s left a communication channel open, something that any of your friends would easily be able to trace, probably thinking you opened it on purpose to let them know where to find you. “And now… we wait. And five more delicious morsels will walk right into the kitchen.” How could she know how many were on your crew for this mission? Did she go through the data on your communicator? (if: $treetalk is true)[Or… did the tree tell her that, too?](else: )[Did the other spider ladies do some recon to find out?] You have no way to know. All you can do is wait and see what she has in store for you. [[Watch the collection grow->FE01C]] It’s hard to tell time wrapped up in a dark cave, but you think it’s about a day before the next development. Your captor stays close to you the whole time, occasionally occupying herself by groping and fondling your helpless body. But eventually something seems to trigger her spider-senses, and she skitters off into the gloom to go hunting. And then, twenty minutes later, she returns with two wriggling bundles, one slung over each arm. (link:"See who she's got")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/F43_JyumonVhajaWebbed_by_Watergirl20.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Watergirl20(click-replace: "Art by Watergirl20")[https://www.deviantart.com/watergirl20]] (set: $picF43 to true) Vhaja and Jyumon kick and buck, mewling into their gags, but only the faintest of moans escape the confines of the silk. Just like you, you can tell all of their clothing has been peeled off beneath the webbing, the strands clinging firmly to the inviting contours of their bodies. As much as you enjoy a bit of kinky web bondage, that’s a personal fetish, and not something you would willingly invite others to participate in without their consent. Your friends had come to rescue you from a lifetime as the sexy spider’s plaything, and were captured themselves as a reward for their efforts. It makes you feel like an absolute heel as the arachnid woman cheerily binds them in place nearby, tripling the yield of her catch. Krysta is the next to show up. She creeps through the gloom, stumbling upon your bound-up bodies. And, thinking she’s about to play the hero, she pulls out her vibra-dagger, slinking toward you to cut your bonds - before a shadow descends from the cavernous ceiling and pins her to the ground. A minute later and she’s mummified in silk like the rest of you. Hearing her cry of surprise, Lumina glides out from the end of the cavern, cleric staff in hand, but she slams into a tangle of silk strewn across the pathway before even getting a single spell off. The spider woman takes her time gleefully peeling away her clothing, forcing you all to watch as she toys with her angelic body.] |drink1)[(link:"Watch")[(show:?drink2)]] |drink2)[<img src="images/F44_LuminaWebbed_by_Shizen1102.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Shizen1102(click-replace: "Art by Shizen1102")[https://www.deviantart.com/shizen1102 https://www.instagram.com/shizen1102/]] (set: $picF44 to true) Once she’s had her fill, she bundles Lumina up just like the rest of you, suspending her in the center of the cavern. She wriggles weakly - all of you do - but the bonds are effectively unbreakable when you’re all wrapped up so tightly. The most any of you can do is moan into the silk covering your lips, straining uselessly against the impossibly firm restraints. It’s clear this spider woman is no novice at her craft. She always makes sure to anchor all of you in place with an excess of tethers, keeping you from squirming around to find some sharp edge to potentially cut a hole in the white dresses she’s woven for you all. “Five down, one to go!” she says brightly, leaving Lumina swaying like a hammock as she goes off in search of her last target. You’d like to think Revissa put up a fight. That she got off a few spells, or maybe transformed into a bear and got a good claw slash right across the spider lady’s face. It’s a nice fantasy. Because it would mean that the six of you weren’t just helpless prey, that you were heroes who had gone on countless adventures across the galaxy, the kind of people they’d write stories about. That’s a much more comforting thought than the image of your wife being pounced on from the shadows, stripped, bound, gagged and dragged off in an instant. So, even when the spider lady comes into view, carrying her helplessly wriggling body, you imagine you just missed the epic confrontation happening right out of frame. But whatever the truth of their encounter was, it doesn’t change the reality of the situation you all find yourselves in now. Completely and utterly defeated, wrapped up so tightly you can’t possibly hope to escape. “There we are cuties, all of you snug as bugs. It was nice of you all to come visit!” She gets a chorus of muffled grunts from her collection of captives, but she ignores them as she lines you all up and glues you to the walls of the cave.] |drink2)[(link:"Struggle together")[(show:?drink3)]] |drink3)[<img src="images/F45_TotalPartyWeb_by_Grafhou.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Grafhou(click-replace: "Art by Grafhou")[https://www.deviantart.com/grafhou https://twitter.com/Grafhou2]] (set: $picF45 to true) “And don’t worry, we’ll take wonderful care of the lot of you. After all, this is a remote planet, so we’ll need some entertainment to keep up morale…” The six of you exchange glances, hoping someone’s expression holds some degree of confidence, a solution to the problem you’ve found yourselves in. But there’s no such luck. Each of you are equally helpless, and each of you is equally doomed to submit to the spider-lady’s advances. With the whole crew caught, there’s no prospect for rescue in sight, making clear that the arrangement she’s chosen for you is going to be a long-term one. (if: $candy is false)[[[Begin your new lives->FE01X]]] (if: $candy is true)[[[Begin your new lives->FE01Y]]] ] As the years go by, you manage to glean some information about who these arachnid women are. Most people in the galaxy have heard of the Spider Queens, the ruthless warlords who travel the stars in their massive dreadnaughts, scooping up all the women in unprotected colonies to add them to their hordes of wiggling slaves. Pure-blooded queens are towering warriors, with the lower body of bulbous spiders and the upper torso of a beautiful woman. Well, the ladies who have caught you all call themselves Spider Princesses - the half-breed offspring of queens. Generally without political power in the hierarchy of the queens, they’ve been gathered together on this planet by the woman who captured all of you, a charismatic leader named Tula. She wants to unite the scattered princesses and form their own coalition, using the natural resources of this planet as an economic weapon to cement her power. The key to her plan is Ghost Matter, the material everything on the planet is made of. When spider women consume fruits made of the stuff, their silk inherits its properties, making their webs both much stronger and much better at putting the women wrapped in them in permanent stasis. But of course, to entice people to her cause, she has to offer them benefits – which come in the form of year-round, all-day access to as many webbed-up sex toys as they want. You and your crew are just the first batch. And so, as Tula’s power grows, more and more cocooned captives are brought in to line the walls of the caverns, helpless slaves who serve no purpose other than to slake the endless sexual hunger of their owners. The six of you, strung up in a major thoroughfare of the cliffside caverns, are in high demand as stress relievers. Rare is the day you get even an hour of alone time when you’re not being played with by an endless parade of beautifully possessive half-breed monarchs. Needless to say, none of you are ever freed. You exist now as nothing more than public-use stimulation fixtures, an important part of the infrastructure of a growing galactic power. GAME OVER [[Start over->A0X]]As the years go by, you manage to glean some information about who these arachnid women are. Most people in the galaxy have heard of the Spider Queens, the ruthless warlords who travel the stars in their massive dreadnaughts, scooping up all the women in unprotected colonies to add them to their hordes of wiggling slaves. Pure-blooded queens are towering warriors, with the lower body of bulbous spiders and the upper torso of a beautiful woman. While, the ladies who have caught you all call themselves Spider Princesses - the half-breed offspring of queens. Generally without political power in the hierarchy of the queens, they’ve been gathered together on this planet by the woman who captured all of you, a charismatic leader named Tula. She wants to unite the scattered princesses and form their own coalition, using the natural resources of this planet as an economic weapon to cement her power. The key to her plan is Ghost Matter, the material everything on the planet is made of. When spider women consume fruits made of the stuff, their silk inherits its properties, making their webs both much stronger and much better at putting the women wrapped in them in permanent stasis. But of course, to entice people to her cause, she has to offer them benefits – which come in the form of year-round, all-day access to as many webbed-up sex toys as they want. You and your crew are just the first batch. It is only by pure chance that you don’t spend the rest of your lives cocooned in the caves. A good thirty years after your capture, a Star Scout squadron here for entirely unrelated reasons happens to pick up your distress beacon from the candy you ate at the start of the mission. By now, the planet is a bustling trade hub with its own government, so they can’t just break you free in a commando raid. Instead, they negotiate for your release with diplomacy, and secure a promise that Scout members and their crews will spend no more than a hundred years in captivity. Which means you’ve all got another seventy years to go, but hey, it’s better than nothing. At the very least, it leaves you plenty of time to think on what you could have done differently to not end up where you are now. (if: $picF40 is true)[ <img src="images/F40_TrophyMelfy_by_Devga.png" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Dvega(click-replace: "Art by Dvega")[https://www.deviantart.com/dvega https://picarto.tv/Tek]] ] (else: )[<img src="images/A01_Lock.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">] Revissa Flips Out... (if: $picF129 is true)[ <img src="images/F129_RevissaCoin1_by_Takachiro.png" style="max-width: 100%;"> ] (else: )[<img src="images/A01_Lock.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">] ...And Gets a Real Bum Rap (if: $picF130 is true)[ <img src="images/F130_RevissaCoin2_by_Takachiro.png" style="max-width: 100%;"> ] (else: )[<img src="images/A01_Lock.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">] But That's Just My Two Cents (if: $picF131 is true)[ <img src="images/F131_TwoCoins_by_Takachiro.png" style="max-width: 100%;"> ] (else: )[<img src="images/A01_Lock.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">] (if: $picF134 is true or $picF135 is true)[What? Are you expecting something else here? Perhaps some monuments to my ignoble defeat? Ugh, fine, I suppose it's true. I don't win in *every* reality... just most of them. So if you insist, you can see some of my less remarkable moments. (link:"How Embarassing")[(show:?reveal1)] |reveal1)[(if: $picF134 is true)[I Do Tend to Get Wrapped Up in My Work <img src="images/F134_FaeWebbed1_by_Dvega.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Dvega(click-replace: "Art by Dvega")[https://www.deviantart.com/dvega https://picarto.tv/Tek]] ] (else: )[<img src="images/A01_Lock.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">] (if: $picF135 is true)[I'd Have Loved to Have Been Able to Bust My Way Out of This One <img src="images/F135_FaeWebbed2_by_Faust1173.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Faust1173(click-replace: "Art by Faust1173")[https://www.furaffinity.net/user/faust1173/]] ] (else: )[<img src="images/A01_Lock.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">] (if: $picF140 is true)[Honestly This if Kind of Comfy <img src="images/F140_FaeBondageSealed_by_Waltodile.png" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Waltodile(click-replace: "Art by Waltodile")[https://www.deviantart.com/waltodile https://www.patreon.com/WaltoArt]] ] (else: )[<img src="images/A01_Lock.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">] (if: $picF141 is true)[Overall Not the Worst Way To Lose <img src="images/F141_FaeAndRoseelaBound_by_Waltodile.png" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Waltodile(click-replace: "Art by Waltodile")[https://www.deviantart.com/waltodile https://www.patreon.com/WaltoArt]] ] (else: )[<img src="images/A01_Lock.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">] ] ] [[Back to Art Gallery->AI00]] [[Back to Main Menu->A00]] [[Back to Forest Art->AIF]] ]Of course, you can’t go on a mission naked. Or at least, you can’t go on *this* mission naked. There’s been more than one occurrence where you and Revissa had to accomplish something entirely in the buff, but that usually only happened after you were kidnapped and needed to fight your way out of custody. Revissa gets dressed first. Her color scheme is a mixture of green, white and gold, a simple cloth shirt that shows off her cute tummy, a very low-cut skirt that would leave some sensitive areas exposed if not for the leaf adornment near the hips, some functional leg-wraps made of material harvested from plants, and a long scarf tied around the neck. The ensemble is completed with some beautifully lacquered wooden jewelry polished to a golden sheen, including a moth emblem meant to show her devotion to the ancient forest guardian Un-Rama, a powerful fae spirit that protects her people. Her long wooden staff bears the same symbol on its tip, making it the perfect conduit for her nature magic. (link:"Check her out")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/P33_RevissaClothed_by_MuleExpress.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by MuleExpress(click-replace: "Art by MuleExpress")[https://twitter.com/alfiardyrulli]] (set: $picP33 to true) You take your time appreciating her before you bother getting your own outfit on. For years you used to prefer purely functional clothing, but a long time ago on a mission you had gone in disguise under the made-up persona of the Dread Captain Wolfe, notorious space pirate, and to be honest you had really dug the aesthetic. And so despite not actually having ever resorted to anything akin to piracy, you still like to sport the look, if for no other reason than as a personal ego boost.] |drink1)[(link:"Show off your bod")[(show:?drink2)]] |drink2)[<img src="images/P34_MelfyClothed_by_NaughtyAzima.png" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by NaughtyAzima(click-replace: "Art by NaughtyAzima")[https://www.deviantart.com/naughtyazima https://twitter.com/NaughtyAzima]] (set: $picP34 to true) The outfit consists of some form-fitting pants that really accentuate your shapely bum, complete with a slit at the back for your poofy tail to fit through, and an equally clingy top that highlights both your chest size and your toned and muscular abdomen. Belt buckles keep your tight leather boots firmly secured, while also providing a place to hang an equipment pouch and a blaster pistol on your hips. A dashingly heroic cape hangs from your shoulders, but it also serves to conceal the heavy sword you also keep fastened there in a sheath along your back. To be perfectly honest, you look damn good. You’ve still got it! Revissa rolls her eyes as you appreciate yourself in the mirror for a bit too long, before she finally grabs you by the arm and leads you out into the hallway so you can meet up with the rest of the crew. [[Head to the bridge->P04]] ] You decide that it would be useful to investigate the potential of settlers or explorers here in the forest. Both because it would give Revissa someone to be angry at other than you for a change, but also because whoever’s here might have some useful information that could help you on your journey. Veering off from the river, you follow an easily visible trail into the trees, walking for only about five minutes until the path opens up into a large clearing. Here you find a half-dozen prefabricated living structures arranged in a semi-circle around a medium-sized cargo ship, maybe twice as big as your Lucky Break. The ship is parked with its landing struts out, and you get the sense that it’s been there for at least a week or so, based on little details like how the loading ramp is arranged. Off to one side you spy more of that resin that had been pooled up from the tree fitted with a faucet, though now it’s been hardened into huge chunks of opaque amber about as tall as a person, maybe six to ten of them all scattered around a massive flower. Near the tree line you see some kind of equipment set up, probably meant for harvesting and packaging resources being gathered from the forest, since there are also a good deal of shipping crates piled up next to it. Altogether, it does look very much like a smuggler’s camp. And you can guess at the culprits based on the model of the cargo ship - a Knottie design. From your briefing you know that the Knotties had established a camp near the ruins, but it looks like their operations have recently expanded towards the forest. (if: $sawbunny is true)[Thinking back on it, you *had* seen some Knottie women entrapped by the psychic bunny in the central part of the forest, so it stands to reason this outpost is where they originated from.] That said, you don’t see any of them currently milling about. Maybe they’re on the ship or in one of the buildings, or perhaps just out working in the woods. “I can’t believe they would treat this beautiful forest as nothing more than a source of raw materials!” Revissa says with an honestly kind of adorable pout. In your head, you take note that Revissa seemed entirely unconcerned with them gathering resources when it was near the ruins - she only cares about it when trees and plants and forests are involved. But you smartly bite your tongue, lest that pout be directed towards you, instead. “Well… I guess we should have expected it,” you say diplomatically. “There’s lots of stuff you can find in a forest to turn into bondage gear. Vines, plant fibers, spider silk… even animal leather. It was bound to happen sooner or later.” “We need to drive them out!” Revissa firmly declares. It takes you a few minutes to convince her that even if you *did* drive them out, it’s not like you’re planning on staying permanently on the planet to keep them away from the trees. Better to just take note of it, and maybe bring it up with Krysta later as a point of discussion during her negotiations at their main camp. Either way, now that you’re here, you may as well take a look around. The scent of pollen is thick in the air here, giving you a slight headache as you start to explore. (set: $pollenlust to 0)(set: $forestoutpost to true)(set: $FCStart to true) [[Investigate the cargo ship->FC02A]] [[Investigate the living quarters->FC02B]] [[Investigate the hunks of resin and giant flower->FC02C]] [[Investigate the harvesting equipment->FC02D]] The tapping of the tree certainly poses an interesting mystery. And you sympathize with Revissa’s anger at the situation. But at the end of the day, you’re not here to solve all this planet’s problems, or to stick your nose into places it doesn’t belong. What you need is to place these data collection devices and fulfill your mission. Besides, once all the devices are in place, maybe the information gathered can help answer all these other questions as well. Revissa is not entirely happy with your choice, but she goes along with it anyway. But as you continue along the side of the river, she is constantly reaching out with her druidic senses, trying to connect with the various trees and plants around you. It slows you down, but you know better than to interrupt her when she’s concentrating so strongly. However, as you pass by a particularly thick cluster of tangled roots and vines, she stops completely. “Are you okay?” you ask, gently walking up and laying a hand on her shoulder. She shakes her head. “No, I… I feel an intense presence in the forest. It’s… alive. But more than alive. There’s a consciousness to it… and it is calling out to me…” You raise an eyebrow. Mysterious consciousnesses in the forest are not exactly the most reassuring thing to encounter on a ghost planet, and you tell her as much. “I know…” she says distantly. “But… I feel a deep… yearning from it, I suppose. A loneliness. I think… I should go to it. See what it wants. I’m a druid, I owe it that much.” She leaves unsaid her annoyance that you did not let her follow up on her previous impulse. And this time, she doesn’t wait for you to tell her otherwise. She turns away from the side of the river and walks forcefully into the thick tangle of plants to the side, not even looking back. You stand there for a moment, flabbergasted, at a loss for what to do next. [[Let her go->FC03A]] [[Stop her->FC03B]] Your desires are impossible to resist! Just looking at Revissa fills you with an indescribable warmth, one which you are compelled to satisfy in the only way you know how. Almost without realizing it, you pounce, pushing your wife to the ground and pawing at her clothing, tearing fabric and sending boots flying every which way. At first, she tries to keep her composure, push you away. But after the first love bite on her exposed shoulder, she mewls with delight and closes her eyes, leaning in against you. “That pollen… from before…” she mutters between gasps. “It must have… been some sort of… slow-acting aphrodisiac…” Her explanation falls on deaf ears. Because the only sound you are searching for right now are passionate moans and delighted squeals. And so you get to work on eliciting those beautiful noises, subjecting Revissa to all of your most effective love-making techniques. She melts in your arms, falling to her knees as your hands satisfy every inch of her yearning skin. And at one point, her pleasure is so great that she screams in ecstasy, unintentionally channeling some of her nature magic to cause the ground to rumble and the trees around you to spread their roots even more deeply. In the long run, that will make the plants in the area stronger and healthier, more resistant to the weather. But in the short term, it has a different effect. Namely, causing the nearby tree with the faucet valve on it to erupt with life, causing a spray of glistening amber to burst out from the spigot right above the two of you. Perhaps it would have been a good idea to spend some time investigating the properties of the honey-sweet sap, because if you had, you’d have found it remains a liquid for only a few seconds after being exposed to the air, before quickly hardening into a thick, impenetrable resin. At most, plants just react. Bending towards a patch of sunlight, dropping their leaves when the weather gets cold, spreading roots deeper and deeper into the soil in search of nutrients. Of course, as part of a plant, you are already helping fulfill one of those tasks. Because as it turns out, the body of an intelligent being is capable of providing many intangible benefits to a thriving floral ecosystem. It could be described as a symbiotic relationship. The plant matter encases your body, the nectar it provides regulates all your essential biological systems, keeps you functioning in all the ways that matter to it, even if your mind has been essentially dulled into sleepy compliance. In exchange, you provide a highly potent spiritual energy to your host, a form of nutrient that it couldn’t find anywhere else. Your very soul nourishes the forest around you, allows the plants to spread ever further, become even more resilient to external threats. You don’t age a day in your new, chlorophyll filled prisons, don’t grow sick or hungry or cold. To you, every day is the same, every moment an opportunity to provide more of yourself to your host. No one ever comes to find you. You have no way of knowing, or caring, what became of the rest of your crew. Maybe they succumbed to some other peril on the planet, or maybe they spent weeks trying to find you before being forced to leave. It doesn’t matter. Nothing does.
