((passage:)'s tags contains "menu"))[------------------------------------------------------------------------] (if: not ((passage:)'s tags contains "menu"))[[[Go to Main Menu->A00]]] (if: not ((passage:)'s tags contains "menu"))[(if: $debug is true)[[[Debug Menu->A05]]]]**Display Chapter Codes** *Explanation:* If this option is turned on, a small string of text will appear at the top every page. This is the internal naming system used to keep track of chapters. This can be useful if you want to report a bug or ask a question about a specific section. (link: "Yes")[ (set: $chapter to true) ] (link: "No")[ (set: $fchapter to false) ] **Star Scout Candy** *Explanation:* Early in the game, players have the option to swallow a Star Scout candy. This is a trigger that determines the exact ending you get when you Game Over. If Yes, endings are less severe, and the heroines are eventually rescued (though it may take a long time). If No, endings are more grim and permanent. (link: "Yes")[ (set: $candy to true) ] (link: "No")[ (set: $candy to false) ] [[Back to main menu->A00]]If there was any doubts whether the chamber here was functional, the woman already mounted on the wall here dispels them. (link:"Check her out")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/F64_NuzCarbonite_by_Dvega.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Dvega(click-replace: "Art by Dvega")[https://www.deviantart.com/dvega https://picarto.tv/Tek]] (set: $picF64 to true) You look between the metal-encased figure mounted on the wall, and the heavy crate holding the vacuum-sealed knottie, and decide that the former is probably safer than the latter. After all, freezium slabs always come with a built-in thawing mechanism. And so, you drag Ros’eela’s crate over towards the freezing device, taking a moment to familiarize yourself with the controls. The device takes the form of a six-foot tall cylindrical chamber, equipped with canisters of sublimated metal gas to do the freezing, and colonies of nanomachines to assemble the display frame used to contain the subject. A hatch swivels open in the front, revealing the cramped interior in which a rectangular structure reminiscent of a doorway rests in the middle. Restraints and shackles line the sides, a contrivance meant to ensure the positioning of an unwilling volunteer for the freezing process. Considering how wiggly the latex-encased knottie is, you figure you’ll probably need to use them. Though you’re by no means a tech wiz, you’re still better at this sort of stuff than Revissa, so you pilot the controls while your wife sets about prying open the crate and getting Ros’eela into position. When the case creaks open, you find the pink-skinned girl just as utterly helpless as before, writhing powerlessly beneath the grip of the goopy black slime. Revissa quickly uses her magic to conjure some vines to curl around the slimy mass and yank it and its captive host into the freezium chamber, swiftly locking her in place within the frame. “Now!” she yells, leaping away from the opening. You nod and press the button to begin to process. The hatch to the chamber slides shut, and you hear the whooshing of air as sublimated metal is sprayed over the knottie and the slime. After a moment, a pleasant ding indicates the process is done, and you press the button to open up the chamber. What you see inside is a pleasant surprise.] |drink1)[(link:"Appreciate your handiwork")[(show:?drink2)]] |drink2)[<img src="images/F65_RoseelaCarbonite_by_Dvega.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Dvega(click-replace: "Art by Dvega")[https://www.deviantart.com/dvega https://picarto.tv/Tek]] (set: $picF65 to true)(set: $roslatex to false)(set: $rosfreeze to true) Ros’eela is frozen solid, naked body nicely mounted on a rectangular frame, completely embedded into the thick mass of mottled metal. That was to be expected. But more important than that is how she is posed. Her hands are held out in front of her in the very traditional style of freezium victims, indicating that she must have been freed from the slime in order to move her arms to get into that position. Which means that the goop must have been destroyed by the icy blast! Satisfied with your ingenuity, you affix a hover-pad to Ros’eela’s body to and help affix her to the wall. But as you secure here there, a thought occurs to you. Unfortunately, it will not be safe to thaw her out for the next few hours at least… so perhaps it would be better to command the droids here to carry her back to the landing site to wait until you return to claim her. Honestly, it’s probably for the best that she says frozen for the time being. If you were to thaw her out, she would probably report what happened to the main encampment, which would take away a potential trump card that could be used in future negotiations. Better to keep her on ice, at least until you’re done with what you need to do on the planet. Surely she’d understand; freezium is a part of Knottie culture after all, though to a lesser degree than bondage. Besides… she’d look rather fetching on the wall of your quarters… [[Keep her as a trophy. Just for a little while, honest!->FC02ND]] ] She might be easy on the eyes, but that’s no reason to go easy on her in battle. You’re not exactly sure what species this woman is, but it’s clear from those insectile legs of hers that she is quite dangerous. With a practiced motion, you unsheathe your sword from its holster on your back, a heavy weapon that has served you well throughout the years. One might think that in the age of warp drives and proton cannons that melee combat has gone out of style, but your natural strength, speed, and agility as a kemomi oftentimes makes it easy for you to close the distance between yourself and your foes before they get the chance to make use of any of that fancy technology against you. When you chose to fight, that was what you were planning to do - to charge at the woman and keep her occupied with close quarters aggression. Even if she proved to be stronger than you, the distraction alone would give Revissa enough time to use her nature magic to turn the tides in your favor. It was, after all, two against one. Unfortunately, you didn’t plan on your opponent being quite so quick on the draw. As soon as you make your intention to engage her known, one of her back legs twitches, then points in your direction, unleashing a long, thin, expertly aimed line of finely woven spider silk. The tether shoots through the air, snagging your sword arm by the wrist before you can even get a handle on its hilt. You grunt in confusion, teetering off balance from the sudden pressure, which the woman capitalizes on with another shot of webbing. This one catches you by the ankles, wrapping your legs together and sending you careening towards the ground. As you impact the floor, a third shot of silk strikes your back, adhering to your sword and yanking it away from your body. The blade flies through the air and lands with a clatter at the foot of a nearby tree, completely out of reach for you. But you’re not down for the count yet! You quickly rally, pulling yourself to your feet, ankles bound though they may be, just as Revissa reaches the end of a familiar incantation. The ground beneath the spider-woman rumbles, and verdant green shoots begin curling around her feet. A quick and easy entanglement spell, conjuring strong leafy vines to wrap around and restrain her. It would have been the perfect way to regain the advantage. But your opponent is too clever, too quick to react. Another glob of webbing shoots forth from the tip of her spindly leg, slamming into Revissa’s face before she can utter the final syllable of her magical attack. Her eyes widen in confusion as her voice is cut silent by the gloopy silk, preventing the spell’s completion and banishing the summoned restraints. The spider-woman follows up with yet more silken tethers, using them to snag Revissa’s staff and throw it into the brush, then catch her wrists and bind them tightly together. And suddenly, it seems like you don’t have the advantage any more at all. You silently curse the fact that you left that runic blade Vhaja gave you buried deep in your pack instead of on your belt somewhere - it would have been a huge help right now in cutting yourself free. But there’s no time to mourn your poor decisions now - if you don’t act quickly she’ll have the two of you fully incapacitated. [[Rush her and try to bodyslam her->FE02B]] [[Try and dive for your sword->FE02C]] [[Hurry to Revissa’s side and try to get her free->FE02D]] (if: $frozenslime is true)[[[Throw the frozen slime at her->FE02E]]] It’s a tale as old as time. Muscular wolf gal walks into a forest, only for a gorgeous spider-babe to strip her naked and wrap her up, spiriting her away to her boudoir to be her helplessly bound plaything for the rest of her life. Well… okay, maybe not a tale as old as time, but definitely one you’ve played out in your dreams and fantasies quite a lot. But despite the frequency of those yearnings, it’s not like the encounter *has* to play out that way. Surely you and this enticing arachnid can find some common ground? “We come in peace!” you announce, trying to flash the gorgeous spider your most disarming smile. “So there’s no need for any aggression or–” But you get cut off as a string of webbing zips out from one of the women’s spindly back legs, shooting quickly over your shoulder and splattering against something behind you. Or rather, some*one*. “Is that so?” says the spider-woman, giving her silken tether a tug. The motion produces a squeak of surprise from behind you from Revissa, who suddenly gets yanked across the forest floor and into the woman’s waiting arms. “Then why was this lovely little deer about to cast a spell, hmm?” You feel your arm start to twitch. Every instinct is telling you to draw your sword and charge at this woman. But your conscious mind tells you not to. Look how quickly she caught Revissa - what would stop her from doing the same to you? So you watch anxiously as the spider-woman’s back legs swiftly shear off your wife’s clothing, replacing it with long lines of white silk that cling tightly to her naked skin. The entire process takes less than fifteen seconds. When she’s done bundling her up, the spider-woman drops Revissa to the ground and sits down on her, pinning her to the forest floor with the curves of her shapely posterior. Well… there’s no turning back now. You’re committed to talking this out. “I’m… sorry about that,” you say, keeping your arms raised. With achingly slow movements, you reach for the strap holding your sword to your back and unfasten it, letting the weapon drop to the ground. You do the same with your belt and blaster pistol, then kick them both away. “But I’m serious. We’re not here to fight or muscle in on your territory. This is a research mission to gather data about the planet and nothing more.” The spider-woman grins. “Oh, you misunderstand me. I’m not under any illusion that either of you are a threat to me.” Another leg twitches, and silk tethers shoot out in tandem, snagging each of your wrists. With a tug she forces your arms over your head, then drags you down to the ground and over to where she is standing. “Whether you have a sword or a blaster or nothing at all doesn’t make any difference, because you were entirely at my mercy the moment I laid eyes on you.” Holy crap… that domineering confidence. The utter lack of effort it took for her to catch you. It’s all you can do not to moan in pleasure right here. But you keep your wits about you as she finishes reeling you in. “No, wait – I know. We’re not a threat! But… we can be useful to you!” You glance around at the fruit orchard you’re standing in, and notice something for the first time. There seems to be signs of deliberate cultivation here. Trees lined up in neat rows, branches pruned, the faint smell of pesticide in the air. Could it be this lady has some kind of operation going here where she harvests these fruits? “To your, uh, business here. You’re growing these fruits, right? Well, there’s something we know that you’d want to know too, but I won’t tell you if you just kidnap us straight off the — mmmphh!” She cuts you off with a glob of webbing right between the lips. “Oh, my silly little wolf. You’re again under a misconception. Calling this ‘kidnapping’ would suggest that you weren’t already mine. But you *are* mine. Again, you were my property the moment I laid eyes on you. And you can’t kidnap what already belongs to you.” Your heart beats faster, fear tensing up your muscles. But there’s nothing you can do about that now. You can only sit there as her spider-legs twitch and use their sharp points to slice off every scrap of clothing on your body. And then you feel yourself spin, round and round, as her warm, wet silk glues itself over your skin, quickly cooling and hardening into a taut cocoon that covers nearly every inch of your toned and powerful, yet now utterly helpless figure. When she’s done she tosses you over a shoulder like you were nothing more than a sack of potatoes, then does the same to your equally incapacitated wife. “Now then, let’s take you back to your new home.” There’s nothing you can do but go along for the ride. (set: $diplotula to true) [[Get carried away->FE03A]] You are by no means a coward. For example, you are not afraid of the prospect of being easily overpowered by this sexy spider lady, stripped naked, cocooned in silk, and carried away to her lair to be her sex slave for the rest of your life. Nope, not scared at all… more like the opposite. But it is that very lack of fear which convinces you that running away is the best option here. After all, your arousal at the thought of being slathered in this gorgeous lady’s silk is probably going to be a detriment in the upcoming encounter. How could you perform your best when the prospect of failure is so incredibly erotic? And so, even as Revissa tenses for battle, you do the opposite, catching her gaze and then nodding back towards the way you came. “We already planted the device,” you whisper. “So there’s no need to stay here and get ourselves captured… captured by this super gorgeous and domineering spider-babe who would probably treat us real nice in her silken sex dungeon.” Revissa makes an expression halfway between amusement and revulsion. “Sometimes, I wonder why I’m in love with you,” she jokes quietly. “Wit, confidence, compassion, and a rockin’ bod,” you answer immediately. She kicks you in the shin, but then joins you in investigating the best direction for a tactical retreat. The spider woman notices your reticence. “What’s wrong,” she purrs, with a sultry voice that makes your loins ache. “Do my new slaves not want to play?” Oof. She’s so domineering that she’s *already* assuming she’s got you both as slaves. It pains you to flee from a woman who would surely show you such a good time, but alas, you have a mission to attend to. Working in tandem, you and Revissa silently agree to a plan of action. You reach for your blaster, prompting the hottie to spray silk towards where you are standing - but Revissa is already prepared for that, slamming the butt of her staff against the ground to cause the earth to shake, creating a wall of tightly packed soil in front of you. The webbing slams harmlessly against it, giving the two of you the opportunity to plan your next move. “I’ll transform into something to carry us out of here,” Revissa says. “Which direction should we head in?” You think about the three viable paths that led from the forest entrance to here. Which one would make for the best escape route? [[Flee along the low path by the riverside->FE06A]] [[Run down the middle path through forest’s center->FE06B]] [[Fly past the high road, utilizing the cliffs and crags->FE06C]] You might have lost your weapon, but you’re still a proud and powerful kemomi warrior. A sharp blade is nothing compared to the raw power of your toned muscles! You let out a bone-chilling snarl, then heave with all your might, unfurling enough of the webbing around your ankles to give you a bit more mobility. And that’s all you need to send yourself hurtling towards her at top speed, lowering your shoulder as you move to tackle her to the ground. The spider-woman just lets out a raspy chuckle. Her back legs twitch, and lines of silk shoot out, catching onto nearby tree branches to allow her to hoist herself up and over your ill-thought charge. Once you sail past, she nimbly leaps onto your back, using her momentum to topple you over onto the ground once more - though this time with the addition of her body weight expertly applied to pin you down beneath her. “How cute,” she says with a playful smile, the smaller of her back legs extending themselves towards you. Before you can make an effort to try and throw her off, the sharp edges of the appendages get to work, moving across your figure to swiftly shear off every scrap of clothing from your body. Boots, pants, cape, shirt, even undergarments, they offer no resistance, falling away to expose the full extent of your naked body to her eager eyes. You can’t help but let out an instinctive whimper as she looks you over. Lupine instincts can propel you into a fight, but they just as quickly will tell you that you should be scampering away with your tail between your legs when things go south. Unfortunately, it doesn’t look like this lady has any intention of letting that happen. You make a token effort to buck her off of you, but she has the better leverage, and clearly knows how to use it. All it takes is her grabbing your shoulders with her humanoid hands to keep you pinned beneath her, giving her the time she needs to unfold her long back legs and prime them to start producing more silk. Despite the warmth of the gloppy webbing, a shiver runs down your spine as it starts to adhere to your naked skin. The fresh silk takes only a moment to fully harden, forming itself into a shear, slightly elastic barrier between your body and the air. She starts with your legs, fully wrapping them together, cutting off your ability to kick her away as her spindly appendages creep higher. Your arms come next, roughly pulled above your head then firmly bound in place. And then, once your main methods of resistance are robbed from you, she picks you up into the air, holding you in a firm embrace as her long legs begin spinning you round and round. You feel woozy as the world whirls past you, sending you into a dizzying confusion as her silk clings to the rest of your unprotected body. Within the space of a few seconds, she’s gotten you totally wrapped up - cocooned from the feet all the way to the neck. One final glob of webbing glues your lips shut, followed by another long tether around your face to make sure you don’t just spit it out. And then, just like that, you’re beaten. She gives your shoulder a triumphant squeeze as she drops you to the ground, turning her attention to the other prey in her sights. [[Watch Revissa get caught->FE02BA]] Without your sword, you’re basically a sitting duck. There’s no chance of winning if you don’t get it back. So the only thing you can do is plunge forward, reckless though it may be, making a dive towards the tree where your weapon was thrown. You land with a thud beside it, causing a sharp pain to ripple through your shoulder as your left side impacts the ground. But this is no time to let yourself be distracted. As you stand back up, you maneuver the blade into your hands, finally feeling the comforting touch of reinforced metal against your fingers. For… about three seconds. Before another glob of webbing shoots from above, snagging the sword from your grip once more. You look up to find the spider-woman lounging lazily in the branches over your head, making a tut-tut motion with her finger as she tosses the weapon away yet again. “Don’t you know that you could hurt yourself playing with dangerous toys like this?” You snarl ferociously at her sneering face. “The idea was to hurt *you* with it,” you yell. That elicits a dismissive chuckle. “Oh, don’t worry. I’m not in any danger at all right now.” And then she pounces. Using some lines of silk almost like a slingshot, she propels herself downwards, crashing into your body and slamming you back against the floor - though this time with the addition of her body weight expertly applied to pin you down beneath her. “How cute,” she says with a playful smile, the smaller of her back legs extending themselves towards you. Before you can make an effort to try and throw her off, the sharp edges of the appendages get to work, moving across your figure to swiftly shear off every scrap of clothing from your body. Boots, pants, cape, shirt, even undergarments, they offer no resistance, falling away to expose the full extent of your naked body to her eager eyes. You can’t help but let out an instinctive whimper as she looks you over. Lupine instincts can propel you into a fight, but they just as quickly will tell you that you should be scampering away with your tail between your legs when things go south. Unfortunately, it doesn’t look like this lady has any intention of letting that happen. You make a token effort to buck her off of you, but she has the better leverage, and clearly knows how to use it. All it takes is her grabbing your shoulders with her humanoid hands to keep you pinned beneath her, giving her all the time she needs to unfold her long back legs and prime them to start producing more silk. Despite the warmth of the gloppy webbing, a shiver runs down your spine as it starts to adhere to your naked skin. The fresh silk takes only a moment to fully harden, forming itself into a shear, slightly elastic barrier between your body and the air. She starts with your legs, fully wrapping them together, cutting off your ability to kick her away as her spindly appendages creep higher. Your arms come next, roughly pulled above your head then firmly bound in place. And then, once your main methods of resistance are robbed from you, she picks you up into the air, holding you in a firm embrace as her long legs begin spinning you round and round. You feel woozy as the world whirls past you, sending you into a dizzying confusion as her silk clings to the rest of your unprotected body. Within the space of a few seconds, she’s gotten you totally wrapped up - cocooned from the feet all the way to the neck. One final glob of webbing glues your lips shut, followed by another long tether around your face to make sure you don’t just spit it out. And then, just like that, you’re beaten. She gives your shoulder a triumphant squeeze as she drops you to the ground, turning her attention to the other prey in her sights. [[Watch Revissa get caught->FE02BA]] You know you’re a good fighter. You know you’re strong. You know you handle yourself well under pressure. But you also know none of that matters when it comes to fighting sexy spider ladies. No matter how you slice it, if you try and face a silk-spinning hottie in combat, you’re going to lose, and you’re going to get wrapped up. It is, quite simply, just the way of things. Perhaps it comes down to fate, or, perhaps, it comes down to the fact that this is your fetish and on a deep level you *want* it to happen. Or perhaps you’re not actually as good a fighter as you think you are. Whatever the reason, you know that if you want to escape the situation you’ve found yourself in, it’s not going to be you that does it. Revissa is your only hope. Which means your only real option is to holster your pride and accept the fact someone else gets to be the hero this time. So with that resolution in your mind, you turn and rush towards your restrained lover. If you could just get her hands and lips free, she could surely come up with a spell that will overpower the fiendishly sexy arachnid. It’s a good plan. A noble one. Almost certainly your best chance, given the circumstances. But the one thing it isn’t is a *successful* plan. Because no sooner do you start closing the distance towards your wife before you feel yet more webbing slink around your ankles, firmly glomming your legs together. Your balance thus gives out and you fall forward, landing face-first onto Revissa’s welcomingly soft chest. A pained grunt escapes her gagged lips as she sees her wife’s desperate attempt to save her get summarily cut short, and a fearful gleam forms in her eyes as the spidery culprit behind the snaring skitters over to loom above the two of you on the ground. “Oh my! How dashing! Were you trying to save her?” the woman says with mock sweetness. “So cute. I was almost tempted to let you do it, just so I could catch her again.” Things are looking bad and tension is running high. Your fight or flight instinct kicks in, and since flight is no longer on the table, your gut picks the only other option before your brain even has time to register what it’s doing. “Don’t you lay a hand on her!” you snarl, twisting your body so that you can hop up into a standing position even with your legs bound together. A shot of webbing glues itself to her back, and with a tug your wife is in the woman’s grip. Several strands of silk are swiftly swirled around her legs, cutting off any future plays at mobility. (if: $candy is false)[[[Accept your fate->FE02BAX]]] (if: $candy is true)[[[Accept your fate->FE02BAY]]] ] At first, you hold out hope for rescue. That someone, somehow, will find you deep in these caves, and will manage to set you free. But as days become weeks, and weeks become years, it becomes fully apparent that there will be no such luck. As the years pass, you occasionally pick up snippets of conversation as your arachnid captors walk by, and you eventually piece together why they are here. These women are Spider Princesses - half-breed offspring of the Spider Queen race. And they, like their full-blooded progenitors, can modify the nature of their silk by carefully managing their diet. And it just so turns out that the fruits in the orchard you encountered in the forest can confer unto their webbing the properties shared by the rest of the ‘ghost matter’ on the planet. Namely, those bound in the silk are kept young and healthy for as long as they remain in contact with it. What they’ve done here is created an *export business*. Cultivating and harvesting the fruits to sell to Spider Queens across the galaxy, allowing them to turn their webbing into the ideal material to keep prisoners in permanent captivity. You and Revissa are some of the first of the ‘lucky’ winners of this fate, but you are far from the last. Every once in a while you see more women get strung up as decoration in the caves, until there’s not really any more space nearby. Business must be booming. And the more successful they become, the more powerful they are - and the less likely a daring rescue will be. You have no idea what happened to the rest of your crew. Maybe they searched for but never found you, and sadly left the planet empty-handed. Or, more likely, they were also captured by the Princesses - or some other peril on the planet, and remain just as doomed as you are. Whatever the case, it is clear that this is your life now. As the years become centuries, and the centuries become eternity, you and Revissa will never be more than cocooned captives lining the halls of these endless caverns. GAME OVER [[Start over->A0X]]The spider-women keep the two of you for days - for weeks, even. The hours begin to blend into one another, disconnecting you from the passage of time, without even the rising or setting of the sun to guide you in these dark caverns. But eventually, you get cut free. Feel yourselves being carried, loaded up onto a transport. And then you open your eyes and find yourselves aboard the Lucky Break. Thanks to your Star Scout homing beacon, Vhaja and the others were able to track you down. But there were too many spider-women to enact a rescue. Instead, your crew was forced to trade their mission for your safety, selling the data about the planet to secure your freedom. The research was discarded, the planet abandoned, any hope of gathering intel surrendered. Sadly, your choices have led to failure. You and the crew return to Kemomi space with your tails between your legs, nothing to show for your efforts. But at least it’s better than spending the rest of your life cocooned in a cavern. And from now on, you’ll always wonder whether your choices could have led to someplace better. So… should I call you ‘princess’ then?” you say with a playful grin. She groans. “Ugh. Not that it matters since I’m going to gag you again in a few seconds. But my name is Tula.” Progress! You’ve learned her name. And with that opening, you might have a chance to convince her to forgo dragging you back to her lair just yet. But what to say? You’ve probably only got one chance… [[Tell her you know some Spider Queens and could set up a business deal->FE03B]] [[Try to convince her you’d be more effective at pleasuring her with more freedom->FE03C]](if: $seenbuildings is true)[ [[Reveal the location of the Knottie Outpost, which could be repurposed for her orchard operation->FE03D]]](if: $sawbunny is true)[ [[Suggest you could help her find one of her missing sisters who got lost in the center of the forest->FE03E]]] ] “So… Tula,” you say, trying to sound all professional and businesslike, despite the fact that you’re naked and wrapped up in a cave, totally at this woman’s mercy. “I get the sense that you’re a shrewd businesswoman, and that you understand an opportunity when it’s presented to you. And it just so happens, I have just such an opportunity before you.” The spider woman snorts, amused at your boldness. “Yeah? And what’s that?” “Well, you’re trying to get an export service off the ground, right? Getting these tasty fruits into the hands of spiders who need them? I just so happen to be a seasoned adventurer who has a number of contacts… including a few Spider Queens.” Tula rolls her eyes. “Really, a kemomi like you knows a Spider Queen. Don’t take this as a compliment, but looking like you do, any Spider Queen with any amount of self respect would scoop you up for her harem the second she laid eyes on you – like I’ve done just now.” Too late, you very much do take that as a compliment. “Be that as it may, the fact is true. I actually used to date a Queen, if you could believe it. Her name was Azkumo, really nice girl…” Now Tula breaks out into laughter. “Really, Azkumo? The holo-film star, you mean?” “Well, yeah, but I knew her before she got her big break. Though I called it off because she wasn’t aggressive enough with her silk.” In your defense, every word of what you’ve said is true. But Tula doesn’t seem to be buying it. “Azkumo wasn’t… *aggressive* enough? Do you seriously expect me to believe you spent a single night with her and it didn’t end with you locked away in her harem halls forever?” “Like I said, she didn’t have a harem at the time…” “Yeah, sure. Alright, you know what? I haven’t laughed like this in a long, long time, so let’s make a deal. If you can get Azkumo, famed film star, on the line and get her to give me an autograph, I’ll let you both go. How does that sound?” “Deal!” You’d reach out to shake… but you’re a bit tied up at the moment. So you just wiggle uselessly a bit as Tula sets her communicator down in front of you. “Well? I’m waiting.” Realization dawns at this point. “Erm… well I probably still have her comm channel on my own device… but you kinda stripped me back in the forest,” you say lamely. “You mean you don’t commit your exes’ comm addresses to memory?” “...no?” “What a shame. Well then, I guess let’s just get this gag back on you and we’ll get you to your new home here after all.” “Wait! Um… hold on, I’m sure I can find her contact info on the galactic holo-net…” Tula humors you and allows you to try. But despite your searching, the best you can do is get the info for the ad agency that handles her publicity. Running out of options, you do give them a call… but it doesn’t exactly go as planned. In fact, one thing leads to another, and you end up ‘hiring’ yourself as a model for them instead… [[Become a star->FE03BA]] “So… Tula,” you say, trying to sound all professional and businesslike, despite the fact that you’re naked and wrapped up in a cave, totally at this woman’s mercy. “I get the sense that you’re a shrewd businesswoman, and that you understand an opportunity when it’s presented to you. And it just so happens, I have just such an opportunity before you.” The spider woman snorts, amused at your boldness. “Yeah? And what’s that?” “Well, as I have just demonstrated, I have a service that I can perform, one that you seemed to be quite satisfied with. And though you may have my wife and I totally trapped, I still have the option to withhold that service from you if I so choose.” She glances towards Revissa. “Aww… you think of her as your wife?” That gives you pause. “I mean… she *is* my wife. It’s not a matter of opinion–” But then Tula gives you a tug, pulling you backwards into her arms. And now, when she looks down at you, all sense of amusement is gone from her eyes – all you can see is an overwhelming confidence, a cold, steely dominance reflected back at you. “You really don’t understand. She’s your wife only if *I* say she is, because I caught you, and I *own* you. You think you have something to offer me? Well think again - I don’t negotiate with my possessions.” You try to voice a counterpoint, but she swiftly seals off your lips with more webbing. “So let me be clear here. Yes, I was satisfied with your service. And yes, I expect you to perform that service on my command. But you don’t have a choice in the matter. You *will* do what I say.” Fear starts to well up in your chest as you realize this negotiation is going south for you. But you at least have the presence of mind to grunt and shake your head at her assumption. “No. You will. Because I own you, and I own this pretty little thing too. Which means I get to decide whether or not you ever get to see your ‘wife’ again. So here’s how this is going to go down. Both of you will spend the rest of your lives in my possession. You get no say in anything, no decisions, no sympathy. But – and this is a big but – if you prove to be a tool that I am fond of, I will treat you with respect. For example, if I kept you in my bedroom, and this other one out in the open caverns for public usage, I might, on occasion, let the two of you see each other. If I’m feeling generous.” Her eyes narrow and she pulls your face in close. “But *only* if my sex toy does exactly what I tell it to, every time, without resistance or complaint. Because if one time - even one *single* time – it doesn’t do what I expect it to, then I’d have no reason not to shove it in a box and ship it off to some distant planet where it would never get to lay eyes on its partner again.” Your heart sinks as you realize she’s found the leverage she needs. The prospect of never seeing Revissa again would be too much to bear. And so… you have no choice but to submit to her, be the compliant, defeated slave she expects you to be. “Do you understand?” You nod your head slowly. It’s over. She’s won. And for the rest of your life, you’ll do exactly what she asks of you. “Good.” She slings you over her shoulder, carrying you off deeper into the cavern, leaving Revissa behind. All you can do is watch helplessly as she vanishes from sight, knowing that your new owner is the only one who can grant you the happiness of seeing her. A few minutes later, you are brought to her private quarters, and roughly tossed onto the sheets of a bed. (if: $candy is false)[[[Start your new job->FE03CX]]] (if: $candy is true)[[[Start your new job->FE03CY]]] ] “So… Tula,” you say, trying to sound all professional and businesslike, despite the fact that you’re naked and wrapped up in a cave, totally at this woman’s mercy. “I get the sense that you’re a shrewd businesswoman, and that you understand an opportunity when it’s presented to you. And it just so happens, I have just such an opportunity before you.” The spider woman snorts, amused at your boldness. “Yeah? And what’s that?” “Well, you’re trying to get a new business started, right? Out here on a remote planet, with little resources or infrastructure to rely on. I mean, you’re living in a cave, which shows to me you are lacking in funding for your venture.” “We’re part spider,” she says dismissively. “Caves are a natural habitat for our people.” You’re not buying it. They might be part spider, but they’re also part Queen. “Oh, sure, you’re *capable* of camping out in some musty old caves. But if you were happy with roughing it you wouldn’t be starting a big export business. I’ve seen the inside of a traditional Spider Queen battle-yacht; they’re some of the most opulent vessels in the galaxy!” Tula rolls her eyes. “Please, you expect me to believe you’ve seen the inside of a battle-yacht and aren’t some Queen’s harem slave? Far more capable adventurers than you have tried, and failed, to escape from the grips of a Queen.” “I mean… I’ve seen them… in holo films,” you admit. “But regardless. You’re living in a cave, but you’d rather have more, wouldn’t you? Well, what if I told you I knew the location of an abandoned settlement not too far from here? It might not be as nice as a battle-yacht, but it’s got food, shelter, and supplies - as well as harvesting equipment you could probably use to speed up your fruit-collecting business.” She raises an eyebrow. “Are you talking about the Knotties? We know about their camp at the ruins. It’s too far away to be useful- and we don’t have the numbers to take it over, anyway.” You nod. “Yes, the Knotties. But I’m not talking about their main camp. There’s a smaller outpost in the middle of the forest, only an hour’s walk from here. They had… a bit of trouble with the local flora, and won’t be using it anymore. Making it ripe for the picking.” The spider woman considers for a moment, but then comes to a conclusion. “Interesting. Alright, I have a deal for you. You show me to this supposed outpost. And in exchange, I keep you, and your friend here, for the rest of your lives as my submissive sex slaves, never letting you go.” You give her a blank stare. “Erm… that’s not really much of a dea— mmphh!” She cuts you off with a glob of webbing over your lips. “No, it’s not. But I don’t negotiate with slaves.” She picks you up and slings you over her shoulder. “Now, show me to the site. Otherwise, you’ll never see your friend here again.” Revissa grunts helplessly into her gag, eyes fluttering nervously. You meet her gaze and try to give her a comforting stare, but the truth is, Tula’s got you beat. There’s nothing you wouldn’t surrender to her to ensure you weren’t separate from your wife. “So, let’s get going!” she says brightly, as she takes you back out of the cavern, leaving Revissa behind. Okay… so this isn’t an ideal situation. But at least you’ve introduced an element of randomness into the mix. Maybe you’ll be able to come up with something that can get you out of this. [[Get taken to the outpost->FE04]] “So… Tula,” you say, trying to sound all professional and businesslike, despite the fact that you’re naked and wrapped up in a cave, totally at this woman’s mercy. “I get the sense that you’re the leader of this operation. Someone who cares for her subordinates. Now, I’ve already met some of your, uh… associates, earlier in the forest.” You think back to the pair of spider-women that attacked you on the cliffs, and how you barely managed to escape them by luring one into the territory of a ‘fearsome’ predator. “And one of them, I know, is now missing. I know where she is.” Tula narrows her eyes. “I heard about that. What did you do to her?” “Me? Nothing. But there’s a vicious monster in the heart of the woods, one with terrible psychic powers. I just so happened to head in that direction when she was chasing me… and, well, she didn’t know what to expect.” The spider-woman tugs your bound body into her arms, lifts you up, and presses you roughly against a wall. “You’re going to lead me to her.” You flash her a smile. “Oh, of course, I would be happy to. All I need in exchange is—” But she cuts you off by slamming you again, hard. “You misunderstand. I don’t make deals with my slaves – and that’s what you are now. There are two options before you. One: you do as I command, and you live a comfortable life in my slave harem. Two: you refuse, and I make you regret ever being born. There’s no future here in which you have agency or ever go free. All there is for you is compliant submission or torturous punishment.” The ferocity in her eyes gives you pause. Suddenly this negotiation route doesn’t seem as good of an idea as you thought it was. “Well… that’s not really a very compelling set of choices,” you manage to sputter. “Too bad.” She twitches one of her back legs and glues your mouth shut with more of her silk. Then she scoops you up and tosses you over her shoulder once again. As you squirm, you catch Revissa’s gaze, and the two of you exchange frightened looks - something that Tula quickly picks up on. “You’re now going to lead me to where my sister is. And if you don’t, I promise, you’ll never see your friend here again.” Revissa makes a nervous grunt as Tula lustily squeezes one of her breasts, then heads out with you, leaving her behind. Like it or not… it seems you’ve got to do as she says. [[Guide her through the forest->FE05]] Zamora the Spider Queen takes a theatrically large bite from the fruit in her hand, puncturing it with her sharp fangs and letting the juice dribble down her cheek. “Sweet and juicy, with a taste tha you can really get wrapped up in!” she says, flashing a ferocious smile at the camera. “Ghost Fruits have changed my life! But best of all is what they’ve done for my silk.” She leans forward, waiting for the camera to get both you and herself in frame, before she gives the threads holding you in place a delicate twang. (link:"Wiggle for the camera")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/F98_MelfyAndZamora_by_Dvega.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Dvega(click-replace: "Art by Dvega")[https://www.deviantart.com/dvega https://picarto.tv/Tek]] (set: $picF98 to true) “I’ve had this meal packaged up for three months, and it’s just as fresh as it was the day I caught it!” Her hand reaches down, groping your breast, prompting you to moan helplessly into your gag, pitching and bucking your body violently at her touch. But then– “Cuuuut!” The director hops down from her chair, pointing her megaphone irritably in your direction. “This prop just isn’t working for me,” she says with a sigh. “Can we swap it out for another one?” Members of the stage crew get right on that, snipping away the silk tethering you to the ceiling and carrying you away. You leave the set designed to look like a cavern, and emerge, for a moment, under the twilight sky of a planet you don’t know the name for, getting only a glimpse of stars before you’re brought to the trailer where the crew keeps their props. Some two dozen cocooned women – all of them outfitted in ghost silk – look up as you’re brought in and glommed to the wall beside them, before the prop crew picks out another option to use for the shoot. “Mmmmphh!” you yell weakly, as they settle on Revissa. You and she can only exchange helpless glances before she’s taken away to replace you in the filming of the commercial. In the end, you never did manage to get in contact with Azkumo through her ad agency. But you did get Tula in touch with the right people to market her product. Now “Ghost Fruits” are the hit of the Spider Queen world and she’s rolling in cash, having made quite a name for herself despite only being a “princess”. And she was kind enough to get you and Revissa jobs modeling the silk spun from her product. To her credit, it really does work quite well; you’re still bound up in the very same threads she used when she first caught you. It’s never torn or frayed, staying taut and firm over your body for the many years you’ve been employed in your new profession. And so long as it clings to you, you’re very low maintenance, not needing food, water, or medical treatment of any kind. Which, of course, means you really are just a ‘prop’ to people using you in the films, not even a person. And like the object that you are, when they finish filming (Revissa didn’t make the final cut either), you and the rest of the props are packed up tightly in a large crate and forgotten about, kept in storage until the next time you’re needed. (if: $candy is false)[[[Get forgotten->FE03BX]]] (if: $candy is true)[[[Get forgotten->FE03BY]]] ] When shooting is finished, you, Revissa, and two other ‘props’ whose names you don’t know are tightly crammed into a single crate, your writhing bodies providing each other stimulation that will keep you occupied for the long period of inactivity before you’re needed again. It’s a cycle you’ve become used to over the years since your capture. You’ve long ago given up on any kind of escape. The film studio is quite fastidious with their props, never giving them even an inch of leeway. At least… they normally are. But this time, for whatever reason, is different. Because some time later you hear the sound of ships taking off through your crate, but you and your fellow props are left behind. Some clueless stagehand must have forgotten to load you back into the cargo ship before they left, resulting in you all being abandoned on an otherwise uninhabited planet. Sadly, this does not prove to be any kind of opportunity. The silk remains firm, not decaying in the slightest, and your storage crate stays sturdy and strong, never letting you or the others see outside the darkness you’ve been trapped in. No one ever comes back for you, and no one ever finds you. The studio just writes it off as inventory loss and moves on, and Tula has long since forgotten about the cute pair she captured in the caverns of Spectra I all those years ago. And so you, Revissa, and two women whose names you’ll never know remain here, trapped forever, squirming against each other uselessly with no hope to ever be rescued. GAME OVER [[Start over->A0X]]When shooting is finished, you, Revissa, and two other ‘props’ whose names you don’t know are tightly crammed into a single crate, your writhing bodies providing each other stimulation that will keep you occupied for the long period of inactivity before you’re needed again. It’s a cycle you’ve become used to over the years since your capture. You’ve long ago given up on any kind of escape. The film studio is quite fastidious with their props, never giving them even an inch of leeway. At least… they normally are. But this time, for whatever reason, is different. Because some time later you hear the sound of ships taking off through your crate, but you and your fellow props are left behind. Some clueless stagehand must have forgotten to load you back into the cargo ship before they left, resulting in you all being abandoned on an otherwise uninhabited planet. Sadly, this does not prove to be any kind of opportunity. The silk remains firm, not decaying in the slightest, and your storage crate stays sturdy and strong, never letting you or the others see outside the darkness you’ve been trapped in. It’s purely by chance that a passing Star Scout vessel happens to pick up on the distress beacon given off by the candy that you swallowed all those years ago. She sets down and pries open the storage crate, finding a quartet of squirming bundles that no one has set eyes upon for years. She cuts you free and carries you back to civilization, though it’s been over a decade since you were first snatched up. Readjusting to life as a person and not a prop will be difficult, but at least you’re finally free. Though, suffice to say, you’ve completely failed the mission you were hired for all that time ago. GAME OVER [[Start over->A0X]]It only takes a few days for Tula to fully tame you. Soon any thought of defiance or resistance fades from your mind, and you dedicate yourself completely to catering to her every whim. As promised, she uses you as a sex toy, over and over. It’s the highlight of your day when she does. For a few hours she’ll peel off your gag and let you get to work eating her out, bringing her over the edge multiple times with your prodigious bedroom talent. Every time, you give it your all, because you know that if you perform exceedingly well, she’ll give you the reward that you desire. When she’s feeling so generous, she’ll scoop you up and carry you back out to the caverns that run through the mountain, stringing you up beside your equally helpless wife. You soon come to understand that Tula has created a very egalitarian society here, where slaves such as you and Revissa are considered communal property. You’re left in the hallway for any passing spider-cutie to use as she pleases, grinding up against you and stimulating herself to completion with your helpless body. When they’re done, you get a moment’s reprieve to make eye contact with your wife, to exchange glances, to bathe in each other’s presence for just a short while. The moments never last long enough, before Tula steals you back to her room to return to your duties as her plaything. Apparently there’s a rule that every resident of the commune gets one personal slave that they get to monopolize the time of, and she’s chosen you for that role. Though when you’re not in use you go right back into the collective supply for everyone to take advantage of as they please. Despite that, you still surrender willingly to her every time, because you know that if you displease her, she could instead put you on display on the opposite side of the mountain from Revissa, and you wouldn’t even get those fleeting moments of togetherness. This is your life now. You never find out what happened to the rest of your crew. Maybe they were forced to leave the planet after you both vanished. Or maybe some other peril took hold of them and prevented them from enacting a rescue. It’s impossible to tell. As the years go by, the fact that you ever had friends and allies will seem like a distant memory, because from now on - indeed, for the rest of your life - you’ll never know anything but the life of a helpless slave. Though when you’re not in use you go right back into the collective supply for everyone to take advantage of as they please. It takes two weeks for your crew to find you. They track you down thanks to the Star Scout homing beacon you’d swallowed at the start of your adventure, though even when they find you, they end up getting surrounded by Tula and her sisters and nearly end up joining you as helpless cocoons. Luckily, Vhaja is a better negotiator than you, and trades all the mission data collected from the scanners you’d planted for your freedom. You end up making a tense exit as the spiders renege on the deal and try to capture everyone at once, but your friends manage to fight their way back to the ship and take off with you in tow. And so you flee the planet, the data lost and the mission failed, though at least you won’t be spending the rest of your life as a sex toy. GAME OVER [[Start over->A0X]](if: $faegone is true)[(set: $faewin to false)] It’s a short trip back to the Knottie outpost, made all the more shorter since you don’t need to walk there. The spider lady is strong enough to carry you without breaking a sweat, and her silk remains firm, taut, and restrictive the entire time. You’d hoped maybe you’d find some weakness or gap in your bindings on your way over, but try as you might, there’s nothing. As much as you hate (but also are kind of happy) to admit, you’re completely and utterly helpless. You aren’t going anywhere under your own power; she’s got you, and unless someone rescues you soon, she’s going to keep having you for as long as she wants you. When she arrives, the spider lady takes a look at the accommodations, quickly realizing that the area is abandoned. “Well, it’s no space yacht, but it’s better than living in a cave,” she says with a grin. After a quick search she locates the storage room of one of the living quarters, and strings you up against a support beam, nodding approvingly at the way you add to the ambience. (link:"Mmph")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/F101_MelfyWebbedCeiling_by_Dvega.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Dvega(click-replace: "Art by Dvega")[https://www.deviantart.com/dvega https://picarto.tv/Tek]] (set: $picF101 to true) “That’ll do. We’ve got plenty of food and equipment, but our little operation here has been lacking in… entertainment.” She strokes your tail lovingly, savoring the softness of your fur, before turning to inspect the rest of the empty room. “You and your friend aren’t enough. We’re gonna need lots and lots of toys to keep morale up. I don’t suppose you know where I can find any more, do you?” She asks, as she reaches to pull off your gag. Okay, this might be your chance. Maybe you can use her desire for more slaves against her. But is there anyone who you could tell her about that would be of any help? [[Tell her about the rest of your crew->FE04A]](if: $petalfriend is true or $petalescape is true)[ [[Tell her about Petal->FE04B]]](if: $rosawake is true)[ [[Tell her about Ros’eela->FE04C]]](if: $faewin is true)[ [[Tell her about the fae woman->FE04D]]] [[Make someone up->FE04E]] [[Refuse to help her->FE04F]] ] You’re carried through the forest, slung over the spider-woman’s shoulder without any care for your safety or comfort. Occasionally you’ll bonk your head on a tree branch or get your tail caught in some nettles, but she pays no mind to it, only looking back towards you every once in a while to demand you nod your head in the direction you should be going. It’s not the easiest method of navigation, especially since she’s not letting you consult the map of the landscape you had on your comm device. But luckily, that’s not too much of a problem. Because you remember that the strange predator seemed to prowl in a large swath of space in the center of the forest. You don’t need to be super accurate with your instructions, only close enough to lure her into the adorable monster’s psychic trap. So you basically just wing it, trying to seem confident and knowledgeable despite the fact you’re making things up as you go along. After a while, she does seem to catch on, and grows increasingly frustrated with you - snarling and growling whenever your directions manage to get her turned around. But if she knew what you knew, it would be clear to her that this isn’t your fault. Because the further in you get, the less navigation becomes possible. Soon enough, she finds herself hopelessly lost. That’s when the real trouble begins. Just as she sets you down in annoyance and web-slings herself up onto a high branch to get her bearings, the wind seems to pick up. Gently at first, but quickly increasing in intensity until it becomes a raging hurricane. The gale-force winds knock her from her perch, sending her crashing back down to the ground with a heavy, painful-looking thump. Of course, you know that the winds aren’t real - they’re just an illusion created to try to incapacitate her. But there’s no reason that you need to tell her that. “Is this the work of that predator?!” she growls. “Mmmphh…” you say evasively. With a groan of annoyance, she finally peels off your gag. “Fine. Tell me what this thing is, and how you beat it,” she demands. Now’s your chance. What can you tell her to help get yourself out of this situation? [[Tell her it preys on your fears->FE05A]] [[Tell her it reacts to lewdness->FE05B]] [[Tell her the truth->FE05C]] Desperate for a solution to this problem, you realize that your only chance for rescue is if the rest of your crew gets informed of your predicament. And though it may not be ideal, telling Tula about them puts more pieces onto the game board - and surely one of your friends will have better luck against her than you did, right? “I… came here with my crew,” you say slowly. “Two went to the Knottie camp near the ruins to the east. The other two are on our ship which is currently in orbit above the planet. If you want more slaves, maybe pick a fight with them?” Tula tilts her head in surprise. “Oh? Selling out your friends? Well, don’t think that by betraying them I’m going to let you free in exchange or anything. [[Pollinate your savior->FE06AE]] ] After about an hour, you hear the telltale sound of spindly legs scratching against the floor. You look up to find that Tula has returned, her face bright and cheerful. “You were right! There really was a sexy plant gal lurking around. Thanks for the tip!” She gives you a thumbs-up, before pulling out a data device and queuing up a holo-pic of a scene out in the forest. The rule you set was that you were both equally helpless while cocooned, so since you ended up being saved it's only 'fair' that she has the same luck. Which means that somewhere out there, the gorgeous fae still lurks. It would have been nice to have been rid of her for good, but it looks like she’s given you the slip for now. Hopefully this will be the last you see of her, though you’re pretty sure you won’t be that lucky.] (set: $tulaambercollect to true) [[Return to the entrance->FE07]] It’s a long shot, you know, but sometimes a long shot is the only shot you’ve got. You try to pass the time by struggling and straining against your bindings, but it’s clear to you that you’re completely unable to escape on your own. Which raises another issue in your mind - even if your plan does work perfectly, how the heck are you going to get out of here if Tula never comes back? Even if you had a hundred years, you don’t think this webbing would ever budge an inch. With nothing else to do, you take a moment to look around the room. And thankfully, no more spider ladies pop out to attack you. After a short and uneventful journey, you find a way to climb down from the rocks and turn towards the trees, plunging boldly into the heart of the forest. [[Enter the deep forest->FE01]] In the end, you can’t be sure there aren’t more of those spider ladies. [[Continue back to the entrance->FE06AB]](if: ($rosawake is true) or ($rosfreeze is true and $roscollect is false))[(if: ($faecaught is true) or ($faestonecollect is true))[ [[Check in on the Knottie outpost->FE04H]]](else: )[ [[Check in on the Knottie outpost->FE06AA]]]] ] “We’ll head straight through the center” you say in a harsh whisper, ears perked up as you hear the sound of legs skittering across the forest floor towards you. You’re both running as fast as you can, but despite your head start, you can see through the corner of your eye the shadow advancing towards you along the treetops, slinging between branches on expertly aimed lines of webbing. It’s only a matter of time before she catches up. No, not even that - she’s so confident she doesn’t even think she *needs* to catch up. It’s not a bad thought on her part. Web-slinging is less tiring than running full tilt, so eventually you’ll both be too exhausted to continue. But she doesn’t know what you do. (if: $swampescape is true)[[[Make your escape->FE06BA]]](else: )[[[Plot your course->FE06BB]]] ] “The cliffs!” you say in a harsh whisper, ears perked up as you hear the sound of legs skittering across the forest floor towards you. The rocky barrier cradles the west side of the forest, high enough to be visible from nearly any spot inside that wasn’t totally blocked by foliage. That makes it easy to head that way and impossible to get lost, though it also poses a problem for your attempts at escape - one you are sure the pursuing spider lady is well aware of. After all, the high wall of stone would need to be carefully scaled, navigated with caution and diligence, and climbed with only two arms and two legs. Slow going for you, but simple for a woman whose many spindly appendages can poke into all those little cracks and gaps. She probably thinks the two of you are fools, heading in a direction that would give her the advantage. But you have a plan. Or, well, Revissa does. But she doesn’t know what your wife is capable of. [[Exit the forest->FE07]] You continue on for quite some time through the river, making good progress towards the entrance, and what you hope is the relative safety of the open fields outside the forest. But as you move with the flow, you remember something. The river goes past the Knottie outpost you encountered earlier in your quest. And last you checked, Ros’eela was still there. It would be wrong to just leave her, especially with this spider lady prowling the area. {Sure, she’s frozen and mounted on a wall at the moment, but that just means she wouldn’t even be able to fend for herself if the arachnid predator decided she’d like better hanging from *her* wall, instead.} No matter how you slice it, you decide the right thing to do would be to head back there. And so you give Revissa a tug on her fin and point towards the surface of the water, indicating you’d like to pop back up to have a chat. “What’s wrong?” she asks, her mermaid face bobbing above the water. Luckily, the magic that transformed her makes her equally adept at breathing in air as she is in water while in this shape. “We should check in on the outpost again,” you say. “It’s not fair to leave Ros’eela behind while there’s a predator wandering the area.” Revissa sighs, but eventually nods her head in agreement. “Alright. Help me out onto the shore and I’ll change back.” One downside to her mermaid form is that it’s not particularly convenient for her to revert to a humanoid while underwater; suddenly losing gills in the middle of doing magic can be very disorienting, not to mention a drowning hazard. So you climb out first, then offer a hand to your wife to remove her from the river. But something else snags her before you do. “Gotcha!” says a voice from above. A line of silk slaps into Revissa’s back the moment it’s exposed, glomming on tightly enough to form a tether to allow the unseen fisherwoman to yank backwards and reel her in. You look up just in time to see that same gorgeous spider woman lurking atop a rocky cliff overlooking the river, now with a squirming mermaid thrashing in her arms. They catch you on the wrists, the ankles, and the waist, preventing you from reaching your weapon. But on the other hand… you confirmed that by *getting* captured. That fact is already a foregone conclusion, despite your fervent efforts to strain against the webbing holding you down. The woman leaps down with lazy grace, taking the time to suspend Revissa upside down beneath a tree branch before she walks over to you, towering above your squirming body. “Need some help?” she says mockingly. You have a witty reply prepared, but she glues your lips shut before you can speak it.] |drink1)[(link:"Mmph")[(show:?drink2)]] |drink2)[<img src="images/F116_MelfyWebbed_by_Faust1173.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Faust1173(click-replace: "Art by Faust1173")[https://www.furaffinity.net/user/faust1173/]] (set: $picF116 to true) A minute later, you find yourself just as bundled up as Revissa. Clothing destroyed, weapons discarded, body slathered so tightly with silken fibers that movement is all but impossible. The most you can do is squirm weakly, writhing on the ground like a worm, causing your exposed breasts to jostle invitingly. The spider woman indulges you by giving them an affectionate squeeze. “Now then,” she says, scooping you up in her arms and throwing you over a shoulder. “You said something about another cutie you were concerned about? What say we drop in and give her a visit? [[Head to the outpost->FE06AC]] ] It’s a short trip back to the Knottie outpost, made all the more shorter since you don’t need to walk there. The spider lady is strong enough to carry you both without breaking a sweat, and her silk remains firm, taut, and restrictive the entire time. You’d hoped maybe you’d find some weakness or gap in your bindings on your way over, but try as you might, there’s nothing. As much as you hate (but also are kind of happy) to admit, you’re completely and utterly helpless. You and Revissa aren’t going anywhere under your own power; she’s got you, and unless someone rescues you soon, she’s going to keep having you for as long as she wants you. When she arrives, the spider lady takes a look at the accommodations, quickly realizing that the area is abandoned. “Well, it’s no space yacht, but it’s better than living in a cave,” she says with a grin. After a quick search she locates the storage room of one of the living quarters, and strings you up against a support beam, nodding approvingly at the way you add to the ambience. (if: $petalfriend is true)[Or at least, it *seemed* that way… until you noticed the tell-tale scent of pollen in the air… [[Get unexpectedly rescued->FE06AD]]](else: )[ (if: $candy is false)[[[Begin your new life->FE06AX]]] (if: $candy is true)[[[Begin your new life->FE06AY]]] ]]It’s a straightforward path from here back to the entrance, but you already know that the route is far more complicated than it appears. Directions become hazy in this part of the forest, with both your map and your senses becoming unreliable thanks to the unseen influence of a lurking threat. But you’re already managed to overcome that challenge. You know that you need to stand firm, to trust your mind and not what your eyes are telling you, to keep pushing forward, even if your surroundings stop making sense. And so, as you draw closer to the ‘danger zone’, you take one last look at your holographic map, committing the route you want to take to memory, since soon that memory is all you’re going to be able to rely on. Behind you, you still hear the spatter of webbing striking against trees, of silken lines propelling your pursuer towards you. Revissa in her deer-taur form is faster than her, but speed isn’t always everything. She can’t always take the most direct route between the trees, forcing her to occasionally veer off to the side, to stop and double back, to slow down to navigate a particularly clustered jumble of brush and thorns. And the spider-lady capitalizes on that, never fully losing track of you. But if you were to go just a little bit further… You and your wife know what to expect. This time, it’s not a mire of quicksand, but a sudden windstorm that tries to get in your way. All your senses are telling you that a powerful hurricane has suddenly swelled up, causing branches to shake and leaves to fall in a whirlwind of colors around you. Behind you, you hear the spider-lady curse, feel the thump as she loses her grip and falls to the ground. She doesn’t know to expect this - but you do. And so, as she struggles with the imaginary wind, you wrap your arms around Revissa’s waist and whisper reassuring words into her fuzzy ear, as her hooves slowly trot forwards, ignoring the intensity of the mentally conjured storm. As before, your diligence pays off. You push through the illusions, escape the gale-force winds that were never really there. Before long the sound of it dies down to a gently swirling breeze, and then to nothing at all. You don’t know what happened to the spider-lady, but the important thing is that she isn’t here. At this point you finally venture a glance at your map, and find that you’re only a short walk away from the entrance. You did it! “That was some mighty fine galloping,” you say, sliding down off of Revissa’s back. Once you’re off, she waves her staff around and dispels the transformation, returning to her normal, two-legged self. “I’m just surprised you chose to run,” she says, doing some stretches to reacquaint herself with how bipedal bodies work. “I half-expected you to surrender to that spider woman as soon as she appeared.” “I mean, I was definitely considering it,” you say with a grin. “Maybe the temptation wouldn’t be so high if you’d get around to learning how to shapeshift into a spider hybrid.” Revissa can turn herself into many shapes, up to and including a full-on giant spider, but transformations like the deer-taur form she just employed are not as easy as they appear and take a lot of training to get right. As much as you love the feel of her silk when she becomes a big scary arachnid, you’d love it even more if she were able to look more like the hottie who had just chased you through the forest. “If you’re good, maybe I’ll figure it out as a Wintermas present for you this year,” she says with a sigh. “Oooh, and then you can gift-wrap me for the occasion!” you say with an eager grin. “Don’t think that gets you out of *actually* buying me something, though,” your wife counters. “Tying yourself up in ribbons and laying in a box stops being cute after you do it three years in a row. Especially when you *know* I’ve been wanting new trellises for the cargo-bay garden…” You make a mental note to earmark some funds for that after the payout for this mission, as the two of you head back to the forest entrance in delightfully high spirits. [[Exit the forest->FE07]] According to your map, it’s a fairly straightforward path back to the forest’s entrance. Sure, the trees are thickly clustered, but it’s mostly just a straight line without any topological abnormalities. And so, what *should* happen as you and Revissa gallop along is that you make good progress, weaving through the trees more quickly than a spider lady can keep up. But nothing is ever that easy, is it? After ten minutes, you start to realize that the readout on your holo-map isn’t corresponding with the landscape in front of you. No matter what directions you give to Revissa as she runs, it doesn’t seem to lead to you making any progress at escaping. Is the map wrong somehow? Are you reading it poorly? Or is there something more nefarious at play? You can’t be certain, but whatever the case, it’s clear that your efforts are being thwarted somehow. (if: $faewin is true)[It’s exactly like what happened with the quicksand pit earlier, though this time, there’s no gorgeous fae to bail you out of it.] Like it or not, you’re unable to escape using this route. “We need to turn around,” you say grimly. “This isn’t working.” “Don’t you have a map?!” Revissa complains. “I do but… I don’t know. Something’s off here.” “If I had time, I’d ask the forest for guidance,” Revissa says, “but I guess we don’t.” And so she begins to turn around. Maybe a different route will give better results. However, no sooner does she swivel her cervine hips than another voice rings out from a tree branch above you. “Oh, I don’t know… I think you’re both about to have all the time in the world!” Before either of you have a chance to react, powerful lines of silk shoot out from the shadows, striking at Revissa’s legs with a sickening wet slap. She grunts in surprise, and you feel her knees buckle as the silk forces her down into a kneeling position. “Ack!” your wife screams, trying to pitch and buck her body to escape the powerful tethers. Her movements nearly throw you off her back, causing you to grunt out as well. The voice from above chuckles. “Watch out, dearie. You wouldn’t want to hurt your rider, would you?” More silk flies outwards, catching your legs in such a way to glue your hips in place against Revissa’s back. You reach for your weapon, but the spider-lady is faster, catching your sword from its holster and tossing it uselessly into the brush. Only then does she drop down to show herself, admiring the way she’s immobilized both rider and mount. “Now then… let’s get you two bundled up…” (link:"Mmph")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/F115_DeertaurRevissaWebbed_by_Faust1173.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Faust1173(click-replace: "Art by Faust1173")[https://www.furaffinity.net/user/faust1173/]] (set: $picF115 to true) It was all too easy for her to defeat you. You may have been on deerback, but you’re no trained rider; mounted combat is not your forte. So the spider was able to capitalize on your awkward position and render you helpless with her webbing. Now you find yourself completely restrained, stripped of weapons and clothing and cocooned in place atop your wife’s back. Revissa is equally defeated, unable to get up due to all the silk anchoring her to the forest floor. The two of you grunt and squirm, writhe angrily and impotently as the spider woman watches with amusement, savoring the sight of your futile struggles. Like it or not, she’s got you right where she wants you now, and you can’t imagine she’s going to be eager to let you go after the effort she made to catch you. “As much fun as it is to watch this, I think it’s about time we brought you to your new home, don’t you think?” You have no choice but to comply as she bustles about with the logistics of transporting you. [[Get carried away->FE06BC]] ] Try as you might, neither you nor Revissa can move a muscle. You’re both completely restrained and exposed, helpless as your captor inspects her catch from every angle. Interestingly, Revissa does not revert to her normal form, even after an extended period of motionlessness. You know that normally, her transformation magic lasts for only a few hours at most. Yet no matter how much time passes, she seems to retain her deer-taur shape. Perhaps it’s some element of this strange planet? You recall the discussion about Ghost Matter, how material made from it can keep restrained prisoners in stasis for an indefinite amount of time. If the spider-woman’s webs have similar properties, then perhaps Revissa’s transformation can also last indefinitely, so long as she remains bound. That’s the best idea you can come up with, because it certainly seems like Revissa is going to stay as she is for the foreseeable future. Though the lady is strong, you’re fairly certain she’s not strong enough to fully carry a deer-taur and its rider back to where she wants to go. So for a while, you hold out hope that maybe she’ll need to leave you behind while she figures out a way to move you. Sadly, that hope is quickly dashed. She pulls out a communicator and makes a call, and within the hour several more women of the same species as her show up, ready to help with the task. Many hands (or in this case, legs) make light work, as the saying goes, and soon enough you’re hoisted up and taken away. You’re carried to the cliffs circling the west side of the forest, dragged into a hidden cavern entrance that leads to a network of natural tunnels. This, apparently, is where the clan of spider-babes make their home. Once they’ve gone far enough, you and Revissa are set down, and all of them slather you with more silk to glue you to the floor. A few tentative struggles against the silk confirm the obvious - there is no way in hell you’re ever getting out of this on your own. “Good work, girls!” says the red-skinned spider-babe who caught you. Listening in on their conversations as they moved you confirms that her name is Tula, and that she seems to be the leader of this arachnid colony. “You’ve all earned a break.” She smiles as she looks towards your helplessly squirming bodies. “These two will be the first public installations in the colony,” she explains to the group. “That makes them *communal* property. They’ll stay here out in the hallway, and are free to use for anyone who wants them. No one is allowed to bring them back to their room, or to move them, without approval from the council. Are we understood?” There’s a murmur of agreement from the various spider-babes, but it’s clear from their faces some are considering spiriting you away in the night. “I’m serious. We’re a team, here, so we need to act like one. Anyone found violating this rule becomes community property herself for a week.” That leads to the ladies exchanging looks between themselves as if imagining what it would be like to have some of their co-workers at their mercy. “Now then, we’ll draw straws for who gets to play with the new toys first. Any questions?” One spider raises her hand. “Um… I found this on the floor,” she says, holding up a small electronic object. Your eyes widen when you realize what it is - your communicator!” Tula takes it with interest, slipping it over her wrist and quickly paging through the UI. You mentally kick yourself for your laziness in not putting a password on it. “Oh-ho… well, look what we have here. It seems there’s four more morsels on the planet along with these two,” she says with a grin. “Perhaps there won’t be as long a line as I thought for the community sex toys.” You and Revissa can only exchange frightened glances. Surely the rest of your crew will be able to avoid capture, right? And come save you both in a flurry of heroics. …right? [[Wrong->FE06DA]] Several hours pass as the two of you wait, restrained helplessly in your silken bindings. Revissa remains in her deer-taur form the whole time, her four legs useless at propelling her to safety. And you remain strapped on top of her, mounted in place with no way to separate. At this point, there’s nothing to do but pray, hope desperately that your friends can mount some kind of daring rescue. But those hopes are dashed before long. You hear several happily chattering voices coming from down the hallway, belonging to a bevy of the arachnid women who have just returned from the hunt. A successful hunt, you’re sad to see. One of them hops ahead of the others, eager to add the prey she caught to the public repository of cocooned slaves. She has two silken bundles draped over her arm, both of them squirming uselessly in her grasp. One after the other, she lifts them up, spraying some tethers against the ceiling, then some anchors against the floor. Instead, you give Revissa’s leg a tug to get her attention, then point downwards towards the forest floor. She nods and descends, landing in a small clearing without any issue. A twitch of a wing returns her to her normal humanoid form, though she takes a minute to do some stretches to reacquaint herself with having arms and feet. “Now what?” she asks. “Where should we go next?” Where next indeed. [[Get carried away->FE06CC]] ] Try as you might, neither you nor Revissa can move a muscle.
