She smiles as she looks towards your helplessly squirming bodies. “These two will be the first public installations in the colony,” she explains to the group. “That makes them *communal* property. They’ll stay here out in the hallway, and are free to use for anyone who wants them. No one is allowed to bring them back to their room, or to move them, without approval from the council. Are we understood?” There’s a murmur of agreement from the various spider-babes, but it’s clear from their faces some are considering spiriting you away in the night. “I’m serious. We’re a team, here, so we need to act like one. Anyone found violating this rule becomes community property herself for a week.” That leads to the ladies exchanging looks between themselves as if imagining what it would be like to have some of their co-workers at their mercy. “Now then, we’ll draw straws for who gets to play with the new toys first. Any questions?” One spider raises her hand. “Um… I found this on the floor,” she says, holding up a small electronic object. Your eyes widen when you realize what it is - your communicator! Tula takes it with interest, slipping it over her wrist and quickly paging through the UI. You mentally kick yourself for your laziness in not putting a password on it. “Oh-ho… well, look what we have here. It seems there’s four more morsels on the planet along with these two,” she says with a grin. “Perhaps there won’t be as long a line as I thought for the community sex toys.” You and Revissa can only exchange frightened glances. Surely the rest of your crew will be able to avoid capture, right? And come save you both in a flurry of heroics. …right? [[Wrong->FE06D]] (if: $faegone is true)[(set: $faewin to false)] You decide it would be best to head through the middle of the forest, so you quickly move that way, keeping your eyes peeled for any signs of spider-babes web-slinging between the branches overhead. (if: $faewin is true)[However, only a short way in, you see signs of something else entirely. There’s a swirl of leaves, a change in the texture of the air, the smell of ancient magic in your nostrils. You turn to face her before she speaks, finding yourself looking into the beguiling eyes of a woman you had hoped you’d never have to see again. [[Hello again, folks! Did you miss me?->FE08D]]](else-if: $swampescape is true)[Luckily, you’ve been through this portion of the forest already, so you know the danger that you face. Something here deep in the woods confounds your senses and disrupts your ability to navigate, but so long as you remain firm and confident in yourself, you’ll be able to get through. And so you push forward together, ignoring your map and your senses and following your heart. [[Make your escape->FE08C]]](else: )[Unfortunately, you’re not very familiar with this region of the forest. And despite the fact that you have a topological map on your comm device, the further you go, the less the map seems to make sense. Is it wrong somehow? Or are you just bad at reading it? Either way, you soon find yourself hopelessly lost, the entrance you came from seemingly infinitely far away from where you are now. [[Admit you’re lost->FE08B]]]After some thought, you point to the river displayed on your holo-map. You know that the entrance to the forest is downstream from it, meaning if you needed to make a speedy getaway, the current would be working to your benefit. Revissa nods in understanding, and agrees to follow you as you head in that direction. Both of you feel a tension in the air as you creep towards your destination. You know that you’re being followed, that at any moment a spider-lady could pop out and catch you in her expertly woven webs. It’s nerve-wracking to be sure, but also just a *tiny* bit sexy. At least to you. To think, one wrong move and a gorgeous arachnid might have you at your mercy. It’s like the plots in all those sexy holo-films you pretend not to own. But you push down your arousal as you plot out a path, eventually leading you to the bubbling brook that flows through the eastern side of the forest. You take a moment to watch the current, then take a deep breath and hold out your hand to your wife. “On three?” you ask. Revissa nods. “One, two, three!” And then you both leap, making a splash as you submerge yourselves in the water. After all this running around, you’ve worked up quite the sweat, so the water feels cool and refreshing as it carries you away. Still, though, you’re not fully relaxed. You have no idea how good the spider ladies are at tracking people. The forest is big, but it’s not like you took particular care at covering up your trail. What if they manage to follow you to the river, realize what you’ve done, and set up a trap somewhere downstream? What if they have a ship in orbit and try to catch you as you leave the planet? And… what if they wrap you up so tight in their silk that you forget all about your worries and just learn to accept your fate as their plaything? “Stop that,” Revissa says, bopping you on the head the next time you both pop up for air. “Stop what?” you ask lamely. “I’ve been married to you long enough to tell when you’re fantasizing about being kidnapped. Now wipe that goofy smile off your face and get back to swimming.” You cough awkwardly and turn your head away in embarrassment. “Yes, ma’am,” you eventually say, before ducking back into the water once again. Thankfully (or maybe, regrettably), you drift the rest of the way without incident. Perhaps these spider ladies are not as good at tracking as you’d feared (or hoped). And so, before long you’ve pulled yourself up on shore. A glance at your comm device tells you it’s just a short walk back to the entrance of the forest. Revissa notices as you look forlornly behind you. “Sorry, no silky kidnappings today,” she mutters, grabbing you by the tail and yanking you back towards your goal. [[Exit the forest->FE07]] Several hours pass as the two of you wait, suspended helplessly in your silken bindings. Revissa remains in her bird form the whole time, her wings useless at propelling her to safety. At this point, there’s nothing to do but pray, hope desperately that your friends can mount some kind of daring rescue. But those hopes are dashed before long. You hear several happily chattering voices coming from down the hallway, belonging to a bevy of the arachnid women who have just returned from the hunt. A successful hunt, you’re sad to see. One of them hops ahead of the others, eager to add the prey she caught to the public repository of cocooned slaves. A line of web above, an anchor to the ground belong, and two more tethers to fasten her catch to some hanging rocks to the sides. She does diligent work, preventing even the slightest hope of escape for the woman who has fallen into her grasp. It’s only when she backs away that you can finally see who it is. They go on for hours, taking turns, swapping one slave out for another, each of them eager to have a go at every one of their new toys. It feels like days have passed before any of you get even the slightest moment of reprieve. Tula said you were communal property, and the community just continues to grow as more and more spider women flock from every corner of the galaxy to join the colony and partake of its amenities. Over time, more cocooned captives are brought in to line the winding halls of the cavern, and their muffled grunts of pleasure echo across the stone non-stop, mingling with those of you and your friends. You feel bad for them, of course, but also somewhat thankful, since more options for the sex slave buffet means each individual course of the meal has more time to marinate unmolested. Whatever enterprise the spider women are engaging in here seems to be quite successful. Successful enough that they gain power, influence, and wealth on the galactic stage, enough that there’s never any danger of their settlement being overtaken. Sadly, what that means for you and the other slaves is that rescue never comes. And thanks to the properties of the planet’s Ghost Matter, woven into the fibers of your silken cocoons, it also means you’ll be able to stay like this forever. You’ll never need to eat or sleep, never grow tired, never age a day, meaning that for the rest of your lives, you’ll be the perfect sex toys to slake the endless lust of your new owners. Thanks to the properties of the planet’s Ghost Matter woven into the fibers of your cocoons, you never need to eat or sleep, and never age a day, meaning that you look more or less the same as when you were first captured as you do when you’re finally released. It’s all because of that Star Scout homing beacon you swallowed ages ago at the start of your adventure that a passing Scout happens to pick up on the distress signal and come in to investigate. Though she’s not able to free you immediately, she does secure a deal with the spider-women that after a hundred years they’ll finally release you. By the time you and your friends finally get to move again, the galaxy is much changed from how you remember it. Surely, it will hold many adventures for you and your friends now, but that’s a different story than this one. Needless to say, whatever you get up to, you’ve still completely failed your mission. GAME OVER [[Start over->A0X]]You know that smell. That sweet, indescribable smell. You faced it not that long ago, the cloying scent that drove you mad while you explored the outpost here. And now, you smell it again. Already, you can feel your pulse starting to rise, your libido kicking into overdrive, the sensations on your skin magnified as every nerve ending yearns for stimulation. Everything else fades away, and you begin to wriggle and writhe, to strain and struggle, to desperately try to find some way to bring yourself over the edge. Of course! If you smelled the pollen, she shouldn’t be far behind. But wait… if Petal showed up… then does that mean… “See for yourself,” Revissa says, reading the expression on your face. You follow her outside, and are stunned to find that your spider problem has been taken care of. No one ever saves you. You’re not even people any more, just objects – tools, a service provided by the growing spider-girl settlement to keep up morale. (if: $gagtalk is true)[[[Try to communicate with her->FE09C]]](else: )[[[Try to communicate with her->FE09BA]]] [[Try to trick her->FE09D]] [[Try to kick and thrash and squirm->FE09BB]] ]“Mmmph!” you say, squirming uselessly against your silken bindings. Merry might be nicer than the other spider ladies, but she’s no less an expert at wrapping up her prey. You’re pretty sure it’ll be impossible for you to escape from this stuff. She lets out another delighted squeal as she watches you struggle. “Aww, you make just the cutest sounds! And I’ll bet you’ll make even cuter sounds when we’re playing!” Despite her appearance she is still quite strong. She easily scoops you up into her arms, cradling you lovingly. “Mmphhh!” you yell, in an attempt to let her know that you’d much rather have fun with her while not slathered in silk. But nothing you say is intelligible. “There, there, it’s okay. We’re going to have some much fun soon. Happy together, for ever and ever… and ever!” One of her back legs bends towards your neck, and you feel the tiniest pinprick against your skin as she injects you with some kind of toxin. “Now rest up, cutie… soon you’ll be at your new home.” No, wait, this isn’t what you want. Dammit… this is bad. Really bad. You feel dizzy and your vision starts to go blurry, but you manage to look up towards Revissa one last time. Sadly, she’s just as helpless as you are, so you both can only lock eyes desperately before you fully black out. [[Wake up at home->FE09E]] You’re wrapped up tight, with no way to get out. No matter how you look at it, you’re in trouble. But Merry doesn’t seem as ruthless as the other spider women you’ve met. Perhaps… even a bit naive. Is there maybe some way you can use this against her? “I can already think of all the fun things we’re going to do together!” she says, completely oblivious to the fact that you’re plotting against her. “I just hope they let me keep you.” Her hand strokes your tail lovingly, her face nuzzles against your cheek. It’s altogether not the… *worst* feeling in the world, being coddled and cuddled like a beloved pet. But no! You’re not a domesticated dog, you’re a proud and cunning wolf! Which is why… maybe it’s time to try a bit of deception. “Mmmph!” you grunt, the pressure of the silk against your lips preventing words from forming. “Grrmmphh!” Your words are not intelligible… but that’s partially because you’re not even trying to make words at all. All you’re doing is grunting, trying to get her attention. “What’s the matter girl? Has Tula fallen down a well?” You shake your head no. And then you grunt again, and tilt your neck towards some nearby bushes. “Oh? Is… is something over there?” You nod. Not that there actually *is* anything over there, but if you could just get her away from you for a few minutes, maybe you can wriggle your way over to your pack and pull out your knife. “Okay… don’t worry. I’ll handle it!” Tula says, before stepping in front of you protectively. “Whatever you are, you’re not going to hurt my new friend!” It would almost be dashing of her, if she were not also in the process of kidnapping you. Though she of course does not get any response from the non-existent threat. “Stay away! Or I’ll wrap you up good and tight!” Merry yells, before she thwips a few shots of webbing into the foliage. But then, to everyone’s surprise (yours most of all) something rustles in the spot where she shot. Wait… was there *actually* something over there? “That’s right! Go on, git!” Merry says, taking a few steps forward. As she does, the figure emerges from the brush. Merry looks down at it and squees. “Aww… what a cutie! You’re not a scary monster at all. You’re just a cute little lizard, aren’t yo—-” (link:"Crrrkkkk")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/F125_MerryStone_by_ZeroTwo9S.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by ZeroTwo9S(click-replace: "Art by ZeroTwo9S")[https://www.deviantart.com/zerotwo9s https://twitter.com/Zerotwo9S]] (set: $picF125 to true) Her voice suddenly cuts off, and you hear a sickening crackling sound emanating from her body. You look up just in time to see her clothing flake away and her body transform into dull, gray granite. What the hell? She’s turned to stone?! Wait, then that means— But you don’t react fast enough. Webbed up as you are, it’s not like you really could run away anyway. Though maybe you shoud have closed your eyes. ] |drink1)[(link:"....")[(show:?drink2)]] |drink2)[<img src="images/F122_MelfyWebbedStone_by_Dvega.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Dvega(click-replace: "Art by Dvega")[https://www.deviantart.com/dvega https://picarto.tv/Tek]] (set: $picF122 to true) Unfortunately, you didn’t, which means now you’ve met the gaze of a basilisk that was prowling for food in the bushes. A moment later, and you’re a statue too, as frozen and immobile as poor Merry. The sound of your petrification echoes through the forest, attracting the attention of the remaining spider-girl who was busy playing with Revissa up in the branches. She hops down to investigate, but by the time she gets to where you are, the basilisk has fled, and two inert stone figures are left behind in its wake. To her credit, she seems upset at your fate, though that may just be because now she no longer has a warm and squishy sex toy to occupy her with. Not that it really concerns you anymore. You’re unable to move, to speak, or even to think. You see nothing, hear nothing, and know nothing, unable to do anything but stay in the place where you were transformed, as powerless as any other hunk of rock left in the forest. “Ugh… I guess now I need to drag this all the way back…” she groans, tapping your granite face in annoyance. You, of course, do not react at all. (if: $candy is false)[[[Stay still as stone->FE09DX]]] (if: $candy is true)[[[Stay still as stone->FE09DY]]] ] She might have caught you, but that doesn’t mean you’re going to go quietly. As she gets close, you start to thrash, kicking with your legs and slamming into her with your shoulders. But she seems entirely unconcerned. “Aww… you’re a feisty one, aren’t ya?” she says, scooping you up into her arms with more strength than you would have expected from someone with her personality. “That’s alright, go ahead and work out all that energy, cutie.” You’re not sure which is worse. The fact that she completely no-sold your struggles, or the fact that she didn’t even *realize* you were trying to resist her. “Grrrmmphh!” you yell. With all the strength you can muster, you reel back, then headbutt her right in the face! “Ow!” she yells sharply. Well, it didn’t accomplish much, but at least you feel a bit better that you were able to hurt. “That… looks like it hurt!” she continues. And then she starts to gingerly rub your forehead. “You need to be more careful, cutie. Wriggling around like and you might get a bruise on that adorable face of yours.” Ouch. Your head will recover from that, but your pride never will. “Anyway… I guess we’ll have to make sure you don’t hurt yourself anymore for now…” One of her back legs bends towards your neck, and you feel the tiniest pinprick against your skin as she injects you with some kind of toxin. “Now rest up, cutie… soon you’ll be at your new home.” No, wait, this isn’t what you want. Dammit… this is bad. Really bad. You feel dizzy and your vision starts to go blurry, but you manage to look up towards Revissa one last time. Sadly, she’s just as helpless as you are, so you both can only lock eyes desperately before you fully black out. [[Wake up at home->FE09E]]“Mmmph!” you say, squirming uselessly against your silken bindings. Merry might be nicer than the other spider ladies, but she’s no less an expert at wrapping up her prey. You’re pretty sure it’ll be impossible for you to escape from this stuff. To the surprise of both of you, a small voice suddenly emanates from somewhere nearby. “Damn, this is tight,” it says. Wait a second… that’s what you were just trying to say! How did it– of course! The sound must be coming from the gag-talk translator you have in your bag. It had been useful when communicating with Ros’eela before. Maybe it can also be helpful when *you’re* the one all bundled up. “Grrmppgghh… mmmphh!” you say. The translator hums to life. “Hey there, spider cutie. Before you finish dragging me away to your sex dungeon, do you mind if we have a little chat first?” Yes, you said all that with a few grunts and groans. It’s more about the intent than actual words, anyway. Merry has a look of confusion as she walks over to your bag, pulling out the device. She stares at it, then turns and stares at you, and then back to the device. “That thing is translating my words,” you explain. “I know I’m just a cute cuddle-toy to you, but believe it or not, I’m a fully sapient being with my own thoughts, hopes, and dreams. I’m like, a full person, dude.” “Well, of *course* you’re a person, silly! That’s why I’m going to treat you with all the love and care and attention you deserve! Don’t worry, I promise you’ll be super happy once we get you home.” Okay… so she’s still got her heart set on kidnapping you. But this is a good start. If you play your cards right, you may be able to get out of here. [[Ask her about herself->FE09CA]] [[Be diplomatic and find common ground->FE09CB]] [[Try and trick her->FE09D]] You do eventually make it back to the spider-girls’ lair. Though sadly, they don’t have access to any magic or technology that is capable of changing you back. If only they would have thought to look in your bag, they’d have found the restoration crystals Lumina entrusted you with that could have done the trick. But they don’t think to do that, nor do they ever ungag Revissa to give her the chance to explain. Merry gets shipped off-world for treatment, but no one bothers to do the same for you. And so, you end up as little more than a paperweight left laying around the caverns the spiders call home. They never even get around to peeling off the silk that had been wound around you. Revissa ends up getting glued to the wall with webbing right across from you, trapped in place and used as a communal sex toy for the colony of arachnids to pleasure themselves with at their leisure. Whenever they finish with her, she looks across the way at your petrified form, and wonders which of the two of you has it better. Sometimes she’ll wish for the slumber of stone over the indignity of being a spider slave. No help ever comes for either of you, and neither of you ever see the rest of your crew again. Whether that’s because they weren’t able to locate you at all, or if they tried to but ended up captured by some different peril on the planet is anybody’s guess. You’ll never know for certain, not the least of which is because you’re incapable of knowing anything at all. GAME OVER [[Start over->A0X]]You do eventually make it back to the spider-girls’ lair. Though sadly, they don’t have access to any magic or technology that is capable of changing you back. If only they would have thought to look in your bag, they’d have found the restoration crystals Lumina entrusted you with that could have done the trick. But they don’t think to do that, nor do they ever ungag Revissa to give her the chance to explain. And so, you end up as little more than a paperweight left laying around the caverns the spiders call home. They never even get around to peeling off the silk that had been wound around you. Revissa ends up getting glued to the wall with webbing right across from you, trapped in place and used as a communal sex toy for the colony of arachnids to pleasure themselves with at their leisure. When they finish with her, she looks across the way at your petrified form, and wonders which of the two of you has it better. Sometimes she’ll wish for the slumber of stone over the indignity of being a spider slave. It’s two weeks before anything changes in your situation. Thanks to the Star Scout homing beacon you swallowed, your crew eventually manages to track you down. Though with so many spiders lurking about, a direct rescue mission is out of the question. Instead, they exchange all the data they’d gathered on the planet - as well as Lumina’s healing techniques to cure Merry’s plight - for you and Revissa’s safety. Though you don’t find out about that until later, when your ship is already light-years away from the planet and they finally have the time to cure your petrification. At least you won’t be a rock for the rest of your life, but sadly, your slip-up has caused your mission to end in failure. GAME OVER [[Start over->A0X]]As you sleep, you’re overwhelmed by dreams. Warm dreams, happy dreams, erotic dreams; dreams where you’re safe and secure, happy, though helpless. When you finally open your eyes, you find there was some truth to the visions you saw while unconscious. Because your body is tightly encased in silk, wrapped around your legs, encasing your arms, slathered over your lips. And that’s when you remember what happened. You were captured by a pretty spider girl, wrapped up tight then drugged with venom. And now you’re here. (link:"Mmph")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/F99_MelfyBedWebbed_by_Dvega.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Dvega(click-replace: "Art by Dvega")[https://www.deviantart.com/dvega https://picarto.tv/Tek]] (set: $picF99 to true) You’re laying on a bed, and you feel like you’re in a bedroom, but the air is wrong, all dank and moldy and stale. Plus it’s dark. The only light source is from a small jar on a nightstand beside the bed, where some bioluminescent mushrooms cast an eerie, greenish glow over the room. So you must be in a cave - probably a passage dug into the cliffs overlooking the forest. And you’re wrapped up, helpless, and alone. Though not for long. “Ooh, hi cutie! Are you awake now?” Merry comes in from an opening concealed behind a curtain at the edge of the room, grinning wildly as she sees her new toy is ready to be played with. She immediately flops down onto the bed and pulls you into her arms, resting your head on her lap as she idly strokes your ears and tail. “Mmmmph!” you grunt, unable to vocalize anything through your gag. “Awwww… what cute sounds you make!” she says, gently squeezing one of your exposed breasts as a reward for entertaining her. That just elicits more grunts… or would it be more accurate to call it a moan? “I’m so happy that Tula let me keep you! She said anyone we catch is supposed to be ‘communal property’, but she was nice enough to make an exception for me. Which means that we’ll get to be best friends! Forever!” Your eyes widen… but it’s hard to tell if it’s out of fear or… excitement. Because being owned by such a cuddly and nurturing spider-gal isn’t the *worst* fate in the world. Though, as you squirm and struggle, and as she strokes and pats, you realize that this *is* your fate… and that you don’t seem to have any way to get out of it… (if: $candy is false)[[[Be domesticated->FE09EX]]] (if: $candy is true)[[[Be domesticated->FE09EY]]] ]Merry proves to be a loving owner. She plays with you, she talks with you, she cuddles you, and she even takes you out on walks. The walks you tend to enjoy the most, since you get carried out into the hallways beyond her bedroom, where you get to see Revissa. Unlike you, your wife has become communal property, a toy for the spider-babes who live here to be groped and molested to their heart’s desire. Sometimes, Merry lets the two of you go on ‘play-dates’, which basically just means you’re glued to the wall beside her for a few hours and ‘borrowed’ by the other residents of the cavern. Not once does she ever unravel the silk spun around your body. Not once is the idea of you getting to go free even considered. You’re a toy now, a pet, and that’s all you’ll ever be. A pet who is loved and cherished, to be fair, but a pet all the same. Thankfully, her silken webbing is imbued with the planet’s Ghost Matter, meaning you’ll never need to eat again, never need to heed the call of nature, will never grow old or feel pain, so long as the material encases your skin. Though it also means there will never be an end to your imprisonment. You never find out what happened to the rest of your crew. Perhaps they fell prey to some other peril in this world. Or maybe they tried to find you but gave up, forced to abandon the planet and the mission. All you know is that you’ll never see them again. From now until the end of your days, this is your new reality - a spider’s toy, a helpless pet. There might be worse ways to end your career, but there might also have been better ones. You’ll never find out, because you’ll never know anything other than this. GAME OVER [[Start over->A0X]]Merry proves to be a loving owner. She plays with you, she talks with you, she cuddles you, and she even takes you out on walks. The walks you tend to enjoy the most, since you get carried out into the hallways beyond her bedroom, where you get to see Revissa. Unlike you, your wife has become communal property, a toy for the spider-babes who live here to be groped and molested to their heart’s desire. Sometimes, Merry lets the two of you go on ‘play-dates’, which basically just means you’re glued to the wall beside her for a few hours and ‘borrowed’ by the other residents of the cavern. And that might have been the end of the road for both of you, if not for the Star Scout candy you swallowed at the start of your adventure. Through it, your friends manage to track down your location. Of course, with so many spiders around, they can’t just run in guns blazing and save you. But they do manage to open up a line of communication, and negotiate for your and Revissa’s release – in exchange for all the data they’ve gathered on the planet up until now. Thanks to that, you both get to return to your ship, after only a few months as helpless slaves. But sadly, it also means that your mission was a failure. Maybe next time, you’ll be more careful around spiders - even cute ones. GAME OVER [[Start over->A0X]]The gag translator hums as it converts your grunts into speech. “Well, going home with you does sound fun… but maybe we could get to know each other first?” That seems to confuse her. “But… we can learn all about each other once you’re nice and safe and secure in my room, right? We can do lots and lots of cuddling and… other things. Hrmm… assuming Tula lets me keep you though…” Okay, that sounds like a thread you can tug. “Why wouldn’t Tula let you keep me?” you ask through the translator. “Well… we’re *supposed* to be sharing the cuties we catch… something about ‘community property to boost morale’. But… I kinda want you all to myself…” This might be your chance. What can you say to turn this situation around? [[Ask her more about herself->FE09CC]] [[Convince her to hide you away from the others->FE09CD]] [[Try and trick her->FE09D]] Okay, so she’s got you at her mercy. But maybe you can find some common ground that will convince her to treat you like a person and not a pet. The gag translator hums as it converts your grunts into speech. First off, start with some flattery. “I gotta tell you… if I had to be caught by anyone, I’m glad it was you,,” you say. “You seem way nicer than those other spiders. I’m sure that we would have a lot of fun back in your lair, but–” The flattery makes her face erupt into a brilliant smile, making her excited enough to not listen to the rest of your sentence. “Aww… thank you so much, cutie! I can’t wait to get you home. We’re going to be the bestest of friends! In fact… there’s no point in waiting, let’s head there now!” “Wait–” you begin to say, but then she switches off the translator. “Hrrmmhhggh? Mmmrrrpgghh!” “It’s okay, cutie. Best friends don’t need words to communicate!” She skitters over and pulls you into her arms, cradling you lovingly. And then she suddenly jabs you with the tip of one of her legs, injecting some kind of toxin into your body. “Now go on and take a nap, and I’ll handle the rest, okay?” No, wait, this isn’t what you want. You were supposed to open up a dialogue, not end it! Dammit… this is bad. Really bad. You feel dizzy and your vision starts to go blurry, but you manage to look up towards Revissa one last time. Sadly, she’s just as helpless as you are, so you both can only lock eyes desperately before you fully black out. (set: $diplomerry to true) [[Wake up at home->FE09E]] You’ve got some good info to go on, but you feel like there’s more to learn about this spider cutie. So you try to keep her talking. “That’s really unfair, making everyone share,” you say through the translator. “Instead everyone should just get to keep any girls they catch, don’t you think?” Merry nods. “Exactly. Though I guess not everyone in the colony is from good hunting families like me, Tula, and the sisters,” she says to herself. “Oh? Are you, uh… spider royalty or something?” you venture. Your captor chuckles. “Well, we’re all princesses, silly! Because Spider Princesses are the daughters of Spider Queens, after all.” She goes on to explain her heritage. As you well know, Spider Queens are an entire race of galactic warlords, more monstrous in appearance than Merry and her kin because from the waist down they have the bodies of massive arachnids. But as it turns out, any half-breed daughters they sire are called Spider Princesses, and look mostly humanoid, save for the spindly legs coming from their backs. “Of course… I guess I *am* a bit more special, since *both* my moms are queens! Uh… or were queens? My Elvaan mom was dethroned a couple centuries ago I think…” Sometimes you forget just how insane it is that some races measure their age in centuries, whereas kemomi like you are lucky if they even make it to seventy. “Wow, you do sound really special,” you say. “Special enough that you deserve your own personal playthings, right? Let me guess… is your spider mom kind of a big deal too?” Merry nods vigorously. “Yup! She’s really good at business and something called… in-vest-ing? Because I asked her really nicely she gave us all the money to set up our base here for Tula’s fruit-selling plan.” She goes on to explain that the fruits from the orchard where you first encountered Tula, the red-skinned spider, are part of an enterprise she is planning. Because when spider-folk consume the fruits (which are made from Ghost Matter), they confer the properties of those fruits into their silk, ensuring the webbed up captives stay healthy and satiated no matter how long they’re cocooned for. All of that is good to know… but more relevant to your current situation is that Merry seems to be ‘the boss’s daughter’... and that probably means she gets special treatment. “So… I don’t know, it seems unfair that I don’t get to keep who I catch, especially after all my mom does for them!” she concludes after several more minutes of chattering From up above, you hear the spider-girl who captured Revissa start to skitter downwards, probably picking up on the conversation the two of you are having. If you’re going to say something to get out of this, now is going to have to be the time! [[Get her and the other spider to fight->FE09CE]] [[Convince her to hide you away from the others->FE09CD]] [[Try and trick her->FE09CF]] Alright, there’s some tension between her and her fellow spiders. Maybe you can use that against her. “That does sound like a problem,” you say through the translator. “They might not let you keep me… and then we wouldn’t get to have fun together. And I really, really wanna be your pet, not anyone else’s!” You flash her your most innocent, puppy-dog eyes. Merry swoons from the cuteness, rubbing your ears affectionately, and then seems to make her choice. “That makes me so happy to hear!” She looks around furtively. “Okay… in that case… we’ll just have to hide you away somewhere. You’ll be nice and safe and secure, and I’ll make sure to visit you every day. How does that sound?” Before you get a chance to reply, she switches off the translator, so all you do is make some muffled grunts. “Sorry, but we need you to be quiet, or the plan won’t work,” she says, as she scoops you up into her arms. Despite her cuteness, she’s still stupidly strong, and doesn’t seem burdened at all by your weight. “Okay… let’s head out into the forest…” And so, you and she go off into the woods, leaving Revissa and the other spider lady behind. [[Find the perfect spot->FE09F]] Wrapped up tight like you are, there’s not much you can do as Merry carries you away. The silk is taut and firm, not giving you even an inch of leeway, and it’s too sturdy to tear without the use of a weapon - meaning escape doesn’t seem like a viable option. But at least she’s carrying you away from the other, more aggressive spider lady, which means there’s still some kind of chance for you out here. “Hmm… this looks like a nice and cozy spot, don’t you think?” You look around as she comes to a halt, and realize that a spider-girl probably has a very different definition of cozy than you do. You’re deep in the forest, in a shadowy part of the woods which smells strongly of rot and decay. There’s not much sunlight here, with dead, scraggly branches forming a spooky canopy over the ground. “Mmmphh…” you say nervously. “Oh, hold on!” Merry replies, and switches the translator back on. You’re surprised that she’s nice enough to do that for you. “Mmmphh,” you say again, but this time the device hums as it converts your sounds into audible speech. “Yeah… this is uh… really scenic.” “Right?! It’s a really cute spot,” Merry says, as she starts weaving a spiral net suspended between two trees with her silk. “I’m really looking forward to spending time with you here. It’ll be our little secret!” When she’s done with the net, she picks you up and adheres you in place with a few more tethers, pressing down on your shoulder to make sure it can support your weight. The silk is springy and soft, and seems like it will hold firm. “There, how’s that?” “Super comfy…” you say through the device. And then an idea starts to form in your head “But, well…” Merry tilts her head to the side nervously. “Oh no, is something wrong? Is the silk not tight enough? I can wrap you up even more if you want!” “No! No, uh… no, it’s not that. It’s just, well… forests can be a dangerous place. And even if I’m hidden away from your friends, you’re not going to be able to be by my side all the time. What if some forest monster comes along and sees me here, and decides to drag me away somewhere else? Or even worse, what if it tries to hurt me? I’ll be helpless to defend myself.” “Oh… oh no!” Merry says, legitimately upset at the thought of harm befalling her new pet. “That’s true… I guess we’ll have to take you back to the colony after all…” You shake your head quickly. “No… we don’t need to do that. You just… well, you just need to leave me something to defend myself with, right? That way, if a monster comes along, I can scare it away.” Merry nods along in understanding. “Hmm… that does make sense. But what can I leave you with?” “Well… how about my sword? You can just strap it up right there next to me in the silk. That way, if I get attacked, I can cut myself free and escape from the monster. And then once it’s gone, I will of course come back here and wiggle myself into your web again, nice and snug, so I’ll be all bundled up for you when you return.” There’s a long pause as Merry studies your face closely. Have you misjudged her? Is she more savvy, less trusting than you’d initially thought? But then she claps her hand and smiles. “That’s a great idea! I’m really impressed with you. All my friends are going to be so jealous that I have such a cute and smart little wolfie!” You breathe out in relief as Merry gets to work gluing your sword next to you on the net. Luckily she brought all your gear along with you together with the translator. “How’s that?” (link:"Test your bindings")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/F123_MelfyWebNet_by_Dvega.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Dvega(click-replace: "Art by Dvega")[https://www.deviantart.com/dvega https://picarto.tv/Tek]] (set: $picF123 to true) You glance towards the sword, then back towards Merry. “Perfect. It’s… just barely in reach, I think, if I stretch as far as I can. So I won’t be accidentally bumping into it unless I really need to.” “Yay!” Merry says warmly, skittering over to give you a big, spidery hug with her arms *and* all of her legs. “Now, you stay right here, all snug and wrapped up, and I’ll go make sure no one followed us. But then, I promise to visit you each and every day, okay?” You nod yes, and get a kiss on the forehead for your trouble. It almost feels bad tricking her like this. And… you almost wonder what it would be like to actually just be her cute and cuddly little pet. Surely there are *worse* fates in the world than that, right? “Okay, see you later!” she says, and then vanishes into the forest. Honestly, you’re surprised that worked. But now you’re alone, and you have a weapon to get you out of this mess. At this point, what could possibly go wrong? [[Find out->FE09FA]] ] You wait a few minutes, but once you’re sure Merry is gone, you get to work. Like you told her, the sword is just barely within your reach. But you’ve got to stretch as far as you can go, really squirm and strain to cover those scant few inches. A little more… just a bit further, and — *Snap* Suddenly you hear the sound of a foot crunching down on a dead twig nearby. Crap, did Merry come back already? Did she forget something? Is she going to realize you were lying? You take a deep, anxious breath, then turn towards the sound. That was a big mistake. (link:"Check your surroundings")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/F124_MelfyWebNetStone_by_Dvega.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Dvega(click-replace: "Art by Dvega")[https://www.deviantart.com/dvega https://picarto.tv/Tek]] (set: $picF124 to true) You only get a glimpse of it before you realize your folly. It’s a squat lizard with a bulky frame, a barbed prong at the end of its tail, and two bright, beady eyes that seem to draw you into them as you meet its gaze. You’ve met creatures like this before, and you know they’re called. Basilisks. That’s the last thing that crosses your mind before you’re swiftly converted into a statue of stone, naked and strung up in silk. The lizard looks up at you in confusion, wondering how this big creature found its way into its lair, but then turns away with disinterest once it realizes the intruder is no longer a threat. Sadly, all you can do is stare forward with sightless eyes, unthinking, unmoving. Well, not *entirely* unmoving. Since after a few minutes, your greatly increased body weight causes the webbing holding you aloft to buckle and tear, dropping you down to the ground with a hard, stony *thunk*. Luckily your petrified form is quite sturdy, so not even a hair on your head is damaged by the impact. But it doesn’t change the fact that you’re hard as a rock, with no immediate prospects of being restored. (if: $candy is false)[[[Rock on->FE09FX]]] (if: $candy is true)[[[Rock on->FE09FY]]] ]Merry does make good on her promise, and comes back to your secret hiding spot only a few hours after your transformation. Unfortunately, she finds not a soft and wriggly cuddle toy, but a hard and stony paperweight, completely unable to respond to her affections. To her credit, she’s devastated by the loss. And be it out of guilt or compassion, she still honors her word and comes by every day to play with her petrified bestie. You, of course, are never aware of this, because you’re just a hunk of stone. And though it wouldn’t be particularly difficult to turn you back into flesh with the right magic or technology, Merry never thinks to do this. Instead she just skitters over once a day and has one-sided conversations with her stony friend, holding tea parties, dressing you up in silk, confiding in you all her hopes and fears. If you were able to hear her, you’d probably really appreciate the company. But you can’t. You’re just a frozen hunk of granite now, and that’s all you’ll ever be, for the rest of your days. Sadly, Merry never did get her pet wolfie. But she still has a pet rock. GAME OVER [[Start over->A0X]]Merry does make good on her promise, and comes back to your secret hiding spot only a few hours after your transformation. Unfortunately, she finds not a soft and wriggly cuddle toy, but a hard and stony paperweight, completely unable to respond to her affections. To her credit, she’s devastated by the loss. And be it out of guilt or compassion, she still honors her word and comes by every day to play with her petrified bestie. And if not for the Star Scout candy you swallowed at the start of your adventure, that’s probably what she would have kept on doing for the rest of her life. But thankfully, Vhaja and the rest of your crew are able to track you down, and recover your statue at a time when Merry isn’t around. You’re restored to flesh back on your ship, after which point you tell your friends where they can find Revissa. Unfortunately, the only way they can negotiate for her release is surrendering all the research data on the planet, so while you do get her back, your mission proves to be a bust. But at least you didn’t spend the rest of your life as Merry’s prisoner. Though she’ll always be sad that she lost her pet rock. GAME OVER [[Start over->A0X]]“You should stand up for yourself,” you tell Merry through the translator. “You can’t just let them push you around like that.” Merry nods her head in determination. “Yeah! I’m gonna go right up to Zauzyne and give her a piece of my mind!” Yes, this is exactly what you wanted. Once they start fighting, maybe you’ll be able to wiggle away in the confusion. There’s a knife in your pack, so if you could just get over to it, you could cut yourself free! A soft skittering of chitinous legs announces Zauzyne’s arrival as she arrives on the forest floor with you. “Merry!” she says sharply. “You shouldn’t be letting your slaves talk so much.” Merry shakes her head. “Oh, I know. Once we’re back home I’ll make sure she never makes any sound other than happy grunts and moans. But… that’s not what I wanted to tell you.” She takes a deep breath and narrows her eyes. “I… have decided I’m keeping this one for myself! I don’t want to share her with anybody!” There is a long pause, before Zauzyne smiles warmly. “Huh? Of course. Go right ahead,” she says. “After all you’ve done for us, it’s only fair. I’m sure Tula feels the same way.” “...really?” Merry murmurs, tears of happiness forming in her eyes. Your eyes are starting to tear up as well, but out of fear. “Of course! Go on and keep her.” “Forever?” Merry asks. “Sure.” “And ever and ever?” “Absolutely. You deserve it. I mean, who could say no to that cute face of yours?” Merry erupts with happiness. “Yaaaay!” She thwips you with a shot of webbing and reels you in for a big hug. “Did you hear that?! We get to be together forever!” “I kind of thought that would go differently…” you say, your words echoing from the device in Merry’s hand. Zauzyne notices the translator and gently takes it. “Hrmm…” she mutters, before she crushes it in her palm. Then she turns and looks you right in the eye. “No more trying to corrupt our innocent little Merry.” “Mmmphh…!” you say helplessly. Your body quivers with fear as you realize just how screwed you are now. And that’s when you feel a pinprick of pain on your neck, as Merry uses one of her back legs to inject you with some kind of toxin. “Now rest up, cutie… soon you’ll be at your new home.” No, wait, this isn’t what you want. Dammit… this is bad. Really bad. You feel dizzy and your vision starts to go blurry, but you manage to look up towards Revissa one last time. Sadly, she’s just as helpless as you are, so you both can only lock eyes desperately before you fully black out. [[Wake up at home->FE09E]] You’re wrapped up tight, with no way to get out. And now, there’s another spider lady about to drop down and join you. Merry might be naive and easily manipulated, but the other one will surely not be so simple to decieve. But… if Merry is the boss’s daughter, then perhaps looking after her is more important to these ladies than making sure their slaves don’t escape. So what if you spooked Merry and got her to run away – would the other woman chase after her? It’s worth a shot! “Mmmph!” you grunt, the pressure of the silk against your lips preventing words from forming. “Grrmmphh!” Your words are not intelligible, even to the gag translator… but that’s partially because you’re not even trying to make words at all. All you’re doing is grunting, trying to get her attention. “What’s the matter girl? Has Tula fallen down a well?” You shake your head no. And then you grunt again, and tilt your neck towards some nearby bushes. “Oh? Is… is something over there?” You nod. Not that there actually *is* anything over there, but if you convince her there is, maybe she – and the other lady, will go to check it out. Speaking of which, you hear the soft sound of skittering legs as the second woman sets down beside you. “Zauzyne! Come quick, there’s something hiding in those bushes!” Merry says. The newly arrived spider raises an eyebrow, looking right towards you with disbelief. “Yeah, sure there is,” she says with a smirk. “It’s true!” Merry insists. “My new friend senses it! Maybe with her nose? She’s a cute little floofer, so her sense of smell is really strong!” “Or she’s lying to you,” says Zauzyne. Merry looks aghast at the notion. “My friend would *never* lie to me! Isn’t that right?” You’re about to grunt a reply, but Zauzyne snatches the gag talk translator away from Merry and smashes it in her hand. “No more corrupting our sweet, naive little Merry, you scamp,” she says. All you can do is squirm and grunt helplessly, your one method of interacting with the situation now taken away from you. “Anyway, let’s get these slaves back to the base, and—” But she’s cut off by the sound of rustling from the bushes. The very same bushes you were just trying to distract them towards. Wait… was there *actually* something there? “It’s coming from over there!” Zauzyne says, pointing her finger as she gets ready for a fight. “Aww… what a cutie!” Merry says as it steps forward. “You’re not a scary monster at all. You’re just a cute little lizard, aren’t yo—-” (link:"Crrrrkkkkk")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/F125_MerryStone_by_ZeroTwo9S.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by ZeroTwo9S(click-replace: "Art by ZeroTwo9S")[https://www.deviantart.com/zerotwo9s https://twitter.com/Zerotwo9S]] (set: $picF125 to true) Her voice suddenly cuts off, and you hear a sickening crackling sound emanating from her body. You look up just in time to see her clothing flake away and her figure transform into dull, gray granite. “Crap! It’s—” Zauzyne begins. But she doesn’t get to finish.] |drink1)[(link:"Hear the hard truth")[(show:?drink2)]] |drink2)[<img src="images/F127_ZauzyneStone_by_ZeroTwo9S.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by ZeroTwo9S(click-replace: "Art by ZeroTwo9S")[https://www.deviantart.com/zerotwo9s https://twitter.com/Zerotwo9S]] (set: $picF127 to true) In a moment she, too, is reduced to being nothing more than an inert hunk of rock. Whatever did this must be quite the foe indeed. And given how quickly they petrified, that must mean it transforms them via eyesight. A gorgon? No, she said lizard, so probably a basilisk, then. You’ve certainly been calcified by your fair share of them in your career. So your instincts kick in and you smartly close your eyes before you end up like the two spiders. You hear it shuffling towards you, its stubby lizard legs padding slowly against the ground. Some basilisks can petrify with their fangs as well, or the barbs on their tails. Is this one going to finish you off? It’s not like you have much choice in the matter, considering how tightly you’re webbed up. But the fact that it didn’t emerge until threatened suggests to you that it might not be a predator. If it’s protecting its territory or acting in self defense, it might leave if you just try to be as non-threatening as possible. It draws closer, close enough that you can feel its hot, rancid breath on your face. You put that nose of yours to good use, and can smell residue of plant matter in its stench – it’s an herbivore! That reassures you as it continues poking and prodding at you, nudging you with its head, slapping you with its tail. But you remain resolute, keeping your eyes closed fast and not moving an inch. And, eventually, to your great relief, it plods away, seeing you as something that’s not worth its time. Once the sounds of its footsteps fade away entirely you finally exhale, and then get to work figuring out how you’re going to untangle yourself from all this silk. (set: $gagtalk to false)(set: $basiliskmet to true) [[Get unwrapped->FE09CG]] ]It takes quite a while to cut yourself free. It probably would have been impossible, given how thoroughly you’d been webbed up, but one of the culprits of the affair also proves to be your salvation. Their silk seems incredibly sturdy - much harder to escape from than normal webbing, but you’d noticed all of them seemed perfectly adept at manipulating the stuff and snipping it apart when needed. Which must mean that their own spider legs must have some kind of property that allows the webbing to be easily severed. You prove that true by stretching and straining until you’re lined up with one of the petrified arachnids, then using the tips of her own stony legs to slice away at your bindings. “Thanks for the assist,” you say once you’re finally free, giving Zauzyne’s hardened form a hearty slap with your hand. A bit too hearty, since your hand stings with pain after the impact. Even when petrified, spider-ladies always seem to get the better of you. You look apologetically towards Merry. “Sorry, cutie.” She honestly didn’t seem so bad… other than the whole wanting to kidnap you and keep you as a pet for the rest of your life thing. But you have other things to worry about than the safety of your kidnappers, because Revissa is still strung up in a spiral net high above the ground. You fish through your pack for the runic knife Vhaja gave you, then clamber up a tree until you’re even with her. Revissa grunts weakly, even more bundled up in silk since the last time you saw her… and with an exhausted expression that indicates her captor was having a lot of fun playing with her until she was lured away. Some tiny, foolish part of you considers taking further advantage of your wife while she’s helpless like this, but the part of you that wants to keep living past today thinks better of it and gets to work setting her free. It takes a while, but you eventually get it done. And once most of the silk is off of her, Revissa reverts from her harpy form back to humanoid, almost as if the webbing was keeping her transformation in stasis until it was removed. “How are you feeling?” you ask, once you help get her back down to the ground. “Like I was tied up and molested by a spider-woman for nearly an hour,” she replies. You just grin and pull her into a tight hug. She melts in your grip, finally letting herself relax. Though she would never show it to anyone other than you, you know that for all the strength and determination your wife exudes, sometimes she really does like being able to relax in a pair of powerful arms, to feel safe and comfortable and secure. So you indulge her, holding her tight, stroking her hair and letting the beat of her heart intermingle with your own. It’s times like this that you remember just how much you love her. Sadly, the romantic moment is broken up by the sound of a communicator beeping out a message. You trace the noise to Zauzyne’s feet, where you discover that her device appears to have survived the petrification process that otherwise reduced her garments to crumbled fragments - funny how stuff like this always seems to destroy clothing, isn’t it? Either way, a voice crackles over the comm, a voice you recognize as belonging to Tula, the red-skinned spider who tried to catch you back at the orchard. “You there? I’m guessing you’ve not reported in yet since you caught those cuties and are having your fun. But the girls back home are getting restless, so hurry up and bring them over to spread the love.” You and Revissa exchange glances. Against all odds, you’ve actually managed to avoid the fate of becoming communal sex toys for a colony of lusty spider babes. But it’s clear at least one of those spiders hasn’t yet given up the chase. “Hello? Zauzyne, come on… your sister’s already gone missing. Don’t tell me you have too! Answer me dammit! Ugh… okay, fine, I’m coming after you. Hold your position.” Well it looks like the honeymoon is over. Tula’s back on the hunt, which means it’s time for you to get the heck out of here. Considering that Merry told you the spider-babes have their home base here in the cliffs, it’s probably a good idea not to stick around in this part of the forest. And so, after you get dressed back up and properly equipped, you pull out your map and try to figure out the best way to go. (set: $merrystone to true) [[Escape through the center of the woods->FE08]] “You again,” Revissa growls, raising her staff defensively in front of her. ”Me again!” the fae woman agrees, raising her hands over her head and doing a little twirl. (link:"You didn't think I was going to limit myself to only appearing in one section of the game, did you?")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/F139_AFaeNamedAdonia_by_Izra.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Izra(click-replace: "Art by Izra")[https://twitter.com/IZRART https://picarto.tv/IZRA]] (set: $picF108 to true) She’s wearing a different outfit now, but that irresistible body of hers still looks the same, even if you know she’s simply pulling images from your mind to base her appearance off of. “Melfy, you know the drill. Whatever you do, never agree to play her–” But Revissa gets cut off when, with a wave of the fae woman’s hand, your wife disappears, and in her place stands a potted tomato plant, its vines curling upwards around her staff which is now plunged into its soil. “Wha– what?!” you sputter, looking lamely at the suddenly manifested greenery. “Did… do you turn her into that?” The woman shrugs, plucking a fruit from the vine and taking a hearty bite from its flesh. “So, I’m sure you know my deal by now. Would you like to play my game?” You look helplessly towards the plant. “It’s not like I have a choice, right?” She smiles. “Oh, there’s always a choice. But since you’re on the run right now, I’ll make it quick and simple. You can play my game - a simple game, a fair game, one with equal odds of success or failure - and if you win at it, I’ll give you a boon. Or you can turn me down, just like your wife would probably like. If you do that, I’ll bring her back here, and let you both carry on with getting captured by a sexy spider.” “I mean… it’s… not *guaranteed* that we’re going to get caught by her…” you mumble. The fae raises an eyebrow. “You’re welcome to believe that, if it will protect your ego.” She finishes the rest of the tomato in a single bite, wiping the juice from her lips, then turns towards you and smiles. “So? Let’s have your choice. Game of chance? Or spider bondage for everyone?” You take a breath and grit your teeth, trying very hard to change your mental pathways from being terrified of one highly dangerous predator whose abilities you have a pretty good understanding of to another, even *more* dangerous one whose capabilities you couldn’t even guess at. But eventually, you make your choice. [[Play her game->FE08E]] [[Refuse to play->FE08DA]] [[Attack her->FE08G]] ] It’s a straightforward path from here back to the entrance, but you already know that the route is far more complicated than it appears. Directions become hazy in this part of the forest, both your map and your senses unreliable thanks to the unseen influence of a lurking threat. But you’re already managed to overcome that challenge. You know that you need to stand firm, to trust your mind and not what your eyes are telling you, to keep pushing forward, even if your surroundings stop making sense. And so, as you draw closer to the ‘danger zone’, you take one last look at your holographic map, committing the route you want to take to memory, since soon that memory is all you’re going to be able to rely on. Behind you, you suddenly hear the spatter of webbing striking against trees, of silken lines propelling an unseen pursuer towards you, and you realize that the spider-lady you met in the orchard is already hot on your trail. And despite your knowledge of this area, the woman remains faster than you. You and Revissa hurry forward, catching sight of shadows from the corner of your eye, of flashes of movement that quickly pass by your periphery. Before long, you’re sure she’ll be able to catch up with you, but that won’t be a problem if you just make it a little bit further… This time, it’s not a mire of quicksand, but a sudden windstorm that tries to get in your way. All your senses are telling you that a powerful hurricane has suddenly swelled up, causing branches to shake and leaves to fall in a whirlwind of colors around you. Behind you, you hear the spider-lady curse, feel the thump as she loses her grip and falls to the ground. She doesn’t know to expect this - but you do. And so, as she struggles with the imaginary wind, you link hands with Revissa and whisper words of reassurance to each other, pressing forwards and ignoring the intensity of the mentally conjured storm. As before, your diligence pays off. You push through the illusions, escape the gale-force winds that were never really there. Before long the sound of it dies down to a gently swirling breeze, and then to nothing at all. You don’t know what happened to the spider-lady, but the important thing is that she isn’t here. At this point you finally venture a glance at your map, and find that you’re only a short walk away from the entrance. You did it! “And so escape the brave warriors, running recklessly away from the threat of danger,” you say with a sarcastic, self-deprecating smile. “I’m just surprised you chose to run,” Revissa says, giving you a playfully affectionate slap on the rump. “I half-expected you to surrender to that spider woman as soon as she appeared.” “I mean, I was definitely considering it,” you say with a grin. “Maybe if you’d let me sign up for a membership to that Spider Queen brothel I found on the holonet the other day–” Revissa’s playful slap becomes more like a full-forced punch as she jabs her fist into your shoulder. “We’ve gone over this a million times already! It was clearly a front for a slavery ring! You’d have been trussed up and spirited away the moment you walked through the door!” “Sounds like a perfectly reasonable vacation to me,” you say, only half-jokingly. Your wife sighs. “Well, if you’re good, maybe we’ll try to find some kind of legit escort service to hire as a Wintermas present this year.” “Oooh, and then you can gift-wrap me for the occasion!” you say with an eager grin. “Don’t think that gets you out of *actually* buying me something, though,” your wife counters. “Tying yourself up in ribbons and laying in a box stops being cute after you do it three years in a row. Especially when you *know* I’ve been wanting new trellises for the cargo-bay garden…” You make a mental note to earmark some funds for that after the payout for this mission as the two of you head back to the forest entrance in delightfully high spirits. [[Exit the forest->FE07]] “We need to turn around,” you say grimly. “This isn’t working.” “Don’t you have a map?!” Revissa complains. “I do but… I don’t know. Something’s off here.” “If I had time, I’d ask the forest for guidance,” Revissa says, “but I guess we don’t.” And so she begins to turn around. Maybe a different route will give better results. However, just as she makes that declaration, a voice rings out from a tree branch above you. “Oh, I don’t know… I think you’re both about to have all the time in the world!” A blast of webbing shoots out from the darkness, just barely missing as it slaps onto the ground between you. “Crap - she’s here!” you yell, turning towards your wife. “We need to move – and fast! Can you transform?” Revissa nods, holding up her staff to weave nature energy around her body. And then, she starts to shift. Her torso raises up higher, legs spreading apart and body shifting backwards until she’s moving on four limbs instead of two. (link:"Take her for a ride")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/F112_DeertaurRevissa_by_Gris.png" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Gris(click-replace: "Art by Gris")[https://www.deviantart.com/gris-9 https://gris9.newgrounds.com/]] (set: $picF112 to true) You call this her deer-taur form. Powerful legs and sturdy cloven hooves provide her with both speed and endurance, making her even faster and more resilient than yourself when it comes to traveling long distances. Before the pursuing spider lady has the chance to catch up, you hop onto her back, wrapping your arms around her torso as you point out the direction she should move in. “If you say ‘giddy-up’ I’m going to toss you right off my back,” she says firmly. “How about ‘git along little doggie’, then?” you venture sweetly. She just sighs in annoyance as you gallop through the trees. But you hardly make any progress at all before you somehow get turned around, finding that you’ve circled back to the very same spot you left from, if the loose strands of webbing glued to the ground are any indication. “Oh, you’re back? That’s great, because I suddenly had a headache trying to follow you,” says that same voice. Before either of you have a chance to react, powerful lines of silk shoot out from the shadows, striking at Revissa’s legs with a sickening wet slap. She grunts in surprise, and you feel her knees buckle as the silk forces her down into a kneeling position. “Ack!” your wife screams, trying to pitch and buck her body to escape the powerful tethers. Her movements nearly throw you off her back, causing you to grunt out as well. The voice from above chuckles. “Watch out, dearie. You wouldn’t want to hurt your rider, would you?” More silk flies outwards, catching your legs in such a way to glue your hips in place against Revissa’s back. You reach for your weapon, but the spider-lady is faster, catching your sword from its holster and tossing it uselessly into the brush. Only then does she drop down to show herself, admiring the way she’s immobilized both rider and mount. “Now then… let’s get you two bundled up…”] |drink1)[(link:"Mmph")[(show:?drink2)]] |drink2)[<img src="images/F115_DeertaurRevissaWebbed_by_Faust1173.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Faust1173(click-replace: "Art by Faust1173")[https://www.furaffinity.net/user/faust1173/]] (set: $picF115 to true) It was all too easy for her to defeat you. You may have been on deer-back, but you’re no trained rider; mounted combat is not your forte. So the spider was able to capitalize on your awkward position and render you helpless with her webbing. Now you find yourself completely restrained, stripped of weapons and clothing and cocooned in place atop your wife’s back. Revissa is equally defeated, unable to get up due to all the silk anchoring her to the forest floor. The two of you grunt and squirm, writhe angrily and impotently as the spider woman watches with amusement, savoring the sight of your futile struggles. Like it or not, she’s got you right where she wants you now, and you can’t imagine she’s going to be eager to let you go after the effort she made to catch you. “As much fun as it is to watch this, I think it’s about time we brought you to your new home, don’t you think?” You have no choice but to comply as she bustles about with the logistics of transporting you. [[Get carried away->FE06BC]] ] You sigh deeply, massaging your temples in frustration, before you look up at the woman with a resigned frown. “Yeah, fine. I’ll play your damn game.” Her face twists into a delighted smile. “Oh, I hoped you would.” She waves her hand, and suddenly, the forest seems to dissolve away around you, like it were a watercolor painting whose colors were being washed off the canvas. It disorients you for a moment, but eventually the swirl of paint reforms, and you find yourself indoors somehow. You blink as you look around. “What *is* this place?” The building you’re standing in has the appearance of something akin to a curio shop, full of various knick-knacks and antiques. On one wall, a giant grandmother clock. Hanging from the ceiling, model airplanes suspended on strings. In the center of the floor, a marble birdbath. And yet, upon closer inspection, everything within the room has a macabre secret to it - because every single one hides the form of a helpless woman, trapped or transformed by the fae’s wicked magic. Behind the glass of the clock, a tsunojian is shackled in place, the pendulum tick-tocking between her two heaving breasts. And within the seats of the airplanes are tiny, glossy pilots, kemomi women shrunken and transformed to forever operate the controls. And the basin of the birdbath, of course, is clutched between the fingers of a petrified elvaan, the placid smile etched onto her face belying the terror she must have felt in the moment her fate was sealed. “My secret lair,” the fae woman says, twitching a finger to cause a fountain of water to erupt from the lips of the petrified woman holding the birdbath, making liquid start to collect in the basin. “My home away from home - and most importantly, it’s where I keep all of my… stuff.” You feel a shiver run down your spine. “I… assume that means me, if I lose at your game?” “Of course.” Looking around, you realize that there doesn’t seem to be a front door to the strange shop, just a curtain leading into a back room. Though there is at least a window. Looking out of it, you see the trees of a forest spreading out into the distance, but somehow you don’t think it’s the same forest you were just standing in. Trying to escape at this point seems like an even more foolish idea than agreeing to come here in the first place. “Okay…” you say with another sigh. “So what’s the game?” The fae woman grins. “Like I said, it’s incredibly simple. A game of chance, of the most basic variety. We’re going to flip a coin. If you guess what side it lands on, you get a reward. If you guess wrong, I get you. Sound fair?” “I… am going to assume that the reward I get is you giving me back my wife?” Your hostess assumes a look of mock offense. “You wound me, my little wolf. I don’t need to give you your wife back, because you’ve already got her.” She pauses a beat, savoring the look of confusion on your face. “Check your pocket.” “My pockets?” Nervously, you stick your hands in your pockets, feeling around for anything unusual. You mostly just find bits of lint and a couple of leaves that must have fallen in there while walking through the forest, but when you get to the one on your right butt cheek, you feel something hard and heavy inside that certainly wasn’t there before. When you pull it out, you find the object to be both shocking yet completely expected. (link:"Head's up!")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/F129_RevissaCoin1_by_Takachiro.png" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Takachiro(click-replace: "Art by Takachiro")[https://www.deviantart.com/takazumishan https://twitter.com/ShanTakazumi]] (set: $picF129 to true) Revissa’s face looks back at you, a blank, neutral expression in her eyes. And so you do] |drink1)[(link:"I do like making her the butt of my jokes")[(show:?drink2)]] |drink2)[<img src="images/F130_RevissaCoin2_by_Takachiro.png" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Takachiro(click-replace: "Art by Takachiro")[https://www.deviantart.com/takazumishan https://twitter.com/ShanTakazumi]] (set: $picF130 to true) Now you’re looking at your wife’s adorable posterior. You can just make out the sight of her hands folded in front of her through the gap in her legs, and when you run your finger over the coin, you can feel a slight texture in the etching of her tail, almost as if it were an approximation of soft fur. “So… that’s it?” you ask. “I just flip it – flip *her* – in the air, and call heads or tails?” “That’s right.” “And if I guess wrong, you keep me.” “Yup.” “But if I win… I get a reward?” Remembering how things went last time with the merry-go-round race, you decide to really iron out the details in the event of your victory right now. “So you said I get a boon. Obviously, I want Revissa turned back to normal. But I think I deserve something more than that, given how I already beat you once and you’re forcing me into a rematch.” “I didn’t force you into anything,” the fae woman says, idly swishing her hands through her hair. “But I suppose you’re right. What do you propose if you win?” You think about it for a while. “If I win… I get to set a rule,” you say. “Something that you have to abide by, no matter what.” “Oh?” she raises an eyebrow. “That’s a dangerous thing for one such as me to agree to.” “Yeah, well it’s a dangerous thing to play a game where I have a 50% chance of becoming a bauble in your collection,” you assert. “If you don’t agree, you can just turn Revissa back and kick us out if you want.” She thinks for a long moment. “Hrm… I will agree on one condition. Any rule you propose must apply to you and me equally. So if you were to, say, make the rule ‘you must remain a stone statue for the next 1000 years,’ then you and I will be sharing a pedestal for a few centuries together.” “Done.” Maybe a foolish thing to agree to, but you figure it’s the best you’re going to get. You hold out your hand, and the fae woman eagerly shakes it. “Wonderful,” the woman says. “Though of course it goes without saying, any attempt to cheat - either from you, or from the folks playing along at home - will result in immediate forfeit. Do you hear me? That means you, $yourname!(if: $cheater is true)[Though I suppose you've already learend that lesson if you're reading this, haven't you?]” Not like you’d be able to cheat anyway. The coin is pretty huge, and you don’t have another one to swap it out for. “Well… I guess this is it,” you say, holding the metal disc tightly between your fingers. “Oohh… I’m so excited! Go ahead and flip it! And for those of you at home, rest assured, I’m playing fair. This game has a random-number function, and that’s what we’re using to pick which side is the winner. So, win or lose, please accept the results, and don’t blame me if you’re forced to redo a bunch of gameplay as a result.” You ignore her perplexing rambling as you toss your wife in the air, then prepare to call out the choice that will decide your fate. (set: $coin to (either: "heads", "tails"))(if: $placeholder is true)[[[Go to->FE08EA]]] (if: $coinguess is true)[[[Make your choice->FE08EC]]](else: )[(link: "Heads!")[ (set: $flip to "heads") (go-to: "FE08EA") ] (link: "Tails!")[ (set: $flip to "tails") (go-to: "FE08EA") ] (if: $faepromise is true)[[[Mira!->FE08ED]]] ]] You think long and hard over it, but eventually, there’s only one reasonable answer. “Yeah… no. I’m not getting tangled up with you again,” you say. The woman sighs dramatically. “Are you sure?” You nod. “Absolutely. There’s no way it could end well for me.” “Actually, there was a 50% chance it could have gone well for you,” she counters. “But I guess you’d prefer 0% instead. Oh well.” She snaps her fingers, and suddenly the forest begins to shift around you. You feel an odd sensation of vertigo, even though you’re pretty sure you’re not moving at all, and hear a sudden chorus of grunts and groans as a number of other people seem to appear around you, each of them caught up in the same whirlwind of pseudo-motion. It gets to the point that you start to black out, though, just as your vision goes dark, you hear the fae woman whisper breathily in your ear. “Maybe it’s not with me,” she says, “but you *are* about to get tangled up with someone. Say hi to your friends for me!” And then you lose consciousness. [[Wake up->FE08DB]] (if: $faepromise is true)[Screw this. You’re not going to let this lady boss you around any more. Spiders and forests, magic and monsters, tricks and traps, you’re done letting all this crap push you around! You’ve already beaten her twice now, and yet she *still* persists in terrorizing you. So maybe it’s time to give her a beat-down that she won’t soon forget. At least, that’s what you’d *like* to do. Muscles lock in place, limbs refuse to move, every nerve ending numbing as you become overwhelmed with some kind of paralysis. “Unnf – wha?” you murmur. You seem… tense.” You growl and snarl, but nothing other than your lips moves at your command. She just chuckles as she gently brushes her hand through your hair, pinching the fuzz between your ears. “My, you’re certainly angry today.” “Can you blame me?” you snap back. “You keep showing up to bother me.” She grins and moves in closer, pressing her chest against your side. “Maybe that’s just because there’s something I find… irresistible about you.” You try to pull away, but your body refuses to move. “Also, you’ve turned my wife into a tomato plant.” The fae woman adopts a mock expression of offense. “Now why would you think that? But I think the game can get a bit more… heated, don’t you?” Her mouth is an inch from your ear when she says this, her breath hot and heavy. You don’t know much about the fae, but the one thing that all the stories agree on is that knowing their name gives you some amount of power over them. She stops what she’s doing, hand still raised in the air, and looks at you curiously. “Yes?” she says bemusedly. “What is it?” You narrow your eyes. “I won your game before and guessed your name. She takes a moment to examine it before, with a playful wink in your direction, she takes a deep breath and inhales. She wanders into the room shortly after Krysta does, nervously peering into the dark corners of the cave, not noticing the shadow descending from above. (if: $candy is false)[[[Begin your new job->FE08DX]]] (if: $candy is true)[[[Begin your new job->FE08DY]]] ] With all of you snugly secured and thoroughly gagged, none of you make much sound. But that doesn’t mean that you don’t scream. The spider-women prove to be just as adept at giving you pleasure as using you all to elicit it for themselves.
