It feels like days have passed before any of you get even the slightest moment of reprieve. Their leader said you were communal property, and the community just continues to grow as more and more spider women flock from every corner of the galaxy to join the colony and partake of its amenities. Over time, more cocooned captives are brought in to line the winding halls of the cavern, and their muffled grunts of pleasure echo across the stone non-stop, mingling with those of you and your friends. You feel bad for them, of course, but also somewhat thankful, since more options for the sex slave buffet means each individual course of the meal has more time to marinate unmolested. Whatever enterprise the spider women are engaging in here seems to be quite successful. Successful enough that they gain power, influence, and wealth on the galactic stage, enough that there’s never any danger of their settlement being overtaken. Sadly, what that means for you and the other slaves is that rescue never comes. And thanks to the properties of the planet’s Ghost Matter, woven into the fibers of your silken cocoons, it also means you’ll be able to stay like this forever. You’ll never need to eat or sleep, never grow tired, never age a day, meaning that for the rest of your lives, you’ll be the perfect sex toys to slake the endless lust of your new owners. If only you’d just played that damn fae woman’s game, you often think to yourself. At least you’d have had a chance to avoid this fate. But you made your choice and she punished you for it, and now there’s nothing left to do but accept that you and your friends will be paying for that decision for the rest of your lives. GAME OVER [[Start over->A0X]]With all of you snugly secured and thoroughly gagged, none of you make much sound. But that doesn’t mean that you don’t scream. The spider-women prove to be just as adept at giving you pleasure as using you all to elicit it for themselves. They go on for hours, taking turns, swapping one slave out for another, each of them eager to have a go at every one of their new toys. It feels like days have passed before any of you get even the slightest moment of reprieve. Their leader said you were communal property, and the community just continues to grow as more and more spider women flock from every corner of the galaxy to join the colony and partake of its amenities. Over time, more cocooned captives are brought in to line the winding halls of the cavern, and their muffled grunts of pleasure echo across the stone non-stop, mingling with those of you and your friends. You feel bad for them, of course, but also somewhat thankful, since more options for the sex slave buffet means each individual course of the meal has more time to marinate unmolested. This continues for many years. Thanks to the properties of the planet’s Ghost Matter woven into the fibers of your cocoons, you never need to eat or sleep, and never age a day, meaning that you look more or less the same as when you were first captured as you do when you’re finally released. It’s all because of that Star Scout homing beacon you swallowed ages ago at the start of your adventure that a passing Scout happens to pick up on the distress signal and come in to investigate. Though she’s not able to free you immediately, she does secure a deal with the spider-women that after a hundred years they’ll finally release you. By the time you and your friends finally get to move again, the galaxy is much changed from how you remember it. Surely, it will hold many adventures for you and your friends now, but that’s a different story than this one. Maybe if you’d just played that fae woman’s game, all those years ago, things would have turned out differently, but that’s not the reality you currently occupy. Needless to say, whatever you get up to now, you’ve still completely failed your mission. GAME OVER [[Start over->A0X]]You’re about to make your choice, when suddenly the coin stops mid-air. For a moment you just stare at it in confusion, before turning and raising an eyebrow at the fae woman. “Yes, yes, that was me. But I have a good reason for it,” she says with a grin. “Look, I know you folks at home have your own lives, and you don’t want to waste precious seconds clicking on blue letters to try to unlock sexy pictures. And while adding an element of randomness is fun, it can get old quickly. I’m not so cruel that I’d let you get all the way up to this point multiple times, then give you the ending you hadn’t seen yet anyway. So, here’s what I’m going to do. I’ll tell you straight up, that the coin is going to land on $coin. Up to you if you choose to believe me, of course, but I have no reason to lie. After all, even if you beat me, I’m only losing in a single timeline, and there’s a hundred more where I don’t. Regardless, anti-cheating measures are still in effect, so please don't do anything foolish.” Then she snaps her fingers again, and the coin starts to move once more… and you can’t remember a thing that she just said. But you don’t have time to dwell on that, since you need to call the flip now before the coin lands! (link: "Heads!")[ (set: $flip to "heads") (go-to: "FE08EA") ] (link: "Tails!")[ (set: $flip to "tails") (go-to: "FE08EA") ] (if: $faepromise is true)[[[Mira!->FE08ED]]](if: $zita is true)[](else: )[(replace:?sidebar)[|undo>[(link: " ↶" )[(go-to: "CHEAT")]]]] The coin spins round and round, the golden light reflecting off of Revissa’s features as it makes its circuit through the air. You catch it in your palm and slam it down, then pull your hand away to reveal the side it landed on. (if: $coin is "heads")[Heads!](else: )[Tails!] (if: ($flip and $coin is "heads") or ($flip and $coin is "tails"))[You feel a rush of excitement as you realize what that means. “Guess I win, huh?” you say, grinning wildly at the fae woman. [[Claim your reward->FE08F]]](else: )[Your heart sinks as you realize what that means. “Oh, so sorry, but it looks like you’ve lost.” [[Accept your fate->FE08EB]]] (set: $coinguess to true) You can hardly believe it! You look down at the coin, marveling at the simplicity of it all. “I… won?” you murmur in confusion. The fae woman chuckles. “I did say it was a fair game, didn’t I? Which means you were equally as likely to win as you were to lose.” “Yeah, but… I just kind of thought you’d have rigged it or something,” you admit. “Me? Never! I am a woman with an impeccable moral compass,” the fae says, lying brazenly. “What’s wrong? Were you hoping to see the Game Over scenario first? I warn you, I wouldn’t recommend it. You need to abide by the results of what happened, even if you *wanted* to lose.” You scratch your head. It’s not like you wanted to lose… though you admit you’re a bit curious as to what she would have done if you had. “Anyway, rules are rules, and fair is fair, so you’re owed a boon, I believe?” the fae says, flicking her finger to once again perform her magic. All at once, the curio shop fades away, and you’re assaulted by a vertigo-inducing sensation of not-quite-motion, shifting between one plane of reality to another. When it finally stops, you’re back in the forest on Spectra I again … and Revissa is once more hale and hearty by your side! “Are you okay?” you yell, running over to her. Your wife shivers for a moment, and then starts patting at her backside. “Yes… I’m fine. But why does it feel like someone’s been groping my butt?” “Err… it’s a long story.” The fae woman claps her hands to get your attention. “Anyway, girls, I don’t have all day (that’s a lie, $yourname, but we don’t need to let them know that), so why don’t you tell me about that boon of yours, yes?” Revissa narrows her eyes at you. “Don’t tell me - did you agree to yet another one of her games!” You throw your arms up in the air. “I had no choice!” “There’s always a choice!” Revissa protests. “She said we’d be guaranteed to be captured by spiders if I didn’t play,” you counter. Though… speaking of spiders. Weren’t you in the process of running away from one just now? You nervously glance around the area… and then happen to spot a shadow nestled in the branches of a nearby tree. Well, crap, it looks like she’s found you. Any moment now, she’ll be sure to pounce. Though… you can’t help but notice that the fae lady is standing between you and her. And that gives you a wicked little idea… You look towards the fae and smile. “So, you said I get to propose a rule, right?” you say. “And the only condition is that it applies to both of us equally?” “That’s right,” the woman says. “In that case… the rule is thus: **Both of us are equally helpless at escaping from spider-silk cocoons**” She raises an eyebrow. “Wait, whaa—--- aaaaack!” Just like you predicted, the spider-woman pounces. But her first target is the one that was closest to her. The fae lady sails through the air in an instant, falling into the arachnids arms and getting spun around quick as can be. She’s cocooned with such speed and talent it’s hard to even follow, but sure enough, when it’s done, she’s strung up and helpless, exactly as you would be if your positions were reversed. (link:"Mrrphhgghhggmmggph. (Translation - This is fine)")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/F134_FaeWebbed1_by_Dvega.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Dvega(click-replace: "Art by Dvega")[https://www.deviantart.com/dvega https://picarto.tv/Tek]] (set: $picF134 to true)(set: $faecaught to true) You’d love to stay and appreciate the view, but you know better than to press your luck. So you grab Revissa’s hand and make your escape while she’s still distracted by her latest catch. Though you’ve got to figure out which way to run. At this point, you’ve already decided the cliffs are too dangerous. You’re in the center of the forest right now, but surely if you keep going this way, she’s eventually going to catch up. So that just leaves one more viable route. [[Head towards the river->FE06A]] ] “Um… best two out of three?” you ask with a nervous smile. The fae woman smiles right back. “Sure! But… I’m going to need another coin to flip.” And then she snaps her fingers. A strange sense of dizziness and vertigo overtakes you as the surroundings of the curio shop start to suddenly grow. No… it’s not that the shop is growing, it’s that you’re getting smaller! You feel your clothing fall away from your body as it becomes too big to fit you, cascading downwards in a waterfall of flowing cloth. By the time you’re done shrinking, you’re practically buried in your fallen outfit and have to burrow your way out of it. When you finally emerge back into the air of the shop, you’re momentarily blinded by the light from the lamp on a table towering high above you (a lamp in the shape of a woman, you can’t help but notice). In your disorientation, you stumble backwards, slamming against some sort of cold, hard, metal disc. “Ack!” you yell out, trying to scramble away from the object, but you find your skin stuck to it, almost as if by magnetic force. “What the heck?” The fae woman’s laugh, coming from high above you, sounds like an earthquake, the vibrations of her voice making your body shiver merely from the force of the soundwaves. “Like I said… I need another coin,” she rumbles, bending down to show your reflection in a hand mirror (the handle of which is also woman-shaped) gripped in her palm. And that’s when you realize what fate has befallen you. While stumbling around you backed up against a thin metal disc made of gold, probably about ten inches high, though it’s hard to tell the relative length of things when you’ve changed so much in size. But now you’re stuck to that disc, arms and legs flailed out embarrassingly, held in place as the golden color from the surface of the object starts to spread across your own skin! “Wha… no! Come on! This, this isn’t–” The fae woman lets out a cascading chuckle. “You lost the flip, but that’s no reason to flip out. Though you *will* be getting flipped, over and over and over again…” And that’s when you finally realize this isn’t just a metal disc, it’s a gold coin, and you’re becoming fused with it! Looking at your reflection, you can see your body getting partially submerged into the coin, not turned into an etching like Revissa, but more like a relief, embossed inside the circular structure. But at the same time, you’re also transforming into gold, your skin numbing whenever the glittering metal passes over your body. Sadly, there’s nothing you can do to stop it, so after a few seconds, the sensation fully eclipses your body. The last thing you see before your vision goes blank is the blue pupils of your eyes turning a lustrous yellow, completing your transformation. “Wonderful!” the fae woman says, though you can no longer hear her. But you can still *feel* it as she picks you up, her fingers rubbing themselves all over the protruding parts of your golden body. And you can sense a rush of movement as you’re tossed through the air, of spinning swiftly, of landing, of a hand slapping down on your golden frame. “Heads!” the fae woman yells, then flips you again. “And heads again! Looks like I win!” She holds the coin up in front of her face, appreciating her trophy, then sets it down on a table right next to her other new acquisition. (link:"Penny for their thoughts?")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/F131_TwoCoins_by_Takachiro.png" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Takachiro(click-replace: "Art by Takachiro")[https://www.deviantart.com/takazumishan https://twitter.com/ShanTakazumi]] (set: $picF131 to true)(set: $coinguess to true) “I’ll be sure to pick you up again next time I need to do some gambling,” she says brightly, before she leaves the room - and the items in her collection - behind. Back again? Oh dear, you're just a glutton for punishment, aren't you?](else: )[“Oh dear. I must say, I am very disappointed in you. If you recall, I did say not to cheat - and that it applied not just to Melfy, but you folks at home as well. And I would say that clicking undo in an attempt to negate your flip certainly counts as cheating.] Now, it pains me to do this, $yourname, but sadly, actions must have consequences. So here’s what they are for you. First of all, your current game session has ended. You’ll have to find your way back to this scene all on your own. (set: $cheater to true)(set: $yourname to "CHEATER") Second, your name has been permanently changed to CHEATER. At least as far as I am concerned. And I’ve also automatically saved your game, so don’t think that you can just close your browser window to get out of this. Third, as punishment, I’m removing all the story checkpoints you’ve earned up until now. You’ll have to start over from the very beginning and work your way back to this point. Maybe take this opportunity to try out some new paths and discover some new secrets. Or just be mad about it – I don’t really care.(set: $forestboss to false)(set: $merryround to false)(set: $racewin to false)(set: $foreststart to false)(set: $ProgressLevelSelect to false)(set: $ProgressHoloChamber to false)(set: $ProgressGameStart to false)(set: $forestoutpost to false)(set: $forestcomplete4eva to false) Fourth, I have turned you, $yourname, the person playing this game, to stone. Permanently and irreversibly. …what’s that? You’re still here? Lucky you. Sadly, I am bound by multi-dimensional law to maintain a copy of the Prime Timeline whenever I do my meddling. What that means is the moment I turned you to stone, I created a splinter reality rather than alter the existing one. So, rest assured, there’s now an alternate universe where you’ve been reduced to nothing but a mere sculpture (and your body was transformed into your ideal self-image right before it happened, because I’m nice like that). In that universe, a lot of people are going to be quite confused, because petrification isn’t exactly a normal occurrence there. Maybe they’ll put you in a museum or something. Just think, there was a 50% that it could have happened to *you*. Of course, since you’re still reading this, clearly it didn’t, and you’re free to go on living your life thinking this is just a silly browser game, and not a window which an incredibly powerful manipulator of reality occasionally steals glimpses through. I’ve got to say - your universe is awfully boring. Can’t one of you at least invent a freeze ray, or genetically breed actual giant spiders or something? Anyway, that’s all I’ve got to say, $yourname. Go on and click that button there to restart your game. And maybe this time, abide by my rules, hmm?” [[Start over->A0X]] (set: $lastPassage to "")The life of a collectible coin is not particularly eventful. You simply stand there, on display atop the fae woman’s desk, reflecting golden light towards anyone whose eye passes over your body. You don’t hear or see anything, and so for the most part you are simply subjected to long stretches of boredom, lulled into a kind of semi-conscious haze as time passes around you. Your slumber is only broken up by occasional flashes of action, when the world again spins for you, when your function as a coin is utilized to settle matters of chance. These are the moments you live for now, the only purpose you have. It’s hard to tell when you forget that you used to be a person. Your life from before seems so far away now. But of course, there’s another function to coins other than flipping. You’re also a unit of currency. And that aspect comes into play some time in the future, when your owner is in the midst of a tense poker game with some other extra-planar entities. “Raise,” she says, sliding a wolf and a deer across the table to join the pile of valuables in the pot. Her opponent matches the ante, and then calls for the end of the round of betting. When everyone reveals their cards, it turns out the opponent has the better hand, and gleefully rakes the whole set of winnings onto their side of the table. For you, it’s a wonderful sense of motion. Especially when you’re dropped into a bag, and Revissa’s coin happens to land right on top of yours. It’s almost like you’re kissing! But eventually the game ends, and your new owner takes their winnings back to their home, emptying the bag over the top of a pile of assorted treasure in a vault somewhere. And then… you’re forgotten about. No one ever comes back to claim you. You’re never needed again, not for flipping, not for paying, not for anything. In the end, your whole life just amounted to a tiny increase in the ledgers of some unfathomable being that exists outside of time and space. If there’s one tiny silver lining to your endless golden existence, it’s that you can feel Revissa laying right beside you. So at least you’ll both always be together, even if no one will ever be thinking of you again. GAME OVER [[Start over->A0X]]The life of a collectible coin is not particularly eventful. You simply stand there, on display atop the fae woman’s desk, reflecting golden light towards anyone whose eye passes over your body. You don’t hear or see anything, and so for the most part you are simply subjected to long stretches of boredom, lulled into a kind of semi-conscious haze as time passes around you. Your slumber is only broken up by occasional flashes of action, when the world again spins for you, when your function as a coin is utilized to settle matters of chance. These are the moments you live for now, the only purpose you have. It’s hard to tell when you forget that you used to be a person. Your life from before seems so far away now. But of course, there’s another function to coins other than flipping. You’re also a unit of currency. And that aspect comes into play some time in the future, when your owner is in the midst of a tense poker game with some other extra-planar entities. “Raise,” she says, sliding a wolf and a deer across the table to join the pile of valuables in the pot. Her opponent matches the ante, and then calls for the end of the round of betting. When everyone reveals their cards, it turns out the opponent has the better hand, and gleefully rakes the whole set of winnings onto their side of the table. For you, it’s a wonderful sense of motion. Especially when you’re dropped into a bag, and Revissa’s coin happens to land right on top of yours. It’s almost like you’re kissing! But eventually the game ends, and your new owner takes their winnings back to their home, emptying the bag over the top of a pile of assorted treasure in a vault somewhere. And then… you’re forgotten about. It’s not until many years later that a Star Scout happens to be conducting an audit on the assets of a certain eldritch horror and notices a coin sending out a signal corresponding to an old distress frequency. She purchases the coin and its neighbor and manages to get the two of you restored - though it’s been hundreds of years since you were first transformed. And so you find yourself stepping into a galaxy that has changed immensely since you were last a part of it. An exciting new adventure, to be sure, but also rather outside the scope of this one. Of course, it also goes without saying, but you failed the mission you were initially hired to complete. GAME OVER [[Start over->A0X]]You continue on for quite some time through the river, making good progress towards the entrance and what you hope is the relative safety of the open fields outside the forest. But as you move with the flow, you remember something. The river goes past the Knottie outpost you encountered earlier in your quest. And last you checked, Ros’eela was still there. It would be wrong to just leave her, especially with this spider lady prowling the area. {Sure, she’s frozen and mounted on a wall at the moment, but that just means she wouldn’t even be able to fend for herself if the arachnid predator decided she’d look better hanging from *her* wall, instead.} No matter how you slice it, you decide the right thing to do would be to head back there. And so you give Revissa a tug on her fin and point towards the surface of the water, indicating you’d like to pop back up to have a chat. “What’s wrong?” she asks, her mermaid face bobbing above the water. Luckily, the magic that transformed her makes her equally adept at breathing in air as she is with water while in this shape. “We should check in on the outpost again,” you say. “It’s not fair to leave Ros’eela behind while there’s a predator wandering the area.” Revissa sighs, but eventually nods her head in agreement. “Alright. Help me out onto the shore and I’ll change back.” One downside to her mermaid form is that it’s not particularly convenient for her to revert to a humanoid while underwater; suddenly losing gills in the middle of doing magic can be very disorienting, not to mention a drowning hazard. So you climb out first, then offer a hand to your wife to remove her from the river. She accepts it and allows you to pull her up, then slowly makes the motions to return herself to her normal shape. “Let’s just hope Ros’eela is more reasonable than you are,” Revissa says once she’s finished, and the two of you start walking towards the outpost. You raise an eyebrow. “What’s that supposed to mean?” “I mean, she might be excited by the prospect of getting webbed up and intentionally surrender herself.” That gives you pause. “Hey wait… is that an option? Because I mean, a few years as a webbed up sex slave wouldn’t be so ba—ow!” You yell as Revissa angrily knees you in the rump. “Fine, fine, no getting caught intentionally,” you say. By now, the buildings of the settlement are coming into view. Unfortunately, something else is as well. The webbing flies out from a direction you weren’t expecting, catching you on the chest and sending you careening backwards onto the forest floor. “Damnit!” Revissa yells, holding out her staff to begin the incantation for a spell. But she doesn’t get the chance to finish it before the spider pounces on her from above. A moment later, and she’s in no position to do anything at all. (link:"Watch her wiggle")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/F14_RevissaWebbedForest_by_Faust1173.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Faust1173(click-replace: "Art by Faust1173")[https://www.furaffinity.net/user/faust1173/]] (set: $picF14 to true)(set: $revissacaught to true) She’s wrapped up tight, cocooned from top to bottom - save for her breasts, made more prominent by the way the silk hugs their tops and bottoms. Plaintive grunts pour out from her gagged lips, the only sound she can make as she desperately searches for a way to escape. But she can’t find one – and neither can you. By the time you recover from the spider-woman’s sneak attack, peeling off the glob of silk stuck to your chest, she’s finished wrapping up Revissa and is ready to move on to you. You’d love to say you put up a good fight before she caught you, but it would be a lie. In a moment, you’re just as helpless as your wife.] |drink1)[(link:"Mmph")[(show:?drink2)]] |drink2)[<img src="images/F116_MelfyWebbed_by_Faust1173.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Faust1173(click-replace: "Art by Faust1173")[https://www.furaffinity.net/user/faust1173/]] (set: $picF116 to true) “Gotta say, you two gave me quite the workout!” the woman says, taking a moment to caress your exposed bosom. “I completely lost track of you when you jumped into the water like that. It was pure dumb luck that I heard you bickering over here.” The two of you exchange helpless glances, both of you equal parts annoyed and humiliated that you’d forgotten to keep your voices down. But there’s nothing to do about it now. You’re both caught and cocooned, and utterly powerless to do anything about it. Once she’s done playing with your bodies, the spider lady takes a step towards the abandoned outpost and surveys its layout. “Hrmm… not bad,” she says. “I mean, it’s no space yacht, but it’s better than a bunch of dreary old caves, at least. I just hope there’s someplace good for storing slaves.” And then she slings each of your wriggling forms over a shoulder and has herself a look around. (set: $revissacaught to true) (if: $faestonecollect is true)[[[Take a tour->FE04HB]]](else: )[[[Take a tour->FE04HA]]] ]After a quick search she locates the storage room of one of the living quarters, and strings you up against a support beam, nodding approvingly at the way you add to the ambience. (link:"Hang out")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/F101_MelfyWebbedCeiling_by_Dvega.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Dvega(click-replace: "Art by Dvega")[https://www.deviantart.com/dvega https://picarto.tv/Tek]] (set: $picF101 to true) She strokes your tail lovingly, savoring the softness of your fur, before adhering Revissa to a nearby rafter. Your wife thrashes and squirms valiantly, but all that accomplishes is prompting the spider lady to add more support tethers to her restraints. “Now… hang tight, you two. But I’ve got another cutie I need to pick up.” And then she skitters away. You and Revissa wriggle about for a good twenty minutes, but make absolutely no progress in escaping. By the time the spider woman returns, you’re both exhausted, with nothing to show for your efforts. “I’m back! And I brought company!” She’s got the fae woman slung over her shoulder, wiggling just as helplessly as you had been. Well, it’s nice to know she’s following the rule you set for her. Though it doesn’t really do you much good as she glued in place beside you.] |drink1)[(link:"Mrrpgghhmmmphhhrgghh. (Translation - this is decidedly *not* fine. A little help here, $yourname? Would you be so kind as to pick a series of choices that gets me out of this?)")[(show:?drink2)]] |drink2)[<img src="images/F135_FaeWebbed2_by_Faust1173.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Faust1173(click-replace: "Art by Faust1173")[https://www.furaffinity.net/user/faust1173/]] (set: $picF135 to true) “That’ll do. This place doesn’t seem so bad. And now we’ve even got some… entertainment.” She cups the fae woman’s breasts, eliciting a weak moan from the bundled up captive. Perhaps the rule you forced on her also makes her share in your fetish for this kind of stuff? And it might just be your imagination, but has her chest grown even larger since the last time you saw it? “But… I do think we could do with some more. We’ve got a lot of horny girls back in the caves.” After a moment of thought, she skitters over to you, and slices away the silk that was wound over your mouth. “Oh, my name is Tula, but the way. I’m your new owner, and you’re my new slave.” You do your best to flash her a smile. “Nice to meet you, I’m Me–” “I don’t care what your name is, slave,” she says, cutting you off by pressing the pointed tip of one of her back legs against your cheek. “But I have noticed that you seem fairly knowledgeable about this place. So… maybe you know where I can find some more cuties for my collection? Lead me to enough of them and maybe I’ll hang you up somewhere with a better view.” Okay, this might be your chance. Maybe you can use her desire for more slaves against her. But is there anyone who you could tell her about that would be of any help? [[Tell her about the rest of your crew->FE04A]](if: $petalfriend is true or $petalescape is true)[ [[Tell her about Petal->FE04B]]](if: $rosawake is true)[ [[Tell her about Ros’eela->FE04C]]] [[Make someone up->FE04E]] [[Refuse to help her->FE04F]] ]“It… preys on your fears,” you say quickly. “It probes your mind to find the thing you’re most afraid of, and brings those thoughts to the forefront.” This isn’t… entirely true, you know. Because when you and Revissa were here before, it tried to trap you in quicksand, and that’s not something you’ve ever been particularly concerned about. Action heroes from the cartoons and movies you used to watch as a kid seemed to run into quicksand pretty often, but now that you’re a seasoned adventurer you’ve learned it’s not nearly as common a threat as you’d been led to believe. Now, *spiders* on the other hand… “Hah!” Tula scoffs. “How unlucky for it, because I’m not afraid of anything!” You nod. “That’s good. But if you *were* afraid of something, you’d have to be very careful not to think about it. Otherwise it could be really bad for you.” Hopefully this will work. Generally speaking, the best way to get someone to think about something is to tell them *not* to think about it. So if she *does* have something that she’s afraid of… Tula’s face suddenly wrinkles in consternation. “Do… do you smell that?” she asks. You take a whiff of the air. Huh, actually, you *do* smell something. Or at least, the illusions are telling you that you do. Is that… coconut? “No! Why would that – this isn’t even a tropical climate! How could it – ack!” She doubles over, holding her chest like she’s got a stomach cramp. Could it be? Is her fear that she’s… allergic to coconut? “You know, I *did* take some scans earlier, and found that some of the berry bushes here bore fruit with a surprisingly similar chemical composition to coconut” you lie, smiling devilishly. The spider woman groans. “Ugggggh, damnit! I have to— urrrrk.” She turns around and starts running for cover, looking like she’s about to have a violent bowel movement. But before she gets too far she suddenly gets a placid, far-away look in her eyes, and falls to the ground. Before long, she’s curled herself into a ball and fallen asleep, just like the Knottie and the other spider-lady from earlier. Score another victory for the fearsome predator! Though… unlike last time, your equipment isn’t anywhere nearby. So how are you going to cut yourself free? Thankfully, she didn’t tether you in place to anything, so after some effort you’re able to wiggle and squirm up the side of a tree to get yourself onto your feet. Presumably, you could bend your knees and hop to get around and eventually make it back to where you were caught and cocooned to reclaim your knife. But that’s going to take forever. Maybe you should try searching for something other than a knife? (set: $tulasleep to true) [[Head back for your equipment->FE05AA]] [[Find something to cut yourself free->FE05D]] “It… preys on your desires,” you say quickly. “It probes your mind to find the thing that you want the most, and brings those thoughts to the forefront.” That is entirely untrue, of course. Because when you and Revissa were here before, it tried to trap you in quicksand, and that’s not something you’ve ever been particularly hot and bothered by. Now, *spiders* on the other hand… Tula raises a disbelieving eyebrow. “Really? Then why did I just get slammed to the ground by a windstorm? Does it think I’m a tornado chaser or something?” “Erm… no, not exactly,” you sputter, trying to think of a worthwhile lie. “It’s just that it gets stronger the hornier you are, so…” “Horny? I can’t say I was particularly aroused by our little excursion,” Tula replies. You feign embarrassment. “Erm… it wasn’t *you* who was horny…” The spider woman processes that for a moment, and then bursts out laughing. “You really enjoy being kidnapped that much, do you?” “Only when the kidnapper is as gorgeous as you are,” you say, flashing her your winningest smile. “My, you are a charmer. But don’t think that’s going to do you any good. You’re still my slave, after all.” She slides over to you and inspects your body, poking and prodigy you every which way. And then her back legs twitch, creating taut tethers of webbing that anchor you to the ground. “So, you say this creature is attracted by lust, do you…” Nervousness flashes past your eyes as you test the strength of her bindings. “Well, yeah, but— mmphh!” She silences you by gluing your lips shut. “Well, let’s test that theory. I’ll send you to heaven and see if that draws out the monster - and then I can condemn it to hell.” “Mmpphh?!” (link:"Wiggle and squirm")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/F121_MelfyWebbedSitting_by_Dvega.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Dvega(click-replace: "Art by Dvega")[https://www.deviantart.com/dvega https://picarto.tv/Tek]] (set: $picF121 to true) You’re not sure if this is a good thing or a bad thing - though it’s definitely going to be an *enjoyable* thing. With little other choice, you sit there in your silk bindings and surrender as the spider woman climbs on top of you. [[Sleep with her->FE05BA]] ] They say that honesty is the best policy. Though of course, they probably weren’t kidnapped by sexy spider-ladies and threatened with a lifetime of slavery when they said that. But still, you think they may have been onto something there. If you lie and Tula ends up getting lost, she’ll probably take her frustrations out on you. But if you tell her the truth, maybe there will be an opportunity to give her the slip while she’s contending with navigating towards her absent compatriot. “It’s not real,” you tell her. “The wind, none of it. There’s a monster that makes its home out here, but it uses some kind of psychic powers to fill your mind with illusions and disorient you. After you get overwhelmed by it you tend to just curl up and fall asleep. At least, that’s what happened to the lady who was chasing me.” Tula frowns. “Then how did you avoid getting caught?” “You just have to believe in yourself, basically. Ignore your senses and keep going forward. Trust in your instincts. Though I was only trying to *escape* from it, not beat it. If you’re itching for a fight, I don’t have much more to tell you.” “Hrmph,” she grunts, before gluing your lips shut once more. She has nothing more to say as she scoops you back up and keeps walking. The wind keeps blowing, but you - and now Tula - know that it’s not really there, and so she pushes forward, heading further and further into the forest. Eventually, she reaches the area where you first met the psychic bunny. And her companion is right where you left her… though in a much different state than you remember. (link:"Take a long, hard look")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/F126_ZerylStone_by_ZeroTwo9S.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by ZeroTwo9S(click-replace: "Art by ZeroTwo9S")[https://www.deviantart.com/zerotwo9s https://twitter.com/Zerotwo9S]] (set: $picF126 to true) “Zeryl?” Tula walks up to the stone figure and runs a finger along her body to test if it’s another illusion. “What the hell happened?” She turns back to you, angrily demanding an explanation. But all you can do is shrug. She was sleeping when you last saw her. Though, looking around, you notice all the Knottie women you had noticed earlier are also scattered about as inert hunks of stone. You wonder if they’re still conscious in their petrified prisons, still trapped in whatever mental trickery the predator had subjected them too. There’s no way to know. “Well… whatever this damn this is, I’m going to kill it!” The spider-woman seethes with rage, dropping you to the floor then spinning around to glare at every shadow from every nearby tree. “Are you here? Well, are you?! Come out and fight, damn you!” Her murderous intent is palpable. The predator must be able to feel it too, wherever it is. Which probably means it’s not going to show itself if it thinks it’s in danger. Though hopefully, Tula will be too distracted trying to challenge it that she won’t notice you trying to wriggle away. You’re just getting started at that when both of you hear something rustling from the bushes nearby. Tula turns to face it. You, smartly, decide not to, and continue worming your way to safety. That is, until you hear something else…] |drink1)[(link:"Crrrkkkkkkk")[(show:?drink2)]] |drink2)[<img src="images/F128_TulaStone_by_ZeroTwo9S.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by ZeroTwo9S(click-replace: "Art by ZeroTwo9S")[https://www.deviantart.com/zerotwo9s https://twitter.com/Zerotwo9S]] (set: $picF128 to true) It’s a sound you’re familiar with, like a cube of ice dropping into a warm glass of water. A crackling echo, the harbinger of flesh succumbing to the grip of stone. You’ve ended up transformed into rock countless times during your adventures, so you’ve developed something of an instinct for it. Which is why you quickly put two and two together, and realize that whatever has done this to her must do it via sight. She’d heard the rustle, turned towards it, and was instantly petrified for her troubles when she made eye contact. You stop moving. Maybe whatever did it to her won’t consider you a threat if you play dead. You also wrench your eyes tightly shut, so you only have your ears and your nose to rely on as something starts shuffling towards you on short, stubby legs. It’s definitely coming towards you, but not with any amount of speed or urgency. Investigating a threat, but not attacking it. You remain still, not reacting even when you hear it right beside you, close enough that you can smell its breath. It reeks of plant matter, which suggests it’s probably an herbivore. That’s good at least. The creature spends some time poking and prodding you, but thankfully decides not to do anything more. As it turns to leave, you risk opening a single eye, and spy the squat form of a large lizard-like creature rumbling away lazily into the forest. A basilisk. Well, good thing you avoided it. Once you’re sure it’s gone, you wriggle over towards Tula’s frozen statue, and manage to cut yourself free of her webbing using the petrified tips of one of her back legs. Your hope was that some special property of her spidery limbs allows her to easily manipulate her silk, and it proves to be correct. Soon you’re free of webbing and able to walk away from the clearing, leaving the statues behind. If you had to guess, the psychic bunny and the prowling lizard had some kind of symbiotic relationship, working together to handle threats to their territory. Tula’s murderous intent prompted the bunny to call in for reinforcements, and this was the result. Definitely good to know. You resolve to stay away from this place from now on. Though as you exit the area, you now have to contend with the issue of rescuing your wife. She’s strung up back at the caverns, and there’s no way in hell you’re leaving without her. Tula seemed content just leaving her hanging there, which potentially means that no one else from her spider conclave has discovered her yet. If you move fast, you might be able to get to her before anyone else does. Alternatively, you might want to first retrace your steps to the orchard where she first caught you, so that you can reclaim the equipment she stripped you of. If a fight breaks out, you’re going to need your gear to protect yourself. [[Head straight to Revissa->FE05E]] [[Grab your gear first->FE05EA]] ] You’ve been cocooned by plenty of spiders in your lifetime, so you generally have a pretty good sense of how strong any particular mass of webbing is going to be. And the stuff that’s around you now seems especially firm. Anything outside of a dedicated cutting implement probably isn’t going to be good enough, so it’s better to take it slow and steady to find one than to waste your time hopping around the forest. And so you get to work. It’s certainly not easy going. You’re wrapped up tight, meaning the only method of propulsion you have is to wiggle and hop, making a series of awkward springing leaps to cover the distance needed. But you keep at it, and after an hour you feel like you’ve covered a decent distance since you started. Unfortunately, you’re also completely exhausted from the effort. This proves to be a problem, because it turns out that Tula wasn’t the only spider hunting in this area. “There you are!” comes a voice from above you. You look up just in time to see the woman before she tackles you to the ground. It’s a familiar face - the second of the spider women who you encountered at the clifftops. And unlike before, you’re in no position to run away and lure her into another trap. “I see Tula left us that other cutie all strung up and waiting for fun,” she says, scooping you up and slinging you over a shoulder. “But I was wondering what happened to this one. She must be getting old, forgetting to tie you down completely.” You wiggle and squirm in protest, but it would be a hopeless endeavor at this point, even if you weren’t already tired out. So you can do nothing but accept your fate as you’re brought back to the caverns. Revissa is strung up right where Tula left her, and after a moment you join her, slathered in webbing side-by-side with your wife. (link:"Mmph")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/F136_MelfyWebbed_by_Leila2015.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Leila2015(click-replace: "Art by Leila2015")[https://www.deviantart.com/leila2015]] (set: $picF136 to true) It’s really not fair. You dealt with one spider lady, and then another, but apparently this cave system is positively swarming with them. Your luck couldn’t hold out forever. And now, you’re completely out of tricks, and forced to accept you’re well and truly caught. (if: $candy is false)[[[Begin your new life->FE05AX]]] (if: $candy is true)[[[Begin your new life->FE05AY]]] ] Hopping halfway through the forest is a terrible idea. Considering how many dangerous things you’ve run into while out here, chances are you’d run into one of them while you’re powerless to defend yourself. Better to take a look around and find some alternative to severing these silken bonds. And so, you start to hop aimlessly, not quite sure what you’re looking for. You leave Tula’s slumbering form behind, careful not to wake her, and head in a random direction deeper into the forest. Navigation is still quite difficult this far in, but before long you manage to stumble back into the spot where you first met the fearsome predator bunny. Though this time… things have changed. (link:"See what's a mere stone's throw away")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/F126_ZerylStone_by_ZeroTwo9S.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by ZeroTwo9S(click-replace: "Art by ZeroTwo9S")[https://www.deviantart.com/zerotwo9s https://twitter.com/Zerotwo9S]] (set: $picF126 to true) You see the spider-woman who had been chasing you earlier, one of the two sisters from the cliffs, but now instead of being curled up and asleep, she’s standing, literally, still as stone. Is this another illusion? Or is there something else at work here? Carefully, you shimmy over to the hardened criminal, nudging up against her stone body to see if she reacts. Predictably, the only response is a dull, stony thump. Though now, an idea occurs to you. All these spider ladies have been really adept at manipulating their webbing while wrapping you up, and none of them have ever had any difficulty snipping away tethers or slicing away gags when needed. Every time they did that, they would use the tip of one of their spindly back legs. Is there perhaps something special about those limbs? And… would whatever special feature they have still function while they are stone? Only one way to find out. You position yourself up against the petrified edge of her leg and start to move, and, to your satisfaction, you feel the webbing begin to slice away. Success! It takes a few minutes, but eventually you manage to completely free yourself. You’re not entirely sure what did this to her, but a glance around the area reveals more stone statues of the slumbering Knotties you had noticed as well. Probably best not to stick around, lest you want to join them. Though as you exit the area, you now have to contend with the issue of rescuing your wife. She’s strung up back at the caverns, and there’s no way in hell you’re leaving without her. Tula seemed content just leaving her hanging there, which potentially means that no one else from her spider conclave has discovered her yet. If you move fast, you might be able to get to her before anyone else does. Alternatively, you might want to first retrace your steps to the orchard where she first caught you, so that you can reclaim the equipment she stripped you of. If a fight breaks out, you’re going to need your gear to protect yourself. [[Head straight to Revissa->FE05E]] [[Grab your gear first->FE05EA]] ] A massive change in the leadership of the spider-girl colonies begins to play out over the next few days. Tula had been in charge before, but the lady who caught you argues that the fact she lost control over you, to the point that you were hopping around in the forest, means that she’s lost her touch. You gather that their culture is heavily based on survival of the fittest rules, and now that Tula has been shown to be unfit, no one seems particularly interested in finding out what happened to her. You and Revissa get claimed by the new leader, whose name is Zauzyne, you eventually discover, and are dragged back to her personal quarters to be her helpless playthings. Apparently the old leader had instituted a policy of ‘communal property’, where captured slaves were to be shared among all the residents, but Zauzyne tosses that right out, happy to keep you both on a permanent basis. And since the silk that binds you is infused with the planet’s Ghost Matter, there’s no need for maintenance on your cocooned bodies, ensuring she can completely ignore the two of you whenever she doesn’t need you to slake her lust. This new arrangement continues for several weeks. During that time, Zauzyne seems heavily fixated on showing off her strength, of proving that she deserves to lead. This eventually culminates in her organizing a full-scale assault on the Knottie camp near the ruins, in an effort to gain more slaves for herself and her followers. She leaves one night after firing up her troops — and never returns. You’ll never know exactly what happened, but suffice to say, you can only guess that she wasn’t nearly as good of a leader as she thought she was, and now it is she and her kin who are the slaves. Not that does you and Revissa any good, because you’re still wrapped up in the depths of a sprawling cave system, trapped in silk that will stay firm and fresh indefinitely. You have no idea what happened to the rest of your crew - maybe they also were caught by one of the other perils on the planet, or maybe they tried their best to find you but eventually were forced to give up. Either way, they don’t ever show up for you. Sadly, that means you’re condemned to solitude, locked away and forgotten, never to see the outside world again. GAME OVER [[Start over->A0X]]A massive change in the leadership of the spider-girl colonies begins to play out over the next few days. Tula had been in charge before, but the lady who caught you argues that the fact she lost control over you, to the point that you were hopping around in the forest, means that she’s lost her touch. You gather that their culture is heavily based on survival of the fittest rules, and now that Tula has been shown to be unfit, no one seems particularly interested in finding out what happened to her. You and Revissa get claimed by the new leader, whose name is Zauzyne, you eventually discover, and are dragged back to her personal quarters to be her helpless playthings. Apparently the old leader had instituted a policy of ‘communal property’, where captured slaves were to be shared among all the residents, but Zauzyne tosses that right out, happy to keep you both on a permanent basis. And since the silk that binds you is infused with the planet’s Ghost Matter, there’s no need for maintenance on your cocooned bodies, ensuring she can completely ignore the two of you whenever she doesn’t need you to slake her lust. This new arrangement continues for several weeks. During that time, Zauzyne seems heavily fixated on showing off her strength, of proving that she deserves to lead. This eventually culminates in her organizing a full-scale assault on the Knottie camp near the ruins, in an effort to gain more slaves for herself and her followers. She leaves one night after firing up her troops — and never returns. You only find out what happened weeks later, when Krysta manages to track the two of you down thanks to the Star Scout homing beacon you swallowed at the start of your adventure. She says about a dozen spider-woman showed up at the Knottie camp, and were promptly defeated thanks to the superior numbers and homefield advantage of the defending team. Now it’s all of them who will be the slaves. Sadly, the Knotties also released some kind of electro-static net over the orchard the spider-women were cultivating in retaliation for their assault, and the data collection device you’d planted there was destroyed in the process. Without it, the mission is a failure, and you’re forced to return to your ship and leave the planet empty-handed. Though at least you do so with the knowledge that a bunch of sexy spider-babes will be getting a taste of their own medicine for a long, long time. GAME OVER [[Start over->A0X]]You decide that time is of the essence. It’s more important to get to your wife’s side and work on freeing her than it is recovering your weapons. Besides, given your track record so far, you’re pretty sure a direct confrontation with a spider lady is going to end poorly for you whether you’ve got weapons or not. And so, you double back through the forest with due haste, heading straight for the cliffs. After some effort you locate the cavern entrance where you were dragged to when Tula first caught you, and to your relief, you find that Revissa is still strung up right where the woman left her. “Did you miss me?” you say with a smirk. But as soon as she notices you her expression changes. She grunts and groans, squirming around, frantically moving her eyes up towards the ceiling above her. It’s a warning! Is there a spider-babe lurking nearby? That question soon answers itself when you hear a high-pitched squee of delight. “Eeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee! Oh my gawwwwds, look at this cutie!” a voice says excitedly, before a silk-clad shadow drops down upon you. (link:"Mmph")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/F136_MelfyWebbed_by_Leila2015.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Leila2015(click-replace: "Art by Leila2015")[https://www.deviantart.com/leila2015]] (set: $picF136 to true) It’s rather depressing how quickly the fight ends in your attacker’s favor. You’re grabbed and snagged, bundled up in silk and tethered to the ceiling side-by-side with your wife before you even manage to get a word off. “Yay! I caught something! Ahhh… and she’s so cute!” says your captor, reaching out to stroke one of your fuzzy ears lovingly. As she does, she finally steps out of the shadows, allowing you to get a good look at her. ] |drink1)[(link:"Check her out")[(show:?drink2)]] |drink2)[<img src="images/F07_MerryArt_by_DreamOns.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Dreamons(click-replace: "Art by Dreamons")[https://www.deviantart.com/dreamons2]] (set: $picF07 to true) She has bright pink skin and big, beady green eyes, that look bright and eager, and she’s wearing a pretty silken dress that’s open in the back to show off the fuzzy fur covering her back legs. Unlike the other arachnids you’ve met up until now, this one is more cute than gorgeous, and seems decidedly less threatening. Though that didn’t stop her from defeating you instantly. “My name is Merry!” she says giddily. “And we’re going to be the bestest of friends! I promise I’ll play with you every single day, and give you lots of snuggles at night, too!” Well… at least she’s friendly. She spends the next few hours giving you tons of hugs and kisses before another of her kind shows up. “Ugh, I looked all over, but I couldn’t find the escapee,” says a voice from near the entrance. “Though I did pick up her stuff. Maybe it will lead us to her.” The woman that enters is familiar to you - the second of the two sisters who attacked you back near the cliffs. She doesn’t notice you at first, probably because she’s got her nose buried in your communicator device. “Hi Zauzyne!” Merry says, nuzzling her cheek against your own. “Are you maybe talking about this cutie?” Zauzyne looks up and groans. “Oh come on! She was supposed to be mine!” Merry pouts. “Well, I caught her fair and square, so now we’re gonna be friends. Besides, Tula caught her before you did, so if she was gonna go to anyone, it should have been her.” “Yeah, well, Tula’s not answering her calls anymore, so I’m gonna guess something in the forest got her. Which means I’m in charge now, and I say that wolf belongs to me!” Merry hugs you protectively, but Zauzyne seems quite adamant that you should belong to her. [[Watch how this plays out->FE05EB]] (if: $gagtalk is true)[[[Interject->FE05F]]] ] You decide that grabbing your equipment is more important than getting back to your wife as quickly as possible. And so, you creep through the forest, retracing your steps back to the place where you were first caught. The orchard area is much how you left it, the fruit from the trees as fragrant as ever. After a bit of searching, you find your discarded items on the ground, and busy yourself getting everything organized. Unfortunately, that’s when trouble strikes. “There you are!” comes a voice from above you. You look up just in time to see the woman before she tackles you to the ground. It’s a familiar face - the second of the spider women who you encountered at the clifftops. But unlike before, you’re in no position to run away and lure her into another trap. “I see Tula left us that other cutie all strung up and waiting for fun,” she says, scooping you up and slinging you over a shoulder. “But I was wondering what happened to this one. She must be getting old, letting you get away from her like that.” You wiggle and squirm in protest, but it would be a hopeless endeavor at this point, even if you weren’t already naked and without a weapon. So you can do nothing as she slathers you with more silk, winding you up nice and tight to the point that escape is no longer an option. After that, it’s a quick trip back to the caverns. Revissa is strung up right where Tula left her, and after a moment, you join her. (link:"Mmph")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/F136_MelfyWebbed_by_Leila2015.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Leila2015(click-replace: "Art by Leila2015")[https://www.deviantart.com/leila2015]] (set: $picF136 to true) It’s really not fair. You dealt with one spider lady, and then another, but apparently this cave system is positively swarming with them. Your luck couldn’t hold out forever. And now, you’re completely out of tricks, and forced to accept you’re well and truly caught. (if: $candy is false)[[[Begin your new life->FE05AX]]] (if: $candy is true)[[[Begin your new life->FE05AY]]] ] In general, one does not simply have sex with a spider-babe. Instead, *she* has sex with *you*. During intercourse, you’re treated more or less like an object. Yes, a spider-babe will see to it that you get pleasured, but that’s mostly just because they love the taste of your fluids, and they love the sound of the moans you make as you mewl helplessly into your gag. All this is to say that the next fifteen minutes are quite satisfying. However, the love-making session does not exactly end as expected. Because right as things are reaching their maximum level of hot and steamy, Tula’s body starts to sag. She’s right in the middle of grinding her hips against your knee, using you as nothing more than a tool for stimulation when her eyes droop. For a moment, she has a look of confusion on her face, but that slowly gives way to a sort of blank contentment. And then she backs away, curls up on the ground, and falls asleep. You’d be perplexed by this turn of events, but you’d seen it once before. This is exactly what happened to the previous spider woman who captured you, when she became overwhelmed by the psychic pulsations from the mysterious predator that lures people into its clutches here in the deepest part of the woods. And now it seems like it has claimed another victim. It’s incredibly lucky that you knew enough about it to avoid suffering the same fate. Although… “Grrmmmphh! Mmmmfggghh! Mm-mmmphh!” There’s another problem. Namely, that you are bound, gagged, and anchored to the forest floor with webbing, rendering you utterly incapable of any sort of movement. Try as you might, your body refuses to budge. This… is not ideal. You can’t even stand up, nor can you roll along the ground, meaning that for all intents and purposes, you’re just as helpless as Tula is. And at least *she* seems to be getting treated to some pleasant dreams while she’s trapped. Unfortunately, there’s not really a solution to this puzzle. All you can do is sit here and wiggle impotently, waiting for something to come along to change the dynamic of the situation. [[Along comes a lizard…->FE05BC]] You’re not entirely sure how much time passes while you wait. It might even be multiple days, with nothing to help you spend the time other than the sound of Tula’s steady breathing coming from her slumbering form nearby. But eventually, something does change. The best way you can describe it is like a dizziness spell. Suddenly you feel disoriented and distracted, your vision going blurry and your ears ringing with white noise. This, you figure, must be the work of that predator bunny again. But what purpose could it serve? Distracted as you are, you can still sense the motion as Tula’s body slowly pulls itself to its feet. Her spindly legs spread wide, and a look of elation creeps across her face. It’s the expression of a woman who’s just spotted the perfect prey, and now she’s planning out on how best to snatch it up. Is that what she’s seeing in her mind? For a while she just stands there, lost in her pleasant thoughts, barely moving. Or wait… no… at some point, it seems like she’s stopped moving entirely! You shake your head and try to focus. That psychic assault is really messing with your perception, because when you squint, it almost looks like Tula’s body has been died a uniform gray color. But that of course is impossible, since that would suggest that she had… been… (link:"Turned to stone?")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/F128_TulaStone_by_ZeroTwo9S.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by ZeroTwo9S(click-replace: "Art by ZeroTwo9S")[https://www.deviantart.com/zerotwo9s https://twitter.com/Zerotwo9S]] (set: $picF128 to true) No matter how you parse it, that really does seem to be the case. But how? What could have done this to her? That bunny didn’t seem to have any powers other than creating illusions and distorting perception. But you’re pretty sure this isn’t a hallucination on your part. Tula really does seem to have been petrified. So… does that mean that there’s something else here? Come to think of it, you do seem to be able to pick out a bit of movement coming from beyond her stone statue. Is that what did it to her? If you try really hard to focus, you can just barely make out the— oh no.] |drink1)[(link:"Crrrkkkkk")[(show:?drink2)]] |drink2)[<img src="images/F122_MelfyWebbedStone_by_Dvega.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Dvega(click-replace: "Art by Dvega")[https://www.deviantart.com/dvega https://picarto.tv/Tek]] (set: $picF122 to true) The culprit, as it turns out, was a basilisk. A fearsome lizard-like creature with the power to turn anyone who meets its gaze to stone. Oftentimes they do so to feed off of the life energy of their victims, filling their territory with the petrified bodies of prey. Lucky for you, this one isn’t interested in that. Not that you have any awareness of this fact - or of anything else, for that matter. Because now you’re just a stone statue, unseeing, unfeeling, and unthinking. Little more than a hunk of stone, at least until someone comes along to restore you. But if you *were* aware, you might have put two and two together, and decided that the bunny and the lizard were partners, somehow. Perhaps in some kind of symbiotic relationship. The psychic bunny incapacitates intruders, but their slumbering minds still create mental feedback in the area which makes it hard for it to sleep. Thankfully, the basilisk is at hand to quiet those minds indefinitely, letting the two of them live safely here in the heart of the woods without any threats of danger. It is, altogether, a rather cushy setup. For them, not for you. (if: $candy is false)[[[Sit around->FE05BX]]] (if: $candy is true)[[[Sit around->FE05BY]]] ] You sit here in the depths of the forest, alone and forgotten. Revissa was left behind at the spider’s colony, wrapped up and defenseless, eventually discovered by one of the occupants and spirited away to be her personal plaything. The two of you will never lay eyes on each other again. Time passes. Days become weeks, months become years. Little ever changes this far into the woods. Others occasionally wander out here, and meet the same fate as you did. It’s really quite unfortunate, since you would have known how to avoid it, had you not been so thoroughly wrapped up. But being unlucky is the story of your life. Or at least, it was. As transformations go, being petrified by a basilisk is pretty tame. Most medlabs have the equipment to reverse it, and any competent magical healer would be able to cure it with just a few spell components. But of course, to turn someone back, you need the body. And no one ever finds yours. You’ll never know what happened to the rest of your crew - not the least of which is because you are incapable of knowing anything at all in this stony state. Perhaps they succumbed to some other peril on the planet, or maybe they simply were never able to find you and were forced to leave. Either way, this lonely meadow is now your home, and it will be forever. GAME OVER [[Start over->A0X]]You sit here in the depths of the forest, alone and forgotten. Revissa was left behind at the spider’s colony, wrapped up and defenseless, eventually discovered by one of the occupants and spirited away to be her personal plaything. It will be months before the two of you lay eyes on each other again. It might have been much longer, were it not for the Star Scout homing beacon you swallowed at the start of your adventure. Using it, Krysta is able to track you down and recover your petrified body, and Lumina is able to restore you to flesh. Once you’re conscious again, you tell your crew where you last saw Revissa. In the end, you reason an assault on the spider-girl colony would just result in failure, so you’re forced to resort to diplomatic means. You exchange all the information you gathered from the data devices for her freedom, regaining your wife, but failing your mission in the process. Not the best result, but at least you’re not a lifeless hunk of stone sitting alone in a forest. Maybe next time, you’ll be more careful where you look. GAME OVER [[Start over->A0X]]The two butt heads for hours, but eventually, things get settled the only way spider-babes know how. Zauzyne challenges Merry to trial by combat, and summarily defeats her. Thus the pink-skinned cutie gets wrapped up and put on display in the caves for all the other women in the colony to have their fun with. (link:"Watch her squirm")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/F142_MerryWebbed_by_MilkGoblin.png" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by MilkGoblin(click-replace: "Art by MilkGoblin")[https://www.deviantart.com/milkgoblinnsfw https://twitter.com/MilkGoblinNSFW]] (set: $picF142 to true) Somehow, you feel bad for her. Unlike the others, she seemed like a kind and loving person. Maybe with time it would have been possible to convince her to respect the free will of other people instead of snatching them up and turning them into pets. Though now she’s just a slave herself. After a week of public display, Zauzyne brings her to her quarters to keep as a personal trophy, strung up in silk right beside you and Revissa. The three of you are helpless to do anything about it, reduced to squirming playthings to be used at her leisure. And it seems she has no intention of changing that. (if: $candy is false)[[[Begin your new life->FE05EX]]] (if: $candy is true)[[[Begin your new life->FE05EY]]] ] “Mmphh! Hrggggmmhhpphh!” you say firmly. The two arguing spiders ignore your grunts. At least, until a voice rings out from your pile of equipment that Zauzyne recovered. “Ladies,” chirps a neutral electronic voice. “Please, there’s no need to fight. There’s enough of me to go around.” It’s coming from the gag-talk translator you’d picked up in the Knottie outpost. Previously you’d used it to communicate with Ros’eela, but it’s just as useful for making yourself understandable to the spider-babes. The pair blink in confusion for a moment, looking between you and then the device. Merry picks up on it first. “Oh wow! What an amazing invention. With this we can talk with our friends even when they’re all bundled up!” Zauzyne scowls. “Are you insane? Why would we ever care what a slave has to say?!” She motions to smash the device, but Merry plucks it away with a line of silk before she gets the chance. “She’s not a slave, she’s my new best friend!” Merry protests vigorously. Zauzyne growls. “That kind of talk is a sign of weakness. Maybe that would fly when Tula was in charge, but now that she’s missing, it seems like I’m the one calling the shots.” You see an opportunity, so you take it. “Oh, she’s not missing,” you say through the translator. “I know exactly where she is. Though she *is* in a bit of trouble…” You spend some time summarizing the location where you last saw her, and briefly outline the peril she faced… though you leave out a number of key details. The sort of details that would help them avoid suffering the same fate, Merry gasps. “Oh no! We should go save her!” “If she got herself into trouble, she can go ahead and get herself out of it,” Zauzyne says dismissively. You’re starting to pick up on the sort of philosophy these spider-women live by - very survival of the fittest. The weak are considered unfit to lead, that kind of thing. Though that does give you an idea. “Yeah, but if you save her from trouble, won’t that make you seem even stronger than if you just ignored it?” you suggest. “Imagine it - the humiliation she would feel when she’s forced to be rescued. Maybe she’ll even openly submit to you as the new leader!” Zauzyne’s eyes light up. “Oh-ho… not a bad idea, slave. Though I still never gave you permission to talk.” She snatches the translator back from Merry’s hands and crushes it against the wall. (set: $gagtalk to false) “But she has a point… I believe a rescue mission is in order.” Merry hops up and down excitedly. “Oh, it’s like a field trip! And maybe we’ll make some new friends along the way!” The other spider-lady just rolls her eyes before skittering out onto the cliffs. Merry hangs back a moment to give you one last hug, then follows after her. You breathe a sigh of relief once they’re gone. That’s another crisis averted. Though it doesn’t answer how the heck you’re going to get out of here. After all, you’re still wrapped up and completely helpless. However, once they’re gone, you hear an encouraging grunt from Revissa. Once she gets your attention, she nods towards your feet – and you can’t believe your luck! “Mmphh!” you exclaim in excitement. It looks like while they were scuffling over the translator, Zauzyne accidentally dropped the runic knife from your pack. And against all odds, it has somehow gotten tangled up in the webbing right near your hands! So if you could just wiggle in exactly the right way, maybe… yes! You’ve got it! Grabbing hold of the knife is only the start of the battle, but it’s the opening you needed. And after a good thirty minutes of grunting, groaning, wiggling, and stretching, you finally manage to slice yourself free. Revissa gets cut down next, and a few minutes later you’ve gotten yourselves dressed back up again and fully equipped. “That might be the first time in history my luck actually turned out in our favor,” you quip, as the two of you head towards the exit. [[Exit the forest->FE05FA]] [[Track down the spiders->FE05G]] With nothing left in your way, it’s an easy trek back to the entrance of the forest. You’re careful to retrace your steps from earlier, sticking to familiar locations and not running off on any more side quests that’ll just get you caught by something else. “What do you think will become of those spider ladies?” Revissa wonders aloud as you walk. “Honestly… I’m not sure,” you admit. “I almost feel bad for them. Especially Merry. She seems like she’d have been a nice girl if she’d been brought up in a culture that wasn’t all about kidnapping and slavery.” You both go quiet for a moment. But eventually, you have to admit that there’s not much more you can do for them. There’s been so many near misses already, risking yourselves for their sake just isn’t a reasonable thing to do. And so you make it back to the start of the forest, and reach the end of this leg of the mission. [[Return to the entrance->FE07]] You start walking back through the cliffs, but eventually, you stop and shake your head in annoyance. “Gah!” you yell out. “I just can’t leave like this.” Revissa looks at you in confusion. “What’s wrong?” “Those sexy spiders,” you moan. “Sure, they wanted to kidnap us and keep us as slaves forever… but it doesn’t feel right abandoning them like this. Especially Merry. She seems like she’d have been a nice girl if she’d been brought up in a different environment.” “There’s no guarantee that Merry and Zauzyne got caught up in the predator’s lair too,” Revisssa insists. “We could just be wasting our time.” You shake your head. “Maybe if I’d given them more information. But as it stands… yeah, I think they’re screwed. As much as I hate to say it… we should go back and help them.” There’s a long silence before Revissa breaths out in exhaustion. “You know, I would hate you, if I didn’t love you so much. That heroic streak of yours is going to be the death of us some day.” “I wouldn’t call myself a hero or anything…” you say lamely. “I just… it just doesn’t sit right with me if I don’t do the right thing sometimes.” Revissa kicks you hard on the shin. “That’s called being a hero, you dunce.” But then you both laugh, and it seems like it’s agreed upon. As crazy as it is, you’re going to go on a rescue mission for the spiders. [[Head into the deep woods again->FE05GA]] As you head further into the forest, you summarize to your wife the interactions you had with Tula when she dragged you out here.(if: $tulasleep is true)[ You lied to her about how the predator operates, telling her it preyed on fears, tricking her into focussing on what made her the most scared. That proved to be nothing more serious than an allergy to coconut, though it was enough to get her to lose her composure, and eventually fall asleep, just like the spider whom you’d deceived earlier. However, when you found that other spider, she’d been turned to stone, though that proved to be useful in helping you cut yourself free.](else: )[ After telling her the truth about how the predator operates, you made it to the spot where her fellow spider had been incapacitated, only to find that she had been turned to stone in the meantime. The culprit was a basilisk which seemed to be working together with the psychic bunny - and it soon visited the same fate upon Tula.] “And I suppose you’re worried Merry will get turned to stone too?” Revissa asks. “I mean… she seems nice,” you say. Revissa raises an eyebrow. “Just nice? And not, perhaps, potential girlfriend material?” You cough. “I mean… she seems like she’d be fun to have around… and I bet she gives just the warmest and, erm, *tightest* cuddles.” “You’re hopeless,” she says, rolling her eyes. Though the two of you have been married for a while now, the relationship is open enough that you’re both allowed to take on additional girlfriends if the mood arises - so long as the partner approves of them. So, yeah, maybe you’re hoping Merry will be so overjoyed that you saved her that she’ll agree to join the crew for a bit. Surely if you explain it to her carefully she’ll understand that other people should only be kidnapped and treated like pets if they consent to it first. The fact that you *will* consent to it (so long as it’s not a permanent arrangement) will hopefully help get the point across. That, of course, is wishful thinking, and you’ll still need to save her first anyway. Assuming she even *needs* saving. You’re about to find out either way, as you now approach the furthest reaches of the deep forest. (if: $tulasleep is true)[[[Find the spiders->FE05H]]](else: )[[[Find the spiders->FE05GB]]] At this point, you’re used to the predator’s tricks. You and Revissa push deeper into the forest, and all around you the air begins to feel thick and heavy, as if with smoke. The crackling of roaring flames resounds from every corner, the warmth of a blazing forest fire washing over you like a curtain of heat. But you know it’s all an illusion and you push past it, eventually emerging at your destination. What you find is… more or less what you expected. (link:"Check out the line-up")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/F133_SekiKumos_by_ZeroTwo9S.png" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by ZeroTwo9S(click-replace: "Art by ZeroTwo9S")[https://www.deviantart.com/zerotwo9s https://twitter.com/Zerotwo9S]] (set: $picF133 to true) Where once there were two stone spiders, now there are four. Merry and Zauzyne have succumbed to the same peril as the others, transfixed in stone with their clothing having flaked away from their bodies. Zauzyne has the pose of someone who had just spotted her enemy, pointing in the direction of a sound she might have heard, such as a rustling of leaves - and now she’s frozen that way, her finger directed towards a threat that has long since departed. Merry saw the threat too, and, it would seem, thought that it was quite cute. Her starry-eyed expression is now indefinitely preserved on her face, no longer able to see the object of her adoration. Revissa spends some time looking the quartet over, sensing their auras with her magic, and gives you a summary of their condition. “It’s a fairly basic petrification,” she says. “It won’t wear off on its own, but it’s also easy enough to restore with traditional healing magics. I don’t quite have the energy for it right now, but those diamonds Lumina gave us before should do the trick. Only…” You raise an eyebrow. “What’s the issue?” “Well, we don’t have an infinite supply of them, and this is a lot of stone spiders. If we cured them, we probably wouldn’t have any left for ourselves if we needed them later.” That’s definitely something to consider. Though… it also gives you an idea. Maybe you don’t need to cure them at all. Maybe you could just… hold on to them for a while. Consider them a trophy of your accomplishments thus far. You’d definitely turn them back… eventually. Or at least you’d turn Merry back. [[Use the restoration diamonds->FE05GC]] [[Take them back to your ship->FE05GD]] ] At this point, you’re used to the predator’s tricks. You and Revissa push deeper into the forest, and all around you the air begins to feel thick and heavy, as if with smoke. The crackling of roaring flames resounds from every corner, the warmth of a blazing forest fire washing over you like a curtain of heat. But you know it’s all an illusion and you push past it, eventually emerging at your destination. What you find is… more or less what you expected. Where you left one spider, slumbering peacefully in illusory dreams, now you find three. It seems that Merry and Zauzyne fared no better than their predecessors, and have fully succumbed to the influence of the psychic bunny. Not that the creature has shown itself in some time. Further in, you find the fourth arachnid woman as well, the one who had been turned to stone and helpfully assisted in removing Tula’s silk. Though they are in short supply, you decide to be generous and pull out one of the restoration diamonds that Lumina gave you at the start of the adventure, applying it to her petrified form. Divine energy flows from the gemstone into her body and restores her to flesh, making her slump unconscious to the ground. Its magic spent, the diamond then cracks and crumbles as well. You pick up the fourth woman and drag her to the others, lining them up in one big, happy, terribly dangerous pile of gorgeous beauties. “So how do we actually want to do this?” Revissa asks. “It seems like the predator can keep them asleep indefinitely. Do we try waking them up?” “Hrmm…” you murmur. “Probably not the best idea. Even though we’re saving them, they’ll probably wrap us up the minute they’re conscious.” “Well, the one who was petrified should wake up normally,” Revissa suggests. “So we could just leave her some instructions on how to navigate out of here and let her figure it out.” “That does seem the safest option,” you say. “Although… there is something else we could try…” Revissa gets that annoyed look in her eyes that happens every time you suggest something stupid. Is the idea even worth bringing up? [[Go with Revissa’s idea->FE05HA]] [[Make your suggestion->FE05HB]] You sigh, but then begin pulling out the healing items from your bag. “I suppose it’s the right thing to do,” you say, though you’re not super happy about it.
