Those diamonds don’t come cheap, and they’d be a great thing to have on hand if you were to get petrified some time in the future… which has a high likelihood of happening, given your track record. But you hold firm to your principles and get to work. One by one, you take out a diamond and apply its magic to a petrified arachnid, expending the divine energy contained within the gemstone and shattering it to dust. They work like a charm, and soon enough each lovely spider is restored to her usual, fleshy self. Luckily, they remain slumped and unconscious after being healed, but you know they could wake up any minute. And so, as much as it pains you to do it, you write a short note explaining how to escape the forest and leave it beside them, and then slink back towards the entrance. “You look glum for someone who just did something heroic,” Revissa notes after a while. “I know,” you say sadly. “I would have loved to have stuck around and get to know them better. Especially Merry. But if I did–” “Then you’d spend the rest of your life as their slave,” Revissa notes evenly. “I mean… would that be the *worst* thing in the world?” you muse absently to yourself. Revissa pats you on the shoulder affectionately. “When the mission is over, I promise I’ll wrap you up nice and tight and keep you that way for a whole day,” she offers. “And give you all the lusty cuddles you want.” That definitely perks you up. And so you have a bounce in your step as the two of you make it back to the edge of the forest, your mission here complete. (set: $nodiamond to true)(set: $spidersavior to true) [[Exit the forest->FE07]] “Okay, hear me out here…” you say carefully. Revissa sighs. “That phrase has never preceded something I actually want to hear said,” she grumbles. “Fair. But listen to me anyway. We’ve got four stone spiders, and if we heal them right now, we’ll be out of restoration items, right? So… why don’t we just not heal them *now*?” “You want us to trek all the way back here later?!” Revissa yells. “No… not that either. What if we just… held on to them for a while. I’ll use my comm device as a beacon and call the ship over, and they can just pick up the statues with the tractor beam and load them into the cargo bay. And then we’d have them safe and secure in our care, ready to be brought back to life when it’s convenient.” Revissa raises an eyebrow. “You’re starting to sound awfully a lot like some of those statue-collecting villains we’ve dealt with in the past.” “What? No, of course not! I mean, we’d turn them back… eventually. We’d only have a gallery of sexy stone spiders for… a little while.” Your wife rolls her eyes, but does eventually agree to the plan. And so you set it in motion and write a quick message to your crew back on the ship together with the location data from your communicator. From here, it should be as easy as standing around and waiting. Which… in a moment, is going to prove very easy to do indeed. Because you and Revissa hear the sudden noise of a loud explosion from right behind you just as you hit send, and years of instinct kick in before your conscious mind has a chance to object. Which means you turn around to face the sound, each of you raising your arms defensively, expecting a concussive blast or something to wash over you Instead… you’re just met with a pair of beady, reptilian eyes… (link:"Crrrrkkkkkkk")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/F137_MelfyRevissaStone2_by_ZeroTwo9S.png" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by ZeroTwo9S(click-replace: "Art by ZeroTwo9S")[https://www.deviantart.com/zerotwo9s https://twitter.com/Zerotwo9S]] (set: $picF137 to true) If you’d been thinking clearly, you might have been able to predict it. You had all the information to work with, after all. A psychic predator that can create false images and noises. And a prowling basilisk whose gaze renders any who meet its eyes into solid stone. Working together, it would be easy for these two creatures to trick someone for just a moment, get them to turn their attention to right where they needed to be. If it had been longer than a moment, perhaps one of you would have seen through the ruse. But you didn’t, and now you’re both stone. Unmoving, unthinking, unfeeling. Two more solid rock sculptures to dot this remote forest sanctuary. Though at least your friends know where you are. That means they’ll come to save you, right? …right? [[Wrong->FE05GE]] ] Jyymon uses her tail to swat at some mosquitoes buzzing around her legs, cursing irritably under her breath. “I don’t understand why we *all* needed to come out here,” she grumbles. Vhaja frowns, glancing down at the topological map on her communicator. “Because Melfy has not answered since the last message she sent, which probably means something has happened to her. And since we detected high levels of psionic activity in the area, it only makes sense for you and I to be present. We are much better equipped to handle tricks and illusions than the others.” Krysta leaps nimbly from one tree branch to another, her squirrel tail flapping wildly in the wind. “And I’m here because I’m actually at home in places like this,” she says with a grin. “Because, case in point, I think I’ve spotted something, dead ahead. It looks like a bunch of motionless bodies, standing upright.” Lumina grips her staff nervously, her wings fluttering lightly in the breeze. “Do you think they’ve been transformed in some way? I’d better prepare a healing spell…” And so the four emerge into the deepest part of the woods, and are shocked at what they find. A smattering of stone Knotties spread randomly throughout the area. A quartet of stone spiders, all lined up in a row. And… “There they are!” Krysta yells, though she’s clever enough not to just run towards the granite bodies of her compatriots. For your part, you and Revissa remain exactly where you were the moment that you were transformed. Still as stone, frozen and unmoving, clothing flaked away to reveal your naked bodies to the eyes of your companions. If you were able to think, you would probably be relieved to know that they were here. Though it’s probably better that you’re not, given what happens next. “Ooooohhh… look at all those tasty-looking acorns,” Krysrta suddenly says, reaching out towards a barrel of treats that isn’t really there. She’s the only one who fully falls for the ruse. “No, Krysta, it’s something else,” Lumina warns, holding out a cautioning hand. “We must be under attack!” Vhaja exclaims, holding out her hands to conjure the magical energy for a runic bow and arrow to defend herself with. Jyumon takes a step back. “Wait, no, check the magical spectrum, Vhaja. It’s—” But she doesn’t get a chance to finish that thought. The psychic predator drops the illusion it was forming and reveals its partner for the four new interlopers to see. And they *do* see it. Quite well. Though only for a moment. (link:"Reunite with your friends")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/F138_KrystaLuminaVhajaJyumonStone_by_ZeroTwo9S.png" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by ZeroTwo9S(click-replace: "Art by ZeroTwo9S")[https://www.deviantart.com/zerotwo9s https://twitter.com/Zerotwo9S]] (set: $picF138 to true) A crackling sound reverberates through the forest, as four more victims join the macabre gallery lost here among the trees. As before, clothing crumbles away, half-prepared spells fizzle out into nothing, and the only hope anyone here had of getting out of this mess fades away into nothing. “...” Krysta says nothing, her imagined trove of acorns as out of reach as her chance of escape. “...” The defensive ward Lumina was working on never completes, though it wouldn’t have done much good. It was something to protect against mental intrusions, not stony transformations. “...” Vhaja never gets the chance to unleash an arrow of arcane force at her target. Her sharp Elvaan eyes are usually perfect at locking on to her targets, though that proved to be her downfall here. “...” Jyumon didn’t want to come here in the first place, but now she won’t be leaving for a very, very long time. Though at least the tail she was using to swat away insects is effective at propping up her unbalanced body, so she won’t have to suffer the indignity of toppling over. Not that she’d be aware of it if she did. And so, you and Revissa rejoin your faithful crew… though perhaps not in the way you had hoped. (if: $candy is false)[[[Stand around->FE05GX]]] (if: $candy is true)[[[Stand around->FE05GY]]] ] The forest has become quite crowded. Though it would be hard to describe it as busy. Four spiders, six adventurers, and a smattering of petrified Knotties dot the hidden grove, none of them moving an inch. Considering the collective skill among them, a single basilisk should have been child’s play to handle, but luck was not on any of their sides. And so, they stand. Naked and motionless, incapable of thought. A single healing spell would be enough to return any of them to life – and indeed, several diamonds charged with the magic to restore them lays on the ground by a petrified wolf kemomi’s feet, spilled out from the bag that dropped from her body when her clothing turned brittle and crumbled to dust. There’s nothing you can do about it. There’s nothing *any* of you can do about it. You’re just statues, and that’s all you’ll ever be. Over the years, moss will grow in the little nooks and crevasses of your stone body, and tiny hairline cracks will spread over your figure, though none will ever be enough to cause your frozen form any real damage. Cobwebs will collect all around you, connecting your tail to your legs, or your extended hand to the surprised look etched upon your face. No one ever finds you. Why would they? You came here in secret, and everyone who knew it is right here with you, petrified at your side. This is your home now. And though you’ll never know it, the forest will make good use of that. Birds will nest in your hair. Hungry critters will forage for grubs in the dirt beneath your feet. Creeping vines, searching for sunlight, will curl up your legs, trying to get higher. You and your friends are a part of the forest now, as if you always belonged here. And, as the years turn to centuries, stretching on until forever, the amount of time you spent as a person will be far eclipsed by your life as a statue, meaning that maybe you always *did* belong here. After all, it’s not like you’re ever going to leave. GAME OVER [[Start over->A0X]]The forest has become quite crowded. Though it would be hard to describe it as busy. Four spiders, six adventurers, and a smattering of petrified Knotties dot the hidden grove, none of them moving an inch. Considering the collective skill among them, a single basilisk should have been child’s play to handle, but luck was not on any of their sides. And so, they stand. Naked and motionless, incapable of thought. A single healing spell would be enough to return any of them to life – and indeed, several diamonds charged with the magic to restore them lays on the ground by a petrified wolf kemomi’s feet, spilled out from the bag that dropped from her body when her clothing turned brittle and crumbled to dust. There’s nothing you can do about it. There’s nothing *any* of you can do about it. You’re just statues, and if nothing changed, that’s all you would have ever been. But lucky for you, you swallowed that Star Scout homing beacon at the start of your adventure. And so, though it takes a long, long time, salvation does eventually come for you. Though maybe not as quickly as you might have liked. When a Star Scout passing through the sector happens to pick up on an ancient distress beacon, she decides to investigate, landing on the planet and arriving at your little grove. There, she finds the many statues that have accumulated, petrified sculptures that have suffered minor wear and tear over the years. In that time, tiny networks of cracks have formed along your stone body - not enough to do any harm, just enough to add some character. Moss has spread between the nooks and crevasses of your stone figure, and creeping vines have curled up your legs, searching for sunlight. You look as if you’d always belonged here, and, to be fair, given the amount of time you’ve stood in the very spot, it’s not entirely inaccurate. After all, it’s been several hundred years, far eclipsing the amount of time you’d been active and mobile in the world. Eventually the Scout does get you and your friends restored. Though when you awaken, you find yourself in a galaxy far different than the one you left. Ahead of you lie many new and exciting adventures in what to you is the distant future, but that’s a story for another day. Regardless, you’ve decidedly failed at the mission you originally came here for, all those years ago. GAME OVER [[Start over->A0X]]Revissa’s withering glare saps any enthusiasm you might have had for your hare-brained idea. “On second thought… your plan sounds much safer,” you concede. “I thought so.” And so, much to your regret, you just type out some instructions and send it wirelessly to one of the spider ladies’ comm devices, then turn around and head back out through the forest. By now it’s easy going, the illusions barely tripping you up. Before long you’re out of the danger zone, though you can’t help but dwell on the thought of what might have been, had you been a bit more daring (and a lot more stupid). “You look glum for someone who just did something heroic,” Revissa notes after a while. “I know,” you say sadly. “It’s just that I would have loved to have gotten to know them better. Especially Merry. But if I did–” “Then you’d spend the rest of your life as their slave,” Revissa notes evenly. “I mean… would that be the *worst* thing in the world?” you muse absently to yourself. Revissa pats you on the shoulder affectionately. “When the mission is over, I promise I’ll wrap you up nice and tight and keep you that way for a whole day,” she offers. “And give you all the lusty cuddles you want.” That definitely perks you up. And so you have a bounce in your step as the two of you make it back to the edge of the forest, your mission here complete. [[Exit the forest->FE07]] “Okay, so, hear me out here,” you begin. Revissa groans. “No intelligent plan ever begins with those words.” “True. But no plan I’ve ever made has been intelligent, and I’ve still managed to get us out of every scrape we’ve found ourselves in.” “Except for the times it failed miserably.” “Yeah, except for those times. Anyway! My idea here is… we’ve got a ship in orbit, four gorgeous spider-ladies at our mercy, and one powerful, beautiful, highly competent, and extremely accommodating nature druid who could conjure up some thick, sturdy vines at will.” Revissa face-palms. “You want to… tie up the spider women and keep them on our ship?” “...yes?” you say tentatively. “And you don’t think that’s a terrible idea?” “I mean… I do. But also… imagine it, what we could do with so many sexy prisoners!” “And what happens when they inevitably break free, escape, then turn the tables on us?” You grin. “Well, that just sounds like a sexy vacation to me!” “No, it sounds like a terribly stupid idea!” Revissa says, raising her voice sharply. Both of you immediately realize that it was a really bad idea to make that much noise. You hear the one spider-lady not trapped in her dreams start to stir, yawning lazily. Which would have been bad enough, but it seems that your ill-timed yelling match was a poor decision for a totally different reason. Something lurking nearby has decided it’s had enough of you two, and makes its move to remove the annoyance you present once and for all. It starts with the sound of a loud explosion coming from right behind you. Despite the fact that you both know better, your distraction from the argument and years of experience reacting quickly to danger prompts the two of you to turn around to face the sound, each of you raising your arms defensively, expecting a concussive blast or something to wash over you Instead… you’re just met with a pair of beady, reptilian eyes… (link:"Crrrkkkkk")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/F137_MelfyRevissaStone2_by_ZeroTwo9S.png" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by ZeroTwo9S(click-replace: "Art by ZeroTwo9S")[https://www.deviantart.com/zerotwo9s https://twitter.com/Zerotwo9S]] (set: $picF137 to true) If you’d been thinking clearly, you might have been able to predict it. You had all the information to work with, after all. A psychic predator that can create false images and noises. And a prowling basilisk whose gaze renders any who meet its eyes into solid stone. Working together, it would be easy for these two creatures to trick someone for just a moment, get them to turn their attention to right where they needed to be. If it had been longer than a moment, perhaps one of you would have seen through the ruse. But you didn’t, and now you’re both stone. Unmoving, unthinking, unfeeling. Nothing but a pair of solid rock sculptures, decorating a hidden forest sanctuary. Though you won’t be there for long. (if: $candy is false)[[[Wait around->FE05HX]]] (if: $candy is true)[[[Wait around->FE05HY]]] ] Eventually, the other spider lady does wake up. And she discovers that all it takes to rouse her companions is a sharp poke on the posterior with the point of one of her back legs. Together, they puzzle out the way to escape the forest, and take with them a couple of heavy, but highly collectible souvenirs. Before long the two statues are installed back in their cave system. It’s not quite a silk-spun sex slave, but it’s still the generally correct shape, and so the colony makes good use of your stone bodies for some stimulation when the desire calls for it, grinding themselves to completion against your inert granite forms. Over the years, they’ll collect more traditional slaves, of course, and string them up in their caverns to be used for entertainment. But something of a trend catches on thanks to you and Revissa, and, over time, some spider gals even start to enjoy the idea of petrified partners during intercourse. They take some supplements to modify the composition of their naturally produced venom to allow it to calcify their captives, and begin a campaign to spread the word. Before long, the colony is split right down the middle between whether slaves should be soft and squirming or stiff and solid. You and Revissa, of course, are unaware of any of this, because you’re just a pair of petrified playthings. It would actually be trivially easy to restore you to flesh - the basilisk’s gaze isn’t nearly as powerful as that of a gorgon, for instance - but no one has any inclination to do that. And so, you remain where you are, a tantalizing fixture made of sculpted stone for the rest of your days. You’ll never know what happened to the rest of your crew - not the least of which is because you’re incapable of knowing anything at all. Maybe they were caught by some other peril on the planet, or maybe they were forced to leave when they were unable to find what happened to you. Whatever the case, this is your life now. Though you’re sadly not conscious enough to enjoy it. GAME OVER [[Start over->A0X]]Eventually, the other spider lady does wake up. And she discovers that all it takes to rouse her companions is a sharp poke on the posterior with the point of one of her back legs. Together, they puzzle out the way to escape the forest, and take with them a couple of heavy, but highly collectible souvenirs. Before long the two statues are installed back in their cave system. It’s not quite a silk-spun sex slave, but it’s still the generally correct shape, and so the colony makes good use of your stone bodies for some stimulation when the desire calls for it, grinding themselves to completion against your inert granite forms. Had you stayed longer than a few weeks, it might have even become a trend. But thankfully, the Star Scout homing beacon you swallowed at the start of your adventure allows the rest of your crew to track you down. And though there’s too many spiders for them to simply rush in and rescue you, they do manage to negotiate an exchange. They trade all the data they’d gathered on the planet from the mission for your freedom, and get the two of you delivered to the ship in large shipping crates full of packing peanuts. That’s where you find yourself when you next wake up thanks to Lumina’s healing magic. Though you almost wish you hadn't woken up at all, given how angry Revissa is at you for causing you to fail the mission after making such a stupid suggestion. You’d like to say you’ve learned your lesson after this, but let’s be honest, you’re going to do this again and again, plenty of times over. And so, though you may have ruined the plan and let everyone down, at least you’re still conscious and mobile enough to make sure that you’ll have the chance to disappoint them all again, some time in the future. And there is definitely a lot of pleasing going around…] Over the years, the spider colony will thrive and grow. And central to its success is the high morale among its residents, and the comfort they have of knowing there’s always a silken bundle nearby to help relieve their stress. So in a way, you’re an important part of the ecosystem, having your own adventures and doing your part. You just don’t ever get the choice to leave. GAME OVER [[Start over->A0X]]Sadly, your life as a sex slave continues for quite some time. The silk you’re bound in contains the properties of the planet’s Ghost Matter, meaning you can be kept wrapped up with no need for maintenance for as long as your captors like. And they quite like having you right where you are.(if: $crewcaught is true)[ Years go by without any changes. With your crew captured and strung up beside you, there’s no one left who even knows where you are. Rescue seems like a distant possibility, forcing you all to acclimate yourselves to the life of a slave. It’s not until much later, decades after your capture, that luck finally happens to strike. A passing Star Scout randomly manages to pick up on the homing beacon sent out by the candy you swallowed at the start of your adventure and comes down to the planet to investigate. With the force of a galactic law enforcement agent behind her words, she manages to eventually negotiate for your release… with a condition. Namely, that the spiders get to hold on to you for the next hundred years. It’s the best she can do, so she signs the deal and moves on, leaving you and your friends to suffer helplessly until that point. (if: $roscaught is true)[Interestingly, Ros’eela turns down the offer to be released, happy with her new life as a webbed-up sex slave. It seems her submissive tendencies were fully unlocked by the experience. ](if: $petalcaught is true)[As for Petal, the spiders value her pollen far too much to make any deals to release her, so it seems her fate (and her body) will forever be tied to her captors. ]When the time comes for you to go free, the galaxy is a very different place from how you remember it. Surely there will be plenty more adventures ahead of you(if: $faecaught is true)[ (not the least of which because when your silken bindings are finally severed, the rule keeping the fae wrapped up is nullified and she’s set free as well, sure to be a thorn in your side in the future)]. But those adventures are a story for another time. And regardless of what happened in them, the fact remains that you failed the mission that originally sent you to the planet.](else: )[ Almost a year passes before anything changes. For most of your captivity, you were left wondering what happened to the rest of your crew. As it turns out, they had been working tirelessly in the background to secure your freedom, though they would never have known where you were if not for the homing beacon given off by the Star Scout candy you swallowed at the start of your adventure. Strings are pulled, favors are called in, and palms are greased, but eventually, you and Revissa are loaded up into shipping crates and delivered back into the hands of your friends.(if: $roscaught is true or $petalcaught is true or $faecaught is true)[ ](if: $roscaught is true)[Ros’eela is not shipped with you, since they were unaware she had even been present, but perhaps that’s a blessing for her in disguise, since she had been seeming to enjoy her captivity.] (if: $petalcaught is true)[As far as you know, Petal never gets released from her new life at the outpost - not that your allies would have known to negotiate on her behalf. Though given how much the spider women enjoyed the effects of her pollen, it seems unlikely they’d have been willing to part with her at all.] (if: $faecaught is true)[As for the fae woman… the moment your shipping crate is opened and you’re cut free, you hear her voice whisper in your ear, letting you know that her captivity is over as well. Your fate and hers was intertwined, so once your situation was no longer hopeless she, too, was able to escape. From now on, you’ll certainly be looking over your shoulder, wondering if she’s ever going to show up again to mess with you. Obviously it goes without saying, but by this point your mission was a complete failure. It’s touching to know how hard your friends fought to save you, but also depressing to realize it was your fault they had to fight so hard in the first place. But at least now you’re free to explore the galaxy once again - and maybe this time, you’ll be more careful around spiders.]] GAME OVER [[Start over->A0X]]“What should we do with her?” Ros’eela asks, looking up at you as you squirm vigorously in your tight bindings. Revissa shrugs. “Let her have her fun, I suppose. She’s earned it. She excuses herself for a moment, rushing to one of the other buildings, leaving you and the fae still hopelessly tethered to the ceiling. It’s a set of enchanted iron sealing shackles, complete with essence modulator gemstone arrays,” she says, with the same sort of enthusiasm as a sportsball card collector showing off an ultra-rare first edition star player rookie card. “I only knew about it because I saw it mentioned on the shipping manifest while doing data entry. It belonged to the outpost’s forewoman, but she’s… err… a bit gunked up at the moment.” You recall that the outpost is chock-full of amber-encased Knotties, thanks to Petal’s intervention. “But yeah, these beauties are rated Triple-S on the standard bondage secureness scale, and are certified to work on most extra-planar and incorporeal entities, up to and including arch-fey.” Revissa raises an eyebrow. “You think they can contain her?” Ros’eela nods. “Yeah… they’ll hold her,” she says. “Here, let me show you.” And so she eagerly gets to work. And the crotch attachment has a ‘perpetual stimulation synchronizer’, she explains, that will create an ‘indefinite feedback loop of unending pleasure’. It seems to do the trick, since once she snaps it on, the fae woman’s eyes roll back in delight, her body quivering in time with the device’s vibrations. Soon enough, all the webbing has been replaced with magic-tech restraints, leaving her looking quite thoroughly secured. But the look on her face seems to confirm that they are, in fact, fully effective at holding her. Just help lock me in… and I guess keep the two of us in a storage crate somewhere on your ship. Straps connect their faces together, causing them to share the ball-gag as their lips lock into a perpetual kiss. Bah, fine, probably far from my best pun, but the fact that I'm still aware enough to make a pun at all is quite impressive, given the fact that I am also being rocked by an admittedly amazing orgasm. Gotta say, I never really paid much attention to her, but this Ros'eela girl really knows how to win a fight. Is it too late to make *her* the main character of this game?")[(show:?drink2)]] |drink2)[<img src="images/F141_FaeAndRoseelaBound_by_Waltodile.png" style="max-width: 100%;"> (set: $picF141 to true) What was it Ros’eela called it? Perpetual bondage energy? Somehow, you can actually feel it. It’s like the device is sending out psychic pulses that make your body thrum with a desire to join them in their restraints. It affects you even more profoundly when Revissa finally gets around to peeling off your silken bindings, setting you free after hours of being so snugly and comfortably secured. Some part of you wishes that she hadn’t freed you, that she’d kept you tied up forever and ever - or better yet, that she’d joined you. But you push those thoughts aside. You still have a mission to take care of – and an old friend to thank for her sacrifice. Ros’eela seems perfectly happy with the arrangement she’s subjected herself to, already moaning eagerly as the restraints work their magic and fully surrendering herself to the device’s ministrations. You suppose that her pleasure is what gives it energy. The fae woman, too, seems thoroughly defeated, even more so than when she was wrapped up. Whenever you met her gaze while you were both bound in silk, she always seemed to have a playful gleam in her eyes. Maybe she was taunting you to try and escape, since she knew doing that would free her as well. But now all her whimsy is gone, and she’s just grunting and groaning like any helpless captive would do in this situation. You’ve got to hand it to Knottie technology - it really does work. Once you’ve had your fill watching the two of them writhe in pleasure, you and Revissa load them up into a storage crate and lock the lid shut. Then you track down the data tablet that controls the outpost’s security droids and instruct them to pick up the box and deliver it to the landing site outside the forest, to be loaded up onto your ship the next time it lands. The two of them will make for precious cargo indeed. Which is when you remember that they are not the only trophies available to you after this excursion. After all, you know that Tula is probably out there in the forest somewhere, hard as a rock. And you see no reason not to track her down and claim her for your collection. With these drones, it should be easy enough to pick her up. (set: $faebondagecollect to true) [[Send out the drones->FE04I]] ]It doesn’t take too long to cut you free, thanks in part to the runic knife that Vhaja entrusted you with at the start of the mission. Ros’eela managed to track it and the rest of your gear down based on Revissa’s description of where you were captured, retrieving it by sending out some of the security drones that had been protecting the base. As a parting gift, she entrusts you codes to operate the drones yourself, in case you have some need of them. And, in fact, you think that you do. After all, you have reason to believe that a statue of Tula is standing somewhere out there in the forest - and you see no reason not to track it down as a trophy of your time here on the planet. [[Send out the drones->FE04I]] You would not call yourself a vindictive woman. But still, after everything that’s happened, you think it’s only fair to get some payback. Somewhere out in the forest, there’s a solid stone spider, and you figure that if she’s going to be stone anyway, she might as well be stone while in the cargo bay of your ship. And so you dispatch the drones from the outpost, giving them the general coordinates of where you encountered the basilisk. To your delight, they return a short time later with the proof that your deception worked against the lusty spider. (link:"Appreciate your trophy")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/F128_TulaStone_by_ZeroTwo9S.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by ZeroTwo9S(click-replace: "Art by ZeroTwo9S")[https://www.deviantart.com/zerotwo9s https://twitter.com/Zerotwo9S]] (set: $picF128 to true) From the way she’s posed, it doesn’t appear like she was taken by surprise. There’s an eager expression on her face, as if she had just spotted a tantalizing target and was ready to pounce. It looks like she really was expecting a brave Usami warrior instead of a basilisk, and paid the price for it dearly. As is often the case with petrifications, her clothing has flaked away from her body, likely because it became frail and brittle after the transformation. This gives you an unimpeded view of her naked form, allows you to run a finger over her calcified inner thigh, to tweak the stone nubs of her nipples, to feel the sharp point of her deadly back legs, now rendered as inert as the rest of her. “If I didn’t know any better, I’d say you were turned on by this,” Revissa remarks quietly. “I didn’t peg you for the kind of person to keep a statue gallery.” You step away from the granite spider sculpture in embarrassment. “What? No… I’m not like that. It’s just… nice to be able to appreciate her body without her immediately wrapping me up.” “I thought you *liked* being wrapped up.” “Oh I do. But I also like beautiful women. Either way, it’s not like I’m gonna keep her this way forever. We’ll restore her once the mission is completed, and then we can turn her over to the proper authorities.”(if: $merrystone is true)[ Though come to think of it, Tula’s not the only spider who should be arrested, is she? After all, you bumped into several more of them on the way here, and they, too, got turned to stone. It’s only fair for them to stick together. With that in mind, you increase the search radius of the drones, and tell them to bring in any more spider-shaped rocks they might encounter. [[Complete your collection->FE04IA]]](else: )[ “Sure you will,” she says jokingly. “But for now, can we get the heck out of here? I never thought I’d say this, but I think I’m tired of being in a forest for so long.” That gives you both a laugh. And so, together you make the easy trip back to the entrance of the forest, your stone spider trophy hauled behind you by the drones. (set: $tulastonecollect to true) [[Return to the entrance->FE07]]] ]A massive change in the leadership of the spider-girl colony begins to play out over the next few days. Tula had been in charge before, but Zauzyne manages to convince the rest of her people that she was weak and incompetent for letting you escape, and thus deserves whatever fate that befell her. She shows a similar callousness towards her own sister. It seems that their culture is heavily based on survival of the fittest rules, and so since both of them have been proven unfit, there’s no interest in trying to enact a rescue. You, Revissa, and Merry remain her personal property, kept enmeshed in silk in her quarters. Apparently Tula had instituted a policy of ‘communal property’ during her reign, where captured slaves were to be shared among all the residents, but Zauzyne tosses that right out, happy to keep you all for herself on a permanent basis. And since the silk that binds you is infused with the planet’s Ghost Matter, there’s no need for maintenance on your cocooned bodies, ensuring she can completely ignore the three of you whenever she doesn’t need you to slake her lust. This new arrangement continues for several weeks. During that time, Zauzyne seems heavily fixated on showing off her strength, of proving that she deserves to lead. This eventually culminates in her organizing a full-scale assault on the Knottie camp near the ruins in an effort to gain more slaves for herself and her followers. She leaves one night after firing up her troops — and never returns. You’ll never know exactly what happened, but suffice to say, you can only guess that she wasn’t nearly as good of a leader as she thought she was, and now it is she and her kin who are the slaves. Not that does you and Revissa any good, because you’re still wrapped up in the depths of a sprawling cave system, trapped in silk that will stay firm and fresh indefinitely. You have no idea what happened to the rest of your crew - maybe they also were caught by one of the other perils on the planet, or maybe they tried their best to find you but eventually were forced to give up. Sadly, that means you’re condemned to solitude, locked away and forgotten, never to see the outside world again. GAME OVER [[Start over->A0X]]A massive change in the leadership of the spider-girl colony begins to play out over the next few days. Tula had been in charge before, but Zauzyne manages to convince the rest of her people that she was weak and incompetent for letting you escape, and thus deserves whatever fate that befell her. She shows a similar callousness towards her own sister. It seems that their culture is heavily based on survival of the fittest rules, and so since both of them have been proven unfit, there’s no interest in trying to enact a rescue. You, Revissa, and Merry remain her personal property, kept enmeshed in silk in her quarters. Apparently Tula had instituted a policy of ‘communal property’ during her reign, where captured slaves were to be shared among all the residents, but Zauzyne tosses that right out, happy to keep you all for herself on a permanent basis. And since the silk that binds you is infused with the planet’s Ghost Matter, there’s no need for maintenance on your cocooned bodies, ensuring she can completely ignore the three of you whenever she doesn’t need you to slake her lust. This new arrangement continues for several weeks. During that time, Zauzyne seems heavily fixated on showing off her strength, of proving that she deserves to lead. This eventually culminates in her organizing a full-scale assault on the Knottie camp near the ruins, in an effort to gain more slaves for herself and her followers. She leaves one night after firing up her troops — and never returns. You only find out what happened weeks later, when Krysta manages to track the two of you down thanks to the Star Scout homing beacon you swallowed at the start of your adventure. She says about a dozen spider-woman showed at the Knottie camp, and were promptly defeated thanks to the superior numbers and homefield advantage of the defending team. Now it’s all of them who will be the slaves. Sadly, the Knotties also released some kind of electro-static net over the orchard the spider-women were cultivating in retaliation for their assault, and the data collection device you’d planted there was destroyed in the process. Without it, the mission is a failure, and you’re forced to return to your ship and leave the planet empty-handed. However, there is one silver lining to it all. After being set free, Merry repents for her actions, finally understanding what it feels like to be a helpless silk-bound slave. You forgive her easily, and even let her join your crew. For many years she’ll share in your adventures, both in the galaxy and in the bedroom, though it will take a bit of learning before she finally understands the meaning of consent. GAME OVER [[Start over->A0X]]It doesn’t take too much time for the search to retrieve results. After all, Tula would have been caught fairly close to where the other ones were. And sure enough, you find some charming stone sculptures dropped off right in front of you before long. Two of them you’re familiar with. Back near the cliffs, you and Revissa had nearly been captured by the adorable Merry and the much more domineering Zauzyne, but thanks to your trickery (and a good deal of luck) they ended up in stone, and you got to go free. But in addition to those two, a fourth granite trophy finds its way in front of you. (link:"Marvel at its detail")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/F126_ZerylStone_by_ZeroTwo9S.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by ZeroTwo9S(click-replace: "Art by ZeroTwo9S")[https://www.deviantart.com/zerotwo9s https://twitter.com/Zerotwo9S]] (set: $picF126 to true) This is another familiar spider. Zauzyne’s sister, who attacked you the first time you passed through the cliffs area. You lured her to the center of the forest where she was overwhelmed by the psychic predator and lulled to sleep. But it seems sometime after that, she was fully petrified. Were the bunny and the basilisk working together in some capacity? You suppose it’s possible. You wonder if she’s still conscious in there thanks to that, perhaps trapped in the dreams forced on her before she passed out. There’s no way to know without the proper equipment, which is all the more reason to bring her and the others back to the ship. “We’ve assembled quite the collection,” Revissa remarks, taking a step back to appreciate the quartert of granite arachnids. You do the same.] |drink1)[(link:"Line them up all in a row")[(show:?drink2)]] |drink2)[<img src="images/F133_SekiKumos_by_ZeroTwo9S.png" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by ZeroTwo9S(click-replace: "Art by ZeroTwo9S")[https://www.deviantart.com/zerotwo9s https://twitter.com/Zerotwo9S]] (set: $picF133 to true) “I can’t tell which one of them is my favorite,” you say with a grin. “Merry was definitely the nicest. Even potential girlfriend material. But Tula was easily the sexiest. Though there’s something to be said about sisters…” Revissa rolls her eyes. “What about your wife?” she asks. “Good point. Which spider-babe would *you* most prefer to be wrapped up and fondled by?” “None of the above,” she says with a groan. Though she makes no further protests as the whole lot are carried off one by one to the landing sight by the drones. The two of you follow after, making the journey back to the forest’s entrance without any further interruptions. (set: $spidersstonecollect to true) [[Return to the entrance->FE07]] ]After having planted one of the three required data devices, you decide to head back to the landing site where you started in order to reorient yourself and update your map, even if it might not be the shortest absolute route between this and your next destination. It’s a relatively uneventful trip, illuminated by the bright aurora overhead, shimmering in the sky beneath the rays of the planet’s sun. Looking up at the colors, something strikes you as odd. The sun was high in the sky when you first landed, and it remains so even now. Has a full day passed since you arrived? Maybe so, but now that you think of it, you don’t recall seeing any change in the illumination of the sky at all so far. Is the planet locked in perpetual daylight? Curious, you open a comm channel to Vhaja back on the ship. After reporting your success with the first data device, you pose the question about the sun. “How fascinating,” she remarks, after spending a moment to refer to her environmental readouts. “According to my own instruments, it should be the dead of night for you right now.” Fascinating indeed. “Well, the planet didn’t seem to get the memo,” you say dryly. You hear Jyumon chime in from over Vhaja’s shoulder. “This is just a guess… but maybe since it’s a ghost planet, every region is somehow spiritually locked into the time of day it was when the world was first destroyed. In the same way ghosts of people always tend to be wearing the same outfit they had on when they died, maybe the sky itself is trapped in the same colors as it was in the moment the planet experienced its apocalypse.” “Huh,” is all you can manage to reply with. “Neat.” “This development only makes this mission all the more important,” Vhaja says sternly. “Please continue to the next two sites and plant the data devices. Once we have all three, we can triangulate readings and perhaps come up with an answer to this mystery.” Fair enough. Before long you arrive back to where you landed, and take some time to rest, check up on your gear, and consult your map one last time to assure yourself where you want to head next. And once that’s settled, you head out for the next leg of your adventure. [[Continue->P17]]Your adventure is not yet finished. There are still more data devices to plant, so you'd best get to work. You really are tempted to partake of that delectable forbidden fruit, but the withering glare your wife levels against you suggests that perhaps now is not quite the right time for it.]](if: $faeglobecollect is true)[ (link:"Mira")[(show:?fae3)] |fae3)[<img src="images/X13_MiraSnowglobe_by_Cangkulretak.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Cangkulretak(click-replace: "Art by Cangkulretak")[https://www.deviantart.com/cangkulretak https://twitter.com/dinnerhaver]] The gorgeous fae woman remains defeated after your clever ploy back in her curio shop. And whenever you pick up the semi-sphere and give it a shake, her body jostles in all the right ways as snowy dust cascades around her helpless form.] ] (link-goto: "Return to the mission", (history:)'s last)Hours go by as the six of you wriggle and squirm. With no one left untied, that means there’s no one left to untie you. Why the heck did you think this was a good idea? At this point, all you can do is wait for another ship to find you, and hope that they don’t have bad intentions. Luckily, you were already on course to a restricted area, and with no one around to switch on your jamming device, you’re sure to be picked up by a passing patrol. At least, that was your hope. But instead, something entirely unexpected happens. A woman suddenly appears in the room after you spend a few hours squirming - a woman with a face that is oddly familiar. (link:"Hello again, $yourname. Looks like you're really getting wrapped up in this mystery, aren't you?")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/F108_FrostyFae_by_Izra.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Izra(click-replace: "Art by Izra")[https://twitter.com/IZRART https://picarto.tv/IZRA]] (set: $picF108 to true) In terms of appearance, she looks like the half-fae princess Skadi, an associate of yours from some time ago. Yet… somehow, you get the sense that this isn’t her. It’s someone else entirely, just pulling that image out from your mind. “Hey there!” she says brightly, walking in like she owns the place. As your crew writhes in their silken bindings, she takes a moment to stroke and caress each woman in the room, savoring their grunts and moans. “Looks like you’ve gotten into a bit of trouble, doesn’t it?” Everyone looks towards her in confusion. Who the hell is this lady, and how the heck did she even get on board the ship? “Now, you may be wondering, ‘how the heck did I get on board the ship’? The answer to that is – don’t worry about it. You may also be wondering, ‘who the hell is this lady?’ Well, that’s a bit complicated, and kind of why I am here. Somewhere, sometime, in some other reality, some or all of you may bump into me, and ask the same question - what’s this lady’s name? And some folks at home might only be reading this right now because they were wondering the same thing.” All of this talk is going over your head. Is she going to help you or not? “You might also be wondering - am I going to help you or not? Well, that depends on your definition of help. But I will say this, so pay attention, everyone - especially those of you reading along in front of a screen. The letter of the day is “I”. As in, “I” can do whatever “I” want; and “I” have decided to send your ship careening out into deep space, far, far away from any people or civilizations. Of course, that means that “I” am probably dooming you all to a Bad End scenario, but also “I” don’t really care. Though in my infinite generosity, “I” will make sure that your life support never runs out, and that you’ll stay hale and hearty indefinitely as you drift aimlessly through the cosmos… forever. Got that?” Everyone in the room gives a chorus of panicked, but muffled, objections. “Right, so the thing is, “I” don’t really care. Enjoy the rest of your lives, girls!” And then she blows a kiss and vanishes, leaving you to your struggles. Immediately after, an alarm sounds throughout the ship, and the computer system’s voice helpfully announces that your navigation systems have been completely overwhelmed due to your galactic position suddenly changing without warning. Over the following hundreds and hundreds of years, you and your crew will have plenty of time to wonder just who that lady was. After all, her words prove to be true. Years and years go by, but no one ever finds you, and none of you ever manage to wiggle free. You’re all doomed to struggle and squirm together as your ship drifts endlessly through the darkest depths of the cosmos, never to encounter any living being again. (set: $beachwebbed to true) GAME OVER [[Start over->A0X]] ] Hours go by as the six of you stand still as statues, helplessly held in place by the holo-chamber’s procedurally generated paralysis pads. None of you can move an inch, able to do nothing but stare ahead and ponder the mistakes that led to this outcome. Since the drunkenness you’re experiencing is simulated, none of you will sober up naturally, which also means there is no way to automatically trigger the safety protocols to release you. All you can do is stand and wait, light gleaming off your glossy skins, and hope that another ship will find you. Luckily, you were already on course to a restricted area, and with no one around to switch on your jamming device, you’re sure to be picked up by a passing patrol. At least, that was your hope. But instead, something entirely unexpected happens. A woman suddenly appears in the room after you spend a few hours standing around - a woman with a face that is oddly familiar. (link:"Hello again, $yourname. Looks like you're really taking a shine to this mystery, aren't you?")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/F108_FrostyFae_by_Izra.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Izra(click-replace: "Art by Izra")[https://twitter.com/IZRART https://picarto.tv/IZRA]] (set: $picF108 to true) In terms of appearance, she looks like the half-fae princess Skadi, an associate of yours from some time ago. Yet… somehow, you get the sense that this isn’t her. It’s someone else entirely, just pulling that image out from your mind. “Hey there!” she says brightly, walking in like she owns the place. As your crew gleams brightly in the holo-deck’s light, she takes a moment to stroke and caress each woman in the room, savoring the sound her fingers make when running across their inert, shiny skin. “Looks like you’ve gotten into a bit of trouble, doesn’t it?” Everyone regards her with confusion. Who the hell is this lady, and how the heck did she even get on board the ship? “Now, you may be wondering, ‘how the heck did I get on board the ship’? The answer to that is – don’t worry about it. You may also be wondering, ‘who the hell is this lady?’ Well, that’s a bit complicated, and kind of why I am here. Somewhere, sometime, in some other reality, some or all of you may bump into me, and ask the same question - what’s this lady’s name? And some folks at home might only be reading this right now because they were wondering the same thing.” All of this talk is going over your head. Is she going to help you or not? “You might also be wondering - am I going to help you or not? Well, that depends on your definition of help. But I will say this, so pay attention, everyone - especially those of you reading in front of a screen. The letter of the day is “I”. As in, “I” can do whatever “I” want; and “I” have decided to send your ship careening out into deep space, far, far away from any people or civilizations. Of course, that means that “I” am probably dooming you all to a Bad End scenario, but also “I” don’t really care. Though in my infinite generosity, “I” will make sure that your life support never runs out, and that you’ll stay hale and hearty indefinitely as you drift aimlessly through the cosmos… forever. Got that?” Though no one else in the room can speak, a tension in the air makes it clear that none of you are particularly happy with the scenario she’s just spelled out. In fact, it’s quite terrifying. “Right, so the thing is, “I” don’t really care. Enjoy the rest of your lives, girls!” And then she blows a kiss and vanishes, leaving you all still trapped beneath the paralyzing glare of the stun lamps. Immediately after, an alarm sounds throughout the ship, and the computer system’s voice helpfully announces that your navigation systems have been completely overwhelmed due to your galactic position suddenly changing without warning. Over the following hundreds and hundreds of years, you and your crew will have plenty of time to wonder just who that lady was. After all, her words prove to be true. Years and years go by, but no one ever finds you, and none of you ever manage to escape from the program that’s trapped you. You’re all doomed to stand as glossy statues together forever as your ship drifts endlessly through the darkest depths of the cosmos, never to encounter any living being again. GAME OVER (set: $ShinySprings to true) [[Start over->A0X]] ]To your disbelief (but also delight), the fae woman snaps her fingers, causing her clothing to vanish from her shapely frame. It’s nearly overwhelming, seeing her amazing figure openly on display like this. “Alright then, little woflie. Say the word, and I’m yours.” You almost do, right then and there. But then you remember that your wife is still trapped as a riding horse from your race earlier. “Before I say it… you need to turn Revissa back to normal first.” The woman who is possibly named Mira pouts. “Oh, poo, I was hoping you’d forget.” “Do it!” you demand. An impish smile crosses her lips. “You’re sure?” For a brief moment, you’re gripped by a pang of anxiety. Are you somehow making the wrong choice? Is this another trick? Were you supposed to say something else, some magic words that would actually get her to do what you want? But you bite your doubts down. No one ever survived an encounter with a fae by being indecisive. “Yes, I’m sure. Return Revissa to normal.” “Ugh, fine. Maybe you’re not as fun as I thought.” She snaps her fingers, and the tiny merry-go-round in your hand starts to spin, whirling faster and faster until one of the ‘horses’ shoots out and smashes into you. And when you look up, Revissa is laying on top of you, hale and hearty. You throw your arms around her and hold her tight. What follows is a kiss more passionate than anything in recent memory. “I told you… never trust a fae,” she says when you finally come up for air. “I could sue you for discrimination, you know,” says the woman, poking her face between the two of you. Revissa bats her away. “Anyway, if that’s all,” the woman says, “then I’ll just be going–” “No!” you shout, cutting her off. “I still won the game. Which means I get to keep you!” There’s a long pause, before Mira throws up her hands in surrender. “Alright, alright. You win. But how, exactly, would you like to keep me?” Now that is certainly an interesting question. Perhaps you could tie her up? Oh, or she’d look lovely transformed into a statue… Revissa taps you on the shoulder. “Now hold on. Even if it seems like you’ve got her, I wouldn’t trust this. It could still be a trap. She wouldn’t have put herself in this position if she actually thought she could lose.” That makes sense. But on the other hand… the prospect of keeping her as a trophy sure is tempting. Besides, how could she have suspected you’d have guessed her name correctly? As far as you can tell, it was pure dumb luck. The name “Mira” simply popped in your head out of nowhere. So it should be fine to make whatever demand you want… right? [[Demand she let herself be tied up now->FD08C]] [[Demand she turn herself into a statue now->FD08D]] [[Withhold her punishment until later->FD08E]] The air shimmers, and suddenly a familiar woman is standing in front of you. She’s a Venushian named Lucinda, a girl whose life you saved early on in your adventures who went on to become a firm ally. But now… (link:"Does it bug you that this is happening?")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/X04_LucindaDazed_by_Izra.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Izra(click-replace: "Art by Izra")[https://twitter.com/IZRART https://picarto.tv/IZRA]] (set: $picX04 to true) She’s standing naked and in a daze, posing with her arms above her head, greyish-green skin exposed to the air of the forest. “Wha… what’s going on?” you ask. “Why is Lucinda here?” “Oh, poor little wolfie, you don’t really understand what’s happening, do you? I bet you don’t even know *why* you guessed that my name was Banana. You see, your actions are currently being dictated by someone outside of time and space, like a puppet that dances for their entertainment. And well, since those folks asked to be entertained, I am only too kind to provide.” She snaps her fingers, and to your horror, you see Lucinda’s skin start to grow even more gray than it was before as a stony texture washes over her supple skin. “They asked for me to ‘de-bug’ things, and with those antennae of hers, I’d say she qualifies as one. After all, you agreed to play my game. But don’t worry, in a moment, you won’t remember this happened. And your cute little bug here will show up in my special gallery. The texture of the air, hot and humid, as she made a dash towards cover. The smell of the ocean, mixed with her own sweat as she pressed herself to her limits. And, of course, the brief glimpse of her opponent from a stolen glance over her shoulder, not looking the least bit concerned. Melfy didn’t know where she was, exactly. It looked like a tranquil beach on some alien planet she had never visited, the sand colored a dark purple, the sky an ominous orange. Nor was she sure how she’d gotten here. The last thing she remembered, she was pursuing Sharda through the back alleys of some dingy market on a no-name moon. They’d crashed through the door of a shop, the merchant had looked up in annoyance, and then – she woke up here. Sharda was next to her, splayed out on the sand, recovering from the same dizzy spell. That’s when the voice spoke to them. “I sense bad blood between the two of you,” the voice said. “So allow me to help you settle it. The nature of this conceptual space is simple - two women enter, only one leaves. Defeat your opponent to return to reality. Escape is otherwise impossible.” Okay, fair enough. Melfy had wound up in stranger situations than this. But there was one problem - she’d showed up wearing nothing but some underwear scraps - no sword, no blaster, no armor - nothing. And though she might have had the advantage on Sharda in raw power, the Tsunojian was an adept at ice magic, which didn’t require any special tools. As usual, the fight was rigged against Melfy from the start. Though the fact that Melfy offered her old enemy a handshake once they both stood up didn’t help things either. Her proposal was that they work together to try to figure out a way to escape without playing the mysterious voice’s game. Sharda responded by blowing a gust of sub-zero wind at her that nearly froze her to the core. So much for cooperation. Shivering and disoriented, Melfy had made the logical choice to get the hell out there to find someplace to hide and regroup. And so now here she was, running across the beach towards the rocky cliffs in the distance. Thankfully, her athletic advantage proved to be enough to outdistance the wily Tsunojian. Other than a few lazy ice needles flung in her direction, Sharda didn’t even try to stop her. That cool indifference of hers was always the worst part. She’d betrayed Melfy’s old crew years ago with that same dispassionate expression on her face, as if selling out your comrades was the most mundane thing in the world. Melfy could forgive a lot of things, but never that. Which is why she couldn’t let herself be caught here. If the parameters the voice spelled out really were true, than it would seem she’d have to take Sharda down, one way or another. A few hours later, she was feeling better. Sharda was nowhere in sight, but Melfy wasn’t worried. From her vantage point high on the cliffs, she could get a good look at her surroundings, and figured the island they were stranded on was pretty small. She’d find Sharda eventually - and the next time, she’d come in swinging. All she’d have to do is close the distance fast, get the drop on her, deliver a few haymakers at close quarters before she had the time to get off any spells. Then it would all be over. The thought of clocking Sharda right in her smugly disinterested face was oddly relaxing. A short rest had shaken the chill from her bones by now, so Melfy was really starting to feel the heat of this desert island. Not to mention she was still sticky with sweat after all that running. Above her she noticed the gentle trickle of a waterfall flowing from the rock face behind her, so she decided to take a quick shower to refresh herself before she went on the offensive. It would be the last mistake she ever made. She closed her eyes as the water washed over her and exhaled slowly, trying to relax the tension in her muscles. The splashing sound the falls made as the water crashed against the stone beneath her feet was soothing, lulling her into a placid calm. That’s why she didn’t notice the crackle. At least, not until it was too late. By the time the chill reached her, she only had time to open her eyes wide and form her mouth into a surprised “O” shape. And then the slick water over her skin froze solid, sealing her in completely. ] |drink1)[(link:"Crickle-crackle")[(show:?drink2)]] |drink2)[<img src="images/X07_MelfyWaterfallFreeze_by_Cangkulretak.png" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Cangkulretak(click-replace: "Art by Cangkulretak")[https://www.deviantart.com/cangkulretak https://twitter.com/dinnerhaver]] (set: $picX07 to true) Through the disorienting chill, Melfy could barely make out the sound of Sharda’s voice from only inches away. “Gotcha,” she said lazily. And then the air shimmered, and Sharda was in front of her. *What? How?!”* Melfy thought helplessly, her body totally rooted in place from the icy shell that covered it. Sharda smiled, perhaps predicting her confusion. “What, you didn’t think I’d picked up some new tricks in the years since you saw me? Ice crystals in the air can bend the light… make me invisible,” she explained, as she languidly began snapping away Melfy’s frozen underwear, revealing the full extent of her frozen flesh beneath it. Damnit! So she’d been following Melfy the entire time, just waiting for her to let down her guard. And she’d done it in the worst possible place, beneath a waterfall. Now she was encased in ice and completely, utterly helpless. Sharda had won. The Tsunojian glanced up towards the sky. “So… this it? Do I get to leave now?” “You must finish her… permanently,” spoke the voice from up high. Sharda paused for only a moment, before giving a lazy shrug. “Alright then.” There was no sympathy in her eyes as she walked up to the inert wolf woman. No affection in her motions as she leaned forward to press her lips against Melfy’s wide-open mouth. And no mercy as she breathed out a blast of wintry magic that flowed down the kemomi’s throat, that spread to every corner of her body, freezing her both inside and out. The magical spell worked quickly, not just freezing her victim but transforming her, completely converting her into a statue carved from solid ice. Melfy’s vision went dark and her mind went blank as she became a person no more, but an eternal sculpture of frost. “That better?” Sharda asked. “Yes, that will do,” was all the voice said. And then the Tsunojian, and the statue she created, were back in the shop they had crashed through earlier. The merchant they had disturbed flicked her wrist, ending whatever magic she had used to entrap the pair. And then, with another motion, transferred the frozen wolf onto a small flat platform in a corner. The device began to hum, scanning the makeup of the statue and generating an energy field that would keep it in indefinite stasis. There would be no melting for the newest addition to her wares. Sharda raised an eyebrow, then looked around the rest of the shop. There were a dozen more inanimate women made from all sorts of other materials on display as well. “With this added to my inventory, consider the damage you did to my storefront repaid,” the merchant said, striking a match against Melfy’s frozen cheek and using it to light a long pipe she pulled from a pocket. Sharda took one last look at the room, at the statues, and at her former comrade, rendered eternally frozen by her magic. And then she shrugged. “Alright,” she said, with her trademark disinterest. And then she turned and left. ] (set: $gallery to true)(set: $micro to true) |drink2)[(link:"Goodness! Wasn’t that fun? Everything about her seemed in order. Amazing figure, long, lustrous black hair, flawless pale skin, and a dark blue dress that wasn’t egregiously risque but nonetheless hugged her curves in all the right places. Yes, she looked *good*. Which was going to be important for this little get-together. For most of her life, Skadi had thought she was merely an elf. Long ears, long life, proficiency with magic, all the signs of being one of the fair folk. And, to be fair, she was half-right, but *only* half. Because while her mother was indeed her mother, it turned out her mother’s spouse was not her other parent. Instead, she was born from a tryst with none other than the Winter Queen of the faeries herself, Lady Aconite. Her mother had never told her about her true heritage; Skadi had only discovered it when she found herself in possession of a natural wellspring of magic that eclipsed anything she could learn through study. And ever since she’d found out, she had been searching the realms for a way to get in touch with the other half of her heritage. Her quest did eventually bring her in contact with members of the Winter Court, though so far she had not managed to gain an audience with the Queen herself – with her mother. But all that was going to change. She’d talked her way into becoming an envoy of the Winter Court, and in that capacity, she was now here on a diplomatic visit to the Lady Hzzzantha, Maiden of the Hive. If she performed well, perhaps she would finally get the recognition she deserved. And so she walked into the hive, flanked by a small retinue of Hzzzantha’s elite drones. Her hostess tonight was a fairy who assumed the appearance of a beautiful queen bee, dressed in yellow and black, with gossamer-thin insect wings and a wicked stinger beneath her elegant gown. She had a reputation for both efficiency and cruelty, though also a well-known fondness for ‘pollinating’ attractive women. Skadi assumed it was for this reason that she was chosen as the envoy - perhaps she was Hzzzantha’s type. Despite the fact that it seemed that was all the court saw in her, she was going to prove she had the talent to perform actual diplomacy - even if negotiations were taking place in a queen bee’s bedchambers. Before long, the drones brought her to the deepest part of the hive, where Hzzzantha herself made her court. The fairy was as beautiful as had been rumored, and from the smile on her face as Skadi stepped in, it would seem the attraction was mutual. “Ah, a pleazzzzzure to make your acquaintance,” said Lady Hzzzantha, sitting imperiously on a throne made of honeycomb. “The pleasure is all mine,” Skadi said with a low bow. “Yes, it seemzzzz that the Winter Court still remembers the debt it owezzzzz me from the Daffodil Wars. I will send word to them immediately that their tribute is accepted.” Skadi blinked in confusion. “Tribute? I am afraid I don’t understand. I am here for negotiations…” The queen bee laughed. “Oh, how delightful. And the tribute doezzzzzn’t even know. That makes it all the more sweet.” She raised a hand imperiously, giving a silent order to the drones that were flanking Skadi on every side. They buzzed in acknowledgement and roughly grabbed Skadi by the arms, forcing her to her knees. One of them used the tip of its spear to run a long tear down the length of the half-fae’s dress, then pulled the garments away completely, leaving her naked and exposed in the center of the room. “I – what? What is this? Surely you must understand you are attacking an envoy of the Winter Court?” Skadi yelled. She tried to stand up, but the drones were powerfully built. “No, my dear. Like I said, you are not envoy, but tribute. You see, it izzzz soon time for me to begin producing the Royal Jelly, but to do so, I need to mix my essenczzzz with another. The pleasure the tribute feels will seep into the jelly, giving it its distinctive flavor.” The queen bee rose from her throne, buzzing over on her beautiful wings, hovering an inch above the ground. She reached down and cupped Skadi’s chin, bringing her head up so that she could meet her lips with a warm, yet dispassionate kiss. As their lips pressed together, Skadi could feel a sweet honey begin to seep down her through, with a flavor deeper and more intoxicating than anything she had ever tasted before. Her protests gave way to gurgles of pleasure as every nerve ending her body began to fill with an electrifying wave of stimulation that was almost too much to bear. “There, now you are pollinated, my dear.” She motioned to her guards. “Bring her to her new chamberzzzz.” Her drones buzzed in acknowledgement, then lifted Skadi up by the arms and carried her to a honey-comb like prison cell directly behind the throne. They threw her in roughly, then moved aside, allowing Hzzzantha to dart up in front of her. With a dainty pursing of her lips, she spat out more of her honey, gobs and gobs of it, enough to throw Skadi back and glue her to the wall of her cell. ] |drink1)[(link:"Splat")[(show:?drink2)]] |drink2)[<img src="images/X08_SkadiHoneyed_by_Cangkulretak.png" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Cangkulretak(click-replace: "Art by Cangkulretak")[https://www.deviantart.com/cangkulretak https://twitter.com/dinnerhaver]] (set: $picX08 to true) The half-fae found herself unable to move as the honey quickly congealed. You’re overcome by a rush of vertigo, your vision goes blurry, and the forest you’d been standing in begins to fade away. It’s all you can manage not to fully lose your lunch. When everything finally stops moving, you find that you are now standing indoors somehow. The smell of the air suggests you’re underground, and the nearly layered bricks comprising the walls makes clear it’s not a naturally occurring cavern. “Where are we?!” Revissa yells, stepping towards the still-nude fae woman. “In the basements of one of the buildings at the Knottie camp near the ruins,” Mira replies. “In one of their many dungeon cells.” She walks forward, swiveling her hips alluringly, before stopping in front of a box that you can see is full of ropes, shackles, gags, and other bondage-related implements. “Why did we need to come all the way here?” Revissa grumbles. “We had plenty of ways to tie you up right where we were.” Mira smirks. “Because if I am giving myself over to you as a prize, I want to make sure we do it *right*. I really think we should just leave.” “Or, maybe, that’s exactly what she *wants* us to do,” you say. “She expects us to get cold feet and back out. Her so-called portal back to the forest will actually just teleport us straight into some other deadly peril, and when we get caught in it her obligation to let herself be captured will be lifted. If that’s true, the only *correct* play is to tie her up now and have our way with her!” Revissa sighs and throws up her hands. “Fine, but don’t come crying to me if this gets us killed.” Your wife does have a point. Mira was a bit too quick to agree to this. Maybe you *should* just leave. But… then you’ll never get to claim your prize… [[Take your time tying her up->FD08CA]] [[Head back through the door->FD08EB]] “Screw this,” you say, “I won your dumb game, and I want my prize. The moment I make contact with it, I’ll be locked in place, and be doomed to slowly vitrify into a glossy sculpture. Feel free to stand around and wait for that to happen. Or, if you get bored, you can always duck out through that passageway, there. If you do, it’ll take you right back to the forest where you left.” You take a step towards her. “What, you think I’m not petty enough to waste a few hours of my life to get a prize? I’ll sit here all day if I have to.” Mira just smiles. “Go right ahead.” And then she steps down on the cursed plate. And there she stands, still as a statue, a smile on her lips and her arms raised above her head seductively. “So… now I guess we wait,” you say, finding a slab of stone to plop down on top of. I think it needed a full three hours to completely transform someone.” “I’ve waited longer while on hold with the Department of Starship Registration,” you say. “This is nothing.” But your wife doesn’t look fully convinced. “Melfy, there’s no way she would just subject herself to a trap like that if she wasn’t plotting something. But… then you’ll never get to claim your prize… [[Wait out the three hours->FD08DA]] [[Head back through the door->FD08EA]] You want to collect her, you really do. But in the end, you know better. [[Choose a path->FA06]] (go-to: "A00")Congratulations on making it through the Spider Forest! There are many secret paths through this area, and many of them depend on choices you’ve made leading up to the final encounter. Using this menu, you can save time on future playthroughs by setting certain conditions instead of playing through the previous parts all over again. Pick one option for each path. New options will unlock once you’ve cleared those conditions normally. **Low Path** |low>[ (if: ($petalfriend4eva is true) and ($frozenslime4eva is true))[(link: "Befriended Petal and Ros'eela is free")[(set: $rosawake to true)(set: $petalfriend to true)(set: $gagtalk to true)(set: $freezebomb to true)(set: $frozenslime to true)(hide: ?low)] (link: "Befriended Petal and Ros'eela is not free")[(set: $petalfriend to true)(set: $gagtalk to true)(set: $freezebomb to true)(set: $frozenslime to true)(hide: ?low)]] (if: ($picF87 is true))[(link: "Defeated Petal and Ros'eela is free")[(set: $rosawake to true)(set: $petalcollect to true)(set: $gagtalk to true)(hide: ?low)] (link: "Defeated Petal and Ros'eela is not free")[(set: $petalcollect to true)(set: $gagtalk to true)(hide: ?low)]] (if: ($petalescape4eva is true) and ($frozenslime4eva is true))[(link: "Escaped from Petal and Ros'eela is free")[(set: $rosawake to true)(set: $petalescape to true)(set: $gagtalk to true)(set: $frozenslime to true)(hide: ?low)] (link: "Escaped from Petal and Ros'eela is not free")[(set: $petalescape to true)(set: $gagtalk to true)(set: $frozenslime to true)(hide: ?low)]] ] **Middle Path** |mid>[ (if: ($swampescape4eva is true) and ($racewin is true))[(link: "Won the race with the Fae and escaped the swamp on your own")[(set: $faewin to true)(set: $swampescape to true)(hide: ?mid)]] (if: $racewin is true)[(link: "Won the race with the Fae and was rescued from the swamp")[(set: $faewin to true)(hide: ?mid)]] (if: $swampescape4eva is true )[(link: "Did not encounter the Fae at all and escaped the swamp on your own")[(set: $swampescape to true)(hide: ?mid)]] ] **High Path** |high>[ (if: $silkyescape is true)[(link: "Escaped from the Spider Sisters")[(set: $FBStart to true)(hide: ?high)]] (if: $picF13 is true)[(link: "Escaped from the Spider Sisters and lured one of them into a trap")[(set: $sawbunny to true)(hide: ?high)]] ] [[Continue->FE01]] Against all odds, it seems like you’ve done it!
