You suddenly disappeared and then–” “And then you decided to get frisky with a statue?” Revissa yells. It takes a few minutes to smooth things over with your wife before she gives her side of the story, though there’s not much to tell. She’s not sure what happened to her after she was ‘disappeared’ by the fae, but she woke up slumped against a tree trunk around the same time that Mira got petrified. At first she was worried something had happened to you, only to find that in fact you had decided to indulge yourself instead of searching for her. “Would you believe I was still under the influence of her lust spell?” you ask. “I think you were under the influence of your own libido,” she grumbles, giving you another whack with her staff, this time across your knees. You wince and double over, but then look up at her hopefully. “So… would this be a bad time to discuss how we might… take this statue home with us?” “You realize that’s an utterly terrible idea, right?” “Not any worse than any other terrible ideas I’ve had. Besides, surely we should take it upon ourselves to ensure that a dangerous woman like this stays trapped and doesn’t cause any more trouble for the galaxy, right?” Revissa sighs. “Fine, fine. Though only because we’re still technically on the run from spiders and I don’t have time to argue.” She stamps the butt of her staff on the ground and takes a moment to cast a spell. You can feel the swirl of nature magic flowing around her, but otherwise it doesn’t seem like anything’s changed. “I’ve communed with the local wildlife,” she explains after she’s finished. “They won’t show up right away, but eventually some animals will drag this hunk of stone back to the landing site. Does that work for you?” You tell her that it does. Even when she’s angry with you, she still always comes through. Though she’s right - the appearance of the fae was a distraction, but you’ve still got to get the heck out of here - there’s a sexy arachnid on your tail, after all. At this point, you’ve already decided the cliffs are too dangerous. You’re in the center of the forest right now, but surely if you keep going this way, the spider lady is eventually going to catch up. So that just leaves one more viable route. (set: $faestonecollect to true)(set: $faewin to false) [[Head towards the river->FE06A]] After a quick search she locates the storage room of one of the living quarters, and strings you up against a support beam, nodding approvingly at the way you add to the ambience. (link:"Hang out")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/F101_MelfyWebbedCeiling_by_Dvega.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Dvega(click-replace: "Art by Dvega")[https://www.deviantart.com/dvega https://picarto.tv/Tek]] (set: $picF101 to true) She strokes your tail lovingly, savoring the softness of your fur, before adhering Revissa to a nearby rafter. Your wife thrashes and squirms valiantly, but all that accomplishes is prompting the spider lady to add more support tethers to her restraints. “That’ll do. This place doesn’t seem so bad. And now we’ve even got some… entertainment.” She cups your exposed breasts eagerly, eliciting a weak moan from your bound up lips. Look, this might be a bad situation, but you can’t be blamed for enjoying it. “But… I do think we could do with some more. We’ve got a lot of horny girls back in the caves.” After a moment of thought, she slices away the silk that was wound over your mouth. “Oh, my name is Tula, but the way. I’m your new owner, and you’re my new slave.” You do your best to flash her a smile. “Nice to meet you, I’m Me–” “I don’t care what your name is, slave,” she says, cutting you off by pressing the pointed tip of one of her back legs against your cheek. “But I have noticed that you seem fairly knowledgeable about this place. So… maybe you know where I can find some more cuties for my collection? Lead me to enough of them and maybe I’ll hang you up somewhere with a better view.” Okay, this might be your chance. Maybe you can use her desire for more slaves against her. But is there anyone who you could tell her about that would be of any help? [[Tell her about the rest of your crew->FE04A]](if: $petalfriend is true or $petalescape is true)[ [[Tell her about Petal->FE04B]]](if: $rosawake is true)[ [[Tell her about Ros’eela->FE04C]]] [[Make someone up->FE04E]] [[Refuse to help her->FE04F]] ]As the coin that depicts your wife flips through the air, several frustrated thoughts run through your head. Why have you been letting this duplicitous fae dictate the terms of your engagements? Especially now, that you’ve managed to guess her name and are owed a boon from her. *You’ve* got the advantage here, not her, so why should you leave things to chance? So instead of calling out heads or tails, you yell her name. You’ll admit that you’re no expert on the magic of the fae, but almost every story you’ve read about that confirms that if you know their name, you hold power over them. So maybe it’s time to use that power. “What are you–” she begins to say, but gets cut off as the heavy metal coin you tossed in the air lands with a soft thud right between her breasts - which is exactly where you’d aimed it. You grin. “In the game of flipping a coin, the object is to toss it into the air, and then correctly call out where it will land, right? Well, my guess was ‘Mira’. And that’s right where it landed.” There is a long pause as Mira wraps her mind around the exact wording of your attempt at trickery. You’re sure if you gave her enough time, she’d figure a way to worm her way out of it. Which is why you decide to act fast. “So, since I’ve won, I get to propose a rule,” you say, loudly and forcefully enough to cut off her protest. “And the rule I will make is that you and I are now both equally susceptible to any magical items you’ve got here in your shop.” “Now hold on,” the fae says, “I haven’t accepted that you won the flip–” “No, I won,” you snarl. “And I’m not letting you distract or misdirect me any more.” As you speak, your eyes dart around the room, taking in all the various knick-knacks on display here. Most of them contain the frozen or bound bodies of women inside of them in some capacity, but one, you notice, seems currently vacant. It’s a small glass half-sphere mounted on a base with a depiction of a cheery-looking building inside of it, and some powdery white dust spread out on the ground. A snow globe. “Yes, well, even if you won, I’m sure there are better things you could propose then–” But you cut her off again. “And now, as my reward for guessing your name, *Mira*.” The sound of her name being called out again makes her stiffen, her eyes drawn towards you as you continue to speak. “For my boon… I want you to swap places with this building here.” You pick up the snow globe and hold it out for her. “Well, I–” “*Now*, Mira!” The room reverberates from the strength of your voice, the confidence and authority that radiates from your words. You’re through being bossed around by this woman. So now, she’s going to be yours. With forceful steps, you walk over, pluck the coin from between her breasts, and then thrust the snow globe in front of her face. “Now.” This time you say it with a grim quiet, speak with the firm belief that your words must be obeyed. Mira’s face blanches, but she does finally manage a smile. “This, my dear,” she says softly. “*This* is why I take an interest in you.” And then she snaps her fingers. What happens next is a confusing blur of movement, a shifting of space and time, a rearranging of the very floor you are standing on. It’s at this point that you realize the little building inside the snow globe might have actually been a depiction of the curio shop itself. So… what would it mean if you asked her to move it? That’s a level of meta complexity that goes far beyond your understanding, but… you’re pretty sure it’s going to play out poorly for Mira. You honestly can’t even process what happens next. You feel like you’re being pulled into a million pieces and crushed into a tiny ball, all at the same time. But when it finally ends, you find yourself laying on soft grass, looking up at the sky above. The strange shop is gone, but you feel the weight of something pressing down against the palm of your hand. (link:"A fittingly ironic punishment for me, given the form I'm appearing in. Altogether a rather embarrassing defeat, though one must expect such things to happen every now and then. After all, if there was no chance of losing, than there would be no joy in savoring the sweetness of victory, either.")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="images/X13_MiraSnowglobe_by_Cangkulretak.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Cangkulretak(click-replace: "Art by Cangkulretak")[https://www.deviantart.com/cangkulretak https://twitter.com/dinnerhaver]] (set: $picX13 to true)(set: $gallery to true) Inside the glass sphere, Mira stands firmly restrained, metal clamps wrapped around her shapely body. Those weren’t there before, you know, but perhaps the magnitude of the magic involved with trapping her manifested them somehow. If you had to guess, they’re probably made of some kind of enchanted iron, which you are pretty sure fae are weak to. “------” She says something, looking out from her prison up at your body, which from her perspective must be gigantic. But whatever it is she says, you can’t hear it. So instead, you just hold the globe aloft and shake it vigorously, watching the powdered snow fly all about and her hair flip around wildly. To be honest, you’d have preferred trapping her in a more lewd or embarrassing position, perhaps without her dress on, but in a way, the lack of eroticism to her prison feels like it makes the magic stronger. As if what’s been done to her is meant to be an ironic punishment rather than something to titillate. “Ooof. What… happened?” The voice comes from beside you, where you find Revissa sprawled out on the grass. You just grin happily as you hold up your prize for her to inspect. “You… you beat her?” she says in wonderment. “I did. And something tells me that I *really* beat her this time.” Your wife nods, tapping on the glass in amusement. Mira looks none too pleased. “You’ll have to tell me all about how you managed that.” “Of course!” And so you do, in intimate detail - and with a tiny bit of embellishment. This is a rare moment where you get to bask in a hard-earned win, so you’re not going to squander it by being humble. And to add a cherry on top of your already stellar luck, it appears that the spot you were thrown to is only a short distance from the entrance to the forest! Which means you don’t even have to worry about any spider-babes as you take a leisurely stroll away from the cover of the trees. [[Return to the entrance->FE07]] ]
